channel.title: Across The Airwaves
channel.description: A podcast dedicated to giving weekly TV show episode reviews along with news and discussions on the Entertainment Industry.
channel.itunes:author: Dan Schmidt & Nico Reifsteck
channel.itunes:summary: Across the Airwaves is a podcast dedicated to providing weekly TV Show episode reviews along with news and opinions on the entertainment Industry. On each episode we cover dramas and sitcoms from network and cable television. We also discuss news about upcoming movies in our "News with Nico" section and on occasion we will review animated shows if it’s something popular like "The Legend of Korra".
channel.itunes:subtitle: A network of podcasts dedicated to giving weekly TV show episode reviews along with news and discussions on the Entertainment Industry.

item.title: News with Nico 08-17-2014 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey Everybody it's Nico and Welcome to Across the Airwaves News with Nico! The podcast is currently on hiatus, but we will continue to bring you all the TV and Entertainment News that comes out this summer in our lead up to returning for the Fall 2014 Season starting in September. This week we have all the TV and Entertainment news that has come out since Comic Con. So let’s get started.   This week’s Headlines include: 1.       Doctor Who’s Jenna-Louise Coleman quits role as Time Lord's assistant and will leave at Christmas 2.       Orphan Black Comic Books to Expand Sci-Fi Series' World 3.       There will Be No Flirting Says Peter Capaldi on Doctor Who Season 8 4.       Dexter Alum Cast as Maroni on Gotham 5.       Vince Vaughn, Elisabeth Moss Circling True Detective Season 2 Roles 6.       Legendary Buys Felicia Day’s Geek & Sundry 7.       Big Bang Stars Ink New $90 Million Deals 8.       Marvel Animation Teases New Guardians of the Galaxy Series 9.       Sharknado 2 Takes a Much Bigger Chomp Out of Ratings, Up 180% vs. Original 10.   Actor James Corden Replacing Craig Ferguson as Late Late Show Host 11.   Craig Ferguson Is in Negotiations to Host a New Early Evening Talk Show 12.   Yahoo!'s First Community Trailer: "We Can Rebuild It; We Have the Technology” 13.   Veronica Mars Web Series Will Feature Most of the Original Cast, Including Kristen Bell 14.   Comedy Central renews @Midnight 15.   HBO and True Detective Writer Nic Pizzolatto Dismiss Plagiarism Allegations 16.   There's More Arrested Development on the Way, Says Will Arnett 17.   Robin Williams Has Passed Away
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey Everybody it's Nico and Welcome to Across the Airwaves News with Nico! The podcast is currently on hiatus, but we will continue to bring you all the TV and Entertainment News that comes out this summer in our lead up to returning for the Fall 2014 Sea

item.title: Tangent Time 14 (Standard Only) "Comic Con '14 Tangents"
item.description: On our latest episode of It's Tangent Time, Woo and I talk about Guardians of the Galaxy! Not only do we talk about the film and how much we adored it, but we also talked about San Diego Comic Con and the news we got from DC, Marvel, Warner Brothers, Disney, and much more! We talk Batman V Superman, Star Wars, Age of Ultron, Arrow, The Flash, Gotham, Constantine, Supernatural, Agent Carter, Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D., Fantastic 4, Infinity gems, cinematic universes, and much more! Not to mention, we're joined by The Flash Podcast/S.H.I.E.L.D. Radio host Andy Behbakht!
item.itunes:subtitle: On our latest episode of It's Tangent Time, Woo and I talk about Guardians of the Galaxy! Not only do we talk about the film and how much we adored it, but we also talked about San Diego Comic Con and the news we got from DC,...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 178 (Enhanced) "Nico Runs Free at Comic Con 2014"
item.description: Greeting ATA Listeners! Have you ever had the feeling that the mountain of news to come out of Comic Con is so high, it puts you in a valley so low where you're confused on which way to go? Well, ATA is here to give you a hand and lead you through Comic Con Land With our annual Across The Airwaves Comic Con Special. So join Nico as he takes us on a free ride through his actual trip to Comic Con 2014 with his live on the floor reactions to The Flash and Constantine Pilots along with the panels for TNT's Legends, The Last Ship, Falling Skies, Sharknado 2, Helix, Defiance and NASA's Next Giant Leap. However, that's not all this episode has in store for you Listeners as I join Nico in discussing news reported from The Con about The DC Comics Live-Action TV Shows (Gotham, The Flash, Arrow and Constantine), Star Wars Rebels, Batman V. Superman: Dawn of Justice (in addition to the Wonder Woman Costume) and the return of our Television Favorites including Game of Thrones, The Big Bang Theory, Sleepy Hollow, Supernatural and Person of Interest. Also just because I didn't mention Castle or Doctor Who doesn't mean we are going to stop covering these shows when returning from hiatus, they just did not attend Comic Con this year and for ATA's coverage on Marvel content to come out of Comic Con you can check out The Helicarrier Podcast's Comic Con Themed Episode.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's podcast is our annual episode covering San Diego Comic Con with discussions & live recordings from the convention itself on Gotham, The Flash, Arrow, Batman V. Superman, Constantine, Star Wars: Rebels, Sleepy Hollow, Person of Interest & more

item.title: Tangent Time 13 (Standard Only) "Battle Cry"
item.description: Hey guys, welcome back to It's Tangent Time! On this episode, Woo and I announce our battle cry as we bring back this off-the-rails podcast dedicated towards covering comic books, science fiction, and film in the entertainment industry! This time, we talk Dawn of the Planet of the Apes, making the villains the heroes, the new female Thor and Captain [Falcon] America, Michael Giacchino, Man of Steel, Godzilla, Arrow, Star Wars Episode VII, Brian Michael Bendis vs Geoff Johns, upcoming Marvel Studios films, and much much more on It's Tangent Time! Definitely check this podcast episode is out and be here for our next episode where we'll talk Comic Con, Guardians of the Galaxy, and the Veronica Mars movie!

item.title: Helicarrier Special Edition #8: Pre-Comic-Con 2014 Show
item.description: On this special edition of Helicarrier Podcast, Nicki Eighmy and Andy Behbakht get together to do a pre-Comic-Con episode focusing on all the cool stuff that will be taking place at San Diego Comic-Con this week, including the panels for Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. and Agent Carter. They also discuss some rumors and news for the second season of S.H.I.E.L.D., some potential characters for Agent Carter and images for Marvel's Avengers: Age of Ultron from Entertainment Weekly.

item.title: Helicarrier Special Edition 07 - The Amazing Spider-Man 2 & X-Men Days of Future Past Review
item.description: Welcome to a special edition episode of Helicarrier Podcast! On this installment, Andy, Nicki and Dan get together after a long break to review the two big Marvel movies, The Amazing Spider-Man 2 and X-Men: Days of Future Past and be aware of major spoilers! They also discuss several news items for Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D., Daredevil, (this episode was recorded before the two latest casting news came out so that's why they aren't mentioned), Ant-Man and Doctor Strange.

item.title: Across the Airwaves News with Nico 06-30-2014 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey Everybody it's Nico and Welcome to Across the Airwaves News with Nico! The podcast is currently on hiatus, but we will continue to bring you all the TV and Entertainment News that comes out this summer in our lead up to our Comic Con episode in late July/Early August. On this week's episode we cover: George Lucas' Museum Selecting Chicago as it's Location; The Doctor Who Season 8 Premiere Date and Teaser being Released; The Announcement that Doctor Who Will NOT Have a Panel at SDCC this Year; Star Trek 3 Director Claims This Movie Will be Closest to Original TV Series; The Goldbergs Doing a John Hughes Homage in Season 2; and The Talks to Bring Commmunity Back on Hulu have Ended.  Join us for all the news this summer as we continue to keep you informed despite the hiatus.
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey Everybody it's Nico and Welcome to Across the Airwaves News with Nico! The podcast is currently on hiatus, but we will continue to bring you all the TV and Entertainment News that comes out this summer in our lead up to our Comic Con episode in late J

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 177 (Enhanced) "A Game of Thrones and Star Wars"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, on this week's podcast, we are playing a Game of Star Wars as we review the Season Finale of HBO's Blockbuster Series Game of Thrones and discuss Star Wars: The Clone Wars as a entire series in response to the final season being released on Netflix. There's also more Star Wars than just that as News with Nico provides an update on Harrison Ford's on set injury and sets up a discussion on the list of brilliant directors Disney has tapped to work on Episodes VIII, IX and potential Star Wars spinoff films. In addition, with the exciting news Legend of Korra: Book 3 is starting early, we discuss our future plans for reviewing the show while Nico brings this episode home with the Airwaves Rundown section reviewing the Season Finales for Orphan Black and FX's Fargo. Oh and last but not least Nico and I are going to take a brief hiatus from doing ATA but will be back in late July/early August for a Comic Con 2014 Review Episode.
item.itunes:subtitle: On this week's podcast we are playing a Game of Star Wars as we review Game of Thrones' Season Finale and the entire series of Star Wars: The Clone Wars. Also we review the Season Finales for Orphan Black and Fargo in the Airwaves Rundown Section.

item.title: Tangent Time 12 (Standard Only) "Tangent in a Bottle"
item.description: On this action-packed, SPOILER-filled return to Tangent Time, Michael and Woo start off with an overview of Veronica Mars, from Season 1 to the current film and book series! After that they talk Amazing Spider-Man 2, X-Men: Days of Future Past, Captain America: The Winter Soldier, Batman V. Superman: Dawn of Justice, the future of the Marvel Cinematic Universe,the Muppets, Supernatural, The Flash, Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D., and much more! So hold onto your butts, and strap on in, because it's Tangent Time!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 176 (Enhanced) "It's Hammer Time!"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, you can't touch this podcast as we review an episode of Game of Thrones where Jon Snow went hammer time on a Wilding villain in one of the most epic battles probably ever seen on television. Yes, it was that good and Nico will tell you why as I share my predictions regarding the battle not being over yet with thoughts of Game of Thrones topping it in the future. Also in our News with Nico Section we discuss the trailer for Legend of Korra: Book 3, revival of The Magic School Bus, the casting of Kingpin for the Marvel Cinematic Universe, a Magic: The Gathering Movie and a new, exciting role for fan favorite Tom Hiddleston that's guaranteed to show off all of his talents. Then we bring this episode home with our Airwaves Rundown reviewing the penultimate episodes for Orphan Black and Fargo.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jon Snow makes ATA Episode 176 hammer time as we review Orphan Black, Fargo & a Game of Thrones episode featuring the most epic battle seen on TV. We also discuss the Legend of Korra: Book 3 trailer & more Marvel Superhero casting news.

item.title: The Story of Across the Airwaves (Video)
item.description: Hi ATA Listeners, it's Dan here. As you've probably noticed we've been making a lot of big changes with our website to make listening to Across the Airwaves and its related podcasts better for you. On that note, through our process of spring cleaning we noticed that what needed the most work was our About ATA Page as it contained way too much text for you to read explaining what our podcast is all about. So to make this process more entertaining my good friend Doug Roewer and his company Ambient Productions decided to help us out by making a documentary telling the origin story of Across the Airwaves. And with that all I can say is sit back, relax and enjoy the show…
item.itunes:subtitle: An 8 minute documentary telling the Across the Airwaves Podcast's Origin Story.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 175 (Enhanced) "Heads Will Explode!"
item.description: ATA Listeners, are you experiencing symptoms of feeling like all your teeth have been knocked out, your eyeballs are being squished or the TV Shows you watch are just too exciting to handle? Well, you might be in danger of your head exploding but the good news is our podcast can provide the best medicine by  using this week's reviews to calm you down about Game of Thrones, Orphan Black and Fargo episodes where heads exploded literally, leaving us in anxiety about the fate of our favorite characters. Also that's not the only cure we're providing as we try to keep your head from exploding in anticipation for the Marvel Netflix Shows and Star Wars Episode VII with Nico providing some huge casting news for both productions including the actor who's taking on the mantle of Daredevil: The Man without Fear!
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA Episode 175 reviews Game of Thrones, Orphan Black and Fargo episodes that will make your head explode! We also discuss Star Wars Episode VII and Marvel Superhero Casting News for the Daredevil TV Series & Doctor Strange movie.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 174 (Enhanced) "Endless Wonder"
item.description: Hey, hey, hey, ATA Listeners! This week's podcast is dedicated to the endless wonder of a TV Series known as Warehouse 13 for "realzies" as we review the  show's Series Finale along with the Season Finales for Supernatural, Revolution, Modern Family and an all new episode of Game of Thrones. In addition, we discuss some big news surrounding the premiere date of Doctor Who Series 8, the unveiling of a Batman themed hotel room  and Marvel's Netflix TV Series. Followed by Nico bagging and tagging this artifact with the Airwaves Rundown Section reviewing the Season Finale of The Americans, Orphan Black and Fargo. By the way as one last announcement, there will not be an ATA Episode released next week due to Game of Thrones taking a one week hiatus in honor of Memorial Day and most of the other shows we cover being off for the Summer.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA 174 is dedicated to the endless wonder known as Warehouse 13 for "realzies" as we review the show's Series Finale along with Game of Thrones, Supernatural, Revolution, Modern Family, The Americans, Orphan Black and Fargo.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 44 (Enhanced) "Unthinkable"
item.description: Hello fellow Arrowheads! Welcome to the FINAL episode of Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast, the podcast dedicated to covering the CW's hit superhero television series: Arrow. For over five years, Woo S! Kim and I have not been trapped on a hellish Island known as Lian Yu, but we have been friends, back then we were joined through Smallville, since then it has expanded further than either of us thought it would and has brought us to Arrow. We started Longbow Hunters back in the summer of 2012, not knowing if Arrow would be a hit or a miss but we decided to take the chance. Since then, we have had the absolute pleasure to talk about Arrow, Green Arrow, DC Comics, and more on air with this show for the past two years with all of you guys who we hold very near and dear to our hearts. We've been able to talk with Marc Guggenheim, Blake Neely, Jeff Lemire (behind the scenes anyways), and all of you about Arrow, the character of Green Arrow, and about our show and we've had a blast doing it. Unfortunately, it is time to "bid adieu" as I am moving on to the next stage of my life and as Woo and I's lives both become much more busy, certainly busier than they were two years ago. Although we gave some of you guys shout outs in our finale episode, which you can find the links to below of download via the Across the Airwaves iTunes/Stitcher pages, I would like to again thank Dan & Nico, Andy, Christopher Wietrick, Alisa Lea, Jay, Lauren, VerdantArrow, Steve & Derek - our inspiration, and a host of others for your love, support, and dedication to Longbow Hunters as we took this two year journey through the DC Universe. It's almost fitting that we're leaving just as some of our favorite characters are given their sends offs on Arrow, like Slade Wilson & Sara Lance (who quite frankly, we don't ever have to see again), and we see that Oliver has finally taken his first steps off of Lian Yu in the flashbacks, just as we saw him do in the "Pilot" almost two years ago. Anyway, thank you all for listening and enjoy our finale episode of The Longbow Hunters where we cover the Arrow - Season 2 episode "Unthinkable", The Flash - Extended Trailer, our favorite memories during LBH, and what we plan on doing next! Plus, a special guest appearance by Mr. Dan Schmidt himself! All this and more on the final episode of Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hello fellow Arrowheads! Welcome to the FINAL episode of Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast, the podcast dedicated to covering the CW's hit superhero television series: Arrow. For over five years, Woo S! Kim and I have not been trapped on a hellish...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 173 (Enhanced) "Freak–Out!"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week we are freaking out over it being that time of the year again for Season Finales as we had to watch our favorite TV Characters contend with wedding madness, a death faking experience, going off the deep end, godlike computer systems going haywire and the old classic trial by  combat. However, just because we are freaking out doesn't mean we can't calm you down as we review new episodes of Game of Thrones, Once upon a Time, Castle, Warehouse 13, Person of Interest, Supernatural, Revolution, Modern Family and The Big Bang Theory speculating the future for these shows or predicting how they will end. Oh and there's more fun to be had from there as Nico provides another edition of his Airwaves Rundown Section reviewing Fargo, Orphan Black, Penny Dreadful, Grimm and maybe a few other things.
item.itunes:subtitle: It's that time of year again for Season Finales causing us here at ATA to freak out with excitement during this week's reviews on Game of Thrones, Once upon a Time, Castle, Warehouse 13, Person of Interest, Supernatural, Revolution, Modern Family & more.

item.title: Helicarrier Podcast: Episode #22 (Enhanced) – “Beginning of the End”
item.description: Welcome back to Helicarrier: The S.H.I.E.L.D. Podcast! On this very exciting episode, Andy, Nicki and Dan come together to review episode 22 of Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D., "Beginning of the End". In the epic season one finale the battle between Coulson and his team versus Garrett gets to final level. They also take time as always to read feedback from the listeners about the season finale, in addition, friends of the podcast comes in with some mini-discussions. But that's not at all as we make several big and exciting announcements for the future of the podcast so make sure to have a pen near you because there will be new links given out; that and more on this double-sized season finale of Helicarrier Podcast!

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 43 (Enhanced) "Streets of Fire"
item.description: Hey guys, first off sorry for the delay on this episode (Happy Mother's Day!), I know you're all very excited to hear our thoughts on this one and I promise we got it out as soon as we possibly could! That being said, on this week's episode of Longbow Hunters, we talk about the penultimate episode of Arrow - Season 2 entitled "Streets of Fire", and no, we didn't start it. We talk about Oliver, Slade, Laurel, Sara, Diggle, Felicity, Roy, Thea, Malcolm, and literally just about every character on the show as everyone has a role in this past week's episode. But after we're done talking with Twitter, do not turn off the podcast for not one but TWO reasons. The first reason is that Woo & I have an IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT for our listeners this week regarding our show and the other is so that you can hear our SPOILER section after listening to some Billy Joel. All this and more on this week's penultimate Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey guys, first off sorry for the delay on this episode (Happy Mother's Day!), I know you're all very excited to hear our thoughts on this one and I promise we got it out as soon as we possibly could! That being said, on this week's episode of Longbow...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 172 (Enhanced) "Renegade"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, it's about time Television's Big Bads know that the jig is up, the noose is out and we've finally found them with this week's reviews on Game of Thrones, Castle, Warehouse 13, Person of Interest, Supernatural and Revolution where the renegade villains featured on these shows were either  set up to be retrieved for a bounty or made to go nevermore astray thanks to Television's Heroes. The sitcoms we cover also went on a manhunt on their own searching for the renegade known as comedy with Modern Family and The Big Bang Theory using drama to boost ratings when laughs is what brings in their audience but thankfully New Girl came through in the clutch delivering the comedy we were looking for with its cruise ship centered season finale. Although,  with the Airwaves Rundown Section it was back to hunting down villains with Nico's reviews on The Americans, Orphan Black, Fargo and Grimm. Oh and if you listen to the Enhanced Version of the podcast be sure to not skip past this week's News with Nico section as it's filled with a wealth of knowledge about what shows including some ATA favorites are going to be picked up or cancel by the big networks for the Fall.
item.itunes:subtitle: On ATA 172, the jig is up, the noose is out, they've finally found them. Television's Renegade Villains that is as we reviewed episodes of Game of Thrones, Castle, Warehouse 13, Person of Interest, Supernatural, New Girl, Big Bang Theory & much more.

item.title: Helicarrier Podcast: Episode #21 (Enhanced) – “Ragtag”
item.description: Welcome back to Helicarrier: The S.H.I.E.L.D. Podcast! On this episode, Andy, Nicki and Dan review episode 21 of Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D., "Ragtag" - which explored Ward and Garrett's origin, how the two met while Coulson and May have to go undercover at Cybertek. Before they head into the spoiler section, they take time always to read a couple of tweets from the fans about the episode. Keep up with Helicarrier Podcast on Twitter @SHIELDassemble. Remember, if you want to have your thoughts read on Helicarrier Podcast, just tweet us after each episode has aired and we will read them on the show. We would love to hear what you think about each episode of Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.! Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. airs on Tuesday nights, 8/7c on ABC.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 171 (Enhanced) "Happy Star Wars Day!"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, may the 4th be with you as we celebrate Star Wars Day on this week's podcast with an installment of News with Nico revealing big casting news for Star Wars Episode VII and an interesting article about an lower budget alternate version of The Empire Strikes Back. Although, that's not the only hope for this podcast as we've also got reviews on Game of Thrones, Once upon a Time, The Following, Castle, Warehouse 13, a backdoor pilot episode of Supernatural, Person of Interest, Revolution, Glee, New Girl, Modern Family and a Big Bang Theory totally dedicated to Star Wars Day. Then Nico finishes off this podcast from long, long ago in a galaxy far, far away with an edition of the Airwaves Rundown Section reviewing The Americans, Orphan Black, Fargo and Grimm.
item.itunes:subtitle: Celebrate Star Wars Day as ATA Episode 171 reviews Game of Thrones, Once upon a Time, The Following, Castle, Warehouse 13, Person of Interest, Supernatural, Glee, New Girl, Modern Family, a Star Wars themed Big Bang Theory, The Americans, Fargo & more.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 42 (Enhanced) "City of Blood"
item.description: Hey everyone, welcome back to the Longbow Hunters Podcast! On this week's episode Michael & Woo cover the "One Day More" type episode of Arrow - Season 2 entitled "City of Blood"! They talk about Moira's funeral, Mayor Blood, Laurel's new role on the series, where Oliver's character could potentially end up next season, Isabel Rochev as the Ravager, and the flashbacks to Lian Yu! Plus the usual jokes, Twitter's thoughts, and SPOILERS for "Streets of Fire"; all this and more on this week's episode of Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast!

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 41 (Enhanced) "Seeing Red"
item.description: On this week's action packed episode of Arrow - Season 2 entitled "Seeing Red", we saw the rise and fall of some of our beloved main cast members, and unfortunately it was mostly fall. So, to honor those who have fallen from grace and risen above their original sins, we talk about this episode and more on the latest episode of the Longbow Hunters Podcast. We discuss Roy Harper, Moira Queen, Oliver & Sara, the possibility of Connor Hawke, Slade Wilson, and much more, all on this week's Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 170 (Enhanced) "Play That Funky Music"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week we're playing that funky music. Yeah, white boy we're playing that funky music as we bring back the psychedelic sounds of the 70s as a Disco Dancing episode of Castle headlines our fresh batch of reviews on Game of Thrones, Once upon a Time, The Following, Warehouse 13, Supernatural, Glee, Modern Family and The Big Bang Theory. Then Nico lays down the boogie to wrap up the podcast with his Airwaves Rundown section  by reviewing The Americans, Orphan Black, Fargo and Grimm.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 169 (Enhanced) "It's a Nice Day for a White Wedding"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, it's a nice day for a White Wedding, Game of Thrones style that is as we reviewed an episode of TV's hottest Medieval Fantasy/Drama that delivered yet another postnuptial shocker for a fan favorite character to follow up the mind blowing Red Wedding from last season. However, this wasn't the only episode we reviewed this week where the tables were turned on our Television favorites with Mike making a life changing decision on The Following, the final season premiere of Warehouse 13 showing us an evil alternate version of the Warehouse, the machine asking Finch to kill on this week's Person of Interest and Supernatural making it look like the Winchesters are the bad guys. There was also fun to be had with the sitcoms we cover as New Girl showed it hasn't missed a comedic beat despite two major characters breaking up  and Community delivered what may be their final episode in a way that dared NBC to cancel the show. Then after that we round things out with Nico's regular review on The Americans followed by his look at a few new things including BBC America's Orphan Black and Fargo, a new hit TV series based off of the Coen Brothers Film.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA 169 says it's a nice day for a White Wedding as we review another Game of Thrones postnuptial shocker along with episodes of The Following, Warehouse 13, Person of Interest, Supernatural, New Girl, Community, The Americans, Fargo & Orphan Black.

item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week's episode is all about celebrating the beginning of our reviews on Game of Thrones Season 4 where Nico presented us with the huge omen change is coming for our favorite characters. However, don't think this prophecy effects just one show as the sitcoms also showed signs of change as Sheldon made a huge new lifestyle decision and Community featured Greendale becoming a University defined by the phrase five dollar foot long. In addition to that we've got Andy and I reviewing Once upon a Time, Nico and special guest Bill reviewing The Following, Woo and Andy reviewing Glee and Nico bringing it all home with the Airwaves Rundown Section reviewing the season finale for Justified, The Americans, the first season of Helix and Grimm. item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 167 (Enhanced) "How I Met Your G.I. Joe"
item.description: Hey Kids, I want you to sit down and hear for over the next nine years the story of how I Met your mother. Actually, the story is more about how I met your G.I. Joe as this week of television featured the awkward pairing of our reviews on the controversial How I Met Your Mother Series Finale and the brilliant Community episode that inserted itself into the 80s Cartoon world of G.I. Joe. Beyond this, some normalcy was found in our reviews on Once upon a Time, The Following, Intelligence, Person of Interest, Glee, Revolution, Modern Family and The Big Bang Theory. However,   the theme of brutality seemed to be a common thread in the episodes of The Walking Dead, Justified, The Americans and Grimm Nico chose to review this week in our Airwaves Rundown Section. By the way, I'd like to thank our ATA Corps Member Woo Kim for all of the How I Met Your Mother voicemails he has sent us over the past two seasons, your insight on the show is absolutely brilliant and we really appreciate you taking time out of your busy schedule to share your thoughts with our listeners on a weekly basis. Thanks again, Woo! Your How I Met Your Mother Sections will be missed!
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's podcast tells the story of How I Met Your G.I. Joe as we review the controversial How I Met Your Mother Finale & a G.I. Joe themed Community. We also review Once upon a Time, The Following, Intelligence, Glee, Person of Interest and much more.

Although, just because we are giving away the ending to this podcast, doesn't mean it's not worth listening to the sections that come before hand. In fact, look at these sections not like the Star Wars Prequels but something more satisfying like The Hobbit Series as we deliver reviews on this week's episodes of Once upon a Time, The Following, Castle,  Intelligence, Supernatural, Person of Interest and Glee. And if we haven't confused you with this episode description more than Burton Guster is around women, then stick around after the Psych Finale Discussion for our sitcom reviews on How I Met Your Mother, New Girl and Modern Family along with the Airwaves Rundown Section where Nico reviews The Walking Dead, Justified and The Americans.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 165 (Enhanced) "Why Can't We Be Friends?"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, on today's podcast we ask the question why can't we be friends? That's because we reviewed a week of Television where our favorite characters had to put their trust in a person they weren't necessarily sure of as Once upon a Time had Emma on a witch hunt with The Evil Queen, a killer returns from the dead to be a possible ally on The Following, Castle teams up with a ninja, Intelligence had Gabriel befriend a teenage hacker down on his luck, Supernatural forced The Winchesters to play sponsor to a strung out on human blood Crowley, Finch was challenged to trust in the machine choosing Root as its conduit on Person of Interest, Psych had Gus put his trust in a dream therapist played by Bruce Campbell to fight the zombies out of his dreams and last but not least Revolution had Miles seek out allies to rise up against The Patriots only to have Monroe blow it all up in his face. Also after another solid Glee section from Andy and Woo, the sitcoms got in on exploring just why certain characters could be friends as the gang had to face what to do with unexpected wedding guest Gary Blauman on this week's How I Met Your Mother and Community had the Study Group played a game of Dungeons & Dragons to reunite Professor Hickey with his son played by David Cross. Then, Nico brought things home with the Rundown Section where he reviewed The Walking Dead, Justified, The Americans and Grimm.
item.itunes:subtitle: Today's podcasts asks the question why can't we be friends? That's because we reviewed a TV week where our favorite characters put their faith in an unlikely ally on Once upon a Time, Castle, HIMYM, Person of Interest, Psych, Revolution, Glee & more.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 164 (Enhanced) "Who's Afraid of the Wicked Witch?"
item.description: Howdy ATA Listeners, this week we are celebrating the return of Once upon a Time by asking the question who's afraid of  the Wicked Witch? Well, I can certainly say there's nothing that can make me go Lions, Tigers and Bears oh my more than Storybrooke's newest resident but do you want to know what's more frightening? Andy's impression of the Witch's wicked laugh, which you will all get to experience if he didn't cut it out of the episode. Then again, if the laugh was left on the cutting room floor believe me when I say it's frightening as Andy doing the laugh for our friend on The Helicarrier Podcast, Siike Donnelly left the poor guy running scared. Anyway, in addition to Once upon a Time, we've got a shorter schedule of reviews that include The Following, Intelligence, Glee, Psych, Revolution, How I Met Your Mother with an extended voicemail from Woo, New Girl, Modern Family, Community and The Big Bang Theory. Also as always we've got the Airwaves Rundown Section where Nico reviews The Walking Dead, Justified, The Americans, Elementary and Grimm in addition to giving us a watch or not suggestion on the new NBC sitcom Growing Up Fisher.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 68 (Enhanced) "War, What Is It Good For?"
item.description: Hello DC Nationites, I've got a question for you. War, what is it good for? Well, as the song goes absolutely nothing but for DC Nation Podcast Week 68 it's worth a whole lot as we review the animated film Justice League War. Although, our thoughts on the introduction to The New 52 version of the DC Animated Universe isn't all you're going to get from this episode as Michael and I discuss some big DC News Headlines surrounding the upcoming Gotham and The Flash TV Shows including the reveal of Flash's new costume as well as the launch of the official Gotham website, which features the series' logo.
item.itunes:subtitle: War, what is it good for? Well, as the song goes absolutely nothing but for DC Nation Podcast Week 68 it's worth a whole lot as we review the animated film Justice League War and discuss some big DC News about the upcoming Gotham & The Flash TV Shows.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 67 (Enhanced) "Beware the Comeback"
item.description: Hey DC Nation fans and welcome back to the show! I know we've been off air for quite some time, but due to scheduling, sickness, being out of town, and lack of new material to cover, we have been on a longer hiatus than anticipated. Nevertheless, we have returned and will be coming out with new episodes on a more frequent basis. On this episode, we cover the last two episodes of Beware the Batman Season 1, Part 1 with the episodes "Ascension" and "Fall". We talk about Batman and his villains, Magpie, what Batman fears he could become, Alfred and his role/past, Katana, Ra's al Ghul, the Soultaker sword, and why we need to see the rest of this season... We also discuss our buddy Giancarlo Volpe's most recent DC Comics production with JLA Adventures: Trapped in Time! Now don't worry, we'll end up talking about Justice League: War, but JLAATIT is definitely the more kid-friendly Justice League feature that you'll be able to watch with your child right after you finish Beware the Batman. It's all good stuff. We also briefly discuss Batman: Arkham Knight, the Arrow spin-off - The Flash, the most recent Gotham casting, and other DC related topics that may catch your eye. All this and more on the most recent episode of the DC Nation Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: DC Nation Podcast makes a comeback with Week 67 reviewing what may be the final two episodes of Beware the Batman and The Target Exclusive Animated Film JLA Adventures: Trapped in Time directed by our friend of the podcast Giancarlo Volpe.

item.title: Helicarrier Special Edition #3 - Interview With OSSM Comics
item.description: Welcome to a special edition episode of Helicarrier: The S.H.I.E.L.D. Podcast! On this installment, Andy interviews Siike Donnelly (great friend of the show who covered a good number of episodes, last fall) and Omar Spahi, the founder and president of OSSM Comics, which is also where Siike works. In depth, Siike and Omar talk about OSSM Comics, how and where it all started as well as what kind of books they offer and much more! Make sure to check them out on ossmcomics.com for additional information! Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. returns on Tuesday, March 4, 8/7c on ABC.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 36 (Enhanced) "Time of Death"
item.description: Hey Arrowheads! Welcome back! On this week's episode of Longbow Hunters, Michael and Woo start you all off with a brief discussion on Grant Gustin's The Flash costume that is to be used in the upcoming Arrow spin-off series starring the Fastest Man Alive (yes, this implies that Barry Allen will come out of his coma, so don't be worried about him)! The duo also discuss superhero costumes in general and what looks best on television and film. However that is not the main topic of the week as the boys also review the latest episode of Arrow - Season 2 entitled "Time of Death"! They talk about the Clock King, Laurel, Dinah, Sin's origin, the flashbacks, Slade's role in the present, and Felicity as she pertains to Team Arrow. Not to mention this week's exciting DC Universe Easter Eggs including references to Blue Devil, Blue Beetle, and Batman & Robin! Plus, we had Lauren be this week's Godsend as she picks up Michael's slack on the Twitter end of things. All this and more, SPOILERS, on the latest episode of Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey Arrowheads! Welcome back! On this week's episode of Longbow Hunters, Michael and Woo start you all off with a brief discussion on Grant Gustin's The Flash costume that is to be used in the upcoming Arrow spin-off series starring the Fastest Man...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 162 (Enhanced) "Collecting Spores, Molds and Fungus with Harold Ramis"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this episode is all about spores, molds, fungus and TV Shows as we tribute the week's reviews on our favorite programs like  The Following, Castle, Almost Human, Intelligence, Supernatural, Person of Interest, Revolution, Psych, How I Met Your Mother, New Girl, Modern Family, Community and The Big Bang Theory to one of Entertainment's best comedy writers/directors, Harold Ramis who tragically passed away last week leaving us with one less Ghostbuster in the world. In addition to our regular reviews, we have a special News with Nico section discussing our love for Harold Ramis' films such as National Lampoon's Vacation, Caddyshack, Groundhog's Day, Analyze This and of course Ghostbusters with the help of audio from the man himself. Then we wrap this episode all up with an Airwaves Rundown Section where Nico gives you a watch or not verdict on the new shows Mixology, Mindgames and About a Boy while reviewing old favorites such as The Walking Dead, Justified, The Americans, Elementary and Grimm.
item.itunes:subtitle: This episode is all about collecting spores, molds and fungus as we tribute Harold Ramis with our reviews on The Following, Castle, Almost Human, Intelligence, Supernatural, Person of Interest, Revolution, Psych, HIMYM, New Girl, Big Bang Theory and more.

item.title: Tangent Time 10 (Standard Only) "Super Tangent Bowl"
item.description: Hey guys! First off, sorry about the delay with this episode getting out. I promise that Longbow Hunters won't be at all affected by this, as the next episode will still be released this Sunday. On this episode of Tangent Time, Woo and I cover this years Super Bowl, including commercials, trailers, and what we are and are not excited for. Lots of Captain America: The Winter Soldier talk in this episode, so if you don't want to run the risk of being spoiled, this one is not for you! And of course, there is some Amazing Spider-Man 2 as well ("say whaaaat?"). Then Michael is put on the spot twice on this episode as he first talks about his experience with Frozen as well as how he feels about Supernatural's interpretation of Cain from the Bible. There's also some talk on what is a reboot and what is a re-imagination, all inspired by the new RoboCop film! Iron Man 3, The Mandarin, Batman vs. Superman, Green Lantern, and the definition of a geek vs a nerd are just a few more of the topics we talk about on the latest edition of It's Tangent Time!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey guys! First off, sorry about the delay with this episode getting out. I promise that Longbow Hunters won't be at all affected by this, as the next episode will still be released this Sunday. On this episode of Tangent Time, Woo and...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 161 (Enhanced) "Easy like a Sunday Morning"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, on this week's podcast we're taking it easy. Yes, that's right we're taking it easy like a Sunday Morning since the Television hiatus caused by the Olympics left us with only four shows to review for the week as in The Following, Castle, Almost Human and Intelligence. However, taking it easy doesn't mean were dropping the ball as we've got a great News with Nico section for you that has some LEGO fun and stirs up some NBC controversy. In addition, we top the show off with Nico's Airwaves Rundown Section Review on the most recent episode of The Walking Dead that you won't want to miss.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA Episode 161 is taking it easy like a Sunday morning only having to review The Following, Castle, Almost Human and Intelligence in response to the Television Hiatus caused by the Olympics.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 160 (Enhanced) "Come on Baby, Do the Locomotion"
item.description: Hi Everyone, after surviving the sickness that was plaguing our podcast, we ATA Cohosts are doing a brand-new dance now. So come on Listeners, let's do the Locomotion as we string together a train of reviews for episodes of our favorite shows that have aired throughout the month of February including The Following, Castle, two Almost Human episodes, two episodes of Intelligence, Supernatural, Person of Interest, Psych and three episodes of New Girl.  Also that's not the only way this podcast has the right moves for the  Locomotion as we review an episode of The Big Bang Theory where Sheldon actually goes on a train for the best night of his life while Nico's Airwaves Rundown Section reviews remind us why  shows like The Walking Dead and Justified are keeping the Cable TV train running strong.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA Episode 160 is doing the Locomotion to play catch-up from being sick with reviews on The Following, Castle, two Almost Human Episodes, two Intelligence Episodes, Supernatural, Person of Interest, Psych, Big Bang Theory, three New Girl episodes & more.

item.description: On this exciting episode of Longbow Hunters, Michael & Woo talk about one of the best episodes of Arrow to-date entitled "Heir to the Demon"! Here we talk the Lance Family, Laurel, Sara, flashbacks, Nyssa al Ghul, the League of Assassins, Thea Queen?, Felicity, Moira, and much much more! item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 158 (Enhanced) "March of the Guest Stars"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, on this week of television we got to review our favorite shows bringing out the big guns as in the giant freakin' laser attached to the Death Star with its March of the Guest Stars, which was so epic, it even knocked couch potatoes off the couch. Yes that's right, TV Producers let us as the audience behold the power of their contacts as Fringe's Lance Riddick kicked off the week as the CIA Director threatening Gabriel's freedom on Intelligence, Supernatural brought back DJ Qualls as Garth with a surprise transformation, Psych ended Anthony Michael Hall's guest run as  crazy Chief Trout and Bret Michaels was brought in for a cameo on Revolution to have some fun with its post-apocalyptic world. However, what really stole the show on the guest stars were the sitcoms as How I Met Your Mother's season-long guest star Cristin Milioti made waiting 200 episodes for Ted to fall in love with the mother worthwhile, Nathan Filion headlined the celebrity cameos on a  hilariously random episode of Community and The Big Bang Theory brought on the voice of the Dark Lord himself, James Earl Jones for the best TV sitcom guest appearance of the year. Beyond that, we bring in our very own special guest star, Andy to help cover The Following and Nico rounds things out with the Airwaves Rundown section covering Justified, Enlisted and Black Sails.
item.itunes:subtitle: With this week's reviews ATA Episode 158 bows down to the march of the guest stars appearing on The Following, Intelligence, Supernatural, Psych, Revolution, HIMYM, Community, The Big Bang Theory and much more.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 34 (Standard Only) "Blast Radius, Blind Spot, and Tremors, Oh My!"
item.description: Happy 2014 gang! Welcome back to Across the Airwaves' very own LONGBOW HUNTERS: THE ARROW PODCAST! Remember us? It's okay if you don't, we've been gone for a while, but we're back and we're here to stay, at least for now! Due to Michael being in Israel for two weeks and Woo being a bit under the weather, we got a few episodes behind in our coverage of our favorite show on television. Therefore, on this episode, the Dynamic Duo returns to cover the mid-season premiere of Arrow - Season 2 "Blast Radius" as well as the following two episodes "Blind Spot" AND "Tremors"! The guys also cover the trailer to the next episode of Arrow entitled "Heir to the Demon", though unfortunately due to all the episodes needing to be covered this week, the guys did not read Twitter's thoughts on the last few episodes. Sorry guys. Anyway, be back next week for our next episode of the Longbow Hunters Podcast!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 157 (Enhanced) "Here's to the Sidekicks!"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, in honor of Nico's birthday, this episode is all about giving a nice big hug to celebrate the sidekicks or supporting characters who made the week of television a critical success in our minds on the Season Premiere of The Following, Castle, the Season Finale of Sleepy Hollow, Intelligence, Supernatural, a first of its kind remake episode of Psych, Revolution, How I Met Your Mother, New Girl, Modern Family and Community. Then we round things out with our very own supporting character, the Airwaves Rundown where my very own sidekick Nico gives us the lowdown on new episodes of Justified, Enlisted, Grimm and the new Starz series Black Sails.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 156 (Enhanced) "We've Just Got Slapped"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, Nico and I went with the title of we've just got slapped for this podcast because like Barney Stinson on this week's How I Met Your Mother we were slapped with a thousand exploding suns as we had to review an avalanche of TV Shows this week that are wrapping up for the season or just getting started including Sherlock, Castle, Sleepy Hollow, Almost Human, Intelligence, Supernatural, Person of Interest, Revolution, Psych, New Girl, Modern Family and Community. However, this wasn't the final slap we took for the sake of this episode as Nico had to deliver the goods in the Airwaves Rundown Section where he reviewed Justified, Enlisted, Grimm and the new SyFy Channel show Helix.
item.itunes:subtitle: Just like Barney Stinson on this week's How I Met Your Mother, we just got slapped by reviews on Sherlock, Castle, Sleepy Hollow, Almost Human, Supernatural, Person of Interest, Revolution, Psych, New Girl, Modern Family, Community and much more.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 155 (Enhanced) "Schizophrenics, Parodies, Some Smoking Barrels and CBS' Computer Love
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners as you can see from the title of this podcast, we got a mixed bag of stuff from our favorite TV shows this week as Sherlock  gave us a look inside of a schizophrenic with a best man speech, Community and Psych parodied the works of David Fincher and Guy Ritchie respectively, Castle and Almost Human dealt with smoking buildings as well as barrels and CBS played up its love for computer by putting one in Josh Holloway's head on its new hit series Intelligence while Person of Interest introduced an arch nemesis to Finch's computerized machine. In addition we discuss New Girl, Revolution, Modern Family and the highest rated episode of The Big Bang Theory ever followed by Nico bringing us home with an Airwaves Rundown Section covering the return of Justified, Elementary, the new Fox sitcom Enlisted and Grimm.

For the first episode of 2014, Andy is once again joined by Across the Airwaves creator Dan Schmidt to discuss the mid-season premiere of Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. that gave us more answers to the mystery revolving Agent Phil Coulson's resurrection. item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 154 (Enhanced) "Stayin' Alive"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this episode is titled Stayin' Alive not for the Bee Gees but in response to Dan Harmon's resurrection as Community's Show Runner and Benedict Cumberbatch's Sherlock Holmes returning from the dead for us to add the hit BBC Series Sherlock to our regular slate of reviews. In addition, we review a new episode of The Big Bang Theory featuring a big moment between Penny and Leonard while News with Nico reveals some big changes for the Star Wars Franchise and the way you watch ABC Shows online. Then we round things out with an Airwaves Rundown Section reviewing that other Sherlock Holmes show Elementary and Grimm.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's episode is titled Stayin' Alive in response to our discussions on Dan Harmon's resurrection as Community's Show Runner and Sherlock Holmes returning from the dead on BBC's Sherlock. We also review Big Bang Theory, Elementary & Grimm.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 153 (Enhanced) "Don't You Forget about Matt"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, on this week's edition of ATA, Nico and I prove why Matt Smith should be telling the entertainment business don't you  forget about me as we review the 2013 Doctor Who Christmas Special marking his departure from the show. In addition, to the review we also discuss how Matt Smith redefined the role while talking about the legacy he and David Tennant left behind which Peter Capaldi now must uphold.  However, our speculation for the future doesn't just stop with Doctor Who as our News with Nico section reveals our thoughts on the casting of Paul Rudd as Marvel's Antman and the alter ego of the DC Superhero Vibe being a main character on the upcoming Flash series for The CW. So with that, what are you waiting for use the links below as your key to open up a fun filled but yet sentimental TARDIS ride of a podcast, which I assure you is much bigger on the inside.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA 153 proves why Matt Smith should be telling show business don't you forget about me as we review the 2013 Doctor Who Christmas Special marking his departure from the show. We also discuss the casting of Antman & Vibe being on The Flash TV Series.

item.title: Tangent Time 09 (Standard Only) "It's A Wonderful Tangent-Filled Life"
item.description: On the latest edition of the Tangent Time Podcast, Michael and Woo talk about everything! From discussing why Cartoon Network cancels good shows (and what Greg Wiesman is doing next) to the first halves of the current seasons of Supernatural Season 9 and Arrow Season 2 (and grieving two characters deaths...) to the Amazing Spider-Man 2 (Rise of Electro) trailer! Not to mention the 4 most important moments in comic book history... The duo discuss why some people like Thor better than Captain America and vice-versa as well as why Ant-Man should NOT be a comedic film and why he should have been in The Avengers: Age of Ultron. Woo also talks about looking forward to Daredevil once more as well as discusses where the Punisher should come into play with the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Finally, the show is wrapped up in a nice clean bow when the guys talk about their favorite Christmas flicks and wish you all a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year! So strap into your delorean, this baby's about to hit 88, and when it does you'll know that It's Tangent Time!
item.itunes:subtitle: On the latest edition of the Tangent Time Podcast, Michael and Woo talk about everything! From discussing why Cartoon Network cancels good shows (and what Greg Wiesman is doing next) to the first halves of the current seasons...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 152 (Enhanced) "Deck the Halls"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, in the spirit of Christmas this week's episode is decking the halls with mobs and musicals as I've caught up to help Nico review the entire season of TNT's Mob City along with Psych the Musical. However, tis' isn't all to make the season jolly as we review new episodes of Almost Human, Person of Interest, How I Met Your Mother and Andy joins me to discuss the Once upon a Time Midseason Finale and Nico rounds things out with a Airwaves Rundown Section covering the Homeland Season. So what are you waiting for? Fill up your glass of eggnog and fa la la la la, la la la la your way down to the links below to get this holiday podcast party started with some fun!

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 33 (Enhanced) "Three Ghosts"
item.description: Hey Arrowheads! Thank you guys so much for being patient with the release of this episode! Unfortunately it is a little late due to people being sick over the weekend and others having school finals to take care of, but we're back for this special mid-season finale episode before we head back off to hiatus-land! On this week's episode, Dan joins Woo and Michael once again to talk about the second part of the Arrow - Season 2 mid-season finale (and second Geoff Johns co-written Barry Allen episode) "Three Ghosts"! We talk about Oliver's secret, The Flash's origin, Diggle's role on Team Arrow, who Laurel could become by the season's end, Roy/Thea/Sin, Felicity and Barry, Solomon Grundy, Shado's unfortunate demise, and Slade Wilson aka Deathstroke the Terminator! Not to mention this week's look at this episode's DC Universe Easter Eggs and the finale to the 6-part CW/Bose commercial series "Blood Rush" starring Roy and Felicity! Oddly enough there are no spoilers in this week's episode as we head off to break, but before we go, we at the Longbow Hunters Podcast, as well as the whole Across the Airwaves Podcast Network, wish all you listeners, and your families, a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey Arrowheads! Thank you guys so much for being patient with the release of this episode! Unfortunately it is a little late due to people being sick over the weekend and others having school finals to take care of, but we're back for this...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 151 (Enhanced) "Jingle Bell Rock"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, the theme for this week's podcast is Jingle Bell Rock as the TV schedule winding down for Christmas has Once upon a Time, choosing the right time to put the Neverland story away but a Almost Human crime still makes it a swell time…to go riding on Sleepy Hollow's Headless Horseman drawn sleigh. So giddyup you Phil Dunphy like listeners, pick up those Canadian trekking feet, we've got a holiday Big Bang Theory review on the clock because with a Rundown Section reviewing Homeland, The Tomorrow People, Mob City and more mixed and mingled in the discussion beat, that's the Jingle Bell, (everybody sing) this is the Jingle Bell, this podcast is the Jingle Bell Rock!

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 66 (Enhanced) "DC Vs. Marvel Battle Royale"
item.description: Hey guys! This episode has been a long time coming and has been in development for quite a while, but with announcements of new X-Men films, Amazing Spider-Man trailers, Barry Allen being on Arrow, and Wonder Woman castings, we decided we needed to not only record but get this episode out to you ASAP! First on the docket we have our final ZERO YEAR tie-ins to cover! We talk about John Layman's CATWOMAN #25 and Francis Manapul's FINAL issue of The Flash (and Zero Year tie-in) in THE FLASH #25! We discuss what why the New 52 Catwoman book hasn't been the best and why the only issues we really enjoyed were tie-ins, not to mention all of our talk on Manapul's Flash book where we discuss not just this tie-in issue, but bits and pieces of his whole run on the series. Oh, and Barry kisses Iris! On top of that, we also covered the entirety of the SMALLVILLE: TITANS arc (aka Smallville Season 11 Special #4) which pays homage to fans of Young Justice, Teen Titans, and Super Friends! However, this is NOT the main event of our episode as we do something much bigger. Dan and Michael compare, contrast, and give THEIR complete and honest opinions on both DC Comics AND Marvel! From COMICS to ANIMATION to TELEVISION to FILM, the guys talk about what originally made these companies great, the fact that they need each other to stay in business, and why characters like Superman, Spider-Man, Batman, and the X-Men as so well loved today! All this and more on this week's DC Nation!
item.itunes:subtitle: DC Nation Podcast Week 66 tackles the ultimate age old debate of DC vs. Marvel in an all out Battle Royale while also reviewing the entire arc of Smallville: Titans and more Batman: Zero Year Tie-Ins such as Catwoman #25 and The Flash #25.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 150 (Enhanced) "A 150th Tribute to Canada"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, our milestone 150th episode of Across the Airwaves is a tribute to Canada because if we didn't have the country of the Maple leaf, the city of Vancouver would never have been built and therefore the TV shows we review couldn't exist since there would be no place to film them. Then again, not all the shows we cover are filmed in Vancouver but I'm sure through using IMDb and entertainment resources of the like you could a way of associating this shows we cover on ATA to Canada through a guest star or making a ton of jokes about the country like on How I Met Your Mother. In other words, I'm on a roll here so whether this episode brings out your inner Dudley Do Right, Alan Thicke or Robin Sparkles just go with it as we pay tribute to Canada through our main section reviewing Once upon a Time, Almost Human and Supernatural (shows I know for a fact were filmed in Vancouver) as well as our sitcom section going over episodes of How I Met Your Mother, Modern Family and The Big Bang Theory. Also there's more where that came from as the Airwaves Rundown discusses shows where their connections to Canada might be a stretch but definitely worth our time anyway such as Homeland, The Walking Dead, The Blacklist, South Park, Once upon a Time in Wonderland, The Tomorrow People, TNT's Mob City, Elementary, Glee and Grimm. By the way, Andy wanted me to mention that if you want more of his thoughts on this week's Once upon a Time check out his spot as a guest host on the Operation Cobra Podcast located here: http://www.operationcobrapodcast.com/2013/12/episode-181-save-henry.html.
item.itunes:subtitle: Across The Airwaves uses its milestone 150th Episode to pay tribute to Canada, the place that made our TV favorites possible by reviewing Once upon a Time, Almost Human, Supernatural, HIMYM, Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Mob City, The Blacklist & more.

On this episode, the terrific trio discuss Barry Allen‘s introduction onto Arrow, Solomon Grundy, Slade Wilson, Felicity and Barry, Roy Harper, Moira and Malcolm, and Oliver‘s final fate?(?)! item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 149 (Enhanced) "Thank You for Letting Us Be Ourselves"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, on this week's podcast we are celebrating what we are thankful for, which is you letting us be our crazy selves as we review our television favorites again and again such as Almost Human, Castle, Supernatural, Person of Interest (which had one of the best midseason finales I've ever seen), How I Met Your Mother and newly added to our Sitcom Section New Girl. However, move over the mashed potatoes and stuffing on this Thanksgiving dinner as we've also got an Airwaves Rundown Section reviewing Homeland, The Walking Dead, Sleepy Hollow, The Blacklist, the Revolution midseason finale, last week's The Tomorrow People, Elementary, Grimm and Glee. So if you're a Pilgrim using a Android device or an Indian using an iPhone sit down and dig in to this feast of a podcast that will surely bring everyone together!

item.description: Hey guys! As Arrow is off for this week, Woo & Michael decided to record a show about all the things they don't get to podcast about on a weekly basis like they do for Arrow! The duo talk about a LOT of topics this week and go off on many tangents. Most importantly, and probably the two longest topics, the guys share their over-all thoughts on Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. and Man of Steel now that it's out on Blu-Ray/DVD. Not to mention, there's also talk on PIXAR films, Muppets Most Wanted, Beauty & the Beast vs The Lion King, Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull, J.J. Abrams run on television, Almost Human, Sleepy Hollow, Supernatural, the Marvel Netflix shows, Stan Lee, and much more all on the latest edition of the IT'S TANGENT TIME PODCAST!

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 65 (Enhanced) "Beware the Storm, Mr. Wayne"
item.description: Hey DC Nationites! On this week's episode of the DC Nation Podcast, Dan & Michael have a lot for you!!! First off, the guys cover FOREVER EVIL: ROUGES REBELLION #2 which not only ties into Forever Evil #3, but will tie into Forever Evil: Arkham War as well... The boys talk about the Rouges, Mirror Master taking charge(?), Parasite, Poison Ivy, Captain Cold, The Flash TV series, and more! However, the main event of this episode seems to be more coverage on the BATMAN: ZERO YEAR tie-ins! This week, the tie-in talk includes coverage of the 25th issues of Batgirl, Batwoman, Birds of Prey, Green Lantern Corps, Nightwing, and Red Hood & the Outlaws! The dynamic duo talk Beware the Batman connections, various Black Canary origins, how much they love John Stewart, how Kate Kane and Bruce Wayne are related, Dick Grayson's young heroics, and Jason Todd & the Joker! But that's not all as the guys don't forget to promote YOUNG JUSTICE: LEGACY! The long-anticipated Young Justice video game, that bridges the 5 year gap between Season 1 and Season 2 of the incredible animated series, is out now! Fans of DC Nation, DC Comics, our podcast, and most certainly Young Justice should make buying this game (and playing it of course) a priority as it may eventually help resurrect the show in some form. All this and more on this week's DC Nation Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: There's a storm coming, Mr. Wayne, an actual storm as we cover Rogues Rebellion #2 with Batman: Zero Year Tie-In Issues of Nightwing, Batgirl, Green Lantern Corps, Batwoman, Birds of Prey & Red Hood and the Outlaws where a hurricane heads towards Gotham.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 64 (Enhanced) "Beware the Zero Year"!
item.description: Hello DC Comics junkies! On this week's episode of the DC Nation Podcast, Dan & Michael review all of the biggest comic book content that DC has out! First off on the list is FOREVER EVIL, with discussion on the third issue of the event as well as Forever Evil: ARKHAM WAR #2! From Ultraman to Bane and Owlman to Man-Bat, we make sure to cover all the big points from this past week's tie ins as we even briefly touch on Justice League if America #8-9! However, this week's main event is about one of the best Batman stories ever writen, and that is ZERO YEAR! The duo discuss Batman's early years, his uniform, and how Scott Snyder & Greg Capullio are making Batman comics stronger than they've ever been. And of course, we talk Red Hood One, the Joker, the Riddler, and even Doctor Death! Plus, we also discuss Jim Gordon, Luke Fox, Clark Kent, and Oliver Queen's roles in Zero Year with discussion on the ZY tie-in issues (all #25) of Action Comics, Batwing, Detective Comics, and Green Arrow! But that's still not all folks as we finally finish our weekly coverage of the SMALLVILLE series of books with Smallville Season 11 #69 "Olympus, Part 12". Here we talk "Alien", Wonder Woman, Season 11 as a whole, and more. Don 'to worry though, we'll still be covering Smallville, but from now on we'll be doing it by PRINT issue instead if digital as we have been. All this and more on this week's DC Nation Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: Beware the Zero Year as DC Nation Podcast Week 64 reviews what has been released so far of Batman: Zero Year and it's tie-ins. We also discuss Forever Evil #3, Forever Evil: Arkham War #2 & Smallville Season 11 #69: Olympus Ch. 12.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 30 (Enhanced) "Keep Your Enemies Closer"
item.description: Welcome back Arrowheads! On this week's episode of Longbow Hunters, Michael & Woo talk about the latest episode of Arrow - Season 2 entitled "Keep Your Enemies Closer"! As I'm sure you could guess, there are actually a LOT of DC Comics villains in this episode! From Slade Wilson to Isabel Rochev, even to Deadshot, Amanda Waller, and KGBeast, this episode is definitely action packed! On this episode, the guys discuss Oliver and Isabel, Oliver and Felicity, H.I.V.E., Deadshot, Diggle and Lyla, Roy and Thea, some suspenseful flashbacks, and more! The guys also talk about this week's edition to Blood Rush with Episode 2 of the Roy & Felicity story! And of course, as always, after the music the guys talk about SPOILERS for next week's episode "State V. Queen", which will feature the return of fan-favorite villain: Count Vertigo! All this and more on this week's edition of Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast, and remember, what happens on this podcast, stays on this podcast!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 147 (Enhanced) "A Tribute to Unlikely Heroes"
item.description: Hey Listeners, let me to you about this week's podcast, which believe it or not is walking on air as we review episodes of our favorite TV shows paying tribute to unlikely heroes. You know people like the Little Mermaid on Once upon a Time, Richard Castle the novelist who has a knack for solving real-life mysteries, the former Angel making slushies at the minimart on Supernatural, Person of Interest's single mother working as a street cop and the wacky uncle who proved his outrageous stories were true on The Legend of Korra. Oh and let's not forget the crazy ones  who found themselves on top of the world thinking the hero should be someone else such as the mother we've waited to meet who tamed ladies man Barney Stinson, the housewife that gave her husband Chinese Acrobats for a gift on Modern Family and the physics professor who wore an extremely itchy sweater to maintain his integrity on The Big Bang Theory. Then we continued flying away on a wing and a prayer into our Airwaves Rundown section unveiling more unlikely heroes where that came from with our reviews on Homeland, The Walking Dead, Sleepy Hollow, The Blacklist, New Girl, South Park, Revolution, Once upon a Time in Wonderland, The Tomorrow People, Elementary, Grimm and Glee. So with all this great content coming your way I've got to ask who could this podcast be? Well, believe it or not it's just  ATA.
item.itunes:subtitle: Believe it or not, ATA 147 is walking on air paying tribute to unlikely heroes reviewing Once upon a Time, Castle, Supernatural, Person of Interest, Legend of Korra, HIMYM, Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Sleepy Hollow, The Blacklist, Revolution & more.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 146 (Enhanced) "Under the Sea"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, you may dream about going to another podcast but that's just a big mistake. Just look at the shows around you, no one reviews as much TV. Such beautiful things surround you, what more than ATA is you looking for?  So come join the party under the sea. Yes, under the sea as this podcast will be better, down where it's wetter take it from me with Ariel, The Little Mermaid's first appearance on Once upon a Time inspiring us to dive right in on this week's reviews of Castle, Supernatural, Person of Interest, The Legend of Korra, How I Met Your Mother and The Big Bang Theory. However, that's not all for our hot crustacean band as we review the return of FOX's Sleepy Hollow, Homeland, The Walking Dead, The Blacklist, Revolution, The Tomorrow People, Once upon a Time in Wonderland and much more in the Airwaves Rundown Section. Then Woo and Andy take us from the bottom of the ocean and back to the surface with the resuming of their weekly reviews on Glee.
item.itunes:subtitle: In honor of Ariel's first appearance on Once upon a Time we're taking you under the sea with reviews on Castle, Supernatural, Person of Interest, The Legend of Korra, HIMYM, Big Bang Theory, Sleepy Hollow, The Tomorrow People, Walking Dead & much more.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 29 (Enhanced) "League of Assassins"
item.description: Hello loyal Arrowheads! On this week's episode, Michael & Woo talk about the ancient "League of Assassins" as they dive into the episode of the same name. They discuss Moira's trial, Laurel Lance - what's her issue and why does she do what she does, Shado's possible fate, who is the "Child of Ra's al Ghul", more Arrow/Canary team-ups, Detective Lance, and much more! The duo also reviews the first episode of the new Bose/CW Arrow mini-series (much like the "Chloe Chronicles" or the "Vengeance Chronicles" from Smallville) entitled "Blood Rush", starring Roy Harper and Felicity Smoak (with Detective Lance!). Michel then gives his quick plug/review of the Batman: Zero Year tie-in issue to Jeff Lemiere's New 52 GREEN ARROW series, which gives some backstory on Oliver, Diggle and Moira! Plus, SPOILERS after the music for next week's episode "Keep Your Enemies Closer"! All this and more on this week's Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast!

item.description: Welcome back to Helicarrier: The S.H.I.E.L.D. Podcast! On this week's episode, Andy is joined by his friend Siike Donnelly, a passionate comic book fan who will be joining Andy in covering Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. for a couple of weeks. item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 145 (Enhanced) "For Those who Love TV That Rocks, We Salute You!!!
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, since you are those who love TV that rocks we are going to salute you by going somewhere over the rainbow with Andy joining me to review a highflying Once upon a Time and then Nico stepping in for our reviews on Castle, a fun filled Wizard Of Oz themed Supernatural, Person of Interest and a Legend of Korra episode that said we certainly aren't in Kansas anymore as she traveled to the spirit world. We also finish the main part of our podcast off with a shortened Sitcom Section featuring thoughts on this week's How I Met Your Mother from the wonderful wizard known as Woo. Although, our following of the yellow brick road doesn't stop there as we've got a Rundown Section featuring reviews on Homeland, The Walking Dead,  The Blacklist, South Park, Revolution, The Tomorrow People, Elementary and Grimm. Then we wrap up the show once again off to see the Wizard, the wonderful wizard of Woo as he presents us with a another voicemail on Once upon a Time. So with all this great stuff coming your way, tap the screen of your ruby iPhone or Android device to be reminded that there's no place like Across the Airwaves for television reviews along with Nico's news.
item.itunes:subtitle: For those who love TV that rocks, ATA Episode 145 salutes you as we go over the rainbow with our reviews on Once upon a Time, Castle, Supernatural, Person of Interest, Legend of Korra, HIMYM, Homeland, Walking Dead, The Tomorrow People, Revolution & more.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 63 (Enhanced) "Beware Necessary Evil!"
item.description: Hello good and faithful DC Nationites! On this week's episode, Dan and Michael (finally) cover FOREVER EVIL #2! The duo have some great discussion on Lex Luthor, the Crime Syndicate, Bizarro, Otis (poor Otis...), the current state of the Justice League and more! But that's not all as they also cover two of the three major Forever Evil tie-ins: Arkham War and Rouges Rebellion! Here they talk about the war between Penguin and Bane and what Bane's real motives are, why the Rouges are really the most heroic villains out there, and what makes Forever Evil such a big event. Also, all is revealed as we get Ultraman's origin in Justice League #24, which the guys also make sure to cover. Unfortunately, that's not all as we have some sad news for all of you DC Nation fans. History has repeated itself as Cartoon Network has taken BEWARE THE BATMAN off of the air until January 2014!  Not only do we take the first 10-15 minutes of this podcast to inform you about it (as well as rant), but we also tell you how you can support this show! Finally, the Caped Crusaders cover Parts 10 and 11 of SMALLVILLE SEASON 11's "Olympus" arc (which is almost concluded) and Michael gives all of you more and more reason to buy the recently released Batman: The Dark Knight Returns - Deluxe Edition Blu-Ray/DVD Combo-Pack! All this and more on this week's DC Nation Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: DC Nation Podcast Week 63 makes evil necessary by reviewing Forever Evil #2, Arkham War #1, Rogues Rebellion #1, Smallville Season 11 #67–68 Olympus Chs. 10 & 11 and the Batman: The Dark Knight Returns Deluxe Edition Blu-Ray/DVD Combo Pack!

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 28 (Enhanced) "Crucible"
item.description: Hello Arrowheads! On this week's episode, Michael and Woo cover the 4th episode of Arrow - Season 2.0 entitled "Crucible"! Much is revealed and even more is discussed as they dive into talking about Sara Lance aka The Canary, Laurel's drinking/driving/drug problems, the very nice scene between Oliver and Quinton, DC Universe Easter Eggs, the Thea/Roy/Sin love-triangle, the amazing Arrow/Canary team-up, Brother Blood, Rochev's goals, and the controversial scene between Oliver, Diggle, and Felicity! Plus, Dan and Andy give their thoughts on this week's episode (as do all of you on Twitter) and the team of M & W discuss whether or not Arrow should be apart of the larger DC Cinematic Universe that began with Man of Steel, as well as Warner Brothers' need to make a decision one way or another. All this and more on this week's episode of Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hello Arrowheads! On this week's episode, Michael and Woo cover the 4th episode of Arrow - Season 2.0 entitled "Crucible"! Much is revealed and even more is discussed as they dive into talking about Sara Lance aka The...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 144 (Enhanced) "We Wouldn't Have a Podcast Without the Tube!"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, I wish we could find a way to have Nico's head bounce across the lyrics but here's the description of this week's podcast episode set to the tune of the song Howard sang to Bernadette on this week's Big Bang Theory so get ready to sing along… If I didn't have the tube, Nico I would have never met you, I'd be Once upon a Time, without Neverland. A Castle without a Beckett, Reese without a Finch, I'd be an Avatar, without bending. I'd never meet the mother, Woo couldn't deal with that. I'd be solving  domestic situations without Modern Family references making someone like the Big Bang Theory's Sheldon much harder to crack... I'd be chasing down Blacklisters without Red, the power like on Revolution would be dead, and we wouldn't have a podcast without the tube. [All:] And we wouldn't have a podcast without the tube. Ever since i met you, you turned my world around. You supported all my dreams and all my hopes. You're like Kenny, and dying, a South Park TV trope... I couldn't have imagined, how many Walking Dead Zombies my life would get... From the moment that I met you, Television tube. If I didn't have you, Supernatural wouldn't be scary. We'd be hunting Vessen, without a Grimm. I'd be Homeland, without a traitor. A Andy Behbakht, without a Glee section. I'd be Longbow Hunters, DC Nation and It's Tangent Time without Michael. I'd speak a lot more kryptonian, "Heghlu'meh QaQ jajvam" And we wouldn't have a podcast without the tube! [All:] Oh we couldn't even imagine, not having Across the Airwaves... Because we couldn't have a podcast, without the tube...  And if our sing-along description as you completely lost in left field, let me translate our crazy for you by explaining this week's episode reviews Once upon a Time, Castle, Supernatural, Person of Interest, How I Met Your Mother, Modern Family, The Big Bang Theory and a hour length Legend of Korra episode unveiling the origins of the Avatar. Then in the Rundown Section, we cover Homeland, The Blacklist, Revolution, The Tomorrow People, The Walking Dead  and much more. So what are you waiting for? If you love television, listen to this ATA episode because like the tube, we also wouldn't have a podcast without you…
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA Episode 144 wouldn't have a podcast without reviewing Once upon a Time, Castle, Supernatural, Person of Interest, HIMYM, Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Legend of Korra, The Tomorrow People, The Blacklist, Revolution, The Walking Dead & more.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 27 (Enhanced) "Broken Dolls"
item.description: On this week's episode of The Arrow Podcast, Michael & Woo cover the incredible 3rd episode of Arrow - Season 2 entitled "Broken Dolls", and was there a LOT to discuss!!! The duo sits down to discuss plot lines like the Black Canary, Ra's al Ghul, the Dollmaker's introduction into live action, Laurel's ultimate revelation, the parallels between the present and the past, Sin, the birth of Deathstroke, the Arrow/Lance partnership, and much more (including SPOILERS!). Plus, on this week's episode, the guys have added a new section to the show where they point out DC Universe Easter Eggs and explain them to the fans of the show, and boy was it a good week to start!!! All this and more on this week's episode of Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast!
