item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 143 (Enhanced) "The Midnight Train to Great Television!"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, Nico is leaving. Yes, he is leaving on the Midnight Train to great television. Actually, as you will hear in the background it's more like a Midnight Car Ride to an undisclosed location as Nico while on the road helps me review this week's episodes of Castle, Person of Interest, Modern Family and The Big Bang Theory.  Then our ATA Corps hopped on board this crazy train as Andy joined me to review Once upon a Time, Woo shared his thoughts on How I Met Your Mother and Michael joined me to talk Supernatural. However, the train didn't pull into the station just yet, as we switched tracks to the Airwaves Rundown Section where I reviewed the week's episodes of Sleepy Hollow, The Blacklist, Revolution and Michael joined me for a great conversation on the second episode of The Tomorrow People that was followed by Nico bringing us home with his review on The Walking Dead's season premiere. Also for those of you looking for this week's Legend of Korra review expect a special section next week discussing three episodes mainly focusing on our thoughts about the origin of the Avatar!
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA Episode 143 is leaving on the Midnight Train to great television reviewing Once upon a Time, Castle, Supernatural, Person of Interest, HIMYM, Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Sleepy Hollow, The Tomorrow People, The Blacklist, The Walking Dead & more.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 26 (Enhanced) "Identity"
item.description: Hey Arrowheads! Welcome back to Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this week's episode Michael & Woo discuss the second episode of the new (and improved) Season 2 of Arrow entitled "Identity". In this episode, the guys talk about Oliver's struggles with his identity both on and off the Island and what it means for him now that he's a hero and not a vigilante. They also talk about Roy's role in Starling City, Laurel's lack of one, how they felt about Felicity's complaints in this episode, and the sad truth behind Diggle's breakup. Also more China White talk and introducing the Bronze Tiger! Plus, SPOILERS for next week's episode "Broken Dolls"! All this and more on this edition of the Longbow Hunters Podcast!

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 62 (Enhanced) "Beware the Cypher"
item.description: Attention DC Nationites, there is a new super criminal loose on the streets of Gotham and Police Officials are warning you to beware the Cypher. I repeat, beware the Cypher!  According to reports,  it's been questioned if he is machine or mannequin but confirmation has been made his parts are from Japan and he is no different than the modern man. Unfortunately, that will not prevent him from using his menacing glowing green tentacles to control your mind. However, we can say domo arigato to scientist Mr. Roboto as he discovered that the answer to protecting yourselves from Cypher's mental attack is listening to this week's DC Nation Podcast featuring our reviews on three Beware the Batman episodes (Control, Sacrifice and Instinct), Smallville Season 11 #65–66 Olympus Chapters 8 & 9 and Michael's suggestions on the Villains Month Comics you should read. So what are you waiting for beware the Cypher and listen to this episode for your own safety from a guy who even puts the Meteor Freak Creepers from Smallville to shame.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 142 (Enhanced) "Blaze of Glory"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, on this week's podcast Angels falling from the sky in a blaze of glory marked the return of Supernatural to our regular slate of reviews while I teamed up with a cohost rotation made up of Nico, Andy and Woo to light up some fire of our own as we covered new episodes of Once upon a Time, Castle, Person of Interest, The Legend of Korra, How I Met Your Mother, Modern Family and The Big Bang Theory. However, that's not all the fuel we put on the fire as we use the Airwaves Rundown section to give our two cents on Homeland, Sleepy Hollow, Hostages, The Blacklist, Brooklyn Nine–Nine, The Goldbergs, the series premiere of The Tomorrow People, Revolution, The Crazy Ones and much more. Also for those of you looking for this week's Glee review keep an eye out for a separate ATA Special Edition episode hosted by Andy and Woo designated towards having a more in-depth conversation on the Cory Monteith tribute.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 25 (Standard Only) "City of Heroes"
item.description: Well hello fellow Arrowheads! Welcome back! After an exceptionally long hiatus from the microphone (especially if you haven't listened to our Tangent Time Podcast, which you all should get on immediately!), Michael and Woo return to Starling City in a fashion that rivals even Oliver Queen (who also returns) as ATA's very own Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast returns! On this action-packed episode, the guys cover the Arrow - Season 2 premiere "City of Heroes" where they discuss the new Black Canary, Oliver's new mission as Arrow, how Roy Harper spends his nights, as well as many other topics! After Dan and Andy share their own thoughts on the premiere and after numerous Twitter reactions are read (you guys rock!), the duo review the DVD/Blu-Ray Box-Set for Arrow - Season 1! And of course, after the music, spoilers for next week's episode "Identity" are included! Sorry about the audio in advance guys as Woo has an echo and Michael is a little scratchy. The joys of podcasting... Anyway, don't miss this exciting episode of Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! #CityofHeroes

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 141 (Enhanced) "Scavenger Hunting for America"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, I've got a riddle for you, as a potato's key tool, I have all the power. I am generally used on the half or full hour. If my cells were deceased or lost or the such, Only my partner would respond to your touch. What am I? Well if your clever like the Raj on The Big Bang Theory or his pal The Riddler, you would have guessed the TV remote control. A tool that helped Nico and I go scavenger hunting for America in search of great television, airing this week with our reviews on the season premiere of Once upon a Time, Castle, Person of Interest, The Legend of Korra, How I Met Your Mother, Modern Family and The Big Bang Theory. Then we got a little lost on our hunt for good television with the Airwaves Rundown as we covered several terrible sitcom pilots but we ended up turning things around with reviews on Homeland, Sleepy Hollow, The Goldbergs, New Girl, Brooklyn Nine–Nine, Hostages, Revolution, Elementary and much, much more including The Blacklist where Elizabeth Keen wanted to reach out with a pen to stab me and then you… So Sweet Caroline give this episode a listen because good times have never been so good!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 140 (Enhanced) "The Boys Are Back in Town"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, guess who just got back today? Our favorite TV shows that had been away. Changes have been made since finales came our way. But man, I still think, how we met the mother was crazy. This week we learned if Castle's muse is still around, tell you Person of Interest moved and where it can be found. Modern Family is scoring from Emmy downtown and Sheldon is driving the cast of Big Bang Theory crazy because (everybody sing)  THE BOYS ARE BACK IN TOWN! THE BOYS ARE BACK IN TOWN! I said the boys are back in town, so spread the word around as Nico and I also throw in a review on The Legend of Korra along with a Airwaves Rundown section catching up with returning shows like New Girl, South Park, Elementary and a vastly improved Revolution. In addition, we take a look at some of the pilots for new TV shows including Sleepy Hollow, Hostages, Mom, The Blacklist, Brooklyn Nine–Nine, The Goldbergs, Back in the Game, The Crazy Ones and The Michael J. Fox Show while Andy and Woo wrap the episode up with their thoughts on Part 1 of Glee's Beatles themed season premiere.
item.itunes:subtitle: With ATA 140, the boys are back in town so spread the word around as we review Legend of Korra, Castle, Person of Interest, HIMYM, Modern Family & Big Bang Theory. We also look at new TV pilots most notably The Crazy Ones & The Michael J Fox Show.

item.title: Helicarrier Podcast: Episode #1 (Enhanced Version) - "Pilot"
item.description: The wait is finally over! Welcome to episode 1 of Helicarrier: The S.H.I.E.L.D. Podcast which covers the new ABC series: Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. The show features the return of Agent Phil Coulson (Clark Gregg) - agent for the S.H.I.E.L.D. Organization from the Marvel Cinematic Universe and focuses on Coulson's new team of agents. In this episode of Helicarrier, Andy and Chris finally discuss the long anticipated series premiere "Pilot", as well as some Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. news that has been released. They also take the time to read what fans have had to say on Twitter about the show. Near the end of the first episode, you get to hear what other podcast hosts from the Across the Airwaves network had to say about the first episode in their individual recordings. Finally, Andy and Chris finish the episode by discussing what is coming up next on S.H.I.E.L.D. in the spoiler section. Keep up with Helicarrier Podcast on Twitter @SHIELDassemble and if you tweet your thoughts to the podcast about each episode after they have aired, your tweet will be read on the show.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 139 (Enhanced) Smells Like Teen Spirit!
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week's podcast smells like teen spirit as we begin our reviews on Book Two of The Legend of Korra with the first three episodes (Rebel Spirit, The Northern Lights and Civil Wars Part 1) where our favorite girl Avatar was being the typical teenager rebelling against her parents, Tenzin and even her boyfriend Mako until he set her straight. Then as we head into the Airwaves Rundown, the rebellious streak continues for some of our favorite TV characters/personalities with us reviewing the Burn Notice Season Finale where Michael turned on the CIA, Seth Green's sitcom about his relationship with a dysfunctional father called Dads and the New Girl gangs trip across the border to cause trouble in Mexico. Also Nico may also possibly answer the question that's been plaguing us all summer, how to get out from Under the Dome. So  if you're feeling a rebellious spirit, have nostalgia for your teenaged days or love rocking out to Nirvana give this podcast a listen because it starts the Fall TV Season out with a firebending bang!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey ATA Listeners, this week's podcast smells like teen spirit as we begin our reviews on Book Two of The Legend of Korra with the first three episodes (Rebel Spirit, The Northern Lights and Civil Wars Part 1) where our favorite girl Avatar was being...

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 61 (Enhanced) "Beware the Bat–Signal"
item.description: Hello DC Nationites! On this weeks episode, Dan and Michael discuss The Flash, Green Arrow, Katana, Batgirl, Batman, Superman, and Wonder Woman! That's right, your favorite superheroes all in one place! Starting off with some DC Headlines, the duo give their thoughts on the casting of Grant Gustin as Michael's favorite Flash, Barry Allen, for this coming season of Arrow. Jumping into their main event, the two review and discuss the Beware the Batman episode "Allies" where they talk Barbara Gordon, Katana, Outsiders, Ghosts, Batman, the Bat-Signal, and much more with their exciting back-and-forth! As always, they also review Bryan Q. Miller's Smallville Season 11 with this past week's issue of the "Olympus" arc as well as their thoughts on Smallville turning into a mini-series as opposed to a continuous series as it is now. And finally, the guys give their recommendations for the last few week's Villain's Month titles that DC Comics has been putting out to celebrate Forever Evil. All this and more on this week's DC Nation Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: DC Nation Week 61 is lighting up the night with the Bat–Signal as we review Beware the Batman S01E08 "Allies", Smallville Season 11 #64: Olympus Chapter 7 and beginning a weekly segment suggesting which DC Villains Month Comics you should be reading.

item.title: Tangent Time 07 (Standard Only) "Tangent in a FLASH!"
item.description: On this exciting episode of Tangent Time, Michael & Woo are joined by none-other than fellow ATA member Andy Behbakht, on this special superhero themed episode (but aren't they all?)!!! On this week's episode, the gang (going in the Longbow Hunters direction) talks about the news that Glee's Grant Gustin will be playing Barry Allen aka The Flash this season on Arrow! On top of that, the guys reminisce back to twenty years ago (before some of us were even born...) when Lois & Clark: The New Adventures of Superman first appeared and talk about how the television series actually shaped the Superman comic books. Speaking of comic books, Woo throws it out there that he doesn't think that comic books are as good or as "exciting" as they used to be, sending the group into a large and extensive discussion about the New 52, Marvel Now, and the comic book industry in general! There is also some interesting talk about the ninth season of Supernatural by Michael & Woo and Michael proceeds to plus MTV's Spider-Man animated series from the early 2000nds to anyone who will listen. All this and more on this weeks podcast: IT'S TANGENT TIME!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: On this exciting episode of Tangent Time, Michael & Woo are joined by none-other than fellow ATA member Andy Behbakht, on this special superhero themed episode (but aren't they all?)!!! On this week's episode, the gang (going in the...

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 60 (Enhanced) "Beware Pandora's Box"
item.description: Hello loyal DC Nationites! Welcome back to the DC Nation Podcast! On our last episodes, we covered all six episodes of Beware the Batman that had aired prior to recording... But on this episode, we return to covering the Bat with the majorly important episode "Family"! We talk Katana, we talk Alfred, we talk Lady Shiva and Silver Monkey, and of course, we talk Batman! But don't worry fans of Bryan Q. Miller, we're not nearly finished as we also cover Smallville Season 11's "Olympus" (Chapter 6) and "Hollow" (Chapter 4) arcs in detail where we talk about Superman, Wonder Woman, Lois Lane, CorTessa, and of course Lex Luthor. But that's not all folks, as before we even cover anything I just mentioned above, Dan and Michael dig deep into DC Comics biggest Justice League story since Throne of Atlantis, Geoff Johns & Jeff Lemire's TRINITY WAR! We talk Pandora, we talk Flashpoint, we talk the outcome and everything that lead up to it. We also give Ivan Reis props for his amazing artwork on the arc which spanned from Justice League to Justice League of America to even Justice League Dark, therefore uniting the three Leagues for the very first time in the New 52 universe! I bet the JL International kids feel left out... Spanning out of Trinity War, the Duo also discuss the biggest DC Comics crossover even since Final Crisis: FOREVER EVIL! Where the guys talk issue one of this groundbreaking Geoff Johns written, David Finch drawn, epic that will shake the DC Universe for years to come. Ultraman, Lex Luthor, Nightwing, the Rouges, Batgirl, Teen Titans, Owlman, Grid, the Crime Syndicate, the Atom, and much more! Don't miss this exciting episode of the DC Nation Podcast folks, it's the stuff of legends!
item.itunes:subtitle: To celebrate the milestone of reaching Week 60 the DC Nation Podcast talks about two of the hottest story arcs in current comics Trinity War and Forever Evil. We also discuss the Beware the Batman episode Family & Smallville Season 11 #62 & #63.

item.title: Tangent Time 06 (Standard only) "Tangents of S.H.I.E.L.D. (Arrow's are also involved...)"
item.description: On this exciting Tangent Time Podcast, Woo & Michael talk about a variety of topics! Go in depth with the guys' thoughts and predictions for Season 2 of Arrow, as well as their thoughts on the rest of the hit series. And of course, they talk the next upcoming MARVEL blockbuster film Thor: The Dark World, as well as a little bit about Avengers: Age of Ultron and X-Men: Days of Future Past. Somewhere in this episode, Spider-Man is also talked about... At one point or another, as well as what Michael & Woo are looking forward to with Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. and what they're worried about with the series. Oh, and don't forget to listen to the story of "How Michael Got Back into MARVEL Comics!" (and which arcs you should be reading...) as Michael recalls his last week buying his first Nintendo 64, along with the Spidey game based off of the hit 90's animated series. Also: STAR WARS! But the real gem of this episode definitely lies in the duos discussion about the new trailer for the upcoming RoboCop film! Michael Keaton! Samuel L. Jackson! Gary Oldman! Jackie Earle Haley! What more could you ask for? Well you'll find out on this week's edition of, well, what time is it? Oh... Right... It's Tangent Time!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: On this exciting Tangent Time Podcast, Woo & Michael talk about a variety of topics! Go in depth with the guys' thoughts and predictions for Season 2 of Arrow, as well as their thoughts on the rest of the hit series. And of...

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 59 (Enhanced) "Beware the Batfleck"
item.description: Holy Affleck, Bat-fans! It's an all-new episode of the DC Nation Podcast that finally talks about Beware the Batman! But hold on just a moment guys, before the big BTB discussion, Dan & Michael talk about Justice League: The Flashpoint Paradox and explain to you guys why you should all watch it!!! But in other news, the Dynamic Duo then go on to talk about the casting of Ben Affleck as Batman in the upcoming Superman/Batman cross-over film as Dan gives his complete and un-filtered opinion on the matter. Then, the two get onto the main event, BEWARE THE BAT(MAN)! In this section, the guys cover episodes 1 through 6 of the series as it is currently on hiatus. They talk about the Batman: Earth One parallels, Katana, Ra's al Ghul, Barbara Gordon, Alfred being a badass, and the parallels between Batman and Anarchy! Plus, not to mention their theory on a possible Beware the Batman spin-off, starring Katana and Metamorpho?... And of course, as always, the guys cover Bryan Q. Miller's Superman book entitled Smallville Season 11 as they catch up on "Hollow" with Part 3 and "Odyssey" with parts 4 and 5! Spoilers, there is a lot of talk about CorTessa and Wonder Woman here. So without further adu, Across the Airwaves' proudly presents the DC Nation Podcast, Week 59, and don't forget to beware the bat...
item.itunes:subtitle: Beware the Batfleck on Week 59 of the DC Nation Podcast as we discuss the casting of Ben Affleck as Batman, the animated series Beware the Batman and Smallville Season 11 Digital Issues #59–61 which includes Hollow Ch. 3 & Olympus Chs. 4–5.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 138 (Enhanced) "Sharp Dressed Podcast"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, on this week's podcast episode we are reviewing the final four episodes of Season 2 for SyFy/Showcase's Continuum with all the discussion you could want on the all the doublecrossing, action, mindbending time travel theories and duck calls that make the show great. Wait a minute, did I just say duck calls? You've got it, jack! As we don't just cover sci-fi on this episode but Si the man himself as we are happy, happy, happy to add Duck Dynasty to our slate of reviews, covering the hit TV show in the same fashion as our sitcoms. On that note, some of you (including the members of our ATA Corps) might think we've gone  quackers lowering ourselves down to covering a Reality Show when we've directed so much hatred towards them but we've got good reason to cover Duck Dynasty since the guys behind the show are putting a positive spin on television's trashiest genre with the intent of making America a better place. So for more on this controversial addition to our slate of reviews and a ton of fun discussing our crackpot theories for Continuum with a surprise guest host, you better come running as fast as you can, cause all the girls are going crazy for this SHARP DRESSED PODCAST!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey! We've got a sharp dressed podcast here as we discuss the final four episodes of Season 2 for SyFy/Showcase's Continuum and add A&E's Duck Dynasty to our slate of reviews. So give this show a listen, jack! It'll leave you happy, happy, happy!

item.title: Across the Airwaves (Enhanced) August News with Nico Bonus Mini-Episode (Fixed)
item.description: Hey Everybody its Nico and Welcome to Across the Airwaves. On this week’s episode, I have a special all "News with Nico" episode where I catch you up on all the news that has come out since ATA started its well needed and deserved summer hiatus. Across the Airwaves will be on Hiatus until after the premiere of Avatar: the Legend of Korra mentioned earlier in this episode on Friday September 13th.  Look for a new episode of ATA, ATA 138 to release sometime around Monday September 16th.  Also keep an eye out for new DC Nation Podcast episodes and a Michael and Dan Continuum episode as well.  But, for even more reviews and information on all of our favorite shows, check out the blogs available on our website at Acrosstheairwaves.com or check out the other podcasts on the Across the Airwaves Network: Including It's Tangent Time where Michael and Woo discuss all their favorite random topics in a hilariously random fashion, DC Nation podcast where Dan and Michael discuss anything and everything DC comics related including friend of the podcast Bryan Q Miller's Smallville Season 11, there's also the newest podcast Helicarrier: The S.H.I.E.L.D. Podcast hosted by Andy and newcomer Chris Doucher discuss the new ABC show Marvel's Agents of Shield show in depth, and finally Longbow Hunters the Arrow Podcast with Michael and Woo that cover's the CW's Arrow show each week. So during this hiatus, please checkout our website, follow us on twitter and Facebook and get caught up on all the podcasts on our network in preparation for a new Fall TV Season coming in September
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey Everybody its Nico and Welcome to Across the Airwaves. On this week’s episode, I have a special all "News with Nico" episode where I catch you up on all the news that has come out since ATA started its well needed and deserved summer...

item.title: Tangent Time 05 (Standard Only) "Holy Tangent, Batfleck!"
item.description: Hello all you film junkies, comic book nerds, and superhero fanatics, welcome/welcome back to Across the Airwaves Presents... IT'S TANGENT TIME! On this highly anticipated episode of Tangent Time, Michael & Woo talk about the upcoming Brain Singer film X-MEN: DAYS OF FUTURE PAST once again in a big discussion on why Chris Claremont is the definitive X-Men writer outside of Stan Lee as well as the one who should be credited for making Wolverine who he is today. We also talk a bit about some of our highly anticipated Fall 2013 television shows including Arrow, Supernatural, and MARVEL's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.! And going off of our last episode's discussion about film composers, the Dynamic Duo go in-depth on how they feel about Hans Zimmer as a composer to the point where the scores from THE DARK KNIGHT and MAN OF STEEL are compared. But speaking of The World's Finest Superheroes, because of the big news that came out regarding the upcoming Batman/Superman film (in theaters July 17, 2015), thoughts and opinions are shared about the choice to cast Ben Affleck as Batman, and here's a hint, they're not necessarily negative. All this and more on the latest episode of Tangent Time!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hello all you film junkies, comic book nerds, and superhero fanatics, welcome/welcome back to Across the Airwaves Presents... IT'S TANGENT TIME! On this highly anticipated episode of Tangent Time, Michael & Woo talk about the upcoming Brain Singer...

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 58 Part 2 (Enhanced) "Dan and Michael's Rousing Coverage of Comic Con 2013!"
item.description: It's Part 2 of DC Nation Podcast Week 58 where Michael and Dan's rousing coverage of Comic Con 2013 previewed what's to come from DC Comics with the Batman: Zero Year, Green Lantern: Recharged!, Superman: The New 52 Era & Meet the Co-Publishers Panels.
item.itunes:subtitle: It's Part 2 of DC Nation Podcast Week 58 where Michael and Dan's rousing coverage of Comic Con 2013 previewed what's to come from DC Comics with the Batman: Zero Year, Green Lantern: Recharged!, Superman: The New 52 Era & Meet the Co-Publishers Panels.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 58 Part 1 (Enhanced) "Michael and Dan's Rousing Coverage of Comic Con 2013!"
item.description: Greetings and salutations DC Nationites! I am in a heroicly boastful mood today as we escaped the destruction of Krypton, investigated the streets of Gotham City, navigated Space Sector 666 and battled alongside the Justice League to create one of the biggest DC Nation Podcast Adventures of 2013. And in the words of Aquaman from Batman: The Brave and the Bold, we are going to call it… Dan and Michael's Rousing Coverage of Comic Con 2013!!! Yes, it's finally here old chums, our coverage of everything to do with DC Comics at Comic Con 2013, most notably the variety of panels where writers and artists discussed what's to come in our favorite DC Comic Books. However, covering the panels was really just a guideline as Michael and I used this episode as an opportunity to lay all of our opinions regarding our favorite superhero characters in their current state out onto the table. In fact, our conversation  got so in-depth we had to divide this podcast into two parts with the first installment, which is a part of this blog post covering the DC Comics: All Access, DC Digital, Justice League: Trinity War and The New 52 Panels as well as featuring a discussion on my fears about Marvel's debut of the Superior Spider-Man (Dr. Octopus possessing Spider-Man's) having negative effects on future DC stories. Then with the second part it becomes a little more character focused as we discuss the Batman: Zero Year, Green Lantern Recharged!, Superman: The New 52 Era and DC Comics: Meet the Co-Publishers Panels while throwing in our thoughts on The World's Finest movie. So with my assurance that this isn't the trap of a dastardly villain, I ask you the question are you a man who is going to let one of the greatest comic book conversations I've had with Michael pass you by or are you a Superman who will embrace your inner geek by listening to this entire episode?
item.itunes:subtitle: It's Part 1 of DC Nation Podcast Week 58 where Michael and Dan's rousing coverage of Comic Con 2013 overviewed what's to come from DC Comics through the DC Comics: All Access, DC Digital, Justice League: Trinity War and The New 52 Panels.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 57 (Enhanced) "You're a Wonder, Wonder Woman!"
item.description: Hey DC Nationites, did you happen to catch the movie with Gerard Butler that came out in the spring called Olympus Has Fallen? Well, in terms of the Smallville universe Olympus is rising as Clark and Lois visit Washington DC where they meet the first superheroine in her white tights, fighting for our rights and the old red, white and blue, Wonder Woman! Wait a minute, that's not right. It should be satin tights but that's not what the artwork shows, as Diana has got her bracelets but she does her heroing in a white jumpsuit instead of the traditional Wonder Woman costume but some future cover artwork showed that it's coming  but at this part of the story, the Amazon Princess isn't quite the full-fledged Wonder Woman just yet as we think she's in The Blur stage in achieving her destiny. Anyway, with this episode's review of Smallville Season 11 Digital Issues #56–58: Olympus Chapters 1–3 otherwise known as Smallville Season 11 Print Issue #16 we talk about the decisions Bryan made to give Wonder Woman a Smallville twist comparing it to our frustration over Superman and Wonder Woman having a romance in The New 52. However, don't think that's all we talked about as we  formed theories on how many of Bryan's ideas behind the Smallville version  of Wonder Woman could be used in a live-action film. We also discussed how seeing Martha Kent again was able to recapture the sense of nostalgia for previous seasons that made the Season 9 episode Hostage so successful and how the mentioning of Connor Kent a.k.a. Superboy going to a school in San Francisco for superpowered teens makes us want to see a side story featuring the Smallville version of the Teen Titans with Cyborg as their teacher.
item.itunes:subtitle: On Week 57 of the DC Nation Podcast, we discuss Smallville Season 11 Digital Issues #56–58: Olympus Chapter 1–3 discussing the debut of Wonder Woman to the Smallville Universe and how this interpretation of Diana might work for a live-action movie.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 137 (Enhanced) (FIXED) "Never Fear, Our Coverage of Comic Con 2013 is Here!"
item.description:
Hey ATA Listeners, we are re-releasing our fixed version of Part II of our Comic Con Coverage where we've navigated our TARDIS through timestream of news, made a recording using salvaged Sentinel technology and edited like a World's Finest team to bring you one of the biggest Across The Airwaves events of the year covering the biggest Entertainment Industry event of the year our 2013 San Diego Comic Con Special! Yep folks, I know it's been a long time coming but the big granddaddy ATA episode of them all covering just about everything we discuss on this podcast is here and this time parts of it is coming from Nico on the Comic Con floor as he goes over the panels revealing what's to come from our favorite shows returning in the Fall/Spring such as Psych, The Big Bang Theory, Defiance, The Legend of Korra, Bones, Game of Thrones, How I Met Your Mother, Revolution, Person of Interest, Warehouse 13, Arrow, Once upon a Time and The Following. However, the fun doesn't stop there as we discuss upcoming films like Divergent, Ender's Game, Kick Ass 2, Riddick and the Veronica Mars movie while taking a look at some new shows revealing to you if we will be covering them on ATA or not including SyFy's Helix, CBS's Intelligence, the CW's The 100, the CW's The Tomorrow People, a little bit about Fox's Almost Human, ABC's Agents of Shield and ABC's Once upon a Time in Wonderland. In fact, this was such a Godzilla sized episode we had to split it into two parts where we used the second part to discuss The Amazing Spiderman 2 Panel and bring Andy in to discuss the panels he actually attended for Seventh Son, Godzilla, Gravity, 300: Rise of an Empire, the World Of Warcraft Movie, The Lego Movie, World's Finest (Superman versus Batman), I, Frankenstein, The Hunger Games: Catching Fire, X-Men Days of Future Past, Thor: The Dark World,   Captain America: The Winter Soldier, Guardians of the Galaxy, Ant–Man and Avengers 2: Age of Ultron. We also round things out with Nico and I finishing off our coverage of the Television Panels with Supernatural and Community while having Andy join the party again to go over the Doctor Who 50th Anniversary Panel giving our two cents on the actor playing the next Doctor. So with all of last out-of-the-way (whew, that was a lot of listing), I suggest you all give this podcast that we've all worked very hard on a listen because yes it's a doozy but it will save you hours of shifting through an avalanche of news on the Internet and as an added bonus you get to find out all about what's to come in the next few years for the Entertainment Industry with a few friends who may possibly deliver some laughs along the way.
Oh, and to better enjoy this year's Comic Con episode, I suggest watching the panels that correspond with our discussions on our ATA YouTube Channel under the playlist labeled Comic Con 2013. Also for our coverage related to the panels centering on comic books check out our next episode of the DC Nation Podcast, which will be available sometime next week.
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey ATA Listeners, we are re-releasing our fixed version of Part II of our Comic Con Coverage where we've navigated our TARDIS through timestream of news, made a recording using salvaged Sentinel technology and edited like a World's Finest team to...

item.title: Tangent Time (Standard Only) "The Power of Tangent"
item.description: On this exciting new Tangent Time Podcast, Michael has a crappy internet connection. No, really he does. So for the times that Michael cuts out, and because they just like having him on, Woo and Michael brought Helicarrier: The [Agents of] S.H.I.E.L.D. Podcast host Andy Behbakht onto this week's show! On this podcast, the trio talk about many of the amazing news to come out of San Diego Comic Con 2013 including news on Guardians of the Galaxy, Captain America: The Winter Solider, and The Avengers: Age of Ultron! The Wolverine is also discussed in great deal as well as what we know about X-Men: Days of Future Past; Michael also explains his hatred for Scarlett Witch and Quicksilver and briefly touches on which characters were not his favorite in The Avengers. But it doesn't stop there as we continue down the Joss Whedon path to talk about what made Firefly great and why Firefly out of any cancelled TV series got the cult status and a continuation film in the form of Serenity! But good times keep on rolling as talk about why MARVEL's Comics aren't as good arises and of course the long-awaited discussion on the upcoming World's Finest film, the apparent sequel to Man of Steel. All this and much more on this podcast which asks you what time it is? Well, it's Tangent Time of course!
item.itunes:subtitle: On this exciting new Tangent Time Podcast, Michael has a crappy internet connection. No, really he does. So for the times that Michael cuts out, and because they just like having him on, Woo and Michael brought Helicarrier: The [Agents of]...
