item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 56 (Enhanced) "Hi, Remember Us?"
item.description: Hello DC Nationites, the hosts of the DC Nation Podcast (Michael and myself) remember you, but do you remember us? Well, hopefully in the words of musician Sarah McLachlan you haven't let life with this podcast pass you by since we don't want to get lost in your memories as we are back to catch up on our Smallville Season 11 Reviews. Yes, we learned the hard way from this episode that time just keeps on slipping into the future but never fear as we are flying like an eagle into getting you caught up on everything Smallville by reviewing the Season 11 Digital Issues #52–53 Chapters 8 & 9 of Argo and #54–55 Chapters 1 & 2 of Hollow. In addition, we also talk about what's ahead for the DC Nation Podcast including reviews on Beware the Batman and our DC themed Comic Con episode covering all the DC Entertainment Panels that took place in San Diego a few weeks ago.
item.itunes:subtitle: DC Nation Podcast Week 56 taught Michael and I, time keeps on slipping into the future, the hard way as we had to get caught up on our Smallville Season 11 reviews covering Issues #52–53 Chapters 8 & 9 of Argo and #54–55 Chapters 1 & 2 of Hollow.

item.title: Helicarrier Podcast: Episode 0 - Origins
item.itunes:subtitle: Helicarrier: The S.H.I.E.L.D. Podcast! #SHIELD discussions & the origins of @Samaritan93 @Comic_Canuck @ShieldAssemble!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 135.5 (Enhanced) "Continuum Catch-Up"
item.description: Hello ATA Listeners, I know this episode comes somewhat out of order but with Michael and I being on vacation, there was some catching up we had to do on our Continuum watching. So on that note, we ask all of you to just play along with your imaginations as we travel back in time to review not just one but two episodes of Continuum, S02E07 Second Degree and S02E08 Second Listen. In addition, we discuss the advancements in Keira's relationship with Carlos now that he knows she's a time traveler, the back story behind Alec's girlfriend Emily, the quality of SyFy Channel's programming and briefly touch upon new sci-fi shows premiering in the fall such as Fox's Almost Human and CBS's Intelligence.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA Episode 135.5 is catching up on Continuum by reviewing the Episodes S02E07 Second Degree and S02E08 Second Listen.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 136 (Enhanced) "Get Back"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, now that we have come back from trips to summer camp and Comic Con, this episode is all about getting our podcast back to where it belongs by reviewing our TV favorites that were also in search of some normalcy this week as the Falling Skies Season 3 Finale brought the show back to its roots of battling an alien invasion out on the open road. In addition, Continuum gave us an episode where Keira got on the wrong side of the law making us want to get back to her original war against terrorists from the future, Burn Notice gave us an indication that it's final season is about Michael fighting to get back his sanity and Under the Dome featured its characters wanting to get back some normalcy as the imprisoned citizens of a New England Town run out of food and water. Also be sure to keep an eye out for our 2013 Comic Con Special, Andy's Comic Con Interviews, Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast's coverage of the Arrow  Season 2 Panel, The DC Nation Podcast's Comic Con Special and the premiere of the Helicarrier Podcast dedicated to covering episodes of Marvel's Agents of Shield coming soon or either already posted by our Across The Airwaves Corps
item.itunes:subtitle: Across The Airwaves Is Getting Back Where It Belongs With This Week's Reviews on Falling Skies, Burn Notice, Continuum, and Under The Dome

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 24 - "SDCC 2013" (Enhanced)
item.description: Hello Arrowheads! It has been too long, but welcome back for this short episode and even shorter period of time as we here at Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast bring you all the news and information you need to get ready for Arrow - Season 2! Now, be warned, there are SPOILERS as we talk about the effects of last season and what we learned last week at San Diego Comic Con 2013 about what is in store for Oliver, Laurel, Roy, Thea, Felicity, Diggle, Lance, Walter, and Moria for Season 2 of the CW's newest (and possibly biggest) break-out show. So strap in as Michael J. Petty and Woo S! Kim return to the microphones (that may or may not be a little fuzzy, sorry guys) to talk about your favorite hooded vigilante, who is on his way to becoming your newest arrow-shooting superhero!
item.itunes:subtitle: Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast is back, bringing you all the news and information you need to get ready for Arrow – Season 2 with our coverage of the show's panel, which took place at San Diego Comic Con 2013.

item.title: Across the Airwaves SDCC Interviews: Doctor Who and Orphan Black (Enhanced)
item.description: San Diego Comic-Con was as always a huge event as there were lots of trailers & announcements for movies as well as upcoming seasons of favorite TV shows to get excited over and more. This year, ATA’s Andy Behbakht got the honor of going to the BBC America Press Room where he talked with stars and creators of these BBC Shows: Doctor Who (Matt Smith as The Doctor, Jenna-Louise Coleman as Clara Oswald and executive producer/writer Steven Moffat), An Adventure in Space and Time (David Bradley as William Hartnell and executive producer/writer Mark Gatiss) and Orphan Black (Jordan Gavaris as Felix, Dylan Bruce as Paul with co-creator/writer Graeme Manson and co-creator/director John Fawcett)
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA Interviews stars and show-runners of @DoctorWho_BBCA & @OrphanBlack at #SDCC 2013

item.title: Across the Airwaves Episode 135 (Enhanced) "I'm Shipping up to Boston"
item.description: Hi ATA Listeners, I know everything has kind of been all over the place with our podcast as I attended the wonderful Camp Horizon (which you can find out about supporting here) Michael visits Montana for the summer and Nico along with Andy went to San Diego Comic Con 2013. In fact, as a result of our travels this episode is going to be shorter than what you're used to expecting since we are only reviewing Falling Skies in our main section as well as two episodes of Burn Notice and Under the Dome in the Airwaves Rundown. Unfortunately, if you're looking for the continuation of our reviews on Continuum you're going to have to wait until Michael's schedule frees up for us to record Episode 135.5, which will cover the past two episodes of Continuum that I missed while being out of town. Although, don't let that make you think this episode is a complete waste of time as News with Nico features some mind blowing TV News that came out of Comic Con, which I'm hoping will put this podcast back in a straightforward direction just like the penultimate episode of Falling Skies shipping the second the 2nd Mass up to Boston for a season ending final showdown with the traitorous Karen. By the way, keep an eye out for ATA's Comic Con 2013 Special Edition Episodes focusing on the second season of Arrow, Marvel's Agents of Shield, the shows we cover that are returning in the Fall and much, much more.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA 135 reviews Under the Dome and two episodes of Burn Notice in our Airwaves Rundown Section along with the penultimate episode of Falling Skies where the 2nd Mass begins shipping up to Boston for a season ending final battle.

item.title: Across the Airwaves Episode 134 (Enhanced) Nico Wants To Be a Comic Con Superhero
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week Dan goes on vacation to Camp and leaves Nico to take over the podcast like the Superhero he is, or at least the one he Cosplays at Comic Con, as he hosts the entire episode on his own. Although, with both Michael and Dan on vacation, Nico brought in a special guest, his Dad Bill Reifsteck to help discuss this week's episode of Falling Skies, where they discuss the possibility that Tom may still be in another layer of Inception like dream/nightmare or somehow still under the influence of Karen.  Then Nico reviews this week's episode of Under the Dome and discusses his excitement with the possibility that the mystery of the Dome may finally lead to that classic Steven King twist we're hoping for, but also how he is disappointed with the scare-of-the-week style episodes we are getting with this show. Also, Nico changed up the format on News with Nico this week as he reported the news and his opinions about the Comic Con panels he attended while there on Friday and Saturday this year.  Listen as he reports directly from the Comic Con floor.  Come join us in this Superhero effort as Nico host the podcast alone for the first time.
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey ATA Listeners, this week Dan goes on vacation to Camp and leaves Nico to take over the podcast like the Superhero he is, or at least the one he Cosplays at Comic Con, as he hosts the entire episode on his own. Although, with both...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 133 (Enhanced) "Surprise, Surprise"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week our favorite summer shows said surprise, surprise as we were shocked by revelations that came from seeing through their character's lies with Paracelsus using Myka's cancer to pull the ultimate doublecross in the Warehouse 13 Season Finale, Keira's secret of being a time traveler threatening her partnership with Carlos on Continuum and Falling Skies revealing the identity of the true mole. In addition, the seeing through characters lies continued in our Airwaves Rundown Section as we reviewed the Defiance Season Finale where the Earth Republic revealed they weren't the saviors Datak used to get himself elected as mayor. Then, I took over to cover a Burn Notice episode that questioned if you can trust a sexy Russian spy, Nico took a crack at just who might not be forthcoming about why the people of a New England town are trapped Under the Dome and Woo gave us his thoughts on a classic example of a story about lies turning things for characters upside down, Shakespeare's Much Ado about Nothing adapted by the great Joss Whedon.
item.itunes:subtitle: The phrase "surprise, surprise" comes to mind with ATA 133 as we review episodes that saw through the web of lies being weaved by the characters on the Warehouse 13 Finale, Continuum, Falling Skies, the Defiance Finale, Burn Notice and Under the Dome.

item.title: ATA Special Edition: Remembering Cory Monteith (Glee)
item.description: It's never easy to accept when an amazing actor on one of your favorite TV shows passes away - last Saturday night (July 13, 2013) it was reported that 31-year old actor Cory Monteith (who portrayed Finn Hudson on FOX's musical show Glee) was sadly found dead in a hotel room in Vancouver. On this episode of ATA Special Edition, Andy Behbakht and Woo S. Kim joins to discuss some of Monteith's most memorable performances, his best songs, the most inspiring aspects about his character and much more as they pay tribute to a young strong actor that was sadly taken from us too early. Our thoughts goes out to Monteith's family, friends/co-stars, (including real life and TV girlfriend Lea Michelle who portrays Rachel Berry), everyone who works within the Glee production, Ryan Murphy & the creative team for their loss - R.I.P. Cory Monteith; a fantastic actor with a big heart (both on-and-off screen) who will be deeply missed.
item.itunes:subtitle: It's never easy to accept when an amazing actor on one of your favorite TV shows passes away - last Saturday night (July 13, 2013) it was reported that 31-year old actor Cory Monteith (who portrayed Finn Hudson on FOX's musical...

item.title: Tangent Time 03 (Standard Only) "Definition of Tangent"
item.description: Hey guys, welcome back to the Tangent Time Podcast, brought to you by Across the Airwaves! On this episode, Woo and Michael talk in depth about your favorite nerdy topics, including (but not limited to) Iron Man 3, Star Trek Into Darkness, Phase 2, Amazing Spider-Man 2, Arrow, Summer Glau, Guardians of the Galaxy, Supernatural, and of course Power Rangers! Lots of rants on this episode, but don't worry, it's still a lot of fun. So, step inside your delorean and set the time... What time you ask? Well, It's Tangent Time of course!
item.itunes:subtitle: It's Tangent Time Episode 03 where Woo and Michael talk in depth about your favorite nerdy topics, including Iron Man 3, Star Trek Into Darkness, Marvel Phase 2, Amazing Spider-Man 2, Arrow, Summer Glau, Guardians of the Galaxy, Supernatural and Power Ran

item.title: ATA Special Edition: Man of Steel
item.description: Listeners of Steel, we present to you a special edition episode of Across the Airwaves that is once again around one of the biggest movies of 2013: Man of Steel! On this special episode, Andy Behbakht returns to the microphone after a  few weeks' absence with ATA creator Dan Schmidt and special guest host Chris Beck (@Chris_WeTalk on Twitter) who is a podcast co-host on the comic book podcast, "We Talk Comics" on wetalkpodcasts.com that is sponsored by Comicosity.com (that Andy has recently joined as a comic reviewer) which is a comic book website that gives you comic book reviews, previews, interviews and much more. In this roundtable discussion, the three men of steel discuss the strength and weaknesses about Zack Snyder's Superman reboot such as the cast, David Goyer's (with Christopher Nolan contributing to the story and serving as a producer on the project), script, the seed that has been planted for the so called DC Cinematic Universe and more. Also included in this episode is the thoughts of Matt Santori-Griffith, senior editor of Comicosity (@FotoCub on Twitter) and Keith Callbeck, podcast co-host of We Talk Comics and a writer of Comicosity (@CubReporterK on Twitter) that were supposed to join the guys but sadly couldn't make it. A warning before you listen to this episode: it is SPOILER FILLED so if you haven't seen the movie yet, we recommend you watch it first and then listen to this discussion. In case you missed it: 1) Michael J. Petty and Woo S. Kim's discussion about Man of Steel on "It's Tangent Time" - http://acrosstheairwaves.com/tangenttime02 2) Dan Schmidt and Michael J. Petty's discussion about Man of Steel on "DC Nation Podcast" - http://acrosstheairwaves.com/dcnationweek55
item.itunes:subtitle: Listeners of Steel, we present Across the Airwaves Special Edition: Man of Steel! Andy Behbakht returns to the microphone after a few weeks' absence with ATA creator Dan Schmidt and special guest host Chris Beck (from the comic book podcast, "We Talk Comi

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 132 (Enhanced) "Fireworks"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, with this week containing the 4th of July, the writers of our favorite Summer Shows seemed inspired to light off some fireworks as the penultimate episode of Warehouse 13 introduced Anthony Stewart Head as the Season 4 Big Bad Paracelsus, Falling Skies had the Second Mass finally confront Karen's control over Hal and Continuum had Keira reached her breaking point over the trauma of being sent back in time against her will.  Although, that wasn't the only excitement to light up the night sky in our discussions on this week's ATA as our Airwaves Rundown section included Woo being frustrated over the  apparent cancellation of The Goodwin Games, Nico and I wondering what's up with the strange use of music at the end of Defiance episodes and Nico reviewing the second episode of CBS's new hit Summer Series Under the Dome. Oh and for those of you looking for the most explosive Summer Series of them all Burn Notice, we didn't have a review this week because it was off due to the Independence Day Holiday but we make up for it with a News with Nico, which caused sparks to fly with some exciting Comic Con Panel Appearance Announcements.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA Episode 132 is lighting up fireworks for the 4th of July with reviews on Warehouse 13, Continuum, Falling Skies, The Goodwin Games, Defiance and Under the Dome.

item.title: Across the Airwaves Episode 131 (Enhanced) The Search for Immortality
item.description: Hey ATA Enhanced Listeners, on this week's podcast we review episodes of our favorite Summer Shows where characters are searching for their immortality or in the case of Warehouse 13's Season 4 Big Bads want to take after the popular Bon Jovi song "I Don't Want to Live Forever". As for our other favorites they fit right in with this theme as Defiance used a murder mystery to breathe life into the series' future, Falling Skies threw Tom and Pope into a fight for survival in the wilderness, a innocent man learns about what it means to have superpowers the hard way from a suit similar to Keira's on Continuum and Burn Notice has Michael learn that being a hardened spy doesn't necessarily keep you alive when hanging out with your old pals from Russia. Also News with Nico delivers some huge TV casting news and we've got more from the section that will never die, the Airwaves Rundown covering the Goodwin Games along with two new hit summer shows CBS's Under the Dome and NBC's Crossing Lines. So with it being the 4th of July, light up the fireworks with this podcast to ooh and ahh over our explosive reviews.
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey ATA Enhanced Listeners, on this week's podcast we review episodes of our favorite Summer Shows where characters are searching for their immortality or in the case of Warehouse 13's Season 4 Big Bads want to take after the popular Bon Jovi song "I...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 130 (Enhanced) Asks Why Can't We Be Friends
item.description: Hey ATA Enhanced Listeners, this week's episode asked the question why can't we all just get along as this week's reviews of our favorite Summer Shows featured individual characters or groups of people that were fighting but really all should just just be getting along. First off, Warehouse 13 took us to a Gated  Subdivision where somebody decided to not be so neighborly using an artifact to create some strange happenings followed by Defiance having a viral quarantine drawing a  bigger rift between Nolan and his alien daughter Irisa. Then things got heated on Falling Skies between the people of Charleston and what's left of the original United States over the Volm being an ally, Continuum set Liberate's gang war as a backdrop to Keira clashing with Alec over being tempted with riches by Kellogg and the final season of Burn Notice having Sam get frazzled by just how far Michael will go to keep his friends protected from the CIA.  Although, don't worry with all the fighting going on between the characters of our favorite shows, it thankfully did not spill into our discussions as Nico, Michael and I all got along this week for the most part so come on and join the fun as a click on the links below will have all sorts of news, laughs, drama and crackpot theories that will blow your mind coming your way.
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey ATA Enhanced Listeners, this week's episode asked the question why can't we all just get along as this week's reviews of our favorite Summer Shows featured individual characters or groups of people that were fighting but really all should just...

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 55 (Enhanced) "Whatever Happened with Dan Reviewing Man of Steel?"
item.description: EXTRA! EXTRA! THE OFFICIAL DC NATION PODCAST COVERAGE OF "MAN OF STEEL" IS ONLINE! ALSO, SPOILERS!!!! That's right folks, look, up in the sky, it's not a bird, not a plane, it's Across the Airwaves' DC Nation Podcast, your #1 source for coverage on DC Entertainment's animation, comics, films, and much more! On this week's edition of the DCNP, Dan & Michael cover DC Comics' latest blockbuster after last years fantastic film The Dark Knight Rises - and that film is: MAN OF STEEL! Now, Man of Steel is ATA's most anticipated film of the summer, and because of that it will be (and has been) covered on VARIOUS podcasts. However, since Dan & Michael do host the DC NATION Podcast, there is no other option but to have coverage on the film HERE. On this episode, the Dynamic Duo discuss Man of Steel to the fullest as they talk about Superman's No. 1 rule, Krypton, Lois Lane, Jor-El, the crazed General Zod, DC Universe hints/references, the fights, what they loved, and what they did not care for. All this and more is included here! But the Superman coverage does NOT stop there as the two also review the last week's Smallville Season 11 digital chapter #51 "Argo" - Part 7 (of 9) where they talk about Clark's role in the future, New Krypton, Doomsday, Booster Gold and Skeets, the Legion, and of course Supergirl! Note: this portion of the podcast takes place in the first 20 minutes of the show, so if you are not a Smallville fan, skip those first 20 minutes. Before you listen to this podcast, please realize that we are huge Superman fans and supporters here on ATA, especially the two hosts of this show, and do not take anything they say about Man of Steel lightly. Also note that there will be SPOILERS in this podcast, so if you have not yet seen the film, listen at your own risk. Man of Steel was a great film, but like any film it has it's flaws. However, that does not stop us from enjoying the film and we actually really enjoyed it. Michael and Woo S! Kim's coverage of Man of Steel on the ATA podcast "Tangent Time" can be viewed here: http://acrosstheairwaves.com/tangenttime02 Michael's review of Man of Steel as seen on the Superman Homepage can be viewed here: http://supermanhomepage.com/news.php?readmore=13468
item.itunes:subtitle: You've heard Michael's review of Man of Steel on Tangent Time, now it's Dan's turn to give his own review with Michael acting as his psychologist diagnosing his thoughts on the movie. Also Dan & Michael review Smallville Season 11 #51: Argo Chapter 11.

item.title: Tangent Time 02 (Standard) "Tangent of Steel"
item.description: Hello Super-fans! Welcome back to Tangent Time, the most recently rebooted version of Retro Reviews. This time, there are many different tangents, but the main one is on DC Comics, Legendary Pictures, Warner Brothers, and Syncopy's latest summer blockbuster by Christopher Nolan, Zack Snyder, and David S. Goyer. That's right folks, on this exciting episode of Tangent Time, Woo & Michael team-up once again to cover MAN OF STEEL! They talk about their favorite and least favorite parts of the film, rate it, and discuss one of the most controversial acts in Superman history. Find out who says what on this SPOILER-filled episode of Tangent Time!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hello Super-fans! Welcome back to Tangent Time, the most recently rebooted version of Retro Reviews. This time, there are many different tangents, but the main one is on DC Comics, Legendary Pictures, Warner Brothers, and Syncopy's latest summer...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 129 (Enhanced) "Heating up for Summer"
item.description: Hey Listeners, it's summer on the airwaves as ATA is heating up with sci-fi that is oh so gritty. Yes, that's right folks as my twist on the lyrics of Lovin' Spoonful's hit song implied the heat keeps getting turned up on Across The Airwaves' Summer Schedule with this week's reviews featuring Game of Thrones' Season Finale firing up the slaves of Yunaki to stand behind Daenerys Targaryen, Warehouse 13 featuring an artifact that spews out lava, Defiance putting more fuel on a burning passion between two female characters which may lead to trouble, Burn Notice kicking up its explosive final season, the 2nd Mass surprisingly exchanging gunfire with fellow humans instead of aliens on TNT's Falling Skies and actress Rachel Nichols being just plain hot kicking butt as a cop from the future on SyFy/Showcase's Continuum. So with all that heat, what are you waiting for? Jump in the pool by clicking the links to the episode below because the water is just fine on a Summer full of fun from your favorite hosts here at Across The Airwaves.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA 129 is heating up for our Summer Schedule by reviewing the Game of Thrones Season Finale, Falling Skies, Warehouse 13, Defiance, Continuum and Burn Notice.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 54 (Enhanced) "Michael's World of Metropolis!"
item.description: Look, up in the sky! It's a bird? It's a plane? No, it's Across the Airwaves's very own DC Nation Podcast covering this year's 35th annual Superman Celebration! On this week's exciting DC Nation, Dan and Michael first cover the digital chapters of SMALLVILLE SEASON 11 that they have not been able to cover over the past few weeks, including the conclusion to "Valkyrie" and the continuation of "Argo"! But after talking about Lana Lang, Metallo, the Legion of Super-Heroes, Doomsday, and New Krypton, the Duo switch to another Super-topic for the remainder of the episode. Every year in Metropolis, Illinois there is a Superman Celebration with celebrity guests, cosplay contests, and a ton of Superman-related fun, this year from June 6th to June 9th. Michael went down from the 6th and left the morning of the 9th giving him a full-on weekend of Superman to hold him over until Man of Steel. Dan and Michael talk about Metropolis, who Michael met (both friends such as Superman Homepage's Steve Younis and celebrities like Smallville's very own Michael Rosenbaum), what he did, how much fun he had, and about the experience in Metropolis over-all. So join Dan & Michael this week for a super-podcast dedicated to the Man of Tomorrow himself! Up, up, and away! And before we get to the links, I just wanted to give a quick thank you to Michael's dad JD, Steve Younis, the owner of Superman Homepage, his siblings and the owner of the  Hardee's in Metropolis, Illinois for showing Michael a good time at the Superman Celebration, you are all friends to this podcast in my book.  – Dan
item.itunes:subtitle: We're playing catch-up on DC Nation Podcast Week 54 by covering Smallville Season 11 Digital Issues #47–50 a.k.a. Chapters 4–6 of Argo & Chapter 4 of Valkyrie. Then Michael discusses his experience at the Superman Celebration in Metropolis, Illinois.

item.title: Across the Airwaves Episode 128 (Enhanced) Dan's on Vacation Attending the Red Wedding
Across the Airwaves Episode 127 (Enhanced) will Psych You Out in the End!
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week's podcast is going to be one of our biggest and longest episodes ever as we review every show that is going to be on TV this Summer! Psych, just kidding! Okay, most of you long-time listeners probably saw that coming from a mile away as we cover a lot less programming over the summer but believe it or not due to the Memorial Day Holiday, this week's episode, ATA 127 if you're keeping count, only reviews five shows this week, the Season Finale for Psych, which is covered by Nico and myself and a Rundown Section featuring Family Guy, Simpsons, the penultimate episode of Revolution covered by Michael and the introduction of the Goodwin Games reviewed by Woo in an extremely shortened Airwaves Rundown Section. However, for those of you disappointed for feeling shortchanged with this ATA episode, never fear because ATA will return after my vacation from June 4–11th covering double the Game of Thrones, Warehouse 13, Defiance, Revolution's Season Finale, Burn Notice, the new season of Falling Skies and a new show that were adding to our slate of reviews that you're all going to love Continuum.
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey ATA Listeners, this week's podcast is going to be one of our biggest and longest episodes ever as we review every show that is going to be on TV this Summer! Psych, just kidding! Okay, most of you long-time listeners probably saw that coming from...

item.title: Tangent Time 01 (Standard Only) "Reboot"
item.description: Hello ATA Fans and welcome to the newest addition to the ATA Podcast Network, phoenix style! On this premiere episode of Tangent Time, Michael J. Petty and Woo S! Kim go in depth into three (which turns into many more...) topics! The Duo discuss the controversy over Quicksilver being in both Marvel Studio's AVENGERS 2 and Fox's X-MEN: DAYS OF FUTURE PAST! Not only that, but they have an in-depth discussion about the X-Men films as well as what it means to be true to a character, at least in film. After that, the two discuss what made them become friends in the first place: SMALLVILLE. But not just the good, they get into the bad and the ugly and talk about what did not work for them while watching the show. Finally, the guys have a conversation about PIXAR, and Disney animation in general, which makes Michael with for another Disney Renaissance! However before they close the episode up, they do talk a bit about the Joker and his current role in comics, animation, and potentially film. All this and more on the first episode of, what time is it, well, It's Tangent Time!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hello ATA Fans and welcome to the newest addition to the ATA Podcast Network, phoenix style! On this premiere episode of Tangent Time, Michael J. Petty and Woo S! Kim go in depth into three (which turns into many more...) topics! The...

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 53 (Enhanced) "Holy 60s Batman, Michael!"
item.description: Holy month-in-the-making-episode Batman! Hey guys, welcome back to ATA's very own DC Nation! This episode was recorded a few week's back, in fact it was the week after Week 52 was recorded. But, due to personal projects, ATA finale episodes, Longbow Hunters finale episode, living our everyday lives, and being sick, we've been working extra hard this week to get this episode out to you all, because it's a classic! Let me start off by saying that this episode starts out reviewing Smallville Season 11 Digital Issue #45 and Teen Titans Go! Episode 2 meaning they are a few weeks old, but still worth a listen especially for some good insight on Smallville's Valkyrie Arc. However, if you would so choose to do so, skip those sections and head right on over to our main event. Yes folks, you've got it. Finally on the DC Nation Podcast, a commentary on one of the greatest superhero films ever made, the 1966 film - BATMAN: THE MOVIE! That's right, Dan and Michael do a commentary on the Adam West/Burt Ward Batman film, where they discuss/rip-on the 60's Batman, Bruce Wayne and Catwoman, Penguin's acting skills, how great Frank Gorshin is as the Riddler, why Catwoman is Russian, and what is up with Cesar Romero's (the Joker's) mustache! All of this and much much more exists on this week's DC Nation Podcast, Robin. POW! By the way, with us being a few weeks behind on our Smallville and Teen Titans Go! Reviews plans are in the works for our next episode to catch us up on everything so keep an eye out for DC Nation Podcast Week 54 when Dan returns from Vacation the week of June 11th.
item.itunes:subtitle: Holy time warp, Michael! DC Nation Podcast Week 53 has gone retro with reviews on Smallville Season 11 #45 & Teen Titans Go! that delivered the kick BAM! and the punch POW! to defeat four Super Criminals with our commentary on 1966's Batman The Movie.

item.title: Across the Airwaves Episode 126 (Enhanced) "The Enjoyable Spoils of Summer"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, welcome to Summer! The time of year that we podcasters want to come fast so we can take it slow because a vacation is needed from our favorite shows, for me and Nico. Although, with The Beach Boy lyrics aside, we really have been in need of a break from the avalanche of  Television programming we have been reviewing over the past few weeks and our wish came true by us having a shortened schedule made up of a Game of Thrones episode that primarily focused on Tyrion's wedding to Sansa, Warehouse 13 returning to the regular section as it abracadabraed into the world of performing magic, Psych going under the knife within the field of Plastic Surgery and Modern Family delivering a Season Finale, which brought everyone together in a heartwarming fashion with the loss of a family member. Then Nico continues to keep things hangin' loose with a chilled out version of the Airwaves Rundown section reviewing his favorite episodes from the Family Guy and Simpsons season finales, a standard episode of SyFy's Defiance and the season finale of Grimm. Also Michael stops by to review Revolution while Woo leaves us a highly interesting voicemail about Ted's progression as a character throughout the series of  How I Met Your Mother and another about a new show called The Goodwin Games that I'm sure all you HIMYM fans would enjoy.  So what are you waiting for? Pull up a lawn chair, grab your shades, fill up a glass of Iced Tea and give this podcast a listen as it will inspire you to act like it's summer even if it's still cold outside where you live.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA 126 lets us enjoy the spoils of summer with a shortened schedule reviewing Game of Thrones, Warehouse 13, Psych and the season finale for Modern Family. We also review Family Guy, Simpsons, Defiance, Revolution and Grimm in the Rundown Section.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 125 (Enhanced) "WKRP Across The Airwaves"
item.description: Awww yeah, ATA Listeners you're entering the television storm known as ATA Episode 125! I'm your host a playa named Dan Schmidt, here with my cohost Nico Reifsteck whose keeping it smooth like Psych's Burton Guster. And we are hugging you across the airwaves from the fictional former home of WKRP in Cincinnati with our reviews on Season Finales for the majority of our favorite shows… First off, the hug we are providing you is out of condolence as Once upon a Time delivered a finale where two villains we hate lived on to next season much to the dismay of Andy and Castle presented us with a disappointing finale, which left Nico and I flabbergasted because this is the first time, the writers have truly let us down but why did it have to come at the end of such a great season? Then the purpose of our hug changed  from being out of condolence to sheer joy as the Supernatural finale had the Winchesters break their constant cycle of sacrificing themselves for each other giving the show progression for the first time in three years. Speaking of character development The Big Bang Theory finale set up a whole bunch of changes for Sheldon, Penny and most importantly Raj in regards to his love life and the Doctor Who finale delivered a shocking revelation about the Doctor's new companion Clara that you need to see the episode to believe. In addition, even though I skipped some of the shows we normally cover that doesn't mean they weren't a part of the podcast as they didn't have finale's this week but held their own against them as Luke once again delivered the comedy that makes us love Modern Family, Psych gave Gus his own attempt behind the microphone producing hilarious results and Game of Thrones featured a epic showdown with a full grown bear who was willing to maul anyone in it's way. Although, that's not the end of the smooth sounds this podcast is ready and willing to deliver as the plan was for us to cover standard episodes of Defiance and Warehouse 13, followed by having Woo join us for our review on the finale for How I Met Your Mother where we after eight long years were finally introduced to the mother but I ended up with a kidney stone (ouch!) which I can assure you is anything but smooth. Anyway to make a long story short, Woo was unfortunately reduced to leaving us a voicemail, a result I feel bad about as I know he was very excited about being a part of this section. I was however able to join Nico and Andy for our review on the finale for Arrow which we called the best finale of the 2012–13 TV Season and gave the show the title of the best new show for this current season. Then Nico brings it all home as he covers the finales for New Girl and Elementary along with much, much more.
item.itunes:subtitle: Awww yeah! This is a playa named ATA 125 living across the airwaves, WKRP's to be exact with reviews on season finales for Once, Castle, Arrow, Supernatural, Big Bang Theory & Doctor Who while covering Game of Thrones, Psych, Modern Family & more.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 23 (Enhanced) "Sacrifice"
item.description: Hello Arrowheads! Welcome back to the Season Finale episode of both Arrow and Longbow Hunters as we close off our podcast (just for a little while) with a dynamic finish. First off, we apologize for the length of this episode being a 3 hour long episode. Sorry, but not sorry. On this episode, Woo and myself (Michael) talk about the Season One finale of Arrow entitled "Sacrifice", which was an incredible episode that really gave us a feel for what this show will be like in the future. We talk about Tommy/Oliver (not the Green/White/Red/Black Power Ranger, unfortunately), we discuss who the true Merlyn is, we talk Detective Lance, Fyers, Oliver's first step to becoming the Green Arrow and what's in store for the Lian Yu flashbacks, the repercussions of Moria's actions, Thea and Roy, Ra's al Ghul (yes, again), Laurel and Oliver, and where we think the series as a whole is going to go. We also discuss the digital comic entitled "From the Darkness" which chronicles Malcolm's origins (in Nanda Parbat) as the Dark Archer, and we briefly give our thoughts on the epic Supernatural finale which was just as good and aired right after Arrow's. All this and more on this special extended episode of Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hello Arrowheads! Welcome back to the Season Finale episode of both Arrow and Longbow Hunters as we close off our podcast (just for a little while) with a dynamic finish. First off, we apologize for the length of...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 124 (Enhanced) "Rise of the Machines"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, for years man has feared the rise of the machines as in Skynet overrunning the world with Terminators, Cylons trying to extinguish humanity and the Sentinels from X-Men creating a post-apocalyptic future. Well,  on this week of television, the machines rising against us almost became a reality as the weaselly Greg used machinery to torture the key to destroying Storybrook out of Regina on Once upon a Time, Castle had a mystery where a robotic military drone murdered an innocent man, Supernatural showed Crowley is a reading machine as he used Chuck's novels to start hunting everyone the Winchesters have ever saved, Psych forced Shawn and Gus to hide a major screwup from a machine of a security guard who was too good for his job, Person of Interest's season finale evolved the machine into an advanced version of the iPhone's and Doctor Who dealt with the return of the villains who originated man's fear of machines the Cybermen!  On top of that, the sitcoms even had to face the machines rising against us as Modern Family had Cam take on a punching bag machine,  Community pitted Jeff against his doppelgänger who had a Luke Skywalker style robotic arm and The Big Bang Theory showed us that Sheldon and Amy are not complete soulless machines when it comes to their relationship while throwing in some Howard as Nicholas Cage. Then to wrap up this well oiled machine of a podcast Nico delivers some big renewal/cancellation news on our favorite CBS, NBC and USA shows we cover here on ATA along with a Airwaves Rundown Section where we review How I Met Your Mother, Revolution, Defiance, Warehouse 13, New Girl, the penultimate episode of Arrow, Elementary and much, much more.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA 124 witnesses the rise of the machines as we review Once upon a Time, Game of Thrones, Castle, Modern Family, Supernatural, Psych, the Community finale, Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest's finale, Doctor Who, HIMYM, Revolution, Glee, Arrow & more.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 22 (Enhanced) "Darkness on the Edge of Town"
item.description: Hello loyal Arrowheads, welcome back to this week's Longbow Hunters Podcast! On this exciting penultimate episode of both Longbow Hunters and Arrow, we talk about the episode "Darkness on the Edge of Town"! Woo and I have some great back-and-fourth about Oliver and Laurel, the death of (comics superhero Geo-Force) Brion Markov, the Roy and Thea issue, the path to becoming Green Arrow or Malcolm Merlyn, Tommy Merlyn, and the shocking flashback on this week (Yao Fei!!!)! We also cover this week's digital comic entitled "No Way Out", which leads into some more discussion points. And don't forget to tune in after we wrap up the episode for our 18 minute long spoiler section brought to you by GreenArrowTV! Enjoy this episode guys, and thanks for listening to Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hello loyal Arrowheads, welcome back to this week's Longbow Hunters Podcast! On this exciting penultimate episode of both Longbow Hunters and Arrow, we talk about the episode "Darkness on the Edge of Town"! Woo and I have some great back-and-fourth...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 123 (Enhanced) Heroic Origins!
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, do you know what Bruce Wayne's parents being murdered, Frodo inheriting The One Ring and Luke Skywalker discovering he is a Jedi  all have in common? Well, they are defined as heroic origins, moments where fictional characters start down the path of becoming who they are destined to be, which seemed to be explored quite a bit on this week of television as Game of Thrones had Jamie Lannister reveal the true origins behind his title of Kingslayer, Once upon a Time gave more explanation to the origin of Snow White's hatred towards The Evil Queen, Castle re–explored the history of Rick and Kate's romance, Supernatural had the Angel Metatron explain the origins behind the Angel/Demon Tablets to the Winchesters, Psych almost had Shawn tell The Chief that the origins of his psychic ability is a little white lie, Person of Interest delivered flashbacks giving the origins of Finch using the machine to help innocent people and Doctor Who had Clara discover the origins of her doppelgängers who exist throughout history. Even the sitcoms  got in on exploring character's secret origins as Modern Family's Phil Dunphy clashed with the super villain who made him a realtor Gil Thorpe, The Big Bang Theory had Sheldon meet the children's television star that inspired him to be a scientist and Community had Abed cleverly line up all of its main characters histories to tell the Study Group's heroic origins of how they got to Greendale in the format of the movie Unbreakable, which also inspired this week's closing podcast music. However, that's not all we've got on this podcast fit for a hero's origin as Andy joins Nico to discuss the heart racing Season Finale of The Following, Woo joins Andy to discuss Glee, Michael stops by to talk Revolution and Nico brings it home with me jumping in briefly to discuss the Midseason Premiere of Warehouse 13, Defiance, New Girl, Arrow, How I Met Your Mother and much more. Also the great Woo S. Kim shares with you guys some voicemails on How I Met Your Mother and the Bones Season Finale where the menacing serial killer Christopher Pelant returned.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA 123 reviews episodes of Game of Thrones, Once upon a Time, Castle, Modern Family, Supernatural, Psych, Community, Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest, Doctor Who and more in our Rundown Section exploring our favorite TV characters' heroic origins.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 52 (Enhanced) "The New 52 Over–View!"
item.description: Hello fellow DC Comics/Nationites and welcome back! On this week's episode of the DC Nation Podcast, Dan and Michael are once again joined by infamous ATA member Woo S! Kim as they talk about a lot of DC Comics material! First off on the list is a review of Smallville Season 11's "Argo" - Part 3 as the Trio talk Brainiac 5, the Legion, New Krypton, and Supergirl! After that the team covers Dan & Michael's least anticipated series Teen Titans Go with the first episode "Legendary Sandwich/Pie Bros", which was legitimately hilarious! But after Smallville and Teen Titans, the gang covers the main event of this week's DC Nation Podcast. Yes, as Woo asks Dan and Michael questions on THE NEW 52, the truth is revealed. Find out what Dan & Michael loved the most, liked the least, hated, agreed with, and would have fixed with DC Comics's The New 52! Warning, major spoilers and talk about Batman, Aquaman, The Flash, Superman, Nightwing, the Justice League, Martian Manhunter, Green Arrow, Green Lantern(s), Red Hood, Grant Morrison, Geoff Johns, and much much more lies ahead of you on this week's edition of the DC Nation Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: It's double the Woo as he joins us for the second consecutive week to record this 52 themed episode for our podcast reviewing the pilot for Teen Titans Go!, Smallville Season 11 #44: Argo Ch. 3 & overviewing the road so far for DC Comics' The New 52.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 21 (Enhanced) "The Undertaking"
item.description: Welcome back Arrowheads to ATA's very own Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this week's episode of Longbow Hunters, Michael and Woo discuss the highly anticipated and extraordinary episode of Arrow entitled "The Undertaking"! After a "brief" explanation of what Free Comic Book Day is... The Duo discuss what the Undertaking is, the Oliver/Laurel relationship and how it's different in the past vs the present, Robert Queen and Malcolm's (and Frank's...) role in his death, Walter Steele, who may die in the next two episodes, tons of DC Universe references, and more! Also, Michael plugs and commends Jeff Lemire's Green Arrow #20, "The Kill Machine, Part 4" and the two podcasting partners review the digital comic chapter of the week, "Patient Zero". All this and more, including spoilers for next week's episode, on this week's Longbow Hunters Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: Welcome back Arrowheads to ATA's very own Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this week's episode of Longbow Hunters, Michael and Woo discuss the highly anticipated and extraordinary episode of Arrow entitled "The Undertaking"! After...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 122 (Enhanced) "I Am Woman, Hear My Dragons Roar!"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, I don't know if you all checked it out but this week's Game of Thrones had Daenerys Targaryen become the ultimate representation of girl power as she said I am woman, hear my dragons roar as she kick started a slave uprising by having her winged pets flame broil an abusive tyrant. In result of this, the writers of our other favorite shows must have been inspired as they aired episodes with their female characters showing some kick butt dominance.  Yep, that's right folks. ATA Episode 122 is all about girl power discussing Belle's jarring personality transformation on Once upon a Time, Beckett using a Millionaire Inventor to play hard to get with Castle, Felicia Day's return to Supernatural where she becomes a full-fledged hunter, Community's Britta untangling a Freaky Friday situation to deal with a breakup, Juliet taking down a stalker Karate Kid Cobra Kai style on Psych, The Big Bang Theory's Amy helping Sheldon find closure to the cancellation of SyFy's Alphas and Person of Interest having Carter save Fusco's butt big time. However, that's not all we got from the liberated female characters of television as I present a whopping crackpot theory from this week's Journey to the Center of the TARDIS Doctor Who episode regarding Clara being the Doctor's ultimate companion or in other words a representation of all 50 years of Doctor Who, who has shown up just in time for the 50th Anniversary Special in the Fall. Also with this week of television, I'm sure you can find plenty of other moments where women have reigned supreme in another edition of our Airwaves  Rundown Section where Andy helps Nico review The Following, Michael covers Revolution, I jump into Nico's review on Defiance and the great Woo Kim gives Andy a helping hand with discussing Glee. On top of that, Nico reviews The Americans, Elementary and much more. So guys who like geeking  out over their TV Crushes and girls who like cheering on their favorite fictional gal pals, what are you waiting for?! Give this girl powered podcast a listen because this one's for you!
item.itunes:subtitle: across,airwaves,television,once upon a time,Castle,go on,modern family,supernatural,arrow,big bang theory,person of interest,the following,glee,new girl,grimm,justified,walking dead,psych,the Americans,ABC,NBC,CBS,Fox,theCW,USA,FX,himym,doctor who

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 20 (Enhanced) "Home Invasion"
item.description: Hey guys, welcome back from that long terrible three week hiatus! On this week's return episode, Woo and I are joined by our good friend on Twitter, My. Jay_Zcost! On this episode, we have the pleasure of covering Diggle's revenge/motives, Deadshot, Oliver and Laurel, Tommy's dark destiny, Roy's heroic destiny, and Mr. Blank in this very exciting episode of Arrow entitled "Home Invasion"! We also cover the flashbacks and this week's digital comic entitled "Shado of the Past", which dives a bit deeper into the flashbacks and the story behind both Shado and Yao Fei! We also discuss why you should all go buy Injustice: Gods Among Us, in stores now, and the "Green Arrow embargo" that may have been put on the Smallville Season 11 comic series. All this and more on this week's Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey guys, welcome back from that long terrible three week hiatus! On this week's return episode, Woo and I are joined by our good friend on Twitter, My. Jay_Zcost! On this episode, we have the pleasure of covering Diggle's...

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 51 (Enhanced) "Woo Will Find Man of Steel #3"
item.description: Hello Super-fans, welcome back (or if this is your first time, welcome) to Across the Airwaves's very own DC Nation Podcast! On this week's episode, hosts Dan Schmidt and Michael J. Petty are joined by their good-friend and fellow ATA podcaster, Woo S! Kim! The reason Woo joined this Dynamic Duo to form a Terrific Trio was because of this week's main event podcast, two weeks in the making! The official ATA coverage of the third and final MAN OF STEEL theatrical trailer! Going deep into the trailer, the team discuss what they enjoyed including the fact that Superman actually throws a punch, General Zod's "I will find him!", Amy Adams' Lois Lane, Russel Crowe's Jor-El, Hans Zimmer's score, and the comic book influences including Superman: Birthright, Superman: Secret Origin, Superman: Earth One, All-Star Superman, Superman: Red Son, and John Byrne's The Man of Steel origin! And of course, to compliment our Superman-themed episode of DC Nation, we cover Smallville Season 11's "Argo" - Part 2, where we talk about Skeets, CorTessa, Brainiac 5's powers, Lightning Lad, and of course more Clark Kent as we see him in the future of the 31st century! All of this and much more on this week's DC Nation Podcast! Read Andy Behbakht's review of the Man of Steel trailer here on the ATA site: http://acrosstheairwaves.com/samaritan-reviews-man-of-steel-trailer-3/ Read Michael's review of the Man of Steel trailer on the Superman Homepage: http://supermanhomepage.com/news.php?readmore=12911
item.itunes:subtitle: WOO WILL FIND HIM!!! Superman that is as he joins us to discuss Smallville Season 11 #43: Argo Chapter 2 along with the third and final trailer for the most anticipated movie of the summer Zach Snyder's Man of Steel.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 50 (Enhanced) "Scooby Dooby Podcast!"
item.description: Hey gang, like what's going on? On this groovy episode of ATA's DC Nation Podcast, Dan and Michael cover, like, one of the last good shows to air on Cartoon Network (after Young Justice  Green Lantern: The Animated Series, Star Wars: The Clone Wars, and ThunderCats) Scooby-Doo! Mystery Incorporated! Like yeah man, Dan, Nico, and Michael have all covered the series on ATA before, but now that it has completed it's run (and because DC Comics does produce a Scooby-Doo comic series), the Dynamic Duo decided to cover the series as a whole and try and get fans of Scooby-Doo, supernatural plots, and teenage dramas to like check out the series. This podcast talks about the Fred & Daphne relationship, Scooby's role in the series, Shaggy & Velma, the supernatural mysteries and over-arching plot-lines that make up the series, and the amazing three-part series finale that could easily be the "greatest Scooby-Doo story ever told". But fret not fans of Bryan Q. Miller's Smallville Season 11 as the Duo does indeed cover "Argo" - Part 1, like, in great detail (yes, we're a little behind on those chapters, but like please bare with us)! All this and, like, more man on this week's DC Nation Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: On DC Nation Podcast Week 50 our review of Smallville Season 11 #42: Argo Ch. 1 made us go jeepers as it was interrupted by the Creeper leading to his capture, unmasking and a retrospective on the recently ended series Scooby-Doo: Mystery Incorporated.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 121 (Enhanced) "Sweet Dreams Are Made on TV"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, have you ever envisioned White Walkers invading from The North, seen evidence proving the existence of Bigfoot, believed you were traveling between parallel realities or maybe thought you had a ghost haunting your Victorian Estate? Well, if the answer to any of these questions is yes, you might think your entering The Twilight Zone but there's really only one place where these sweet dreams are made on TV with this week's reviews on Game of Thrones, Castle, Psych, Community and Doctor Who. Although, the trip through the seven seas of a television dreamworld doesn't stop there as our Airwaves  Rundown Section welcomes you to the new age where humans and aliens must coexist by reviewing SyFy's revolutionary new show Defiance, the first TV series to ever tie in with a videogame of the same name. Then we finish off this week's dream themed podcast with reviews on a filler episode of How I Met Your Mother, The Following, The Americans, Glee, Da Vinci's Demons, Grimm and much more.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sweet dreams are made on TV and who we to disagree as ATA 121 reviews Game of Thrones, Castle, Psych, Community and Doctor Who episodes questioning if seeing means believing. Also our Rundown Section discusses SyFy's new series Defiance, HIMYM & more.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 49 (Enhanced) "Death of the Podcast"
item.description: Hello all of you who have been anxiously awaiting this latest episode of ATA's DC Nation Podcast! We're sorry that it took so long, but both Dan and myself had a lot going on and we weren't able to work on this episode as much. Anyway, on this week's episode, Dan and I cover one of the greatest Batman epics of this generation, if not of all-time: BATMAN: DEATH OF THE FAMILY. We go through this story play-by-play where we talk about the tie-in's, including Batgirl, Catwoman, Suicide Squad, Nightwing, Teen Titans, Red Hood & the Outlaws, Detective Comics, and of course Scott Snyder's Batman! We also discuss the Joker and his possible New 52 origin, as well as how we feel about Batman: Zero Year! And, on the note of DoTF, we also go into in depth discussion about Grant Morrison's ROBIN R.I.P. story (in Batman Incorporated #8) and go deep into our feelings about Grant Morrison's Batman, Batman Inc., and Action Comics. And don't worry fans of Bryan Q. Miller's Smallville Season 11, because we also cover "Valkyrie" - Part 1 where we talk about Lois Lane and Lana Lang! All this and more on this week's DC Nation Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: On DC Nation Week 49, it's all smiles around here as we discuss Smallville Season 11 #41 Valkyrie Ch. 1 & the Joker's frightening return to comics in Death of the Family. Then we take the face off of Grant Morrison's controversial storyline Robin R.I.P.

item.title: Across the Airwaves Episode 120 (Enhanced) "Dan & Nico Wang Chung Tonight!"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, it's time for everybody to Wang Chung tonight as the reviews of our favorite TV shows for the week took us back to the 80's with this edition of the Across The Airwaves Podcast. Well actually we first take a pit stop in a parallel fantasy style version of what we would classify Medieval Times  as we discuss Game of Thrones. Then we Wang Chung to the synthesizing sounds of the 80s as Modern Family has the Dunphys woo a potential buyer of their flipped house with the hit Queen song Another One Bites the Dust, Community's use of puppets brought me back to watching Sesame Street as a kid in the 80s, Go On told a joke that probably referenced George's days as a cop in the 80s and Psych literally had their characters Wang Chung tonight as Lassie's wedding  was a perfect celebration of his character that ended in one of the most shocking moments of the series. Heck, we even ran into the Doctor and Clara with our travels back to the 80s as they had just come off a Doctor Who adventure that was a combination of two classic 80s films, Aliens and The Hunt for Red October. They also added a little bit of Duran Duran's Hungry like the Wolf to our Wang Chung rocking by introducing us to their new friend the Professor from Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles II Secret of the Ooze. However that wasn't the end to our Wang Chunging as our Airwaves Rundown Section had Michael, Andy and Woo bust out the freestyle dance moves on their respective reviews of Revolution, The Following and a highly controversial school shooting episode of Glee. Then Nico puts his final moves on the dance party with his reviews on New Girl, The Americans, the new Starz original series Da Vinci's Demons and much more.
item.itunes:subtitle: Everybody Wang Chung tonight as we review episodes of Game of Thrones, Modern Family, Psych, Community, Go On and Doctor Who that took us back to the 80s. Then we keep partying with the Rundown Section reviewing Revolution, Glee, The Following and more.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 48 (Enhanced) "A Haunted Throne of Atlantis"
item.description: Hey gang! Welcome back to this long awaited episode of ATA's DC Nation as we return from a long hiatus due to our main animated content being cancelled by Cartoon Network (Young Justice and Green Lantern: The Animated Series). Sad day. But what isn't sad is our final coverage of the conclusion of the Bryan Q. Miller written Smallville Season 11 episode "Haunted" as we wrap up the final three digital issues (#38-40) aka the 12th print issue of the series! After that sad talk about Bart's demise, the return of Tess Mercer and Clark Kent, and the farewell (at least for now) of Chloe and Oliver, we move right along into covering one of the best parts of the New 52... The Geoff Johns written Aquaman/Justice League crossover event that rocked the New 52 universe: Throne of Atlantis! We talk about Aquaman, Cyborg, the Superman/Wonder Woman romance, the Batman/Aquaman duo, Vulko, the Prologue  the Epilogue and what is in store for both the Justice League and Aquaman himself! All this and much more on this week's edition of the DC Nation Podcast!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: After brief period of mourning for Green Lantern: TAS and Young Justice, we have returned with DC Nation Podcast Week 48 reviewing Smallville Season 11 Digital Issues #38–40 and the Justice League/Aquaman Comic Book Story Arc Throne of Atlantis.

item.title: Across the Airwaves Episode 119 (Enhanced) Rear Window to a Game of Thrones
item.description: Good day Lords and Ladies from the House of ATA Listeners! I present you a legendary sized podcast titled "Rear Window to a Game of Thrones" as Castle's  Rear Window themed 100th Episode and the addition of Game of Thrones to our regular slate of reviews headline our discussions about Luke and Phil trying to invent the first self flipping pancake on Modern Family, Psych presenting us with a Two and a Half Men scenario that led to a brief breakup for Shawn and Gus,  Supernatural taking Sam on the highway to hell literally and the guys having a somewhat socially offensive battle for tenure on The Big Bang Theory. In addition, Community has Abed tangle with the classic TV Trope of having two dates to the same dance, Ryan shows off his mad dance skills in a mascot uniform on this week's Go On and we give our two cents on a Doctor Who episode that did a good job of getting us to know his new companion Clara but fell short on the awesomeness scale compared to the other episodes we've had this season. Although, that's not all you're going to get from this podcast as we're not going to keep you hanging without another Airwaves Rundown Section where Michael takes over our weekly Revolution segment to lead off thoughts on the Season Finales for The Walking Dead and Justified as well as reviews on regular episodes of New Girl, The Following, Arrow, Glee and much more.
item.itunes:subtitle: On ATA 119, the Game of Thrones Season 3 Premiere & Castle's Rear Window themed 100th Episode headline this week's reviews on Modern Family, Psych, Supernatural, Community, Go On, Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest, Doctor Who, and much more.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 19 (Enhanced) "Unfinished Business"
item.description: Hey guys, welcome back to this week's very exciting and action-packed episode of Across the Airwaves' Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this episode, Woo & I talk about the ATA-favorite Bryan Q. Miller co-written episode (with Lindsey Allen) of Arrow: "Unfinished Business"! We talk about the Count's new status at Starkham, Tommy's dark decent, Oliver's training on Lian Yu, and Diggle's revenge-against-Deadshot story-line. As you will be able to tell by our discussion, we really enjoyed this episode, but the episode is not all we talk about as we discuss this week's digital comic entitled "Lapse", which chronicles the Tommy/Laurel relationship in graphic detail! And for those fans of Jeff Lemire's New 52 Green Arrow comic series (as I am), I review the 3rd issue in his new run (Green Arrow #19), "The Kill Machine, Part 3". All this Emerald Archer-y goodness in this week's episode of Longbow Hunters!!!

item.description: Welcome back Arrowheads to ATA's very own Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this week's episode of Longbow Hunters, Michael and Woo discuss the highly anticipated and extraordinary episode of Arrow entitled "The Undertaking"! After a "brief" explanation of what Free Comic Book Day is... The Duo discuss what the Undertaking is, the Oliver/Laurel relationship and how it's different in the past vs the present, Robert Queen and Malcolm's (and Frank's...) role in his death, Walter Steele, who may die in the next two episodes, tons of DC Universe references, and more! Also, Michael plugs and commends Jeff Lemire's Green Arrow #20, "The Kill Machine, Part 4" and the two podcasting partners review the digital comic chapter of the week, "Patient Zero". All this and more, including spoilers for next week's episode, on this week's Longbow Hunters Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: Welcome back Arrowheads to ATA's very own Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this week's episode of Longbow Hunters, Michael and Woo discuss the highly anticipated and extraordinary episode of Arrow entitled "The Undertaking"! After...

item.title: Across the Airwaves Episode 118 (Enhanced) "Dan & Nico Don't Have a CLUE"
item.description: Hello ATA Listeners, this week's podcast is entitled "Dan and Nico Don't Have a CLUE" in honor of Psych's 100th Episode having a Clue as in the motion picture  theme but this title ended up going beyond Psych as Nico and I had a few strong disagreements on a Castle episode that puts its focus on Ryan as well as our thoughts on the success of Psych as a whole. Although in the end, we were pretty much left unsure on who was right with their arguments as all of you  Television Watchers out there could've seen it either way so that's what left us without a clue.  The good news is Andy was able to give some direction with our  cluelessness as he joined me to review an episode of Once upon a Time where we vented our frustrations on the reset applied to Pinocchio's character.  Then Nico and I were able to get back on the same page as we reviewed a Friends reunion on Go On, Modern Family taking Handball to the extreme, Supernatural  going X-Men style with the wild world of Hunters and a Doctor Who episode that will now make us think twice when logging on to a Wi-Fi network. However, that's not all we go over this week as the Airwaves Rundown Section has us looking at the midseason premiere of Revolution, which seems to be a better show than when we  left it but there's still much better stuff out there as we indicate by providing our thoughts on How I Met Your Mother, Bones, New Girl, Justified, The Following, Walking Dead, Glee, The Americans and much more.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA 118 reviews episodes of Once upon a Time, Castle, Go On, Modern Family, Psych, Supernatural & Doctor Who creating disagreement between Nico and I that left us without a clue. We also review Rundown Shows like Revolution, Glee, The Following & more.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 18 (Enhanced) "Salvation"
item.description: Hey Arrowheads, and welcome back to Across the Airwaves' very own "Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast"! On this week's episode Woo and I reveal a big secret about the future of our podcast before our main event: covering the 18th episode of Arrow entitled "Salvation" (no, not the Smallville - Season 9 finale...)! We go in depth here about the Island Flashbacks with Oliver, Slade, Shado, and Yao Fei, Moria's actions, The "Savior" how much we just don't care about Dinah Drake-Lance, Tommy's dark destiny, and if Oliver & Felicity may or may not have a thing. Also, Roy Harper. We also cover the 25th digital comic book chapter entitled "The Pieces Missing" as we try and figure out why Diggle wants to know about Lian Yu. And, after the music we talk in the SPOILERS section about how much we're looking forward to this week's episode, "Unfinished Business"!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey Arrowheads, and welcome back to Across the Airwaves' very own "Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast"! On this week's episode Woo and I reveal a big secret about the future of our podcast before our main event: covering the 18th episode...

item.title: Across the Airwaves Episode 117 (Enhanced) "March Madness"
item.description: Salutations ATA Listeners! It's that time of year again where our podcast experiences its own version of March Madness that doesn't even involve Basketball. Actually, it does kind of involve basketball as the NCAA Tournament (which I enjoy watching) acts as one of the reasons why the Spring schedule for our favorite TV Shows is a giant hodgepodge that makes filling out a bracket of 64 teams look easy  as we seem to get a different set of shows on hiatus or premiering every other week. In other words, if it wasn't for people like Nico and Andy helping me keep it all straight, I'd be pulling my hair out because it's getting crazy up in here. As for what's on tap to review this week, Once upon a Time reveals a new real world villain, Castle gives its own fun homage to horror movies like The Ring, Go On continues to have more fun with NFL star Terrel Owens, Jeffrey Tambor shines in a great guest spot on Psych, Supernatural pushes the tablet story arc forward in big ways and Abed starts his own fraternity on Community. Then we round this podcast out as always with our Airwaves Rundown section featuring our thoughts on The Walking Dead, How I Met Your Mother, Bones, The Following, New Girl, Justified, Arrow, The Americans, Glee and much, much more including a voicemail from Longbow Hunters/ATA Retro Reviews very own Woo Kim.
item.itunes:subtitle: It's March Madness here on ATA 117 as we try to navigate the on-again/off-again Spring TV Season with reviews on Once upon a Time, Castle, Go On, Psych, Supernatural and Community. We've also got the Rundown Section reviewing The Following, Glee and more.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 17 (Enhanced) "The Huntress Returns"
item.description: Hey Arrowheads! Welcome back to ATA's Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this week's return episode, Woo & I discuss the Arrow episode "The Huntress Returns" along with this week's digital comic book "Diamond in the Rough"! Be warned, there is a tone of in-depth discussion this week about the Huntress, McKenna Hall's send-off, Tommy Merlyn, Sara Lance, how cute Felicity is, the Undertaking and how it may be involved with the Island (tying into Jeff Lemire's incredible New 52 - Green Arrow run!) and even some Steve Aoki! We also get deep into the news section this week in talking about Paley Fest 2013, Roy, Slade, and Felicity being regulars in Season 2, and Stephen Amell's role in the upcoming DC Comics fighting videogame "Injustice: Gods Among Us"! Plus, SPOILERS  for next week's episode, "Salvation". All this and more on this week's Longbow Hunters Podcast, thanks guys and enjoy!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey Arrowheads! Welcome back to ATA's Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this week's return episode, Woo & I discuss the Arrow episode "The Huntress Returns" along with this week's digital comic book "Diamond in the Rough"! Be...

item.title: DC Nation Live Show Event (Enhanced) "Heroes Never Die, They Multiply"
item.description: Greetings loyal Fanterns, Young Justice fans, and DC Nationites! On March 16th, 2013, we all experienced a heavy loss. It wasn't just Aya or Wally West's "deaths" that were bad, it was the fact that DC Nation will never be the same again as Green Lantern: The Animated Series and Young Justice: Invasion are now gone from Cartoon Network. But, as you will hear in this recording of that day's Live Show Event hosted by DC Nation Podcast hosts Dan Schmidt & Michael J. Petty, with guest host Andy Behbakht, it may not be the end of these shows forever. However, in this ATA Live Show, the Trio discussed the Green Lantern: The Animated Series series finale "Dark Matter" & the Young Justice: Invasion series finale "Endgame". They talk about Aya's "death" and how she could easily be alive, the epic space battle between the Green Lantern Corps and the Manhunters, shipping Razaya, SuperMartian, and Spitfire, Wally West's "cease", Aqualad being back as team leader, Artemis's change to Tigress, and Dick Grayson's send-off. But that's not all, the three each give their own experiences watching both series' and explain how they got into each show. But that's not all folks, because for the second half of the show, Dan, Michael, and Andy play the voicemails that us here at the DC Nation Podcast have received over the past week from a bunch of fans (shout out to Jason A. and Rod) and cast/crew of Young Justice and/or Green Lantern alike! We hear from Phil Morris (Saint Walker on GLTAS), Josh Keaton (Hal Jordan on GLTAS, Black Spider on YJ), our friend Jeremy Adams (writer on GLTAS), Christopher Jones (artist on the YJ comic), and Jason Spisak (Kid Flash on YJ, Razer on GLTAS)! On top of that, superhero animation experts from all over the internet including, Eric from Superhero Shows, Steve Younis from the Superman Homepage, and James Harvey from World's Finest Online send Young Justice & Green Lantern their farewells too! We would also like to give a big thank you to everyone who has been a part of DC Nation, Young Justice, and Green Lantern: The Animated series in some fashion from those who write or come up with the story to the actors & editors to the artists and animators. Thank you all so much, special thank you to Giancarlo Volpe and Jeremy Adams for being involved on our podcast and getting on here to talk about Green Lantern and special thanks all those who called in, from fans to cast & crew, we wouldn't be here without you guys. Also shout out to DW of Fanboys Inc., Alisa Lea, Cards (you know who you are), and CellTherapy! Thank you all for doing what you have been doing and remember, Heroes NEVER Die!
item.itunes:subtitle: Join Dan, Michael and Andy along with a variety of fans and celebrities as we give a final farewell to Green Lantern: The Animated Series and Young Justice through our DC Nation Live Show Event!

item.title: Across the Airwaves Episode 116 (Enhanced) "Is TV Burning Our Eternal Flame?"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, have you ever felt like you spend your week around a campfire with your friends Emma Swan, Shawn Spencer, Jeff Winger, Dr. Sheldon Cooper and John Reese where they share stories about everything from hunting down Bigfoot to the retelling the plot of The Goonies? Do you understand what I'm talking about, do you feel the same? Am I only dreaming or is this campfire that's burning an eternal flame? Well, if you answered yes that means you are a hard-core television watcher fired up for our podcast reviews on your favorite shows airing this week including an episode ofOnce upon a Time where Snow White goes to the dark side, a Psych hunt for Bigfoot parodying The Blair Witch Project, Jeff trying to prove Chang's amnesia is a fake on Community, a Big Bang Theory that did a good job of getting a little emotional and Person of Interest bringing itself back to the Casinos where International Men of Mystery like John Reese originated. Also as always we have another edition of News with Nico featuring a story about the upcoming fan budgeted Veronica Mars movie as well as ourAirwaves Rundown Section featuring reviews on Walking Dead, The Following, Justified, The Americans, Glee, the return of Grimm and much, much more.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA 116 invites you to join us for this Eternal Flame of an episode reviewing Once upon a Time, Psych, Community, Big Bang Theory and Person of Interest. Also we have our Airwaves Rundown reviewing The Following, Glee, Grimm, Justified and much more.

item.title: Retro Reviews Episode 35 - Top 6 Supernatural Episodes
item.description: Hello fellow Hunters and welcome back to ATA's very own Retro Reviews Podcast! On this brief returning episode of Retro Reviews, Michael & Woo share their Top 6 favorite episode of Supernatural! This episode includes discussion on why the episodes they picked are their favorites, how each episode impacted them personally and the series, where SPN should have really ended, and Michael trying to get everyone listening (including Woo) to watch Supernatural: The Animation as it really does enhance the series. Although this is the first and last time in a while that you will be listening to Retro Reviews, don't worry because next week Michael & Woo will be back with a new episode of Longbow Hunters. Enjoy!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hello fellow Hunters and welcome back to ATA's very own Retro Reviews Podcast! On this brief returning episode of Retro Reviews, Michael & Woo share their Top 6 favorite episode of Supernatural! This episode includes discussion on why the episodes...

item.title: ATA Special - Comics, Comics, Comic Book Movies and More Comics!
item.description: While some of the shows that Across the Airwaves cover here are on a little break: the two comic book nerds Andy Behbakht and Michael J Petty join forces for a special edition of Across the Airwaves dedicated to reviewing some of their favorite comic books. They review and discuss books such as Geoff Johns Justice League, Justice League of America, Jeff Lemire’s current run on the Green Arrow book, as well as other big books in DC Comics current “New 52”. There is also a big discussion regarding what is up with Marvel Comic’s favorite web-crawler Spider-Man. The second portion of the episode is dedicated for discussions of the several upcoming movies in the Marvel Cinematic Universe while also discussing Zack Snyder’s upcoming Man of Steel movie. The two nerdy hosts also talk and discuss what is currently going on – as well as not going on - with Warner Bros. DC Cinematic Universe with all the rumors regarding a future Justice League movie keeping flying in almost every week. Suggestions to how the approach on the DCCU could be done as well as casting ideas is also brought because what would a comic book/comic book movie episode be without some dream casting discussion?
item.itunes:subtitle: While some of the shows that Across the Airwaves cover here are on a little break: the two comic book nerds Andy Behbakht and Michael J Petty join forces for a special edition of Across the Airwaves dedicated to reviewing some of their favorite comic...

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 47 (Enhanced) "Hello Megan!"
item.description: Hello DC Nationites, welcome back to the DC Nation Podcast, here on Across the Airwaves, and it looks like we've got a special penultimate episode for you guys tonight! First on this week's agenda, we try and help get through some Manhunters when we cover the Green Lantern: The Animated Series episode "Ranx"! We discuss the possibilities of seeing more than one Earth Green Lantern in the series finale, Razer's realization of what the team may have to do to defeat Aya, and give our other thoughts and predictions about the final episode. Then, after covering the Plastic Man and Amethyst: Princess of Gemworld shorts, we move onto covering the Young Justice: Invasion episode "Summit" where we freak out over Dan's crackpot theory for the series finale, cry at the "deaths" of Aqualad and Artemis, rejoice at the return of Wally West, and plead with DC Comics to give Young Justice (and Green Lantern as well) a "Smallville Season 11-like" comic series that will continue the series for us fans. We quickly end our episode (as the discussions got a little long) with covering Smallville Season 11's  "Effigy, Part 4" where we witness the birth of Miss Martian into the Smallville Universe, which opens the way for Bryan Q. Miller to bring in a Smallville-version of the Young Justice Team! Also, Batman and Martian Manhunter. All this and more on this week's DC Nation Podcast! And don't forget to tune in tomorrow at 2/1c PM on our Ustream account to watch our DC Nation Live Show Event covering the series finales of Young Justice & Green Lantern, as well as giving our final goodbyes to the shows and sharing our experiences with the shows in the past. You can read Michael's "Mild-Mannered Review" of Smallville Season 11 "Effigy" - Part 4 on the Superman Homepage: HERE.
item.itunes:subtitle: new,miller,network,comics,superman,miss,young,invasion,green,dc,flash,batman,lane,brian,queen,cartoon,kid,oliver,animated,arrow,robin,justice,martian,smallville,nation,jordan,lois,clark,superboy,lantern,52,q,hal,artemis,cw,lex,luthor,wb,aqualad

item.title: Across the Airwaves Episode 115 (Enhanced) "Chantilly Lace Action"
item.itunes:subtitle: On ATA 115, the Big Bopper gives TV Watchers just what we like, reviews on Once upon a Time, Go On, Psych, Community, Big Bang Theory & Person of Interest. Also the Rundown Section gives our thoughts on The Following, Justified, Walking Dead & more.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 46 (Enhanced) "Scar's Intervention feat. Jeremy Adams
item.description: Hello fellow DC Nationites, Fanterns, and Young Justice junkies and welcome back (or for some of you, welcome) to Across the Airwaves' DC Nation Podcast, and boy do we have a special one for you guys today! On this episode of DC Nation, hosts Dan & Michael are guested by none other than   Green Lantern: The Animated Series writer of "Blue Hope" and "Scarred": Jeremy Adams!
