So, for the first hour and 15 minutes, the Terrific Trio discuss GL:TAS, specifically Jeremy's episodes of the series, and get a "behind-the-scenes" feel of how the show is created. But if you thought that talking Green Lantern for over an hour wasn't enough, Dan & Michael also cover the DC Nation Short - Amethyst: Level 6! But that's not all as the Dynamic Duo continues to cover the Young Justice: Invasion episode "Intervention", where the two get into some talk about Zatanna's use this season, Blue Beetle, and how Batgirl works on the Young Justice Team. After that there is also some talk about the Smallville Season 11 issue #36, "Effigy, Chapter 3", where the boys have an interesting theory on just who the White Martian that Batman and J'onn J'onzz are hunting may be. All this and much more on this week's DC Nation Podcast, so be prepared! Michael's review of this week's Smallville Season 11 issue can be found on the Superman Homepage: HERE.
item.itunes:subtitle: Green Lantern: TAS writer Jeremy Adams joins us on DC Nation Podcast Week 46 to discuss his episodes Blue Hope and Scarred. We also review the Young Justice Invasion episode "Intervention", a new Amethyst Short and Smallville Season 11 #36 Effigy Ch. 3.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 45 (Enhanced) "The Hunt for Larfleeze"
item.description: Hey guys, and welcome back to ATA's DC Nation Podcast! This week on the DC Nation, Dan & Michael cover the Green Lantern: The Animated Series episode "Larfleeze" (joined by Gollum) where they talk about... Well, Larfleeze! But not just that, they also plug Geoff Johns' Green Lantern series once again and talk about just how much willpower Hal Jordan has. But don't worry folks, we still have 3 episodes of this series left, and if this is our final fun episode, then we're in for a treat in the next few weeks! But on that note, they Dynamic Duo also cover the Young Justice: Invasion episode "The Hunt" (joined by Godfrey) where there is in depth discussion on Arsenal, the Light, and how to fix what's wrong with Young Justice in 5 minutes or less! But that's not all folks, because Smallville Season 11's "Haunted, Chapter 9" (joined by Alisa Lea) is still covered as Michael is starting to question if Bart Allen really is Smallville's Barry Allen or not? Plus, Superman Blue! All this and more on this week's DC Nation Podcast!!! And don't forget folks, that on Saturday March 16th at 2PM/1PM CST, the DC Nation Podcast will be hosting a LIVE SHOW EVENT dedicated to Green Lantern: The Animated Series and Young Justice: Invasion along with both shows respective Series Finales airing that day! For more information on this upcoming event and for links to where you can join in on the show, visit this post here for more details!
item.itunes:subtitle: We wanted it all on DC Nation Podcast Week 45 by reviewing the Green Lantern: TAS episode Larfleeze, a DC Nation's Farm League Short, the Young Justice episode The Hunt & Smallville Season 11 #35. We also play a voicemail from podcast supporter AlisaLea.

item.title: Across the Airwaves Episode 114 (Enhanced) Castle's Papa was a Rolling Stone
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, welcome to Across the Airwaves, on this week’s podcast we discuss our favorite shows this week and five interesting News with Nico items. In our discussion this week, Castle saw the introduction of James Brolin as Castle's father in a great second half to the Season 5 two-part episode.  Go On saw a great bit with Mr K as Mary Poppins that both Dan and Nico thought worthy of their favorite comedic moment.  The Modern Family discussion mostly focused on the great Phil and Luke story arc that revolved around Luke's dating.  Dan and Nico both agreed that Supernatural was a pretty great, despite being slower, more plot driven, and a lot less action oriented than the past few episodes.  Psych saw a discussion of our favorite comedic moments in the middle of a full review because both Dan and Nico loved this season premiere.  Finally, the Community discussion saw a disagreement between Dan and Nico on the quality of this episode and Nico's argument that showing the Study Group as villains was consistent with theme of this episode, while Dan argued that it was inconsistent with the theme of the overall show.  Also join us for a great Rundown Section that covers The Walking Dead, How I Met Your Mother, The Following, Bones,  New Girl, Justified, White Collar, the premiere of Golden Boy, Arrow, and The Americans.  The voicemail section this week featured two voicemails from Woo about Supernatural and How I Met Your Mother. Another great episode. So join us for our Father focused episode.
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey ATA Listeners, welcome to Across the Airwaves, on this week’s podcast we discuss our favorite shows this week and five interesting News with Nico items. In our discussion this week, Castle saw the introduction of James Brolin as Castle's...

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 16 (Enhanced) "Dead to Rights"
item.description: Hello Arrowheads and welcome back to Across the Airwaves' Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this exciting episode, Michael and Woo cover the 2nd Geoff Johns-Arrow episode (directed by the wonderful Glen Winter) entitled "Dead to Rights"! The Dynamic Duo talks in depth about Oliver and Tommy, Malcolm and Tommy, Dinah Drake-Lance, Deadshot's return and it's effects on Diggle, China White, and the possibility of the League of Shadows... But that's not all, Michael plugs Arrow #4 and Green Arrow #18 (available at your local comic book store this coming Wednesday) and the team cover this week's digital chapter "Detour"! And after the closing music (this week brought to you by The Fray), join Michael & Woo for SPOILERS (brought to you by Craig Byrne from GreenArrowTV) were the two discuss "The Huntress Returns", which will return Wednesday, March 20th on the CW!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hello Arrowheads and welcome back to Across the Airwaves' Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this exciting episode, Michael and Woo cover the 2nd Geoff Johns-Arrow episode (directed by the wonderful Glen Winter)...

item.title: Across the Airwaves Episode 113 (Enhanced) "Bow Before Thoraxis!"
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey ATA Listeners, it's time to Bow Before Thoraxis on this week's podcast as we discuss our favorite shows this week and three interesting News with Nico items.  In our discussion this week, Once Upon a Time saw the dual reunion of father and...

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 15 (Enhanced) "Dodger"
item.description: Hello and welcome back to Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast, brought to you by the Across the Airwaves Podcast Network! However, this may have not been the best episode for you all to come back to as Michael & Woo are joined by ATA Corps member Andy Behbakht and the whole show is de-railed from it's tracks! Is this a bad thing? No, not completely as there is a lot of great discussion. The Terrific Trio talk about relationships (Oliver & McKenna, Diggle & Carly, and Roy & Thea to be exact), the Dodger, why Arrow is not Smallville, Neilson ratings and how they hurt television programs, Felicity Smoak, Oliver being awesome, Roy Harper, and tough choices. Michael & Andy also explore how the DC Comics villain Cheshire could be introduced into the Arrow Universe and the three talk about where Roy Harper may go in later seasons. But that's not all as Michael gives his recommendation to all Green Arrow fans to go read Geoff Johns's "Justice League of America #1" book and then the three discuss the latest Arrow digital comic chapter "Make it Rain"! All this and SPOILERS for the next episode (written by DC Comics legend Geoff Johns himself) "Dead to Rights" all on this weeks episode of Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hello and welcome back to Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast, brought to you by the Across the Airwaves Podcast Network! However, this may have not been the best episode for you all to come back to as Michael & Woo are joined...

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 44 (Enhanced) "Love Is a Battlefield"
item.description: Greetings, DC Nationites! On this week's podcast our reviews proved "Love Is a Battlefield" as the Green Lantern: The Animated Series episode of the same name featured Dark Aya trying to eradicate the Champions of Love known as the Star Sapphires, Young Justice Invasion had Miss Martian face several "Complications" as she tried to escape captivity to be reunited with her lost love Superboy and Smallville Season 11 #34 Haunted Chapter 8 stirred up quite a bit of controversy as it was revealed that in the Earth 2 timeline Chloe and Oliver had an affair while he was engaged to Lois. Even Michael and I got out on the battlefield as we form an argument against Cartoon Network about canceling the current DC Nation shows we love now for something goofy like Teen Titans Go! while explaining what they should do instead. Also to top that off we tried to review the short Amethyst - Level Five: Battle in the Stormy Peaks but it ended up evolving into a discussion on our concerns/fears on the future of Superhero Animation as a whole that was quite informative. Yeah, I know it sounds like we skewed off quite a bit in this podcast but ultimately what it boils down to is some of the best discussions we've had so give this show a listen as you are in for a real treat.
item.itunes:subtitle: On DC Nation Podcast Week 44 Love Is a Battlefield in discussing a new Green Lantern: TAS episode, the Young Justice Invasion episode "Complications", Smallville Season 11 #34, a Amethyst Short & our concerns about the future for Superhero Animation.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 43 (Enhanced) "War, What Is It Good For?"
item.description: War, what is it good for?! Absolutely nothing! Actually for you DC Nationers war was good for something as it set up great installments of our favorite DC  related TV Shows and Comic Books for us to review here on Week 43 of the DC Nation Podcast. First off, the Green Lantern: The Animated Series episode "Babel", Dark Aya's war against the Universe began as she sent the Interceptor crash landing on an strange Alien planet where Hal, Razor and Kilowog had to make do without their power rings. Then in the Young Justice Invasion episode "War", the team goes to War literally as they battle to stop Mongul from destroying Earth with his Death Star, I mean WarWorld. Finally, the week was rounded out with Clark and Bart's war against the Dark Flash directing them to the home of a surprisingly gruff and grumpy Jay Garrick in Smallville Season 11 #33: Haunted Chapter 7. Along with some great discussions on our favorite heroes going to war, we have a special edition of Michael's DC Headlines News Section where we talk about a big announcement made by Geoff Johns regarding writing the current Green Lantern Comic Books and reveal the title as well as artwork for the next Smallville Season 11 story arc entitled "Argo" where Clark is going to be sent to the future! So get excited or Argo flip yourself.
item.itunes:subtitle: DC Nation Podcast Week 43 asks the question: war, what is it good for as we review the Green Lantern: TAS episode "Babel", a new Amethyst Short, the Young Justice Invasion episode "War" and Smallville Season 11 #33: Haunted Chapter 7.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 112 (Enhanced) "Happy Together on Valentine's Day"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, with this week's podcast reviewing episodes of our favorite shows during the week of Valentine's Day. We decided to celebrate television's most popular couples being happy together as Once upon a Time gave Snow White and Prince Charming a renewed sense of adventure, Castle and Beckett kept each other in suspense over their Valentine's Day gifts, Claire and Phil's aspirations to do some sexual role-playing on Modern Family was ruined with a trip to the hospital and The Big Bang Theory featured the sweetest Valentine's Day moment of the week as Sheldon made Amy his emergency contact. However, the theme of being happy together on Valentine's Day dinner didn't just apply to romantic love, it applied to other types as well with brotherly love being exhibited by the Winchesters as Sam made a hard decision to end the cycle of the brothers sacrificing themselves for each other. We also got buddy love as Reese got into a no holds bar death match with a Government assassin to protect Finch's identity and some love between holidays as Community had a Halloween episode during the week of Valentine's Day creating a new event known as Valoween. By the way,  I can't end the introduction to our Valentine's Day episode without mentioning Andy being happy together with both Nico and then later Woo in our discussions on The Following and this week's Glee. On top of that, we show our love for Arrow with a brand-new formatted section that isn't a repeat of our voicemails on Longbow Hunters and finally, we round out our episode discussing television happy together with Rundown Sections on How I Met Your Mother, Bones, Justified, ABC's new series Zero Hour and a whole lot more.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA 112 reviews episodes of Once upon a Time, Castle, Modern Family, Supernatural, Community, Big Bang Theory & Person of Interest featuring our favorite TV couples being happy together. We've also got a rundown reviewing Justified, The Following & more.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 14 (Enhanced) "The Odyssey"
item.description: Hello Arrowheads! Welcome back to ATA's Longbow Hunters Podcast! On this episode, Woo and I discuss some good news with Bryan Q. Miller writing an episode of Arrow, Arrow getting a Season 2 pickup, and Harrison Ford (along with Mark Hamill and Carrie Fisher) being in Star Wars Episode VII. But moving on from the news, the episode that we discuss on this podcast is 1x14 "The Odyssey"! We talk about Oliver getting shot by his mom, Felicity's time on Team Arrow, Batman/Green Arrow parallels, Oliver's training on the island with Slade, how the Undertaking could be a part of the Island, and Yao Fei's mysterious daughter! We also cover the digital comic book chapter of the week, this week's being "Wintergreen", which explains the origins of how/why Slade and Wintergreen got on the Island in the first place. And of course, as always, after the music we talk about next week's episode "Dodger" in the spoilers section! All this and more on this week's Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hello Arrowheads! Welcome back to ATA's Longbow Hunters Podcast! On this episode, Woo and I discuss some good news with Bryan Q. Miller writing an episode of Arrow, Arrow getting a Season 2 pickup, and Harrison Ford (along with Mark Hamill and Carrie...

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 42 (Enhanced) "Love Hurts"
item.description: Hey DC Nationites! Welcome back to the DC Nation Podcast, where we cover everything DC Nation! On this episode, Dan & I cover the Green Lantern: The Animated Series episode "Cold Fury", where we talk about Dark/Darth Aya turning to the Dark Side (Darkseid?) along with some discussion on where this series is going now that Anti-Monty is out of the way and just how cool the epic Green/Red Lantern space battle between them was! But that's not all! After some interesting DC Nation Shorts, we cut to talking about the Young Justice Invasion episode "Runaways", where we discuss the newest team of young superheroes (Infinity Inc?), which include Static Shock and Apache Chief, the revelations about Blue Beetle, and the future of Young Justice. To wrap it up, we talk Smallville Season 11 "Effigy, Part 2" by discussing Batman's presence on the Justice League, John Jones's past, and why he may be a murderer... All this and more on this weeks DC Nation!
item.itunes:subtitle: On DC Nation Podcast Week 42, we learn love hurts when taking love advice from Hal Jordan as we review the Green Lantern: TAS episode "Cold Fury", a new Thunder & Lightning Short, the Young Justice Invasion episode "Runaways" and Smallville Season 11 #32.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 111 (Enhanced) "Community: Our Happy Place within a Happy Place"
item.description: (Upbeat Singing) It's Dan and Nico in the morning! Podcast style!  That's right loyal listeners, we are broadcasting to you from our happy place here at Across the Airwaves a spinoff version of Troy and Abed's popular imaginary morning show to celebrate the return of the happy place within a happy place known as our review section on Community, a show that has been on hiatus for far too long. Personally, I felt the Season Premiere lived up to the hype as Community didn't seem to miss a beat with transitioning to new Showrunners but Nico tended to feel otherwise. The good news is that despite our differences we give you solid coverage on everything to be excited about when it comes to this episode along with the upcoming season including the Study Group facing the challenge of being Seniors, little red balls and Greendale Babies?! In addition to Community, we review new episodes of Castle, Modern Family, Supernatural, The Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest and The Following while providing you with a Airwaves Rundown Section revealing our favorite commercials from Super Bowl XLVII. Then we wrap the Rundown up with condensed reviews on Bones, HIMYM, White Collar, Glee, Justified and much more.
item.itunes:subtitle: It's Nico & Dan in the morning as we celebrate the return of Community while reviewing Castle, Modern Family, Supernatural, Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest & The Following. We also have a Rundown Section revealing our favorite Super Bowl Commercials.

item.title: Across The Airwaves SHIELD Preview Podcast (Enhanced)
item.description: Greetings listening agents! Welcome to a special edition episode of Across the Airwaves that we would call, Across the S.H.I.E.L.D.  In this special episode Director Andy Behbakht is joined by his fellow podcast agents/your favorite hosts, Dan Schmidt and Nico Reifsteck for a roundtable discussion about the ABC/Marvel pilot, S.H.I.E.L.D. that is currently in production and being directed by the man responsible for shows such as Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Angel, Firefly, Dollhouse and one of the highest-grossing films of all time, Marvel's The Avengers: Joss Whedon! In the episode, the three nerdy agents discuss the facts that has been released so far such as what the show is about, about the six main characters and the actors that will be portraying them, the people behind this project (writers, executive producers), in addition discussing the potential the show has as the show is connected to the Marvel Cinematic Universe, what familiar faces we might see on the show at some point. Highlights such as Nico gushing his nerd love for Felicia Day, Dan and Andy ranting about the status of a certain webcrawler in Marvel and much more! The episode also discusses about Across the Airwaves' very own S.H.I.E.L.D. podcast that is in pre-production as we wait for the official pickup at the ABC Upfront that will take place in May. Make sure to check out these sources whose articles we refer to in our information section on and these recommending websites. |The Hollywood Reporter's casting announcement #1 and #2| - |TVLine's casting breakdown and casting announcement| |Deadline's casting announcement| - |Comic Book Resources - the article contains information about the show's biggest character| |KSiteTV's portal page for Marvel's S.H.I.E.L.D. on Facebook & Twitter| - |ABC's official S.H.I.E.L.D. Facebook & Twitter page| Stay tuned as we'll keep you posted on updates and news about the project and in the meantime, swing by the official Across the Airwaves forums and throw some of your own crackpot theories about S.H.I.E.L.D.!
item.itunes:subtitle: Join Andy, Dan and Nico as they discuss and speculate about Marvel/Joss Whedon's SHIELD TV Series coming soon to ABC.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 13 (Enhanced) "Betrayal"
item.description: Hey Arrowheads, and welcome back to ATA's very own Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this exciting episode, Woo and myself cover Episode 13 of Arrow entitled "Betrayal"! We discuss Detective Lance (redemption or depression?), David Anders guest appearance as an Arrow original villain Cyrus Vanch (who we hope returns soon), Ollie's 24 arrows, the Undertaking, Slade Wilson aka Deathstroke (2?), and that incredible end scene! We also talk about this weeks Arrow digital comic book "Keep 'Em Coming", where we get some interesting backstory on Lance that actually makes me feel sorry for the guy. But that's not all Green Arrow fans, I also give my thoughts and recommendation on Jeff Lemire's incredible Green Arrow #17 (a reboot of the rebooted Green Arrow title) with "The Kill Machine, Part 1". 2013 is a great year to be an Oliver Queen fan everybody as you can also check out Smallville Season 11 and Justice League of America to see Green Arrow in action alongside your favorite superheroes! All this and more (including spoilers for "The Odyssey") on this weeks edition of ATA's Longbow Hunters Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey Arrowheads, and welcome back to ATA's very own Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this exciting episode, Woo and myself cover Episode 13 of Arrow entitled "Betrayal"! We discuss Detective Lance (redemption or...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 110 (Enhanced) "Blast from the Past"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, on this week's podcast we review episodes where our favorite television characters experienced a blast from the past as Go On featured Ryan  being haunted by the ghost of his wife, the Winchesters met their grandfather on Supernatural, Sheldon tangled with his old nemesis Kripke during The Big Bang Theory and Person of Interest had Reese contend with his ex-partner from the CIA to avoid getting caught in his own personal bomb blast! At the same time,  let's not forget Ryan Hardy having to take on the friends of a serial killer he apprehended years ago on The Following, which has now become a part of our standard reviews beginning with this podcast. Then we've got a supersized edition of our Airwaves Rundown Section where Nico and I share our top 5 favorite commercials from Super Bowl XLVII while introducing a new segment dedicated to reviewing FX's new series The Americans. In addition, we discuss HIMYM, Arrow, Glee, Justified and much more.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA 110 reviews episodes of Go On, Supernatural, Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest and The Following where our favorite TV characters experience a blast from the past. Also we've got a Rundown Section featuring our favorite Super Bowl commercials.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 41 (Enhanced) "Loss"
item.description: Hello DC Nationites! Welcome back to the DC Nation Podcast! This weeks episode was sad. As we cover the very depressing Green Lantern: The Animated Series episode "Loss", we  do get a little emotional because of some intense Aya and Razer scenes... But the emotions don't stop, as Dan and Michael freak-out in both joy and horror as they cover Young Justice Invasion's episode "The Fix", which features M'gann going deep into her former teammate's, Aqualad, head (with Artemis) to bring him back to the land of the living. But with villains like the Anti-Monitor, Red Lantern Zox, Black Manta, and Deathstroke, who needs friends? Well in Smallville Season 11's "Haunted, Chapter 6" we find out that Bart Allen aka Impulse needs a friend in Clark Kent aka Superman as the Black Flash is gaining on him fast. Who else is there to turn but to the first speedster to call himself "The Flash"? But don't worry, some great DC Nation Shorts are included in here as well, including DC Nation's Farm League AND (back by popular demand) Batman of Shanghai in the super-exciting "Bat-Man". All this and more on this week's DC Nation!!! And don't forget Fanterns and Young Justice-fans, that on the finale day of DC Nation's Green Lantern & Young Justice (March 16th, 2013), our podcast will be doing a DC Nation Live Show Event to talk about the past year of DC Nation, thank the creators, actors, writers, and producers of both GLTAS & YJ, and of course get fan-reactions to the finale, as you are all welcomed to call in during the event and be part of it yourselves! Join us then, more details will be made available as it gets closer to the finale date and we find out more ourselves.
item.itunes:subtitle: DC Nation Podcast Week 41 was all about facing loss as our reviews on Green Lantern: TAS "Loss" and Young Justice Invasion "The Fix" was marred by the news that both shows are canceled. Also we discuss new Superhero Shorts and Smallville Season 11 #31.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 12 (Enhanced) "Vertigo"
item.description: Holy Riddler-Joker-Scarecrow wannabe, Woo! Welcome to our latest episode of Across the Airwaves's Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this weeks episode, ATA Creator, Dan Schmidt, joins Woo and I for a special episode where we talk about the Arrow episode "Vertigo". We talk about how this episode is really a game-changer on a bunch of levels, including the Flashbacks, Arrow's Rouges Gallery (mainly The Count) Thea, Laurel, and Oliver's roles on the series, Felicity becoming part of Team Arrow, and what may happen with Moria or Walter. We also Dig deep into our predictions on where Detective Lance, Tommy, and Moria's characters will go throughout this season (and series) and how we see them either dying or embracing their dark destinies. Also, there's a point in the episode where Woo, Dan, and I get a little heated when talking about Arrow and Man of Steel being the bridge for the upcoming Justice League movie, and the (hopefully) upcoming DC Cinematic Universe. We also cover the latest digital comic book chapter "Two Minute Warning" and I give out SPOILERS at the end for the next episode "Betrayal". Enjoy!
item.itunes:subtitle: Holy Riddler-Joker-Scarecrow wannabe, Woo! Welcome to our latest episode of Across the Airwaves's Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this weeks episode, ATA Creator, Dan Schmidt, joins Woo and I for a special episode where we talk...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 109 (Enhanced) "There's a Serial Killer on the Loose!"
item.description: Oh no, ATA Listeners! We've got a serial killer on the loose with this week's episode and his name is Andy! Just joking, we enjoy having Andy here on ATA to the point that we have appointed him as Nico's cohost for a new section premiering on today's podcast dedicated to the show that inspired our serial killer themed title, The Following. In fact, that's not all the Andy you are getting in this episode as voicemailing extraordinaire Woo S. Kim joins him for an all new weekly discussion on Glee that obviously doesn't involve committing murderous acts of terror but I did hear that you have to watch out for buses. Anyway, besides Glee are other favorite shows didn't escape the theme of at least someone going on a violent rampage as Once upon a Time introduced Frankenstein's monster,  a deranged nerd enslaved a fairy to kill innocent Live-Action Role-Play Gamers and Castle certainly had a title that inspired a serial killer theme with Death Gone Crazy but ultimately it left us with a mystery that left us disappointed. Even the sitcoms got in on the violence as Luke played a hitman in the Modern Family version of a scene from one of the greatest movies of all time and Go On featured Mr. K taking revenge by performing dirty deeds, done dirt cheap with NFL Star Terrel Owens. Then moving into the Airwaves Rundown Section, the killer mayhem continued as the addition of a White Collar section and the departure of our Last Resort section was coupled with the return of the always chilling serial killer Christopher Pelant on this week's Bones along with discussions on some shocking life taking moments involving presidential assassinations, conspiracy wielding senators, preaching snake charmers, crazed night–school students and Barney Stenson getting married?! Yep, it's pretty much like Silence of the Lambs up in here with this week's episode, so curl up with a can of Fava Beans to give this podcast a listen at your own risk as throughout the show, someone could sneak up behind you and say "Hello Clarice" in a cold, robotic voice.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA 109 has a serial killer on the loose as we discuss Once upon a Time, Castle, Go On, Modern Family, Supernatural, Bones, HIMYM, Justified, the Last Resort series finale and more. We also introduce new sections for White Collar, Glee & The Following.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 40 (Enhanced) "Jeepers Creepers"
item.description: Hello loyal DC Nationites, Fanterns, Smallvillians, and Young Justicers(?) and welcome back to Across the Airwaves's DC Nation Podcast! The part of ATA that covers Green Lantern: The Animated Series, Young Justice: Invasion, Smallville: Season 11, and all of DC Comics other imaginative content including DC Nation Shorts (Batman of Shanghai & Amethyst: Princess of Gemworld), the New 52, and other upcoming animated series and movies! On this special "CREEPER" episode, Dan & Michael cover the GLTAS episode "Prisoner of Sinestro", the Young Justice episode "True Colors", the two DC Nation Shorts of the week, and Smallville S11 "Haunted, Chapter 5"! This includes great discussion on Sinestro and his role in the series, Raya & Deathstroke talk, Aqualad speculations, Black Flash talk, and much much more as we dive into each episode/short/comic with enough force to move Kilowog about 5 feet before he gave us one. All this and more on this weeks DC Nation!
item.itunes:subtitle: On Week 40 of the DC Nation Podcast we discuss all the creepers who made us go jeepers in this week's reviews of Green Lantern: TAS "Prisoner of Sinestro", Young Justice Invasion "True Colors", Smallville Season 11 #30 and two new Superhero Shorts.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 11 (Enhanced) "Trust but Verify"
item.description: Hey gang, and welcome back to ATA's Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast. On this weeks episode, Woo and I discuss a bunch of different things, mainly focused on the latest Arrow episode "Trust but Verify". We talk about Diggle's partnerships with Ted Gayner of the Blackhawks & Oliver, Thea's attitude (that really needs adjustment), Tommy's strained relationship with his father, Tommy & Laurel's awkward relationship, and of course, the Flashback cliffhanger of Yao Fei being a traitor. But that's not all guys, as we also cover this week's digital comic book chapter "Sins of the Father", which tied in nicely to this week's episode (believe it or not). At the beginning of the episode, we also briefly touch on the news that J.J. Abrams will be directing "Star Wars - Episode VII" (sorry guys, Woo dropped out at the last moment...), the possible Justice League movie roster, Woo's rant on "fans" and how they should disagree instead of saying "that sucks", and "The Huntress Returns". All this in lots more detail in this weeks episode of the Longbow Hunters Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey gang, and welcome back to ATA's Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast. On this weeks episode, Woo and I discuss a bunch of different things, mainly focused on the latest Arrow episode "Trust but Verify". We talk about Diggle's...

item.title: ATA's Fringe Finale Live Show (Enhanced) "The Final Walterism"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, while listening to our various podcasts you have probably heard Michael, Nico and I use the term crackpot theory when it comes to  predicting what we think is ahead for our favorite shows but where did it come from? Well, Nico and I coined the phrase about five years ago when we began having phone conversations about a little show called Fringe. First it started with us marveling at the acting talents of John Noble and Joshua Jackson, then came the questions who are these Observer guys, is Massive Dynamic good or evil? And next thing we knew Leonard Nimoy showed up giving this show incredible credibility within the Sci-Fi genre. However, the clincher was this show introducing one of the most imaginative ideas presented television in the past 10 years, a war between multiple universes taking the concept out of comic book stories like Crisis on Infinite Earths and on to the television screen. The fact that this show went this direction simply just blew our minds and as it continued to develop the idea train ran wild for Nico and I with us throwing out all sorts of crazy predictions on where the writers were going to take this Science Fiction roller coaster ride. Eventually, as our TV conversations developed into the ATA Podcast, these predictions became known as crackpot theories since the writers of Fringe raised the bar to a level that we had to go way out in left field to even take a guess at how certain plot lines were going to be resolved. Most of the time our theories were so off that it didn't even seem like we could hit the broad side of a barn but in those rare times we were right the feeling of satisfaction was immeasurable leading to some of the best content that this podcast has ever produced. Now obviously, with us being indebted to Fringe for providing Nico and I with some of our best and favorite discussions we've had on Across The Airwaves as we cited in our epic 100th Episode, it needed the red carpet treatment just like we gave our other favorites (Smallville and Chuck) when they came to an end by setting up a Live Show providing a retrospective on all the Fringe moments from Season 1 through the 5th season's Series Finale that simply blew our minds with crackpot theories. Unfortunately, due to Nico being on the West Coast and me being in the Midwest we had to push our Final crackpot theories on Fringe back to our recording of ATA 108, leaving me needing a cohost for this Fringe Finale Live Show. So as always our very own DC Nation/Longbow Hunters/Retro Reviews Podcast host Michael J. Petty swooped in to save the day but with Fringe's imaginative content being such a mind explosion we needed more help, which was a bit of an issue since Andy and Woo haven't watched Fringe. But that wouldn't have stopped Dr. Bishop and it certainly didn't stop me as I crossed over to get the alternate versions of Andy and Woo, my friends on the other side Doug Roewer and Lyndley St. John to join us for this Live Show. Again, don't ask me who's the alternate to each person, just kind of go with it since I'm on a roll here. Anyway, with Doug and Lyndley who are as nuts as Nico when it comes to getting excited about crackpot theories backing up our Fringe Team, Michael and I were able to put together a great Live Show that paid a great tribute to Fringe, the Television Series of endless possibilities, which led ATA to what I think has been some of its finest moments. In other words, I present this recording of our Fringe Finale Live Show to you, the fans, cast, writers and crew who made this outstanding show that will go down in Sci-Fi History possible so what are you waiting for? Sit back and listen to this podcast, which I think you will all enjoy.
item.itunes:subtitle: Join Dan, Michael along with Andy and Woo's alternates from the Other Side, Doug Roewer and Lyndley St. John for our Fringe Finale Live Show where we provide a retrospective on moments from the entire series that blew our minds with crackpot theories.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 108 (Enhanced) "Sending a White Tulip to Fringe"
item.description: Hey ATA listeners, hope springs eternal as we say goodbye to Fringe, one of the first shows we reviewed on Across the Airwaves by sending it a “White Tulip” with our heartstring tugging discussion on the Series Finale.  Hope and Forgiveness pervade our discussions this week as we discuss Castle and how Jon Huertas' performance allowed us to forgive the Castle writers for a lackluster mystery this week due to the pure force of his acting will saving a weak mystery with a strong side plot and hope for a better mystery next week. In Go On's Goal Doll episode we discuss the need for forgiveness as Ryan ditches Carrie for her friend, but how she later forgives him when he ditches the friend to spend time with her instead.  Cass seeks forgiveness for his sins from Season 6 by trying to heal the wounds of Sam and Deans relationship in our Supernatural discussion.  Finally, we discuss Walter's sacrifice and redemption in the Fringe Series Finale and we discuss our hopes for a show to fill the void left by the loss of this great show.  We wrap up the show with our Airwaves Rundown Section that includes How I Met Your Mother, New Girl, Justified, Arrow, and the penultimate episode of Last Resort. There's also some sad news in the News with Nico section as we learn that another ATA favorite has been cancelled, but hope springs eternal as we discuss how this could be a good thing for our other favorite shows as these actors are now free to join other projects.  Join us for a great discussion that we Hope you will enjoy and won't force us to ask you for Forgiveness next week.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we say goodbye to Fringe by sending it a White Tulip with our emotional discussion on the Series Finale. We also review Once upon a Time, Castle, Go On, Modern Family and Supernatural along with HIMYM, Justified & Arrow in our Rundown Section.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Presents Glee: The Section (Enhanced)
item.description: Hello ATA Listeners!First of all, I hope you all had a great Christmas break and that you are all ready for 2013 as much as I am.Before the Winter Hiatus started, me and Longbow Hunters/Retro Reviews co-host Woo S. Kim, both fans of FOX’s musical show Glee, talked about possibly doing reviews on the show on the regular ATA podcast and we decided to give it a go.Right after the show went on hiatus, we recorded a special long episode where we recap the first 10 episodes of the 4th season to give you listeners out there an overall review of what has been going on with the storylines and the characters of the show and what we think so far of it.Now I want to be extra clear that this is only a one-time thing: We will not be doing these long reviews on separate episodes once the show returns, it will be in the regular format just like the other shows that ATA covers. We only did this so that we could have the first half of the season covered on the podcast.I hope you Gleeks out there will enjoy this section as well as the return of Glee, which will return on Thursday, January 24h, 9PM on FOX.
item.itunes:subtitle: Woo and Andy prepare to introduce their very own Glee section to Across The Airwaves by providing you with this Road so Far Podcast recapping Season 4 and other past events that took place in the Series.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 39 (Enhanced) "Bad Day"
item.description: Hello loyal DC Nationites, and welcome back to ATA's very own "DC Nation Podcast"! On this episode of the DC Nation Podcast, Dan & Michael go deep into Green Lantern: The Animated Series with the episode "Blue Hope", discussing Aya's soul, and digging even deeper into Razer & Aya's "Love Connection", while still getting to the good stuff of the Green/Blue Lanterns fight against the super-charged Manhunters. But once the topic switches from "Cheers" to Young Justice: Invasion's "Cornered", it's like a "Glee" catastrophe waiting to happen! We realize that Nightwing was being a total jerk to the Team, that Godfrey is getting REAL old, that Captain Atom should NOT be the spokesperson for the Justice League, and that Superboy & Miss Martian really need to get back together. And when getting to the discussion on Smallville Season 11, "Haunted - Chapter 4", your Dynamic Duo discusses Smallville's version of the "Speed Force", the Black Flash, Chloe's need for an attitude adjustment, and "Haunted"'s connection to "Justice". And fear not, for we also give our thoughts on the amazing "Batman of Shanghai" and "Amethyst: Princess of Gemworld - Level 2" shorts!
item.itunes:subtitle: On Week 39 of the DC Nation Podcast we discuss a bad day for Razer on the Green Lantern: TAS episode titled "Blue Hope" and another bad day for Young Justice in the episode "Cornered". We also discuss new DC Nation Shorts and Smallville Season 11 #29.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 10 (Enhanced) "Burned"
item.description: Hey guys, Happy 2013 and welcome back to Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this special mid-season return episode, Michael and Woo discuss some news about their new favorite show that is a bit jarring, including Roy Harper, Huntress's return, Deadshot's survival and return with China White, and much more. They also briefly discuss Amazon and what may occur on this podcast if it gets picked up! But onto the main event of this show, Arrow Returns! And much better than Superman Returns I might add! On this episode, the Dynamic Duo discuss the return episode "Burned" as well as the companion comic "6:15 to Starling City", along with all their predictions for what may happen next! All this and more (including SPOILERS for next week) on this week's edition of Across the Airwaves' Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey guys, Happy 2013 and welcome back to Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this special mid-season return episode, Michael and Woo discuss some news about their new favorite show that is a bit jarring, including Roy...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 107 (Enhanced) "Jailbreak"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, tonight there's gonna be a jailbreak, somewhere in this podcast as our full reviews for this week dealt with Cora and Captain Hook breaking out of the fairytale world into the real world on Once upon a Time and Castle trying to escape the arsenal of redheads living at his apartment. Then Go On had Bob Costas make an attempt to break out of his image as a sportscaster with Modern Family beginning to break into the world of dramaedy while the gang on Big Bang Theory tried to break out of reality by turning a bad situation of being stuck on the side of the road into a Star Trek: TNG Landing Party mission. And last but not least we rounded out the week with the Person of Interest Team using the art of espionage to actually break Reese out of jail as the fantastic writers of Fringe set up a final last-ditch effort jailbreak to save September's son Michael who is the key to saving the world from the Observers. Also this podcast has got a Airwaves Rundown section featuring the addition of FX's Justified as well as a voicemail segment where Michael J. Petty gives his thoughts on the penultimate episode of Fringe and Woo Kim presents his two cents on the SHIELD TV Series news revealed in our News with Nico section.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA 107 reviews episodes of Once upon a Time, Castle, Go On, Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest & Fringe that shared the theme of a jailbreak figuratively and literally. Also we add Justified to the Rundown Section & play some voicemails.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 38 (Enhanced) "Back in Black"
item.description: Howdy DC Nationites,  I'm so fired up for this week's awesome DC Nation Podcast episode, we're gonna bust this post out as classic rock lyrics since...  DC Nation is back How about that  It's been too long and were glad it's back Yes, we've been let loose  From the commentary noose That Cartoon Network left us hanging around We had Black Lightning in the sky   Lanterns on a blue power high Amethyst's videogame came alive The Reach lies They're bad guys Young Justice is going to stop them from running wild 'Cause it's back DC Nation's back!  It's back in black! And in case you haven't caught on already, I'm going to come out of my AC/DC Brian Johnson voice to explain that this episode is dedicated to the triumphant return of DC Nation to Cartoon Network with us reviewing the Green Lantern: The Animated Series episode "Steam Lantern" and the Young Justice Invasion episode "Before the Dawn" along with two brand-new DC Nation Superhero Shorts. Also as always we have our now weekly reviews of Bryan Q. Miller's Smallville Season 11 with us taking a look at Digital Issue #28 otherwise known as Effigy Chapter 1 starring Batman and Martian Manhunter.  So with the anticipation for DC Nation's return feeling like it lasted for an eternity, I'm going to cut it with my usual jargon I put into these posts and let you get to the fantastic episode that's been seven podcasts in the making that was certainly worth the wait.
item.itunes:subtitle: After a hiatus that felt like an eternity, DC Nation is back in black meaning Week 38 of this podcast reviews new episodes of Green Lantern: TAS & Young Justice Invasion as well as two new Shorts. Also we review Smallville Season 11 #28: Effigy.

item.title: ATA's James Bond 50th Anniversary Tribute Podcast Part 1 (Enhanced)
item.itunes:subtitle: Join Dan and special guest host Kyle Franchi for Part 1 of our James Bond 50th Anniversary Tribute Podcast where we discuss our first introduction to James Bond and provide an in-depth review on the characters most recent movie incarnation Skyfall.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 106 (Enhanced) "Welcome Back Finch"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, the title of this week's CBS centric podcast is a reference to a former hit sitcom Welcome Back Kotter, a show about a guy who returns to his former High School as a teacher because our review for Person of Interest was about an episode where Finch kind of did the same thing by going back to school as a substitute teacher to save the life of a student. However, this theme doesn't stop here as we review a The Big Bang Theory episode where Sheldon is taken back to school by the Human Resources Department to learn what's considered to be sexual harassment and with our lone Airwaves Rundown show for the week a.k.a. Sherlock, Nico criticizes the most recent episode for hiring an actress that really needs to go back to acting school. All right, so now that class is in session, give this podcast episode a listen for an informative News with Nico section, great discussion and just flat out all around fun from Nico and myself.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's podcast references the 70's sitcom "Welcome Back Kotter", a show about a guy who returns to his former High School as a teacher because our reviews on Person of Interest, Big Bang Theory and Elementary all correlated to a Back-To-School Theme.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 105.5 (Enhanced) "Have Yourself a Doctor Who Christmas"
item.description: Hello ATA Listeners, on this week's edition of Across The Airwaves that we numbered as a .5  since it was too short to be classified as a full episode, the Doctor is in as Nico and I review the highly anticipated 2012 Doctor Who Christmas Special entitled The Snowmen!!! Now as we went into watching this epic new adventure for the Doctor, which included the voice of Sir Ian McKellen, Nico and I thought it was going to take a bit to get back in the swing of things with Amy and Rory being gone but this great show didn't even miss a beat as Matt Smith gave another stellar performance and we both fell madly in love with the Doctor's new companion played by Jenna–Louise Coleman who is going to fill Karen Gillian's shoes beautifully. In fact, Nico and I have fallen so head over heels for this character that we are on the verge of fighting over her so it's going to be interesting how our reviews on ATA are going to play out over the next half of Series 7.  Anyway, I'm getting ahead of myself because if I go on ahead about Clara, the new companion any longer, it's going to take away your reason for listening to this great podcast episode.  So with that give this show a listen to find out why we simply love the direction of Doctor Who is going despite saying goodbye to the Ponds and in addition you will get our crackpot theories about the mystery surrounding Clara Oswin Oswald, which structured this Christmas Special as a midseason premiere designed to set up the second half of Series 7 set to premiere in April.
item.itunes:subtitle: On this week's edition of Across The Airwaves that we numbered as a .5 since it was too short to be classified as a full episode, the Doctor is in as Nico and I review the highly anticipated 2012 Doctor Who Christmas Special entitled The Snowmen!!!

item.title: ATA Retro Reviews 34 - Countdown to Destruction
item.description: Hello ATA listeners, and welcome back for the first time in over 3 months, to Across the Airwaves' Retro Reviews Podcast! On this SPECIAL comeback episode, veteran ATA members Woo S! Kim and Michael J. Petty return to talk about many different topics this week. Woo talks about how creepy LA, California can be and what he's encountered there. Michael talks about the 13 inch Darkseid figure he got for Christmas (and wants to sleep with). They both talk about their emotional experiences seeing Les Miserables in theaters (TWICE IN A ROW) and why EVERYONE should go see it!!! Then this Dynamic Duo gets to their main topic and event, the Power Rangers In Space finale (and the finale to the "Zordon-Era") "Countdown to Destruction" Parts 1 and 2. This action packed episode dives right into the heart of the Power Rangers franchise and talks about highly controversial issues behind the scenes. Also, Michael has his own "Supervillain Soapbox" moment in the episode and near the end Woo and Michael talk about how important it is to support ATA. So strap in, and "Let's Rocket"!
item.itunes:subtitle: After a 3 month hiatus, ATA Retro Reviews returns with this special comeback episode where Michael and Woo discuss the action-packed Power Rangers In Space finale (and the finale to the "Zordon-Era") "Countdown to Destruction" Parts 1 and 2!

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 37 (Enhanced) "Born to Run Starcrossed"
item.description: Hello DC Nationites, welcome back! On this exciting episode of ATA's DC Nation Podcast, Dan and Michael cover the latest TWO chapters of Bryan Q. Miller's 'Smallville Season 11' 11x03 entitled "Haunted". They discuss, in great detail, the Black Flash, Clark and Bart's relationship, the Tess-in-Lex's-head arc, and much more that happened in the two chapters AND what they would like to happen in the Smallville Universe. However, the Smallville discussion is NOT the main event as this Dynamic Duo also do a commentary on the animated film/three part season finale entitled "Justice League: Starcrossed - The Movie". This is a great film that shows how great the JL really are, that shows a better love story than Twilight, and gives us all hope for a live-action Justice League film (that's slated to be released in 2015). Don't worry DC Nation fans, next week's episode will feature the return of Green Lantern: The Animated Series AND Young Justice: Invasion (along with a new episode of Smallville Season 11), so bare with us through this final commentary episode so we can discuss what's been on our mind for the past few months!
item.itunes:subtitle: Week 37 of the DC Nation Podcast continues our reviews on the Smallville Season 11 Haunted Story Arc with Issues #26 & #27. Then we delve into main event, our audio commentary on one of the DCAU's finest achievements Justice League: Starcrossed The Movie.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 105 (Enhanced) "Mele Kalikimaka"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, as you may have learned from watching Christmas Vacation or the Bing Crosby classic White Christmas, Mele Kalikimaka is the thing to say on a bright Hawaiian Christmas Day and that's the island greeting we'd like to send to you from the land where palm trees sway since Nico and I are in need of a  vacation to someplace warm after all the hard work we've been into the podcast this year. And thankfully the Television Gods looked fondly down upon us by giving us a lighter schedule where we only had to cover Fringe and our Airwaves Rundown shows (including the midseason or season finales for Homeland, The Simpsons, How I Met Your Mother and Burn Notice) on this week's podcast.
item.itunes:subtitle: We're wishing you Mele Kalikimaka, the Hawaiian way of saying Merry Christmas because the shortened schedule of reviews on this week's episode featuring Fringe and our Airwaves Rundown shows like Burn Notice & HIMYM reflect us taking a Holiday vacation.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 36 (Enhanced) "Mystery of Bruce Wayne's Love Life"
item.description: Hello DC Nationites, it's Dan here proud to present you with an DC Nation Podcast that combined us giving our thoughts on the newly released Man of Steel Trailer and our review on Smallville Season 11 #25: Haunted Chapter 1 into one of our best Superman discussions ever. Then we follow it up with this episode's main event our audio commentary on the controversial DC Animated Film, Batman: Mystery of the Batwoman! And if this podcast's title wasn't a dead giveaway, this Batman movie can best be described as ladies night for Bruce Wayne but let's just say the feeling is just not right as The Dark Knight's alter ego reacts to an abundance of beautiful women in a Peter Parker spastic manner rather than being the usual mysterious billionaire playboy who keeps the ladies at an arms distance. In addition, there's the little issue of one of the most uncomfortable scenes throughout the whole entire DC Animated Universe where Bruce Wayne hits on Barbara Gordon, which is so wrong on so many levels especially from my perspective as a huge Batgirl/Nightwing shipper. I mean, Batman can be described as a lot of things dark, awesome, paranoid but pedophile who hits on college girls is not one of them. I love you Bruce Timm and all your content but I'm not feeling a Batman/Batgirl romance. However, don't think this commentary turned out to be a complete bust as Michael and I still made watching the movie a great time despite our discrepancies and we did make some interesting points about how this movie acted as a bridge between Batman The Animated Series and Batman Beyond as well as why a time jump to the future was necessary at this point for the Batman side of the DC Animated Universe. But if that's not enough to get you interested in the commentary for this week feel free to skip it but I advise at least to check out the Superman discussions we had in this episode because as I said before they were really great and as an added bonus we throw in information regarding when DC Nation is returning to Cartoon Network.
item.itunes:subtitle: On Week 36 of the DC Nation Podcast we review Smallville Season 11 #25: Haunted Chapter 1 and the newly released Man of Steel Trailer. We also perform an audio commentary on Batman: Mystery of the Batwoman, a film where Bruce Wayne's love life gets weird.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 104 (Enhanced) "Joy to the World, It Hasn't Ended!"
item.description: All right ATA Listeners, I expect you to sing along with me as I bust out: JOY TO THE WORLD, IT HASN'T ENDED! THE MAYANS ARE FULL OF CRAP! Okay, that's enough with the singing, I don't want anybody hurting themselves. However, you can hear us repeat the sounding joy on the 2012 end of the world prophecy being complete hogwash by listening to our reviews on the midseason finales for Modern Family, The Big Bang Theory and Person of Interest as well as a spirited discussion on a standard episode of Fringe that can be best described as Walter Bishop's Flying Circus. In addition to going over a Fringe episode that you need to see to believe, we have another edition of our Airwaves Rundown section with more voicemails from our buddy Woo Kim and an extended Arrow segment where Andy joins us to give his thoughts on the show's impressive midseason finale. By the way, I apologize on the late release of this episode we were having some server issues on the ATA Website that are now resolved.
item.itunes:subtitle: Joy to the world, it hasn't ended! And you can hear us repeat the sounding joy on the Mayan's prophecy being total hogwash by listening to this week's reviews on Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest, Fringe and our Airwaves Rundown shows.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 9 (Enhanced) "Year's End"
item.description: Hey Arrowheads, DC Comics junkies, Green Arrow wannabe's, and general likers of our show, welcome (and/or welcome back) to Across the Airwaves Productions' Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this episode of Longbow Hunters, Michael & Woo discuss the mid-season finale of Arrow - Season 1, entitled "Year's End"! There's also a 40 minutes discussion on the Man of Steel trailer/DC Nation's Return/Michael's signed comic collection/Connecticut shooting (our hearts all go out to the victims of this terrible event)/Roy Harper being cast for Arrow. All of that is just in the first 40 minutes guys, but once we get to talking the episode, man does it heat up. Also, they cover the latest digital comic book chapter for Arrow "Caged" and talk about why they would like to see it in live action. All this and much much more on Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast, Merry Christmas ya'll!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey Arrowheads, DC Comics junkies, Green Arrow wannabe's, and general likers of our show, welcome (and/or welcome back) to Across the Airwaves Productions' Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! On this episode of...

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 35 (Enhanced) "Bryan Q. Miller Forever"
item.description: Hey Smallville, DC Comics, and ATA lovers! Welcome back to Across the Airwaves' very own DC Nation Podcast. On this special episode, Dan and Michael go behind the scenes of the Smallville Season 11 comic book continuation of one of their favorite TV shows, with the writer of the book Bryan Q. Miller, returning for a third time to the show! On this special interview event, Dan, Michael, and Bryan discuss "Detective" as a whole, get inside the Batman's head, look at the future of the Crisis and Tess-In-Lex's-Head stories, Lois Lane's evolution from damsel-in-distress to where she is now, and briefly touch on what is to come in the next episode "Haunted"! All this and more in this special week of the DC Nation Podcast, FOREVER!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: On Week 35 of the DC Nation Podcast, Smallville Season 11 Writer Bryan Q. Miller joins us to discuss his work on the current story arc "Detective" featuring Batman and the upcoming arc "Haunted" where Impulse a.k.a. Bart Allen is set to return.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 103 (Enhanced) "It's Christmas Time in Tinseltown Again"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, it's Christmastime in Tinseltown again meaning this week's podcast covers episodes of our favorite shows that either had a Christmas theme or was used as a Midseason Finale. Some of our favorites like Castle ended up fitting into both categories giving us one of the best Christmas episodes I've ever seen from a Police Procedure Series. Go On also added Christmas spirit into their Midseason Finale but it wasn't as effective because the zany humor we've come to expect from the show was sacrificed this week for character development, but we sucked up our disappointment realizing the series would become boring if it stayed in one place. As for the returning ABC, Fox and CW shows we cover they are writers decided to just go the Midseason Finale with Once upon a Time finally getting us back to the place that had us excited for its current Second Season in the first place, Supernatural continuing its rise back to greatness through creating a turning point in Dean's relationship with the vampire Benny and the 150th episode of Bones showing us how far this once outstanding show as fallen. Meanwhile, on CBS it appears that the Network Executives are going to have their employees work towards the holidays as we review the penultimate to the Midseason Finale episodes of How I Met Your Mother, The Big Bang Theory and Person of Interest. At the same time on the Fox Network, the executives over there are going to run Fringe  through the holidays since the people behind that show are sadly on their way to a long but hopefully not eternal hiatus. The good news is this week's episode was a pretty strong indicator that Fringe is going to go down swinging as we got one of the best fight scenes I've seen on television next to Buffy, Angel, Smallville and what they are currently doing on Arrow but this was almost like watching the fight scene at the end of The Matrix on a TV Show and it literally blew my mind!   So I guess there's a lot to look forward to with it being Christmas time in Tinseltown again and we better enjoy it because a show like Fringe only comes once in a lifetime.
item.itunes:subtitle: It's Christmastime in Tinseltown again as we review episodes of Once upon a Time, Castle, Go On, Supernatural, Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest & Fringe that had a Christmas theme or was used as a Midseason Finale. Also we cover Rundown Section Shows.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 8 (Enhanced) "Vendetta"
item.description: Hello Arrowheads and welcome back to Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast, where Woo S! Kim, our special guest Nico Reifsteck, and myself (Michael J. Petty) talk about the second part to the fantastically well done Huntress two-parting story arc. We talk about the most recent episode "Vendetta" and the digital comic book chapter "Falling", which explains the backstory of Helena Bertinelli explained in the previous episode "Muse of Fire". Some of our discussion points include what justice truly is, the Hollie relationship, Tommy's decent towards darkness, and much more (especially if you join Woo & I for Spoilers...)! All of this and more in the latest episode of Across the Airwaves' Longbow Hunters Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hello Arrowheads and welcome back to Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast, where Woo S! Kim, our special guest Nico Reifsteck, and myself (Michael J. Petty) talk about the second part to the fantastically well...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 102 (Enhanced) "Goin' Looney Tunes"
item.description: What's up, Doc? I mean, ATA Listeners? On this week's episode of Across The Airwaves things got kind of looney with us actually liking the midseason of Revolution. Yeah I know, we might sound like we've really gone off our rockers on that one but my use of the word looney is about much more than that as we witnessed characters on our favorite shows for this week acting like a bunch of Toons as in cartoons by doing some pretty funny but wacky stuff. First of all, we had Modern Family's Cam get caught hanging from a tree in a costume from the musical Cats, then we had Ryan get in a old man fight with a blind man on Go On and Dean Winchester actually got to somewhat be a cartoon character as a psychokinetic man's abilities gave him a first-hand experience of the great film  "Who Framed Roger Rabbit?".  However, what I think completely stole the show on the term looney was this week's Big Bang Theory where we got some hilarious scenes with both Sheldon and Howard getting naked over wanting the rights to a parking spot, which was made even more looney by the fact that Sheldon doesn't drive. Again, like with everything there's good looney and bad looney and boy did we get some things to roll our eyes at here as Once upon a Time had Captain Hook magically take a heart out of a character's body, Person of Interest featured a couple that took a hit out on each other over the wife having a miscarriage and  Bones made the ridiculous decision to have Booth perform standup comedy while scaring the crap out of us that a beloved character was going to have an affair. Yep, that's a show that for sure needs to say that's all folks. In fact, with that line I'm going to take after the great cinema icon Porky Pig and use this as my exit leaving you to a episode that Nico described on Twitter as a great discussion supported by some excellent voicemail material from Woo.
item.itunes:subtitle: Join us as we review episodes of Once upon a Time, Go On, Modern Family, Supernatural, Big Bang Theory and Person of Interest that got Looney Tunes in mostly a good way. We also discuss Bones, Revolution, Burn Notice and more in our Airwaves Rundown.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 34 (Enhanced) "The World's Finest Podcast"
item.description: Hello DC Nationites and thank you for your patience! With Across the Airwaves' 100th Episode and the Thanksgiving holidays, getting this episode out has been a mess! But, it's finally here and we're here to talk DC Comics and DC Animated Movies!!! On this episode of ATA's DC Nation Podcast, Dan and I are proud to present to you our thoughts on Chapters 22 and 23 of Smallville: Season 11! With 11x02 "Detective" Parts 10 and 11, we discuss Lois & Clark, Bruce & Clark, Chloe & Oliver, and the cool action scenes we got and how to tear-proof Superman's K-Shielded Suit.  After that, we get into our "main event" following our chain of commentaries on DC Universe Animated Movies, this time with The Batman/Superman Movie (aka the "World's Finest" 3-parter from Superman: The Animated Series)!!! We go behind the scenes into our experiences with the film, how it changed the DCAU, and the similarities between it and Smallville's "Detective". All this and more on our Superman and Batman themed episode!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: On Week 34 of the DC Nation Podcast we discuss Digital Issues #22 & #23 of the Smallville Season 11 story arc Detective, perform an audio commentary on The Batman Superman Movie also known as Superman: Animated Series Episodes World's Finest Parts 1–3.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 7 (Enhanced) "Muse of Fire"
item.description: Hey everyone and welcome back to ATA's very own Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! After a week hiatus, Woo and myself could not wait to get right back into talking about Arrow, and to help us on this episode is a very special guest and a friend to the podcast, Alisa Lea Gossage! On this episode, the News Section goes a bit long (as in a whole 30 minutes!!!) as the three of us discuss the development of DC Comics's other potential CW series entitled "Amazon", based off of the Wonder Woman character and comics. After a half hour of discussion on that, we then get into the 1st Geoff Johns episode of Arrow entitled "Muse of Fire". We talk about Tommy, Hollie, Huntress, what a hero is and what their "codes" are, and the identity of John Barrowman's character previously known only as the "Well-Dressed Man". After this, we discuss TWO comic book chapters of Arrow entitled "Boy's Night" and "[REC.]"! Plus, don't forget to show GreenArrowTV some love and check their site along with us after the Closing for Spoilers of the next episode! All this and more on the latest episode of the Longbow Hunters Podcast!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: Join Michael, Woo and friend to the podcast AlisaLea as they discuss the first Geoff Johns episode of Arrow entitled "Muse of Fire" along with two issues of the show's related comic book and the potential Wonder Woman TV series "Amazon".

item.title: Across The Airwaves 101 (Enhanced) "Over the River and through the Streets to a Basic Human Feast We Go?
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, with most of our favorite shows being on hiatus during the week due to Thanksgiving being celebrated in America, I decided to give this episode a title that's a variation on the most popular Thanksgiving song "To Grandmother's House We Go" because all we did during this week of television was somehow go over the bloody river on Revolution and through the city streets on Castle to a Thanksgiving feast with the Support Group on Go On. But take note on the Question mark at the end of this title because we still don't know how the cast of Revolution crossed the river to give us a terrible episode in the tunnels underneath Philadelphia that featured the worst use of the song Kashmir that I've ever seen. In fact, it was so bad we decided to use the song for our closing just to make up for the travesty of the legendary Led Zeppelin's music being used for a stupid hallucination scene that was all about false advertising. Anyway, going back to the theme of this week's episode, what would be a Thanksgiving Feast without the sides coming from our Airwaves Rundown Section where we discuss some really great episodes of Homeland, New Girl, Vegas, Ben and Kate, Sons of Anarchy and more along with an episode of Bones that had the potential of being outstanding like the Veterans Day episode but ended up falling short.
item.itunes:subtitle: On this week’s episode, we are making up for the weight that everyone gained from their Thanksgiving dinner by trimming the fat on our schedule with only reviews of Castle, and Go On and most of the shows that make up our Airwaves Rundown section.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 100 Part 2 (Enhanced) "The 100th Episode Spectacular"
item.description: "And there came a day, a day unlike any other, when Earth's mightiest entertainment fans found themselves united in one big epic event. On that day, the Across The Airwaves 100th Episode Spectacular was born—to  thank all of our wonderful fans and celebrity contacts for the support they have given our show!" You've got it ATA Listeners this tremendous two-part episode that has been 100 episodes in the making is dedicated to you and to celebrate the party, I decided to have The Arrow Podcast's Michael J. Petty and Woo Kim join Nico as my cohosts with Andy Behbakht as our discussion moderator. Now with that being said you're probably what topic is worthy of five people being on one podcast?  Well, since it is our 100th Episode we decided to go with something that would be accessible to all of our fans whether your an original ATA, DC Nation or Arrow Podcast Listener and that's a behind the scenes look at Across The Airwaves. In other words, since Andy is the new guy around here we brought him on this episode to ask the burning questions that you fans may have about our show like our secret origins, drama that may have gone on in the making of this podcast, what makes us want to get on the air every week and  How I Met Your Michael. Then, with this being a podcast dedicated to providing news and opinions on the Entertainment Industry, we have Andy moderate a roundtable discussion about TV shows, comic books and movies, that even the most casual Entertainment enthusiasts can follow. However,  I should stop trying to explain and just let you experience the fun, laughs, impressions, silence and frustration that made this 100th episode a spectacular and proved if you'll listen to 100 episodes, then I will make 100 more just to be the man who records next to Nico, Michael, Andy and Woo.
item.itunes:subtitle: This is Part 2 of ATA's 100th Episode Celebration with The Arrow Podcast's Michael J. Petty and Woo Kim joining Nico and I for a behind the scenes look at ATA and a roundtable discussion on the entertainment industry all moderated by Andy Behbakht.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 99 (Enhanced) "It Fell on Black Friday"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, sorry about the delay but looking on the bright side of Nico's computer crashing and the Thanksgiving holiday throwing off our production schedule, it became a no-brainer to give ATA 99 featuring reviews on Once upon a Time, Castle, Modern Family, Supernatural, The Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest and Fringe for the week of 11/11 the episode title of It Fell on Black Friday because this episode is coming out on well, Black Friday, one of the biggest shopping days of the year.  Also as an added bonus to this great deal that doesn't even require a wait in line, we're going to throw in our Rundown Section  with a Bones voicemail from Woo and a burning question about the characters on Revolution crossing the river, that's all available for the one low price of completely free.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sorry about the delay on Once upon a Time, Castle, Modern Family, Supernatural, Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest and Fringe reviews for the week of 11/11 but it was easy to come up with an episode name since its release date fell on Black Friday.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 6 (Enhanced) "Legacies"
item.description: Hello and welcome back fellow ARROWheads to Across the Airwaves' Productions very own "Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast" hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S! Kim! On this exciting episode of LBH, Michael and Woo test out their new format to covering Arrow episodes starting with episode 6 entitled "Legacies". Not only was it a great episode to try their new format on, but it also was a great episode! Discussion points include the Royal Flush Gang, Tommy's destiny/fate, Oliver becoming a hero in his own right, Taylor Swift, and the difference between DC's characters vs Marvel's. But that's not all as the Dynamic Duo also cover the latest digital comic book for Arrow entitled "Moscow", which spawns some more good discussion. And don't forget, Dan, Nico, and Andy share their thoughts on the episode as well! All in a days work for the Arrow Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hello and welcome back fellow ARROWheads to Across the Airwaves' Productions very own "Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast" hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S! Kim! On this exciting episode of LBH, Michael and Woo test out their new format to...

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 98 (Enhanced) "Podcasting: The Final Frontier"
item.description: ​ Podcasting – – – – The Final Frontier. These are the voyages of the podcast Across The Airwaves. Its multi–year mission: to provide weekly television episode reviews, seek out entertainment news and give opinions, to boldly go where no TV watcher has gone before. (Imagine Original Star Trek Theme playing introducing Dan Schmidt as Captain Kirk, Nico Reifsteck as Mr. Spock and Andy Behbakht as Dr. McCoy. If you ATA Listeners haven't figured it out already this week's podcast is dedicated to the exploration of not just space but anything that can be classified as the final frontier as we reviewed episodes of Once upon a Time, Castle, Modern Family, Supernatural, The Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest and Fringe where our favorite characters used beanstalks, romance, a knockoff version of Comic Con, bus rides and even Star Trek: The Next Generation DVDs to explore the places where no man has gone before. And if that's not enough adventure for you we've got another addition of our Rundown Section where we discuss Bones' return from hiatus and the epic two-hour midseason premiere of USA Network's Burn Notice that sure lit up some fireworks.
item.itunes:subtitle: Join us as we review episodes of Once upon a Time, Castle, Modern Family, Supernatural, Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest, Fringe and Rundown Section shows where our favorite characters explored the new frontier of going where no man has gone before.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 5 (Enhanced) "Damaged"
item.description: Hey fellow ArrowHeads, and welcome back to ATA's Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast. On this exciting (or is it boring?) episode of LBH, Michael and Woo are joined by creator and host of Across the Airwaves Productions, Dan Schmidt! Now that we got the trio back together (remember Retro Reviews?), they discuss the latest episode of Arrow entitled "Damaged". They discuss the Well-Dressed Man, Slade/Deathstroke, Yao Fei, Lollie, and more. But that's not all, Woo and Michael then discuss the next comic chapter for Arrow entitled "Fathoms" and go into some deep speculation about who's the real boss of this season, Checkmate? And don't forget to listen after the music to our SPOILERS section, brought to you by GreenArrowTV, where Woo and Michael discuss the latest spoilers for the next episode, "Legacies". Oh, and listen closely for Michael's exciting story about his experience watching the new James Bond 007 film SKYFALL!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 5th episode of Across the Airwaves' Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast. Hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S! Kim, featuring Dan Schmidt!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 97 (Enhanced) "Feed My Frankenstein"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, when it comes to this week's podcast, IT'S ALIVE!!! as we review episodes of Once upon a Time, Castle, Modern Family, Supernatural, The Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest and Fringe where a main character had to contend with a physical or metaphorical Frankenstein monster of their own creation. Yep, when it came to creating monsters this week are favorite shows had everything from the actual Frankenstein monster to Penny on The Big Bang Theory's newfound success at Community College is secretly thanks to her gal pals that are scientists and Castle's pesky Triple Killer who just doesn't know how to die. We even had a ventriloquist dummy that resembled Modern Family's Jay and a character turned themselves into a freaking Observer on this week's Fringe! In addition to this shockingness, Nico gives us a special news section where he discusses thoughts on Disney's very own Frankenstein monster people might go after with their torches and pitchforks, STAR WARS EPISODE VII! Also we tackled our very own creation that we've made beginning with this third season of ATA, the Airwaves Rundown section with our brief thoughts on Revolution, New Girl, Vegas, Last Resort, Elementary, Arrow and more TV shows we watch that we just don't have time to cover in a full review section.
item.itunes:subtitle: As for this week's podcast IT'S ALIVE!!! as we reviewed episodes of Once upon a Time, Castle, Modern Family, Supernatural, Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest & Fringe where a main character contented with a Frankenstein monster of their own creation.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 33 (Enhanced) "Podcast of Ice"
item.description: Hey DC Nationites, and welcome back to the DC Nation Podcast! On this week's episode Dan and I discuss Chapter 21 of Smallville: Season 11, "Detective, Part 9" by our good friend Bryan Q. Miller. But after that, we decided that we couldn't get enough of Batman and Mr. Freeze (as well as Barbara Gordon) so we host another DC Animated Original Movie commentary on the Batman: The Animated Series animated film: "Batman & Mr. Freeze: SubZero". So pull out your VHS, DVD, Blu-Ray (is it even on Blu-Ray?), and/or Digital Copy and fire it up, because with all this talk about Batman, you're going to need to watch what we're talking about. Enjoy!
item.itunes:subtitle: Brrrr! Do you feel that cold chill going down your spine? Well, that's this week's podcast as we perform a commentary on the Batman:TAS Movie Sub–Zero and review an issue of Smallville Season 11 featuring Mr. Freeze as the major villain.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 4 (Enhanced) "An Innocent Man"
item.description: Hey guys, welcome back to the #1 Arrow podcast on the Internet (at this point) entitled Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast, brought to you by Across the Airwaves Productions! On this exciting episode of LBH, Michael and Woo are joined by ATA co-host Nico Reifsteck! Before diving into Arrow, they cover the current Arrow news, Disney buying LucasFilm and what that means for both Star Wars and Indiana Jones, and of course Michael's comic picks of the week and why you should all read Superman: Earth One, Volume 2. But after about 20 minutes into the show, they quickly switch from the news into the episode "An Innocent Man" where a lot of stuff went down. The trio talk about their thoughts on Detective Lance, Felicity Smoak, what may happen with Walter, and give their theories on who the Well-Dressed Man may be, as well as predictions for next week.
