And don't worry folks, they play Dan & Andy's thoughts on the episode as well as read the Twitter comments of the week. The group also covers the 4th Arrow digital chapter entitled "Diggle", which gives more background on Diggle's life as a soldier. And don't think we forgot the Spoilers! At the end of the fade out music, Michael give you all the spoilers on the next episode "Damaged", brought to you by GreenArrowTV!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 4th episode of Across the Airwaves' Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! Hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S! Kim, with Nico Reifsteck.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 96 (Enhanced) “What's the Matter with Dan and Nico”
item.description: Greetings ATA Listeners, it's Count Danula and I've come to drink your blood! Actually, I have returned once again to introduce this week's Across The Airwaves' Giant Sized Halloween Spooktacular! Now, while listening to this special extended episode many of you mortals might ask yourself what's the matter with Dan and Nico because the two hosts who are normally on the same page had vastly different opinions regarding the week's schedule of their favorite shows this especially when it came to the controversial Season Finale of Alphas. In fact, things got so batty Dan had to bring in another cohost for covering Once upon a Time! Scary, huh? Well before you go spreading the news all over Twitter, bringing our new ATA Corps Member Andy (Samaritan93) in to discuss Once upon a Time on a weekly basis was something decided by Nico and Dan together so you listeners can get to know him before he starts his podcast dedicated to ABC's SHIELD TV Series that's supposedly premiering next Fall. Going back to this episode, for those of you worried that Nico and Dan's difference in viewpoints turned them into werewolves ready to tear each other apart they were able to reconcile through their love for Fringe spawning a joint crackpot theory that a certain Fringe Team member who was killed in this week's episode might not necessarily stay dead or potentially still be alive. Then, from here things just kept getting better for Dan and Nico as they went into this week's Rundown Section with their thoughts on New Girl, Vegas, Vampire Diaries (the show starring my bloodsucking friends the Salvatore Brothers) and more. So now that the stage is set, I really must be going because it's almost sunrise but as I fly off into the fading moonlight, hear my compelling cry...listen to this Halloween podcast it's simply something to die for!
item.itunes:subtitle: It's a Halloween edition of ATA as Dan and Nico debate their thoughts on the week's episodes of Once upon a Time, Castle, Go On, Modern Family, Supernatural, Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest & Fringe. Then things are wrapped up with a Rundown Section.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 32 (Enhanced) “Mask of the Podtasm”
item.description: Hello DC Nationites, with Cartoon Network's sudden decision to put DC Nation (Green Lantern: The Animated Series & Young Justice Invasion) on hiatus until January, I bet you're thinking the Angel of death awaits for our podcast as Michael and I are going to be stuck doing more comic book discussions but just because DC isn't providing us with new animation doesn't mean we can't go back and discuss their great animated content of the past. In other words, we are going to start a series of audio commentaries on the DC Animated Films beginning today with an old classic Batman: Mask of the Phantasm and wrapping itself up hopefully just before DC Nation returns from hiatus with the most recent film to come out Batman: The Dark Knight Returns Part 1. However, with us digging through the past, that does not mean new DC Comics content won't be discussed on the podcast as we will still be reviewing Smallville Season 11 with this week's episode and there are plans in the works for talking about the big story arc going on in Batman comics, Death of the Family.
item.itunes:subtitle: DC Nation Podcast Week 32 begins our series of audio commentaries on DC's Animated Films with Batman: Mask of the Phantasm and we review Smallville Season 11: Detective Chapter 8 featuring the Batmobile.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 95 (Enhanced) “Vacation Is All Dan Ever Wanted”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, between Castle finally taking us on a trip with him to the Hamptons, Nico being out of town and the computer problems that made this episode come out so incredibly late, the inspiration behind the editing of this week's reviews for Once upon a Time, Alphas, Castle, Modern Family, Supernatural, The Big Bang Theory and Person of Interest would have to be me wanting to take a vacation. However, even though a vacation is all I ever wanted by the end of the week, don't worry we're not going on hiatus as I understand that the show must go on. In addition, all the blood and sweat that went into this episode was worthwhile as it had some really solid discussions especially when it came to Castle and Supernatural, so what are you waiting for? Give this episode a listen, I think you'll enjoy it!
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we review Once upon a Time, Alphas, Castle, Modern Family, Supernatural, Big Bang Theory & Person of Interest episodes that made a vacation all Dan ever wanted. Also with Nico traveling we had a shortened Rundown section featuring Arrow & more.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 3 (Enhanced) "Lone Gunman"
item.description: Hey everybody and welcome back to ATA's very own Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! In this long-awaited episode, Michael J. Petty and Woo S! Kim bring in their first guest-host to LBH, Andy Behbakht! And after about 20 minutes of hearing this trio rant about Arrow's full-season pick up, the DC Comics picks of the week, and the interview Michael and Dan did with Arrow executive producer Marc Guggenheim, they get into covering the latest episode of Arrow entitled "Lone Gunman".  A lot of interesting theories are brought up about Deadshot's victims, Moria's intentions as a parent, Tommy and Laurel's relationship, Oliver's mission, and which character Michael just wants to die. But that's not all, after a very long recap and review on this episode (and after hearing Dan & Nico's thoughts, as well as the thoughts from the Twitterverse), the trio then go on to discuss the latest digital comic chapter explaining China White's origin. This gets into some heated discussion about origin stories in the comics and whether or not super villains should have origin stories. The answer will shock you! We apologize that this episode went a little (or a lot) longer than we expected guys, and the next time Andy joins us we will try and move things along, but until that time comes, enjoy the podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 3rd episode of Across the Airwaves very own Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast. Hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S! Kim.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Exclusive Interview - Marc Guggenheim (Enhanced)
item.description: Hello and welcome (for some of you, welcome back) Arrow fans to Across the Airwaves's very own "Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast". On this exclusive interview episode, LBH host Michael J. Petty and, his co-host on the "Arrow SPOILERS" section of LBH, Dan Schmidt interview one of the writers and executive producers of Arrow: Marc Guggenheim. Unfortunately the interview was very brief, but we are so very thankful for the time we did get to spend with Marc, even if we had to mention the boxing glove arrow. Special thanks to LBH co-host Woo S! Kim and our good friend and follower Andy Behbakht (from K-Site TV) for the questions that they sent into Dan & I. Because we only had 20 minutes with Marc, we were only able to ask so much. We did our best to incorporate your questions into ours guys. Anyway, enjoy this short and sweet interview with Arrow executive producer Marc Guggenheim!
item.itunes:subtitle: Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast's exclusive interview with Marc Guggenheim! Hosted by Michael J. Petty and Dan Schmidt.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 2 (Standard) "Honor Thy Father"
item.description: Hello and welcome back all DC Comics/Green Arrow/Arrow fans! We're glad you joined us for this second episode of Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! We hope you're all enjoying our show so far, and we hope that you have also been enjoying Arrow as much as we have. On this thrilling episode of LBH, Michael & Woo discuss the 2nd (and latest) episode of Arrow entitled "Honor Thy Father" (but don't worry, Dan & Nico's thoughts are in there too), which does off the rails as they discuss their feelings about Detective Lance (and where he may be going...), Tommy Merlyn, and Oliver's new line, "You have failed this city". Also, look for the Finding Nemo reference and why you should all go watch Batman '89! We also discuss Woo's birthday, the latest news about the Justice League film, and why Bryan Q. Miller should write for Arrow (and why you should all watch it). But we can't forget about the latest Digital Chapter of Arrow entitled "Prey" where we learn some interesting things about Moria Queen. All of this and more on the latest episode of Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 2nd episode of Across the Airwaves' Longbow Hunters Podcast covering the Arrow episode "Honor Thy Father". Hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S! Kim!

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 31 (Enhanced) “A Call to Arms”
item.description: Hello DC Nationites, we hope we didn't loose you in all the recent confusion that has gone on surrounding Cartoon Network's schedule change regarding DC Nation and all that that implies. But don't worry, we're still here to cover our favorite shows! Although we had no new material air on Cartoon Network this weekend, Dan and Michael still get to talk about why DC Nation was moved, what that means for us fans, how this is a disservice, and how you can help! One of the ways you can help is by signing the petition to "Save DC Nation", which is located on the right side of our website! And even though we bought the episodes of Green Lantern: The Animated Series and Young Justice: Invasion on iTunes before they were taken down (they were excellent by the way), we decided to wait to cover those episodes until they air on Cartoon Network in January so that those who missed them don't feel left out. But speaking of being left out, we aren't loosing any new Smallville episodes, as we continue the discussion on Smallville:  Season 11 with "Detective, Part 7" featuring a great scene between Lois and Toyman, as well as some incredible action sequences with Clark, Batman, Mr. Freeze, and Prankster that we can only imagine on the show. So thanks guys for tuning in, and listen to this episode to find out what we'll be doing each week on this show before DC Nation comes back in January, because what we're doing is going to be great (and no, it's not JUST covering DC Comics...)! Editors Note: I introduce this week's Smallville section as Detective Chapter 6 but it really should be Chapter 7. Sorry about that, it's totally my bad. – Dan
item.itunes:subtitle: DC Nation Podcast Week 31 discusses Cartoon Network's controversial decision put DC Nation on hiatus without warning and how we can fight this heinous crime. We also review the next installment of Smallville Season 11: Detective Chapter 7.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 2 (Enhanced) "Honor Thy Father"
item.description: Hello and welcome back all DC Comics/Green Arrow/Arrow fans! We're glad you joined us for this second episode of Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast! We hope you're all enjoying our show so far, and we hope that you have also been enjoying Arrow as much as we have. On this thrilling episode of LBH, Michael & Woo discuss the 2nd (and latest) episode of Arrow entitled "Honor Thy Father" (but don't worry, Dan & Nico's thoughts are in there too), which does off the rails as they discuss their feelings about Detective Lance (and where he may be going...), Tommy Merlyn, and Oliver's new line, "You have failed this city". Also, look for the Finding Nemo reference and why you should all go watch Batman '89! We also discuss Woo's birthday, the latest news about the Justice League film, and why Bryan Q. Miller should write for Arrow (and why you should all watch it). But we can't forget about the latest Digital Chapter of Arrow entitled "Prey" where we learn some interesting things about Moria Queen. All of this and more on the latest episode of Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 2nd episode of ATA's Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast, hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S! Kim!

item.title: Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast - Episode 1 (Enhanced) "Pilot"
item.description: Hey everyone, and welcome to Across the Airwaves' latest podcast endeavor known as "Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast". This show is obviously dedicated to the hit new CW series "Arrow", and on this first episode Woo S! Kim and I are back to cover the highly anticipated first half of the CW's Super-Powered Wednesdays with "Pilot". The Pilot was a great episode and great way to start off this new series as Woo & I dive into discussion on this new version of Oliver Queen, this relationships, his friends, and his family. But that's not all we cover! We also cover the San Diego Comic Con/Arrow Day Special Edition Arrow #1 comic, along with the first digital chapter of the Arrow comic that follows the series (with awesome art by Longbow Hunters writer/artist Mike Grell)! We've been waiting for this show for 6 months, and it did not disappoint! We're glad to be here and give you all our thoughts on this show every week. But don't worry, Dan & Nico are still a part of this too! Dan sent us his thoughts on the Pilot episode, so we put them into the podcast. You can hear Nico's thoughts on the upcoming ATA Episode 94 during the "Airwaves Rundown" section. Also, we have to thank GreenArrowTV for the Spoilers that Dan & I talk about in the "Arrow Spoilers" section after the closing music at the end of the episode. We hope you enjoy our first episode guys, and please remember it was our first LBH podcast covering live material on our own (we've only covered past stuff before), so when you call in or send us an email, try not to be to harsh, okay? Also, details about our "Arrow Day Issue #1 Giveaway" are in this episode, listen for more!
item.itunes:subtitle: The premiere episode of Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast, covering the premiere episode of Arrow! Hosted by Michael J. Petty & Woo S! Kim

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 94 (Enhanced) “Slow Ride”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week's podcast is titled “Slow Ride” as the writers of our favorite TV shows took it easy on story development with the set of episodes we reviewed to give us what Nico and I called a slow week of television. I don't know if it was Person of Interest being preempted due to the presidential election but many of the shows we watched this week were lacking action as character development and overarching stories stayed in place. In fact, Bones as you'll hear in our Airwaves Rundown section was downright boring this week! Now, this philosophy didn't apply to all the shows that aired this week as the sitcoms (Go On, The Big Bang Theory and two episodes of Modern Family) all had solid outings that delivered big laughs. In addition, Once upon a Time and Supernatural made huge strides in making up for the shortcomings their shows had during the previous season but this still did not save this week from being deemed as slow. We even thought we could make up for this issue by filling in the place Person of Interest left open in our schedule with a full review of the week's Alphas episode but that turned out to be slow as well with things needing to be ramped up into the Season Finale.  However, where Alphas needed to ramp up the new CW show Arrow hit the ground running with one of the best new pilots of the Fall 2012 TV Season, right up there with ABCs Last Resort. I personally thought Arrow was better but Nico and others might disagree with me on that one because I'm kind of biased when it comes to superheroes and I really miss watching Smallville on a weekly basis. Anyway, I do agree with Nico's review on the pilot for Arrow given in our Rundown sections where he raves about the new series calling it an action show that looks nothing like a CW teenybopper show but something more  reminiscent of Christopher Nolan's Batman or the Bourne Movies. I also piggyback onto Nico's positive reviews with my comic book based theories on how the series next five seasons are going to play out but for my full review on the pilot itself you're going to have to check out my section on Michael and Woo's new show Longbow Hunters, the ATA podcast slowly dedicated to just reviewing episodes of Arrow.  So from here what you listeners need to do is check out this podcast episode to stay updated on TV Shows that act as your old favorites and then check out Longbow Hunters to hear about Arrow, the new show that all of you should be watching especially if you are having Smallville or DC Nation withdrawals.
item.itunes:subtitle: Join us as we review episodes of Once upon a Time, Castle, Go On, Modern Family, Supernatural & Fringe that took a slow ride on story development this week. We also have our Rundown section featuring Nico and my thoughts on the pilot for Arrow plus more.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 1 "Pilot"
item.description: Hey everyone, and welcome to Across the Airwaves' latest podcast endeavor known as "Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast". This show is obviously dedicated to the hit new CW series "Arrow", and on this first episode Woo S! Kim and I are back to cover the highly anticipated first half of the CW's Super-Powered Wednesdays with "Pilot". The Pilot was a great episode and great way to start off this new series as Woo & I dive into discussion on this new version of Oliver Queen, this relationships, his friends, and his family. But that's not all we cover! We also cover the San Diego Comic Con/Arrow Day Special Edition Arrow #1 comic, along with the first digital chapter of the Arrow comic that follows the series (with awesome art by Longbow Hunters writer/artist Mike Grell)! We've been waiting for this show for 6 months, and it did not disappoint! We're glad to be here and give you all our thoughts on this show every week. But don't worry, Dan & Nico are still a part of this too! Dan sent us his thoughts on the Pilot episode, so we put them into the podcast. You can hear Nico's thoughts on the upcoming ATA Episode 94 during the "Airwaves Rundown" section. Also, we have to thank GreenArrowTV for the Spoilers that Dan & I talk about in the "Arrow Spoilers" section after the closing music at the end of the episode. We hope you enjoy our first episode guys, and please remember it was our first LBH podcast covering live material on our own (we've only covered past stuff before), so when you call in or send us an email, try not to be to harsh, okay? Also, details about our "Arrow Day Issue #1 Giveaway" are in this episode, listen for more! "We couldn't not get away with it!"
item.itunes:subtitle: Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast Episode 1 "Pilot", hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S! Kim, with special guest Dan Schmidt.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 30 (Enhanced) “Gates of Fire”
item.description: Hello our loyal DC Nationites and welcome back to Across the Airwaves' very own DC Nation Podcast! This episode is entitled "Gates of Fire" for a few reasons. In Green Lantern: The Animated Series, Hal and the gang (minus Razer) have to deal with angry Guardians, an army of Manhunters, and the second half of Season 1's "big bad": the Anti-Monitor! On the GLTAS discussion, Dan and I speculate just where did "Monty" send Hal and when (and where) does Sinestro come into play this season, as well as how to bring Razer back into the fold. Oh, and Lion King... But that's not all on this Week 30! On Young Justice: Invasion, the team has to deal with ex-Aqualad Manta and his team of super villains (including under-cover Artemis aka Tigress)! And to make things worse, Dan and I think they not only know who the Partner is, but the identity of the real traitor against the Young Justice team! They also go into another tangent about how to kill Lagoon Boy, and in 45 seconds, they fixed all the relationships on the show to make all of the fans happy. Unfortunately, there was no new Smallville: Season 11 chapter this week, but Dan and I do talk about the latest DC Nation Mythbusters, New Teen Titans, as well as another "World's Dumbest" from Aardman Entertainment. I also give my input on what you DC Nation fans should go out and buy immediately (hint: they both have to do with Batman) and I also read (sort of...) an email to the DC Nation Podcast from new listener and ATA supporter @Samaritan93!
item.itunes:subtitle: DC Nation Podcast Week 30 features discussions on three new DC Nation Shorts along with reviews on episodes of Green Lantern: TAS & Young Justice Invasion where our favorite heroes were sent through the gates of fire to face their possible destruction.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 93 (Enhanced) “A Whole New World”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week's episode title is dedicated to Once upon a Time and Supernatural returning to our slate of weekly reviews with season premieres that took both shows to a whole new world. First off, the writers of Once upon a Time changed things up with restoring all of the fairytale characters memories and having events in the fairytale world happen simultaneously with the real world instead of relying on Lost style flashbacks. Then using the sounds of classic rock new Supernatural show runner Jeremy Carver brought back us back to the more kick but feel we remember from previous seasons as a much tougher Dean Winchester broke out of Purgatory to reunite with his brother Sam. Now for what Nico and I thought of these epic new changes that took place with two of our favorite shows? You've got to give this podcast a listen but for those of you that aren't a Once upon a Time or Supernatural fan, tune in anyway because we've got discussions on Castle, the midseason finale for Warehouse 13, Alphas, Go On, The Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest, Fringe and just about everything else that was worth watching on TV this week in our new Airwaves Rundown section.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's episode is dedicated to our reviews on season premieres for Once upon a Time & Supernatural that took both shows to a whole new world. We also review Castle, Go On, Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest, Fringe & more in our Rundown Section.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 29 (Enhanced) “Gamma Rays Will Not Give You Super Powders”
item.description: Hello DC Nationites and welcome back to Across the Airwaves' very own (and so far only) DC Nation Podcast!!! On this week's episode of DCNP, Dan and I cover the returns of two of our favorite shows to watch (and review): Green Lantern: The Animated Series and Young Justice: Invasion! The Green Lantern episode "The New Guy" was great as it introduced new GL of Sector 2814 "Guy Gardner" as well as the new villain for the second half of the season, and of course, setting up Hal's role in the coming Crisis. We even get our friend Giancarlo Volpe to Tweet us the answer to a question we had about what Hal Jordan eats in space, stay tuned... Speaking of crisis', the Young Justice episode "Satisfaction" was about some more, personal crisis's happening in the lives of our favorite heroes, including Superboy, Miss Martian, Nightwing, Kid Flash, Blue Beetle, and even the original Roy Harper aka Arsenal. But not only that, this Young Justice episode brings on some heated discussion on whether or not "Batman: Under the Red Hood" falls into the Earth-16 (aka Young Justice Universe) continuity and if the currently deceased Robin (Jason Todd) will return to team-up with fellow Outlaws: Arsenal and Starfire. (As well as shout-outs to Otis in both Young Justice and Smallville!!!) On top of that, there are more DC Nation Shorts to cover as we briefly talk "DC Nation Mythbusters", a new "New Teen Titans" short (as well as talk about what Teen Titans Go! should be...), and a great/heartbreaking "Super Best Friends Forever". But that's not all!!! As Michael starts off this podcast with news from Batman writer Scott Snyder himself on what's in store for the Bat-Family in his upcoming "Death of The Family" story arc, featuring the return of the Joker! And while we're on the subject of comics, we also review last week's Chapter 18 of Smallville: Season 11 with 11x02 "Detective, Part 6" featuring a shocking cliffhanger on who the major villain of this episode is, and showing us that Clark Kent can still inspire good in the darkest of knights.  Oh, and shout outs to Michael Wen, Andy Behbakht, and Josh Winchester! All this and more on Week 29 of DC Nation!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: This week Michael and I discuss the much anticipated return of Green Lantern: TAS and Young Justice Invasion from hiatus. We also review new DC Nation Shorts and Smallville Season 11: Detective Chapter 6. Plus, there's news on Batman Death of the Family.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 92 (Enhanced) “All We Ever Knew, Was Last Year's Tube”
item.description: With this week's ATA Episode we felt like Walter on the Season Premiere of Fringe as this week got us lost in a future world of new TV pilots where our favorite shows of yesterday like Chuck seem to be drifting a way and all we ever knew was last year's tube (TV Schedule). So to help you navigate through this foreign land  known as the 2012–13 TV season filled with all sorts of things new we're giving you a monster sized episode featuring reviews from our returning favorites (Castle, Alphas, Warehouse 13, Modern Family, The Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest, Fringe and Doctor Who) as well as a second edition of our Airwaves Rundown section where we analyze all of the new pilots to tell you which ones are worth watching. On that note, the length of this podcast may seem extraneous but if there is a show you don't want to hear about while listening to our Enhanced Podcast just press the skip button on your iPod or other portable device to move on to the next chapter or review so you don't feel like you have to listen to all 2 1/2 hours of this episode. There is just a bunch of new stuff to cover at the beginning of this particular TV Season and a long podcast episode was the best way to do that for your listening pleasure.  In other words, thanks for bearing with us on this one and we promise we'll have a shorter episode for you next week once we narrow down what shows we're going to follow this upcoming season.
item.itunes:subtitle: Since all we ever knew was last year's tube, Nico and I decided to help navigate you through the new 2012–13 TV Season with reviews on returning favorites and an Airwaves Rundown section where we tell you which new Pilots are worth watching.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 28 (Enhanced) “From Zero to Hero”
item.description: Hello DC Nationites and welcome back to the DC Nation Podcast Season 1 Finale!!! Why is this a finale you might ask? Well, because we are finally going to be closing shop on our DC Comics Summer Comic Book Reviews and will be transitioning back to Cartoon Network's DC Nation Block next week (Week 29)! But, until next week, Dan & I come back to wrap up the month of September where we cover DC's "Zero Month". The zero issues that we cover on this podcast include: Green Lantern (the first appearance of new GL of 2814 "Simon Baz"), Justice League (which is a whole issue devoted to the JL's amazing back-story (and soon to be member) SHAZAM!), Earth-2 (similar to JL 0, but this time talking about one-time Mr. Terrific aka Terry Sloan), Supergirl, Detective Comics, Batman, Nightwing, Red Hood and The Outlaws, and Batgirl! Sadly, at the time of recording, the zero issues for Aquaman, Batman: The Dark Knight (continuing Batman's origin), Superman (starring Jor-El!), and Teen Titans (covering Tim Drake's origin as Red Robin) were not available, so we did not record on them (although I read them and they are all worth the buy!). But that's not all folks! We also cover Smallville 11x2 Detective Part 5, where Clark interrogates Bruno Mannheim as Batman and his loyal sidekick plan their next move! All this and more in the latest DC Nation Podcast!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: On this week's episode we review some of the Issue Zeros that have been released this month as a part of DC Comics' New 52 including Batman, Green Lantern and Justice League. We also review Smallville Season 11: Detective Chapter 5.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 91 (Enhanced) “Turn off the Lights”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, on this week's episode we're turning out the lights as we delve into the modern world without electricity featured on NBC's new series Revolution to tell you if it's worth watching on a weekly basis. At the same time this review on Revolution's Pilot episode headlines a new section that will be a part of our original ATA Podcasts entitled Airwaves Rundown where Nico and I will briefly discuss new TV shows that we've watched and programs we think you should be watching that we just don't have time to review on a weekly basis. This section will also be a place where we will keep you updated on shows that we're not so enthusiastic about reviewing on a weekly basis because they've creatively gone off the rails and yes we're talking to you Bones. Beyond, our brand spanking new section, the main portion of this week's podcast is dedicated to keeping up with our reviews on the new seasons of Alphas, Warehouse 13 and Doctor Who. In other words, that's your cue to get excited because Fall TV is on the Horizon and we here at ATA are living up to the hype with an episode giving you some old favorites with a little dash of something new, so what you waiting for?! Get out your iPod and give this episode a listen ASAP because you never know the power might go off leaving ATA gone forever. FOR–EVER! FOR–EVER! FOR–EVER! Man, I love the Sandlot.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we're turning off the lights as our discussion on the Pilot for NBC's new show Revolution headlines a new podcast section called Airwaves Rundown. We also provide another set of reviews on new episodes of Alphas, Warehouse 13 and Doctor Who.

item.title: Retro Reviews 33 - Even MORE Arrow Preparation for this Fall!!!
item.description: Hey guys, welcome back to Retro Reviews. On this action-packed episode, Woo S! Kim and I (Michael J. Petty) discuss the difference between IMAX and "fake" IMAX, The Avengers, Amazing Spider-Man, and Indiana Jones coming to Blu-Ray, Supernatural, Arrow, and of course, we review the Smallville episodes "Reunion" & "Roulette" to continue our "Prep For Arrow" series. Thanks guys for listening to Retro Reviews for the past year, we love recording the show and we love hearing from our fans. Since we probably won't be back until November or December, we want to make sure that you guys know where to find us. Michael can be found on the DC Nation Podcast, his "World's Finest TV Blog" series on the ATA website, and on Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast with his co-host Woo S! Kim!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 33rd episode of Across the Airwaves' Retro Reviews Podcast, hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S! Kim.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 27 (Enhanced) “That's Robot Chicken!”
item.description: Hey everyone it's Michael, and welcome back to DC Nation Podcast! Your #1 source for all things related to Cartoon Network's DC Nation programming block (including Green Lantern: The Animated Series & Young Justice) as well as DC's Smallville: Season 11 comic book series. Because Adult Swim is technically part of the Cartoon Network and because Robot Chicken did a DC Comics related episode, I'm proud to present to you all Dan & my commentary on the "Robot Chicken: DC Comics Special"!!! Because we hadn't seen the episode before, and because it's a commentary, you may want to watch the episode along with us via DVR, or whatever format you use to watch Robot Chicken, so that you understand why we're laughing so hard when we do. But Smallville fans, don't turn your backs on us now, because coming off of our last interview with Season 11 scribe Bryan Q. Miller, my theories were correct about how Batman is able to beat Superman as we talk Detective, Chapter 4 (aka Smallville Season 11 chapter 16)! So, without any more distractions, let the chaos begin as we watch the first (and hopefully not the last) DC Comics Special of Robot Chicken! (and Smallville!)
item.itunes:subtitle: Pop Culture jokes pushing the envelope, that's Robot Chicken! So with our commentary on their DC Comics Special we were just as off-the-wall by not watching it before recording but there's still sanity in the episode as we cover more Smallville Season 11.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 90 (Enhanced) “Showdown!”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, when it comes to this podcast, an old saying from Westerns comes to mind about this town not being big enough for the two of us. Although, just in case you were wondering I'm not referring to Nico and I. I'm actually talking about the episodes of our favorite sci-fi/fantasy shows we reviewed for the week because they all seemed to feature a standoff between our favorite heroic characters and an arch nemesis. First off, on Alphas we had a literal battle of the minds between Dr. Rosen and the immortal big bad Stanton Parish, then with Warehouse 13, Artie and Brother Adrian's  conflict over the astrolabe began to heat up by taking another nasty turn and last but not least Doctor Who appeared to set up a Wild Western shootout with a cyborg that gave way to the Doctor battling a far greater nemesis himself as he was confronted by an alien Doctor, who was a skewed version of his David Tennant persona. In other words, to sum everything up this here podcast has got itself several good old-fashioned showdowns so draw your iPod from its holster and PRESS PLAY for some discussion slinging action!
item.itunes:subtitle: On this week's podcast we've got ourselves some good old-fashioned showdowns as our reviews on Alphas, Warehouse 13 and Doctor Who were all about episodes where a heroic character had a Western style standoff with an arch nemesis.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 89 (Enhanced) “Everybody Walk The Dinosaur”
item.description: Hey Everybody its Nico and Welcome to Across the Airwaves.  On this week's shorter, but still amazing episode of Across the Airwaves, Dan and I discuss the spectacular Doctor Who episode "Dinosaurs on a Spaceship," ... I know, Dinosaurs on a Spaceship. Join us as we geek out about my favorite show on television, we discuss the dinosaurs, the Doctor has a gang, riding 'Tricey' to freedom, the big, frothy, nothing-earth-shatteringly-dangerous-will-happen-but-this-is-going-to-be-nuts type of episode that this was, and what I'd call the "Willy Wonka Doctor."  It may not have been perfect, but at least 'Dinosaurs on a Spaceship' delivered where it counts, with frivolous Jurassic Park sized fun for all.  So join us for a fun episode of Doctor Who on a shortened episode of Across the Airwaves and we will be back to full size next week.
item.itunes:subtitle: Even though no Alphas and Warehouse 13 makes this a shorter episode. There's still plenty of fun for us to have as we discuss the second episode of Doctor Who Series 7, Dinosaurs on a Spaceship.

item.title: DC Nation Podcast Week 26 (Enhanced) “Bryan Q. Miller Returns!”
item.description: Hello DC Nationites, as you already know there have been some pretty controversial DC superhero related content with the word “returns” in the title. There has been the Danny DeVito nose biting fright fest Batman Returns and the letdown to Superman fans everywhere Superman Returns. Although, unlike those movies us using the word “returns” in the title of this week's DC Nation Podcast does not indicate another disappointment as we were joined again by Smallville Season 11 Comic Book Writer Bryan Q. Miller. Now you'd think Bryan could only handle one dose of our antics but believe it or not he actually asked us for more and even through in some antics of his own  while throwing in some entertaining off-topic tangents that I only thought Michael was capable of pulling off successfully. However, this episode wasn't all goofing around as we got down to Smallville business with Bryan revealing some alternate scenes he had for Season 11 Chapter 1 Guardian, giving background on the decision to bring Batman in the Smallville Universe and explaining how he is using the comic to fulfill a wish list of his own ideas for the Smallville TV Series that were left on the cutting room floor. In other words, if you like the behind the scenes content on the Smallville DVDs/Blu-rays or just in general, this DC Nation Podcast is totally worth the listen because Bryan gives you everything you want to know about the Smallville Season 11 Comics and more. In fact, this podcast was such a jolly good time, Bryan might even come back again after the next Smallville Chapter is complete but don't worry we will come up with a more creative title for that episode than Bryan Q. Miller Forever. Again, I know we said it a bunch of times on the podcast but Bryan we can't thank you enough for coming back to do a second interview and DC Nationites if you enjoyed this episode please tweet complements to Bryan while replying to us @AcrossAirwaves because our good buddy deserves all the appreciation he can get from the DC Nation Podcast for taking the time out of his busy writing schedule to make this episode possible.
item.itunes:subtitle: Again, I know we said it a bunch of times on the podcast but Bryan we can't thank you enough for coming back to do a second interview and DC Nationites if you enjoyed this episode please tweet complements to Bryan while replying to us @AcrossAirwaves beca

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 88 (Enhanced) “Doctor Who Are You?”
item.description: Hi ATA Listeners, it's time to EXTERMINATE!!! Oh no, I'm turning into a Dalek! Wait a minute, here's the Doctor with a funky light up bracelet to save the day, YAY I'M CURED! And as you might've guessed our favorite bowtie wearing alien time traveler has returned to ATA with our review on the Doctor Who Series 7 Premiere, Asylum of the Daleks. An episode that left Nico and I completely blown away by its astonishing ability to keep blindsiding us with twists that we just did not see coming like this episode ending with the Doctor's greatest enemies asking who are you?  However, the fun we have on this podcast doesn't stop with Doctor Who as we get caught up on our reviews for the two other great sci-fi series that premiered this summer, Syfy Channel's Warehouse 13 and Alphas.
item.itunes:subtitle: This episode asks the question Doctor Who are you? As we discuss the Doctor Who Series 7 Premiere, Asylum of the Daleks while getting caught up on our reviews for Warehouse 13 and Alphas.

item.title: ATA's DC Nation Podcast Week 25 (Enhanced) “Comics That Personify Their Characters“
item.description: Hello DC Nationites, it's Dan here bringing you another Comic Book Discussion podcast episode! And now there's probably a guy in the back of a room somewhere letting out a slow uncaring clap. In all honesty, this is a shorter episode because we feel you guys on that one as it's really time for new Green Lantern and Young Justice. However, please try to indulge us one more week since there's some new stuff planned for our next couple of episodes and you've got to be excited about this podcast's discussion on Smallville Season 11 as the longest running TV incarnation of Clark Kent/Superman comes face-to-face with Batman. In addition, the other comic books we talk about today, The Flash and Supergirl are some of the best to come out of The New 52. Obviously, The Flash written by Francis Manapul was expected to be good but Supergirl was a surprise as it took the character of Kara in a whole new direction that felt as intense as a Bourne movie. However, what really makes these books great is that they personify their characters meaning that reading The Flash makes you feel like you are fighting criminals at the speed of light just like Barry Allen and the nonstop action featured in Supergirl makes your heart starts racing like your an innocent teenage girl who woke up on a strange world where it seems like you can't trust anybody. Again, with these comics personifying their characters we tried to do the same with this podcast as we threw in musical transitions and more that represented Supergirl and The Flash. Heck, we even sped through this episode and that's a flash fact. On top of that, Michael would be a human Supergirl would believe to have questionable motives as the song he used at the end of the episode even personified one of Flash's Rogues good old Captain Boomerang who has yet to appear in The New 52. So Francis Manapul if you're listening, there's your next story arc but make sure credit goes to Dan and Michael the hosts of the DC Nation Podcast.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we discuss The Flash and Supergirl, two comic books that have become some of the best titles to come out of The New 52 reboot for their ability to personify their characters. In addition, we review Smallville Season 11: Detective Ch. 3.

item.title: Retro Reviews - Episode 31
item.description: Hello my friends, and welcome back to Across the Airwaves' very own Retro Reviews Podcast with our "Season 2 premiere" covering Smallville episodes "Toxic" and "Disciple", and yes, they're BOTH Oliver Queen-centric as we are continuing our Arrow-Preparation campaign that we started with Longbow Hunters Episode 0, and will continue until Retro Reviews 32 (next episode). So, strap in and get ready because our new format to Retro Reviews and our new episodes are coming (at only 2 episodes a month!) and you won't want to miss out!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 31st episode of Across the Airwaves' Retro Reviews hosted by Michael J. Petty & Woo S! Kim

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 87 (Enhanced) “The Sky Is Falling!”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, I've got some bad news for you, the sky is falling and no it's not in a Disney fairytale Chicken Little kind of way, I'm talking about giant spaceships, nuclear bombs, aliens enslaving children and every form of creepy crawley you can find in the book. However, with that thought in mind ATA Episode 87 can only go positive from here as my DC Nation Podcast cohost Michael J. Petty joins Nico and I to share the accounts of humanity's last line of defense the Second Mass Military Unit with our discussion on the second season of TNT's hit sci-fi TV Series Falling Skies. So with great pride and honor I present to you the sites and sounds of those same heroes acting as our defense against the alien threat told from the perspective of the Across The Airwaves Corps...
item.itunes:subtitle: Join Dan, Nico and our special guest Michael J. Petty as we discuss Season 2 of TNT's Steven Spielberg produced hit sci-fi TV Series Falling Skies.

item.title: ATA's DC Nation Podcast Week 24 (Enhanced) “Super Soap Box”
item.description: Hey guys and welcome back to DC Nation! Well, you've been waiting for this episode since summer started (well, since the New 52 started... but yeah...) and now we're finally going to deliver! On our "Super-Soap Box" episode, Dan and I get on our mics and go right at it! It being Grant Morrison. Morrison is personally responsible for destroying both Batman & X-Men comics of the last decade (which, both have (for the most part) been, thankfully, un-done by various means) and is now working on Superman (in Action Comics). I had high hopes for this run, mainly because of how good All-Star Superman is (which he also wrote), however, as Dan and I talk about, this run on Action makes no sense at all. But Morrison isn't all we talk about! We also discuss Dan Jurgens run on the current Superman book as well as our high hopes for Scott Lobdell's run, coming this fall. But, since we didn't want to leave you on a sour note, and it did fit into our "Superman" theme, we also cover the Smallville: Season 11 episode "Detective" in Part 2 (which is technically Chapter 14) written by our good friend Bryan Q. Miller (who will be back with us on Week 26 I might add)! So, without any more delay, enjoy Dan and I rant about Grant Morrison, Superman history, Dan Jurgens, comic book artists, Superman/Lois Lane/Wonder Woman love triangle, and of course Smallville!
item.itunes:subtitle: We continue our Summer Comic Book Discussion Series on DC Comics' The New 52 with our thoughts on Superman Volume 3 and Action Comics Volume 2. We also discuss the next installment of Smallville Season 11: Detective Chapter 2.

item.title: ATA's DC Nation Podcast Week 23 (Enhanced) “Green Lantern's Light Featuring Batman”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, with Week 23 of our DC Nation Podcast you are in for a great show as we discuss a highly anticipated event that has been 10 years in the making, the introduction of Batman to the Smallville Universe with the next digital installment of Bryan Q. Miller's Smallville Season 11 entitled Detective Chapter 1. However, that's not all we have for you in this thrilling episode as we continue our Summer Comic Book Discussion Series with our thoughts on the New 52 Green Lantern as well as a recap on few story arcs that actually crossed over from the Post Crisis Universe, Blackest Night, Brightest Day and War of the Green Lanterns.
item.itunes:subtitle: Join us as we continue our Summer Comic Book Discussion Series with our thoughts on the New 52 Green Lantern and Smallville Season 11 Detective Chapter 1, which featured the highly anticipated introduction of Batman to the Smallville Universe.

item.title: Longbow Hunters - Episode 0 - Origins of the Emerald Archer
item.description: Welcome one and all to the 0 episode of LONGBOW HUNTERS: THE ARROW PODCAST. Brought to you by Across the Airwaves Productions. In this 0 episode of LBH, Woo S! Kim and I (Michael J. Petty) cover Green Arrow in comics, television, film (well... not film, but you get the picture), and everything else! We also discuss our thoughts on what we've heard so far about Arrow, the show in which this podcast is about. Also, sorry about Woo's audio. We're getting back into recording season and we're still working out the kinks. Anyway, enjoy out (very poor...) episode 0 of Longbow Hunters!
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 0 of Michael J. Petty & Woo S! Kim's latest podcasting endeavor, Longbow Hunters: The Arrow Podcast, on Across the Airwaves Productions

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 86 (Enhanced) “Extreme Ways Are Back Again”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, extreme ways are back again for Across the Airwaves as Nico and I reprise our hosting duties to kick off our third season featuring more celebrity interviews, new podcast spinoffs and the addition of two new cohosts (fingers crossed) with a episode on SyFy Channel's Warehouse 13 and Alphas. In fact, within the worlds of these shows extreme ways have taken us to places we've never known as Artie used an dangerous artifact to restore the warehouse despite the risk of unleashing an evil upon the world and Dr. Rosen announced the existence of Alphas to the public. As you can imagine, this means that our discussion on this episode is all about the debate on if Rosen and Artie's epic decisions will save the world or cause it to fall apart. However that's not without our favorite Warehouse Agents  and Alpha Team Members having to say something about it especially when Gary Bell is on the case. I know it's been a while but with Gary around you've got to remember to respect the badge by accepting our invitation to join us as we delve right into the adventurous realms of Warehouse 13 and Alphas, two programs worthy of the title Powerful Mondays.
item.itunes:subtitle: Extreme ways are back again for Nico and I as we kick off Season 3 of Across The Airwaves with a discussion on SyFy Channel's Warehouse 13 and Alphas.

item.title: ATA's DC Nation Podcast Week 22 (Enhanced) “Justice for All”
item.description: Hello, ATA Listeners! It's Dan here and with us still trying to get our bearings straight after returning from vacation, we decided to make this episode simple by just making it a discussion on The New 52 Justice League Comics brought together by Geoff Johns, Jim Lee and an All-Star team of additional artists. Now normally we would pair this discussion with a review on the next installment of Smallville Season 11 but since the next chapter Detective is not going to be released until this Friday, we decided to stick with giving you our thoughts on Justice League as well as the back story involving the new origins of Shazam beginning in Issue #7. However, more Smallville is not the only thing for you to look forward to as a comment from long time podcast listener Jason A. reveals that an ATA Episode 86 is in the making, which is set to review new episodes of Warehouse 13 and Alphas currently airing Monday nights on SyFy. Also as you may have noticed ads have been added to the ATA website and we ask that you please bear with these sponsors because we need their support to keep producing podcast episodes.
item.itunes:subtitle: With Smallville off for a week, join us as we continue our Summer Series of Comic Book discussions with our thoughts on Geoff Johns and Jim Lee's New 52 Justice League Comics and their back story about the new origins of Shazam that began in Issue #7.

item.title: ATA DC Nation Week 21 (Enhanced) “DC Nation and Man of Steel at Comic Con”
item.description: Hey guys, and welcome back to the DC Nation Podcast's coverage on this years San Diego Comic Con. Because we didn't get to finish our coverage of DC Comics at the Con this year, we split it into two episodes (or weeks). Week 20 was all about the comics aspect of DC Entertainment, and now Week 21 (the one you are currently downloading and reading the description of...) will talk more about DC's media, including everything DC Nation (no, not our podcast, the actual Cartoon Network programming block!) including the second halfs of the current seasons of Green Lantern and Young Justice, the upcoming shows for this block including the highly anticipated Beware the Batman as well as the return of the Teen Titans to Cartoon Network in Teen Titans Go!, and of course the next wave of DC Nation Shorts coming up. But that's not all Dan and I talk about on this episode, we also talk about the most highly anticipated film of 2013 and it's panel featuring director Zack Snyder and lead actor Henry Cavill, yes, you guessed it, Superman's return to the big screen: Man of Steel! We talk the teaser trailer shown in front of The Dark Knight Rises (now on Youtube as well), the Comic Con footage, and everything Snyder & Cavil said about the movie. But we couldn't leave you with just one discussion on Superman, we also had to throw in the final moments of the Smallville Season 11 premiere arc entitled "Guardian" (by our friend Bryan Q. Miller) and our thoughts on what's in store for the Smallville Universe with our discussion on Chapter 12. All this and more on Week 21 of DC Nation!
item.itunes:subtitle: On Week 21 of the DC Nation Podcast, we continue our Comic Con 2012 coverage with discussions on the panels held for the DC Nation Programming Block and the upcoming Superman movie, Man of Steel. We also review Smallville Season 11: Guardian Chapter 12.

item.title: ATA DC Nation Week 20 (Enhanced) “DC Comics Goes to the Con”
item.description: Hello everyone and welcome back to the DC Nation Podcast! We're sorry it took so long for this episode to get out to you, but unfortunately, Dan was at Summer Camp all of last week, so he couldn't really put it out. Regardless, we're back, and this time we are covering DC Entertainment's news at Comic Con 2012! We cover the Batman: Beyond the Court of Owls panel, the DC - All Access Now panel, the Superman, Justice League/Green Lantern panels, and the New 52 panel as well. There is a lot of news coming out of Comic Con this year and a lot to discuss, hence this being a long episode. In-fact, this episode was actually split into two parts as the recording was getting way to long. So our coverage of DC Nation at SDCC and the Man of Steel panel are going to take place on our next episode (Week 21) instead. But don't worry Smallville fans, we haven't let you down so far and we won't let you down today as we cover the Season 11 premiere "Guardian" with the 11th Chapter of this amazing saga featuring a showdown between Superman and the Cyborg-Superman, and a shocking reveal at what may come next for our dear Smallville Universe. All this and more on Week 20 of DC Nation!
item.itunes:subtitle: On Week 20 of the DC Nation Podcast, we begin Part 1 of our San Diego Comic Con 2012 coverage by discussing all the panels that occurred at the Con related to the pages of DC Comics. We also review Smallville Season 11: Guardian Chapter 11.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 85 (Enhanced) “I Want to Become a Cosplay Hero”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, I was going to come up with something really eloquent and profound for this post to hype one of the biggest events of the year, San Diego Comic Con 2012. However, with all of the delays that have been going on with the release of our podcast episodes from computer issues to me being on vacation, I'm going to keep this short and sweet by saying join us as we discuss all of the news headlines that came out of Comic Con 2012 and the panels where the people behind our favorite Live-Action TV shows (Community, The Big Bang Theory, Psych, Once upon a Time, Person of Interest, Fringe, Supernatural and Doctor Who) give a sneak peek at their upcoming new seasons.
item.itunes:subtitle: Become a Cosplay hero as we discuss all of the news headlines that came out of Comic Con 2012 and the panels where the people behind our favorite Live-Action TV shows give a sneak peek at their upcoming new seasons.

item.title: Retro Reviews 31 - The Aurora Theater Shooting
item.description: Hey everyone, and welcome back to Across the Airwaves' classic spin-off podcast entitled "Retro Reviews". Today we speak to you all with very heavy hearts as Woo and I return from our slumber to talk about the theater shooting that took place at The Dark Knight Rises midnight screening in Aurora, Colorado. First of all, we'd like to send our deepest sympathies from here at ATA towards the victims and the families of the victims during this terrible time. Secondly, this even really disturbed Woo and I, and we really get emotional and angry in this podcast. I do encourage you to listen to it, because we do get light-hearted again while talking about The Dark Knight Rises, Arrow & Supernatural at SDCC, and the Man of Steel trailer in detail. And while we do briefly discuss those last three things, the main event of this podcast is our long discussion on this event, as well as our Man of Steel trailer that is suppose to give us hope. If you are afraid to go see TDKR, or any movie at all, I'd encourage you to rise above your fear, doubts, and anger to do it. Not only is it one of the greatest films of the year, but it's also the most epic end to a trilogy that I have ever seen (well, maybe it ties with Return of the King & Return of the Jedi...). The whole point of The Dark Knight Rises and the Dark Knight Trilogy in general is overcoming fear to be better than we are. This is what I encourage all of you to do. Thank you, and enjoy our tribute to the families and victims of this terrible tragedy.
item.itunes:subtitle: A special 31st episode of Across the Airwaves' Retro Reviews Podcast, dedicated to the victims of the Aurora, CO shooting. Hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S. Kim.

item.title: ATA's DC Nation Podcast Week 19 (Enhanced) “Atlantians, Kryptonians, Black Mantas OH MY!”
item.description: Hello loyal DC Comics fans, Atlantians, Kryptonians, cyborgs, Geoff Johns fans, and DC Nation listeners and welcome back! This week on ATA's very own DC Nation Podcast, Dan and I cover the most controversial superhero in pretty much all of comic book history, this character is none other than Orin/Arthur "A.C." Curry aka AQUAMAN! Now, Aquaman (created by Paul Norris), has had one of the most convoluted backgrounds in all of comic book history (others with that title include Hawkman, Jean Grey, Ben Reilly, and Power Girl) but now with DC's New 52 relaunch, Geoff Johns has fixed all the problems we've had with Aquaman over the past 75 years, in just ONE ISSUE!!! That's right, so far issues 1-10 of this new series are out, and we cover all of them, but first, we start out with a little bit of background on "mankind's truest friend" followed by our discussion on the first story line, "The Trench". After that we quickly move onto the better of the two story arcs (witch, by the way, is still going on) "The Others" featuring my all-time worst fear: BLACK MANTA!!! But Aquaman isn't all we talk about this week on DC Nation, we also talk about Bryan Q. Miller's Smallville Season 11 with part 10 of "Guardian", kicking off the final act of the premiere! We discuss Superman maybe redeeming Superman IV, Lex Luthor's latest "butt kicked" moment, and the birth of Smallville's Cyborg Superman! All this and more on this underwater episode of the DC Nation Podcast!
item.itunes:subtitle: On Week 19 of the DC Nation Podcast we are diving right into The New 52 Aquaman comics and Smallville Season 11: Guardian Chapter 10.

item.title: Road to TDKR - The Dark Knight
item.description: Hello fellow Gothamites, Nolanites, and Bat-Fans and welcome back to Across the Airwaves! This is of course the Road to TDKR Podcast Series of commentaries on the Bat-Films leading up to The Dark Knight Rises. HOWEVER, this time on Road to TDKR, your favorite host Dan Schmidt & I will be commentating on one of the most important films in movie, super hero, and comic book history. That film, of course, is The Dark Knight. As the longest and final film in this series of commentaries, Dan & I make a very special effort to not just enjoy the movie, but really dissect the most important elements of it. The Joker. The rise and fall of Harvey "Two-Face" Dent. The effect Rachel's death had on the characters. The importance of the Batman. Our theory on Heath Ledger's death and that his portrayal of the Joker may have driven him to madness. And our theories on how the events of this film will carry on over into The Dark Knight Rises.  We dedicate this commentary to Heath Ledger, Conway Wickliffe, Jerry Robinson, and Christopher Nolan himself.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Road to TDKR finale on the epic masterpiece "The Dark Knight"! Hosted by Dan Schmidt & Michael J. Petty!

item.title: ATA's DC Nation Podcast Week 18 (Enhanced) “Goes Beyond Unlimited”
item.description: Hey gang, and welcome back to the DC Nation Podcast, brought to you by the Across the Airwaves Network! As you know, last week on the podcast, we interviewed Green Lantern: The Animated Series producer Giancarlo Volpe,  what most of you don't know, is that the next day, we recorded this episode for you as well! Unfortunately, due to scheduling conflicts, we couldn't get it out to you all until now, but hey, no one's perfect! So on this weeks DC Nation Podcast, as Green Lantern & Young Justice aren't back from hiatus and reruns, Dan and I decided to keep going with our "Summer of DC" thing that we did on Week 16 with the Batman books and continue on with the Batman Beyond Unlimited comic! Now, this book is different than most. 3 digital chapters of Batman Beyond, Justice League Beyond (or Justice League Unlimited), and Superman Beyond are released each month, and when it comes time for the print, they combine and form the BBU comic! Pretty neat, huh? So, Dan and I start with Batman Beyond: Hush, then Batman Beyond (2011 series), and then go into the current series, then Superman Beyond, and then the JLU book. It's a great, long, and fun discussion and if you're a fan of the DC Animated Universe and want to know what happens before Epilogue, then you've come to the right place! But don't be alarmed my friends, since we didn't get to cover Smallville: Season 11 "Guardian" Part 9 yet, we cover that too (for about 20 minutes or so...)!!! Dan talks about Lex's "beat-up" moment of the week and I think I have a good theory on who the person in the Queen Industries ship is... All this in the DC Nation Podcast Week 18!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: Welcome to the future as this week's DC Nation Podcast features our discussion on the various Batman Beyond comics that act as a follow-up to the popular animated TV series. Then we head back to present day with another review on Smallville Season 11.

item.title: ATA's DC Nation Podcast Week 17 (Enhanced) “An Interview with Giancarlo Volpe”
item.description: Hello fellow Green Lantern Corps members, Benders, comic fans, and ATA followers and welcome back! On this special episode of Across the Airwaves' DC Nation Podcast, Dan and I interview one of the show-runners of one of our favorite shows to cover here on the ATA Network entitled, Green Lantern: The Animated Series! As you all know, we have covered every episode of this show on our DC Nation Podcast from Week 1 (aka ATA Episode 74) to Week 13 until the show took it's summer hiatus. But now, we have scored an interview with a producer of this show who has worked on Avatar: The Last Airbender, Star Wars: Clone Wars, and, of course, Green Lantern: TAS, his name is Giancarlo Volpe! Giancarlo graciously (like Smallville: Season 11 writer Bryan Q. Miller did months ago) agreed to an interview and we didn't even have to force him at gunpoint! In this interview, we talk about the "behind-the-scenes" of Green Lantern, the creation of Aya and Razer (and their romance...), how Gi got his job on GL: TAS, how and why the Interceptor was created, why we don't like when some super heroes have vehicles, translation from comics to television, and more on this special DC Nation Podcast One-Shot! Also, a shout out to Steve Quayle for letting me use his office to record this interview as the connection at my place was down. Thanks Steve!
item.itunes:subtitle: Join Michael and I as we interview one of the most upbeat guys in television animation, Green Lantern: The Animated Series Producer Giancarlo Volpe!

item.title: ATA's DC Nation Podcast Week 16 (Enhanced) “Podcast of the Owls”
item.description: Howdy DC Nationers, it's Summer and we're going to use Green Lantern: The Animated Series and Young Justice Invasion being on hiatus as an excuse to take it easy because frankly everyone here at ATA has been working really hard. However, that does not mean we are going to stop providing you with podcasts we are just going to be taking a different approach with our episodes as our reviews on the digital issues of Smallville Season 11 will be combined with a series of discussions on DC's The New 52 Comic Books until our favorite DC Nation Shows return. Now that you know the lowdown  for the next couple weeks. This particular episode is called Podcast of the Owls since we are beginning our New 52 discussions on the Batman related books, particularly their connection to the highly acclaimed Court/Night of the Owls crossover event, which concluded with a reveal that may change the dynamic of the Bat Family forever! On that note, in going along with the laid-back nature of summer, this section is going to be a mostly unedited conversation between Michael and I discussing what we like about the current Batman Comics with a few sound effects for entertainment and chapter markers to help you follow our little chat. So with that get out your stack of comics and enjoy the show because we have a fun one here for your listening pleasure.
item.itunes:subtitle: On Week 16 of the DC Nation Podcast we're reviewing Smallville Season 11: Guardian Chapter 8 and beginning our Summer series of discussions on DC's The New 52 Comic Books starting with the Batman Titles relating to the Court/Night of the Owls Story Arc.

item.title: Road to TDKR - Batman: Gotham Knight
item.description: Hey guys, welcome back! In case you don't know, you're listening to the "Road to The Dark Knight Rises" commentary series brought to you by Across the Airwaves! This time, Dan and Michael watch the animated "bridge" in between Begins and TDK entitled "Batman: Gotham Knight". The reason we decided to cover Gotham Knight was because it really does get into Batman's head and sets up his position in TDK (which will be our next and final commentary for Road to TDKR) as well as the fact that Batman is voiced by the only "true" Batman in our opinion, Kevin Conroy! Join Dan and I in watching Batman: Gotham Knight consisting of 6 chapters, by 6 different writers, but it's one over-arcing story. So, thanks for taking the last minute to read this and now put in your Gotham Knight DVD/Blu-Ray, turn on your commentary, and strap in, because we're taking this up to 11!
item.itunes:subtitle: This is the 2nd commentary in the Road to The Dark Knight Rises series brought to you by Across the Airwaves, hosted by Dan Schmidt and Michael J. Petty

item.title: ATA DC Nation Week 15 (Enhanced) “Comeback”
item.description: Hello DC Nation Fans! It's Dan here, bringing you our Week 15 episode entitled Comeback because this week's Young Justice Invasion episode “Depths”  featured the seeds being planted for Superboy and Miss Martian to come back to their romantic relationship and Smallville Season 11 Guardian Chapter 7 dealt with Clark as Superman making a comeback towards Lex Luthor for sabotaging his own space shuttle launch.  In addition, we here at ATA hope that with Green Lantern as well as Young Justice on hiatus you will  come back for more of our ATA DC Nation podcasts as we're going to continue reviewing the Smallville Season 11 Digital Comics and begin discussions on DC's The New 52 comic books until the animated shows return with new episodes. By the way, before I forget to mention it, this ATA DC Nation podcast also features discussions on the Superhero Shorts: DC Nation Mythbusters Kid Flash's Dodging, Sword of the Atom Part 2 and The New Teen Titans in Taped before a Live Studio Audience.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA DC Nation Week 15 is all about individual characters, story arcs and romances all making a comeback on the Young Justice Invasion episode “Depths” and within the pages of Smallville Season 11. Also we review three all new DC Nation Shorts.

item.title: Retro Reviews 30 - Top 5 Favorite Smallville Episodes of All Time!!!
item.description: The UNEDITED, EXPLICIT, ROUGH-CUT Retro Reviews Season 1 finale is here with our most highly anticipated episode of the season on our "Top 5 Favorite Smallville Episodes". No exceptions, no limitations, only what you think are your favorite episodes of the series. This episode includes co-hosts Michael J. Petty & Woo S. Kim joined by  the ATA-god Dan Schmidt, and our resident Smallville/Young Justice fan-girl Alisa Lea Gossage! Before the main event, however, we do talk about Hans Zimmer (NOT James Newton Howard) composing Man of Steel, Superman vs The Elite (why you should watch it according to Michael), Batman coming to Smallville in 11x2 "Detective", and why Superman is always given a significant chin in DC Animation. So on that final note, be warned that this is a 2 and a half hour long episode, that we talk in depth about the episodes we chose, and that the last few episodes we mention were rushed because we were running out of time. Special thanks to Dan for allowing Retro Reviews, Alisa for listening, Woo for being my co-host this year, and to Nico, James, and Josh for being patient with being on the show (which will happen for sure next season!). So, until next time guys, we'll catch you on the Airwaves!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 30th episode and Season 1 finale of Across the Airwaves' very own Retro Reviews, hosted by Michael J. Petty & Woo S. Kim, guest-starring Dan Schmidt & Alisa Lea Gossage!

item.title: Retro Reviews 28 - Clana (Guest-Starring AlisaLea)
item.description: Hello my friends and welcome back to ATA's very own spin-off hosted by myself (Michael J. Petty) and my partner-in-crime Woo S. Kim, this is the Retro Reviews podcast!!! This week on R&R, Woo and I thought it would be "fun" to talk about one of the most hated and criticized parts of Smallville as a whole... Clana. But don't worry female listeners, your perspective is here as well in the form of ATA loyalist and frequent guest-star on our Smallville shows, Alisa Lea!!! That's right, Woo, Lis, and I talk Clana (and Lana in general) to death. Why did we hate it? Why did it go on for so long? How could it have been better? All these questions and more are answered on the latest episode of (Smallville) Retro Reviews!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 28th episode of Across the Airwaves' Retro Reviews Podcast hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S. Kim, with special guest-host AlisaLea

item.title: ATA DC Nation Week 14 (Enhanced) “Mr. Speed and Family”
item.description: Hello DC Nationites!  It's Dan here, Week 14 of our DC Nation Section is entitled Mr. Speed and Family because this week's Young Justice Invasion episode “Bloodlines” was all about the DC Universe's very own Mr. Speed, The Flash along with his extended family including his grandson Bart Allen better known as Impulse and later on Kid Flash in the current comic books. Also with our excitement wanting us to take a cosmic treadmill or flash forward to July 20th we took the time left open on this podcast due to Green Lantern: The Animated Series and Smallville Season 11 being on hiatus to discuss the footage from The Dark Knight Rises that was shown at the MTV Movie Awards. In addition, the discussion on Young Justice and the upcoming Christopher Nolan Batman Film was rounded out with our thoughts on the DC Nation Shorts, Who's Who in the DC Nation: The Flash, Sword of the Atom Part 2 and The New Teen Titans in Cyborg the Lifeguard.
item.itunes:subtitle: Week 14 of ATA DC Nation is titled Mr. Speed and Family because the Young Justice Invasion episode “Bloodlines” was about the DCU's own Mr. Speed, The Flash and his family. We also discussed footage of The Dark Knight Rises shown at the MTV Movie Awar

item.title: Road to TDKR - Batman Begins
item.description: Hi everyone, and welcome to the long awaited and anticipated event of ATA's Summer schedule: Road to The Dark Knight Rises (or "Road to TDKR" for short). I'd like to thank you all for being patient about the release of this series and this commentary in particular. For our first of three commentaries, Dan and I discuss and commentate on the Christopher Nolan film, Batman Begins, while watching the film (hence commentary)! We talk a lot about Ras Al Ghoul, Bruce's journey to becoming Batman, and how this movie will connect (and how it has forshadowed) to the most anticipated film of this summer, The Dark Knight Rises. So without furtur adu, I'm proud to present to you, Batman Begins, ATA style!
item.itunes:subtitle: A commentary on Batman Begins, a part of the Road to The Dark Knight Rises series brought to you by Across the Airwaves

item.title: ATA DC Nation Week 13 (Enhanced) “Ladies Night”
item.description: What's up DC Nationers, on Week 13 of our podcast, it's ladies night and the feelings right because if it wasn't for the many women in Hal Jordan's Life such as Carol Ferris, Aya the robot girl and the Star Sapphires, the little blue Smurfs on Oa would have gone bye-bye at the end of the Green Lantern: The Animated Series episode “Homecoming”. But the fun with the ladies didn't stop there as Nightwing sent just the mighty heroines of the team on a mission in the Young Justice Invasion episode “Beneath” and we got a Super Best Friends Forever Short where the extremely perky Batgirl gave the girl powered group its name. Then we moved away from the ladies a bit as we covered the first short in the Sword of the Atom series, although it took the original superhero comic book heroine, to prove you can't put a good woman down as Smallville Season 11 Guardian Chapter 6 featured Lois Lane reminding Clark why the world needs Superman when he questions if astronaut Adam Sandler, I mean Hank Henshaw would make a better hero.
item.itunes:subtitle: On Week 13 of ATA DC Nation it's ladies night because without the DC Universe's Heroines, the bad guys would have won on the Green Lantern: TAS episode “Homecoming”, the Young Justice Invasion episode “Beneath” and in the pages of Smallville Seaso

item.title: ATA DC Nation Week 12 (Enhanced) “Where in the World Is Artemis Crock?”
item.description: Hello Superhero Animation Fans, it's Dan here with the Week 12 edition of ATA DC Nation where we learned the answer to that burning question we've had on our minds since Young Justice took a five-year time jump, where in the world is Artemis Crock? And just how did we get this answer do you ask?  Well, it was through our reviews on the Green Lantern: The Animated Series episode “Invasion” and the Young Justice Invasion episode “Salvage”. Also with this week's ATA DC Nation, we discussed three new DC Nation Shorts, delved through the digital pages of Smallville Season 11: Guardian Chapter 5 and to keep you in suspense recorded a special opening to this podcast that I think you're all going to enjoy or at least give you a big laugh. Again, as you've probably noticed with this podcast, Michael comes up with these things and I just end up going for the ride, even if it ends in a fiery blaze of glory. So enjoy... I guess LOL!
item.itunes:subtitle: It's Week 12 of ATA DC Nation where we answer that burning question Where in the World Is Artemis Crock? with our reviews on Green Lantern: TAS, Young Justice Invasion and 3 new DC Nation Shorts. Also we discuss Smallville Season 11: Guardian Chapter 5.

item.title: Retro Reviews 27 - Assembling To Give Heather ANOTHER Shout-Out
item.description: Hey guys and welcome back! Or for some of you, it's the FIRST TIME! No, this episode of Retro Reviews is NOT going to make you loose your virginity (seriously guys?), BUT it may make your ears bleed as we talk for a LOOOOOOOOONG while about Marvel's The Avengers (or in EVERY OTHER COUNTRY: "Avengers Assemble")! But don't worry guys, there's still some comics talk, Smallville talk, Supernatural talk, Chuck tal... Wait, there's none of that... (Woo's twitter account is @WSK9002 if you wish to complain). So assemble your iPod or Zune or Droid, suit up in your "work clothes" or your pajamas, and strap in to this landmark episode for Across the Airwaves very own: Retro Reviews!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 27th episode of Across the Airwaves official spin-off podcast: Retro Reviews! Hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S. Kim!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 84 (Enhanced) “Adrenaline”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week's podcast is called “Adrenaline” because this title and the song by Gavin Rossdale is the best way to describe our favorite Season Finale of the year, the Person of Interest episode “Firewall”, which Nico hailed as the best hour on television next to Game of Thrones for simply maintaining its regular format while providing us with action worthy of a Finale. However, with this also being Across The Airwaves' Finale as we head into a short Summer hiatus we had some intense adrenaline filled action to deal with on our own. For the most part, this episode started out calm like Person of Interest with our review on the Finale for Once upon a Time and our favorite comedic moments from Modern Family but then the drama amped up with our reviews on the Finales for Bones, Supernatural and the whopping three episodes that rounded out Community's finale. Don't get me wrong, even though we were apprehensive about the concept at first, Nico and I really loved all three episodes of Community believing they fit together really well in a writer's triumph for Dan Harmon. But alas, this victory was bittersweet as word has come out that Dan Harmon has been replaced as Showrunner making us face the possibility Community will never be the same. In addition, this issue of being fearful for the future flooded into our discussions on Bones and Supernatural as both Finales left us disappointed. Again, the future looks a little brighter for Supernatural as Sera Gamble the Showrunner who diminished the show's quality during Season Six is now gone. Although, Bones on the other hand, there Finale could have been the best episode of the series, if it wasn't marred by the second half of this season jumping the shark, leaving the question on if we are going to continue covering Bones in the Fall as our ATA Season Finale cliffhanger. By the way with our favorite live-action shows now on hiatus, we are going to be taking a two-week hiatus to further develop the Across The Airwaves Website and plan out our summer programming but Michael’s show ATA Retro Reviews will be continuing as well as DC Nation until those cartoon series go on hiatus. Also keep an eye out for our return episode featuring our favorite comedic moments from the Modern Family Season Finale and a discussion on  Nickelodeon's new Avatar Series, The Legend of Korra.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA 84 is titled “Adrenaline” since it's the best way to describe our favorite Season Finale of the year, the Person of Interest episode “Firewall”. We also review Modern Family along with the Finales for Once upon a Time, Bones, Community & Super

item.title: ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews 26 - A Star Spangled Memorial Day
item.description: Good morning, good morning, good morning to you! GOOD MORNING VIETNAM!!!!! In the words of Supernatural's version of Satan, and welcome to another episode of ATA's Retro Reviews! I am you host Michael J. Petty and with me is my co-host >Woo S. Kim, how's it going everybody?< (NOTE: Translated from Klingon). Wait... This is NOT the episode of RR here... This is the description! Silly me! Well, on this week's Retro Review, Woo and I cover the Smallville episodes Patriot (which we did a live show on back last year...), Beacon, and the Season 11 premiere (well, the 4th part of it...) Guardian! So, thanks for joining us, and Avengers Assemble!!! Dedicated to our friend James Hansson.
item.itunes:subtitle: The 26th episode of Across the Airwaves' Retro Reviews, featuring Michael J. Petty and Woo S. Kim!

item.title: ATA DC Nation Week 11 (Enhanced) “Scaring Michael is what Black Manta's For...”
item.description: On this edition of ATA's DC Nation Section, we investigate what Black Manta is for, which is scaring Michael as he faces his worst nightmare, the knowledge that there is now not just one but two Black Mantas out there terrorizing the high seas and possibly the swimming pool in my infamous cohost's backyard.  (Good luck sleeping tonight Michael, mmmwahahahahahaha!) Anyway, the identity of this second Black Manta was a shocker to all of us here on ATA, so join us as we discuss this unbelievable revelation that occurred during this week's Young Justice Invasion entitled “Alienated” and review the Green Lantern: The Animated Series episode “Flight Club“.
