Also as always we talk about the week's new DC Nation and resume our conversations on the Smallville Season 11 Comic Books with the release of Guardian Chapter 4. In addition, we round everything out for this episode with Michael sharing some news about upcoming Young Justice and Green Lantern: The Animated Series DVD releases, more insight on the Young Justice Legacy Videogame and the exciting announcement that The CW has picked up Arrow for the Fall 2012 TV Season.
item.itunes:subtitle: On Week 11 of ATA DC Nation we discovered scaring Michael is what Black Manta's for as we reviewed the Green Lantern: TAS episode “Flight Club”, three new DC Nation Shorts, the Young Justice Invasion episode “Alienated” and more Smallville Season

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 83 (Enhanced) “Love Is a Battlefield”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, on this week's episode we learned that love is a Battlefield as the shows we discussed or gave our favorite comedic moments from in terms of the sitcoms including Once upon a Time, Castle, Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Community, Person of Interest, Fringe and Supernatural all dealt with many of our favorite characters having to face incredible hardship or making hard sacrifices to understand just how important they are to the ones they love.
item.itunes:subtitle: On this week's ATA we learned that love is a battlefield with our discussions on Once upon a Time, Castle, Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Community, Person of Interest, Fringe and Supernatural.

item.title: ATA DC Nation – Week 10 (Enhanced) “Breaking Up Is Hard to Do”
item.description: On this week's ATA DC Nation, our discussion seemed to teach us the hard way, breaking up is hard to do as Ganthet was banished by The Guardians in the Green Lantern: The Animated Series episode “Regime Change” and the Young Justice Invasion episode “Earthlings” answered the burning question that has sent the Internet buzzing of why Miss Martian and Superboy broke up. Shockingly, this topic almost caused a breakup between Michael and myself as fellow  podcast hosts as we disagreed on Superboy's reasoning for causing the breakup with Megan. Michael thought it was because of Superboy's inability to age and I thought it was because Connor didn't like how Megan was just going around lobotomizing people without thinking of the consequences but then there was BLACK MANTA!!!  Again, Black Manta really wasn't important to this episode except for appearing in the Animal Man Short and he for sure as nothing to do with breakups but I had to mention the Aquaman villain anyway since it's hilarious how Michael is afraid of him. On that note, if you enjoyed this episode of ATA's DC Nation be sure to show your support for our show by posting the hashtag #blackmanta on our ATA Twitter Page @AcrossAirwaves, Google Plus Page and Michael's personal Twitter @MJPetty7.
item.itunes:subtitle: It's Week 10 of ATA DC Nation where we learned breaking up is hard to do with discussions on the Green Lantern: TAS episode “Regime Change”, the Young Justice Invasion episode “Earthlings”, more of DC Nation at WonderCon & two new Animal Man Short

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 82 (Enhanced) “We Are TV Families”
item.description: Hi ATA Listeners, first off apologies about the delay in the release of this podcast, I had a nasty case of food poisoning that put me out of commission for a few days. Anyway, due to things being somewhat behind schedule, I'm going to make my synopsis for this episode short and sweet by saying that this week's set of reviews all seemed to deal with the characters on our favorite shows such as Once upon a Time, Bones, Castle, Person of Interest, Fringe and Supernatural  working out some sort of issue with their real or surrogate families. Even the sitcoms dealt with family drama as Howard on The Big Bang Theory had to push back his wedding for going into space, Modern Family obviously dealt with a family issue and on Community, the family of students at Greendale had to say goodbye to one of their own.
item.itunes:subtitle: On ATA 82, it's all in the family as our reviews deal with the characters on Once upon a Time, Bones, Castle, Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Community, Person of Interest, Fringe and Supernatural working out issues with their real or surrogate families.

item.title: ATA DC Nation – Week 9 (Enhanced) “The Invasion Has Just Begun”
item.description: On this week's ATA DC Nation, we are being invaded as we review the Green Lantern: The Animated Series episode “In Love and War” and the highly anticipated premiere of Young Justice: Invasion entitled “Happy New Year” as well as this week's DC Nation Shorts; Mad Presents Teen Titanic and the Super Best Friends Forever in “Grounded”. Also with the release of the next Smallville Season 11 Digital Comic postponed, we took time to discuss the newest trailer for The Dark Knight Rises featuring more footage of Anne Hathaway as Catwoman.
item.itunes:subtitle: It's Week 9 of ATA DC Nation reviewing the Green Lantern: TAS episode “In Love and War” and the Young Justice: Invasion Premiere “Happy New Year” as well as this week's DC Nation Shorts. Also we discuss the newest trailer for The Dark Knight Rises

item.title: ATA's Scooby-Doo Retro Reviews 26 - Sha'ggy!!!
item.description: Hey gang, and welcome back to the one show on the ATA Network that includes both Mr. Thor-voice AND Wooton Kim! On this highly anticipated episode of Retro Reviews, Woo and I cover one of the greatest franchises in all of television, cartoons, and the entertainment industry: SCOOBY-DOO! In this episode, after brief Smallville, Chuck, and Supernatural discussion, we talk about Scooby-Doo! Where Are You?, The New Scooby-Doo Movies, The 13 Ghosts of Scooby-Doo, A Pup Named Scooby-Doo, the two (good) Scooby-Doo films, Scooby-Doo and The Reluctant Werewolf, Scooby-Doo on Zombie Island, and Shaggy! I also try really hard to convince Woo to watch the current Scooby-Doo! Mystery Incorporated series on Cartoon Network (send him a tweet to help me out!!!!) But don't think that we only talk about our favorite animated pooch, Woo and I also have an in-depth discussion about the Cartoon Network and cartoons/children's television of today! That is almost worth listening to us for 2 hours! So, strap into the Mystery Machine, grab a hand-full of Scooby-Snacks, and scream for Sha'ggy, because this will be one big mystery, that only we can solve!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 26 episode of Across the Airwaves' Retro Reviews Podcast featuring Michael J. Petty and Woo S. Kim!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 81 (Enhanced) “Walking on Sunshine”
item.itunes:subtitle: On this week's ATA we're walking on sunshine as we review new episodes of Once upon a Time, Bones, Person of Interest, Fringe and Supernatural as well as reveal our favorite comedic moments from The Big Bang Theory and Community.

item.title: ATA DC Nation – Week 8 (Enhanced) “What Kilowog and the Justice League Have Done”
item.description: On this week's ATA DC Nation section our discussion is all about the heroes of the DC Universe facing the consequences of what they've done under the influence of mind control or super villainy as this week's Green Lantern The Animated Series “Fear Itself” episode dealt with Kilowog turning on Hal and this week's Young Justice entitled  “Auld Acquaintance” had a Starro controlled Justice League turn on Aqualad and his team.  Even the heroes in this week's shorts had to face the results of their actions as Plastic Man turned on the TV itself and Robin in the course of defeating Mad Mod took The New Teen Titans to the future. Meanwhile in the Smallville Season 11 department,  things were good between Clark and Oliver as they performed a solid superhero team up but Chloe realized she might be making a mistake on the decision to move away from the Watchtower in Metropolis as a mysterious spacecraft, which Michael and I share a few crackpot theories about in this episode heads towards Earth.
item.itunes:subtitle: It's Week 8 of ATA DC Nation reviewing the Green Lantern: TAS episode “Fear Itself” and the Young Justice episode “Auld Acquaintance” as well as new Plastic Man and The New Teen Titans Shorts. We also discuss the next Smallville Season 11 Comic I

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 80 (Enhanced) “Let's do the Time Warp Again!”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, let's do the time warp again as this week's slate of reviews took us from past, present, future and beyond in a way that would make the Doctor and the TARDIS proud. Basically, our time warp started out taking us to the past where and this week's Bones made us wish for better days when the show's  writing was stronger and Castle caused us to relieve the time were Firefly was on the air with a reunion between Nathan Filion and Adam Baldwin. Then Phil trying to give his daughter the best day ever on Modern Family caused us to take a quick stop in the present followed by us going a little bit of everywhere as this week's Community intelligently spoofed on Doctor Who. From here it was welcome to the future as this week's episodes of Fringe and Legend of Korra dealt with the descendents of heroic characters that we love trying to instill their parent's visions upon worlds threatened by evil. And lastly we round out our exploration of space and time in the great beyond as Supernatural gave us a story about Bobby being a ghost in training. So with that pull out your TARDIS key and unlock the sounds of this podcast because it contains an adventure that makes your iPod look bigger on the inside.
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's do the time warp again as this week's reviews of Bones, Castle, Modern Family, Community, Fringe, Supernatural and Legend of Korra takes us on an adventure through past, present, future and the great beyond.

item.title: ATA DC Nation – Week 7 (Enhanced) “Traitors”
item.description: This weeks DC Nation episode is called traitors for a few reasons. 1. Because Razor betrays Hal, Kilowa g, and Aya to go and kill Atrocitus in Green Lantern. 2. Because Red Arrow is revealed to be the mole in Young Justice. and 3. Because of a shocking conclusion to the latest episode of Smallville Season 11. So, are you ready for some crackpot theories on upcoming Green Lantern and Smallville episodes? Thought so! Are you ready for Dan's thoughts on the (already aired) Young Justice finale? Bout time! And are you ready for some good discussion on the latest DC Nation Shorts? Damn straight! Alright, so, without anymore stalling, Week 7 of DC Nation!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: It's Week 7 of ATA DC Nation reviewing the Green Lantern: TAS episode “Reckoning” and the Young Justice episode “Usual Suspects” as well as the DC Nation Shorts, DC Nation Mythbusters, Mad Presents: Green Care Bear and DC's World's Funniest #4.

item.title: ATA's Retro Reviews 25 - Welcome to Randomville!!!
item.description: Hey guys, welcome back to a little town called Randomville. Population: US! (us not U.S. as in A) Anyway, on that note, Woo and I had nothing in particular to talk about on a Saturday night, so we decided to just do a Geek Out Loud style podcast and go wherever the airwaves take us (see what I did there?). And guess what?.... IT WORKED!!! We talk about a bunch of things, like Smallville, Chuck, Glee (ugh!), Smallville Season 11, theories about the Ghost-Tess, cancelled shows, Supernatural, and more! Also, trying to convince Woo to do a Scooby-Doo themed episode like our Power Rangers one, so if anyone wants that, PLEASE message him @WSK9002 on twitter or buy ANY other means necessary... Good luck!
item.itunes:subtitle: The landmark 25th episode of Across the Airwaves' Retro Reviews, hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S. Kim!

item.title: ATA's Road to The Avengers - Captain America: The First Avenger
item.description: Hello Avengers! Welcome back to Across the Airwaves' Road to The Avengers commentary campaign! If you're here for the first time, check out our commentaries on Iron Man, The Incredible Hulk, Iron Man 2, and Thor! They're all just as fun. However, in my honest opinion, I think that our commentary about Marvel's First Avenger (see what I did there?) is our best one yet. So, without further adu, I am proud to present ATA's finale Road to The Avengers commentary on CAPTAIN AMERICA: THE FIRST AVENGER!
item.itunes:subtitle: The final installment of ATA's Road to The Avengers, hosted by Dan Schmidt and Michael J. Petty, on Captain America: The First Avenger!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 79 (Enhanced) “Meet Korra, The New Avatar”
item.description: Earth. Fire. Air. Water. When this podcast was in its infancy we discussed the story of how Avatar Aang and his friends heroically ended the Hundred Year War.  Talking about the achievement of Executive Producers Michael Dante DiMartino and Bryan Konietzko transforming the Television Animation Industry by  combining the styles of Anime and American cartoons into a show where children and adults from all over the world, could enjoy together an epic tale of peace and harmony. They named this great Nickelodeon series Avatar: The Last Airbender. During their time on the air, the adventures of Avatar Aang accomplished many remarkable things. But sadly, after an outstanding series finale and a god-awful live-action movie adaptation his time in this world came to an end. Then like with all strong entertainment franchises, the cycle of the Avatar, began anew." And with that I'm proud to present Across the Airwaves Episode 79 as one of your first chances to meet the new Avatar, Korra as we add Nickelodeon's new series The Legend of Korra to our slate of reviews with our discussion on the highly anticipated one hour World Premiere. Although, that's not all you are going to get with this podcast episode as Nico gives a  rant about how Bones seems to be losing its touch and I discuss how the shocking cliffhanger at the end of the Psych Season Finale might change the character  of Shawn Spencer forever. Oh and did I mention that we've got a bunch of crackpot theories that came out of our discussion on this week's Fringe episode? Also as always we cover our favorite sitcoms, with Nico and I sharing our favorite comedic moments on this week's Modern Family and Community.
item.itunes:subtitle: Meet the new Avatar on this week's ATA as we discuss the world premiere of the Nickelodeon Series, The Legend of Korra as well as new episodes of Bones, Modern Family, the shocking season finale of Psych, Community, Fringe and Supernatural.

item.title: ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews 24 - The De-Evolution of Lex Luthor
item.description: Hello faithful Smallvillians and ATA...ians? I don't really know, but WELCOME BACK!!!! Sorry we've been away so long, it won't happen again (well, not until summer hiatus, and winter hiatus, and spring break of 2013...). On this special come-back episode of Retro Reviews, I, Michael J. Petty, and two of my favorite people to work with, Woo S. Kim (who I host this show with regularly) and Dan Schmidt (who I do weekly reviews on DC Nation/Smallville Season 11 with, check those out here). Anyway, on this episode, Woo, Dan, and I will be talking about the De-Evolution of Smallville's Lex Luthor! But, for the first 15-20 minutes, we talk about Chuck, Supernatural Season 7, Glee, and a host of other things, including Season 11 of Smallville!!! So, I'm sorry it took so long, but we're back, and we're here to stay!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 24th episode of Across the Airwaves' Smallville Retro Reviews hosted Michael J. Petty & Woo S. Kim, with special guest-host Dan Schmidt

item.title: ATA DC Nation – Week 6 (Enhanced) “SEGWAY KILLER!!!”
item.description: Hey guys, and welcome back to ATA's weekly coverage of Cartoon Network and DC Comics newest combination entitled: DC NATION! This week on DC Nation, Dan and I will cover the Green Lantern episode "Lost Planet", the Young Justice episode "Performances", a DC Comics Spotlight on Kilowog, 2 Animal Man shorts, Super Best Friends Forever, and for the first time, part 1 of the Smallville Season 11 episode entitled "Guardian"! This action-packed episode we rant about all things DC Comics, from Gotham Girls, Grant Morrison's Action Comics, Kilowog (of course), and the DCAU to ANIMAL MAN!!!! Also, for the 1st time on ATA, we have a full coverage of Smallville Season 11 #1 brought to you by Dan and myself, in which we got through a page-by-page review of the 1st digital chapter. And don't worry guys, Woo and I will still cover Season 11 on Retro Reviews every month! So, enjoy this episode of our DC Nation podcast, and be sure to check back soon for a special Retro Review comeback! Thanks guys! Also, credits for the "Animal Man" voice, go to my sister Madelynn.
item.itunes:subtitle: It's Week 6 of ATA DC Nation reviewing the Green Lantern: TAS episode “Lost Planet” and the Young Justice episode “Performance” as well as the DC Comics Shorts, Who's Who in the DC Nation, Animal Man and Super Best Friends Forever: Time Waits for

item.title: ATA - Road to The Avengers: Thor
item.description: Hey guys, welcome back to ATA's Road to The Avengers series! On this commentary, we will be covering the Pre-Avengers movie entitled Thor! Covering this movie was so much fun, and we hope you all will enjoy watching this movie with us, even though sometime got screwed up with the audio (sorry about that by the way). So, Walk over to your DVD/Blu-Ray players, put Thor in, and lets join voices in watching the God of Thunder on screen, together!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 4th commentary in Across the Airwaves' podcast event entitled "Road to The Avengers" covering Thor!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 78 (Enhanced) “Nico's Bad Monday”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, with this week's episode I'm proud to say that it contained some great emotional insight from Nico and I as we reviewed this week in television. However, this came at a price as Nico had to suffer through what he thought was a bad Monday night of television based on Castle acting completely out of character of the most recent episode and the birth of Bones' baby being done in a way that made the show a shadow of its once great former self. Again, I attributed these issues to Castle gearing up for an epic season finale and Bones recovering from an insanely long hiatus but from Nico's status he was just not happy, which is fine because as our good friend Bryan Q. Miller says everyone is entitled to their own opinion on a piece of creative work. In fact,  Nico's rant as we'll call it was all in good fun as we both got a good laugh after it was all over with on this actual episode but that does not mean his points didn't have merit behind them.  Plus, compared to Monday, the rest of the week in television went much better for Nico as you will hear in our reviews on   Once upon a Time, Psych, Person of Interest and Fringe as well as our favorite comedic moments from this week's episodes of Breaking In, Big Bang Theory and Community.
item.itunes:subtitle: After suffering through a bad Monday night of television with this week's Castle and Bones listen to how Nico turned his week around with our reviews on Once upon a Time, Breaking In, Psych, Big Bang Theory, Community, Person of Interest and Fringe.

item.title: ATA DC Nation – Week 5 (Enhanced) “Super Powered Love”
item.description: This week on ATA's Marvel Universe section, Dan Schmidt and Michael J. Petty cover the premiere of Ultimate Spider-Man, in which Spidey crosses over into the Young Justice universe of Earth-16 and... Wait! Wrong show. Ahem... Hello, and welcome back to Across the Airwaves' coverage on DC NATION!!!! (NOT Marvel Universe...) This week on DC Nation, we will cover the Green Lantern episode "Heir Apparent", the Young Justice episode "Insecurity" and the DC Nation shorts (DC Nation Mythbusters, New Teen Titans, and Baby Superman)! During this discussion, we talk about the new romance of Aya and Razer (Ayazer), Wally and Artemis (Wartemis?), Roy and Cheshire (Reshire?), Kilowog, Spider-Man, Baby Superman's height, Anime, Beast Boy's racial change in the New 52, and much more on this weeks ATA's DC Nation! Also, this brodcast has been brought to you by the word "kinky"... (listen for more details...)
item.itunes:subtitle: It's Week 5 of ATA DC Nation reviewing the Green Lantern Animated Series episode “Heir Apparent” and the Young Justice episode “Insecurity” as well as the DC Comics Shorts, The New Teen Titans: “Stream of Consciences” and Superman of Tokyo #2.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 77 (Enhanced) “Ridin' The Storm Out”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, on this week's episode we are riding the storm out as we wait for the fallout caused by all the emotion, drama and surprises leading our favorite shows to their season finales. On one side of the spectrum we have Castle and Person of Interest dealing with emotional differences between lead characters and on the other side we've got Once upon a Time, Fringe and Supernatural widening their overarching stories to a whole new perspective  where a character on one of these shows was brought back in a way that we thought was unimaginable. Heck, Community even got in on the storm leading up to season finales as it set up a pillow versus blanket Fort fight between Troy and Abed. As for Breaking In, The Big Bang Theory and Psych, I would classify them as the eye of the storm since they were much calmer on the conflicts this week compared to our other favorites but their episodes were still worth talking about as they covered topics in geekdom Nico and I love like Star Trek and Indiana Jones. So now that we've got the lowdown on this podcast out of the way, it's time to get in your homes and bat down the hatches because  it's the time of year again for season finales meaning only Across The Airwaves can guide you through the storm.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we are ridin' the storm out caused by all the emotion, drama and surprises leading Once upon a Time, Castle, Psych, Person of Interest, Fringe and Supernatural to their season finales. We also talk Breaking In, Big Bang Theory and Community.

item.title: ATA DC Nation – Week 4 (Enhanced) "This Looks Like A Job For...Plastic Man?"
item.description: [Note: Read this paragraph in the Super Friends' announcer voice] In a world of Red Lanterns, mini-wormholes, Plastic Men, a British Superman, and a mean Superboy-clone (whose name is "Match", by the way), you have us: Across the Airwaves' DC Nation section! Hosted by Dan Schmidt & Michael J. Petty (oh, wait, that's me...), is the latest episode (covering the 4th week of DC Nation) of this section. On this weeks episode, Dan and I cover the Green Lantern: The Animated Series episode "Into The Abyss", the Young Justice episode "Agendas", two Plastic Man themed shorts, and another DC's World's Funniest claymation short by the guys at Aardman! Don't worry, we didn't forget our "DC Nation from a Child's Perspective" section, that's in there too, along with some great theories about Young Justice: Invasion, some Plastic Man discussion, and a lot of talk about Kilowog and GL's new chick, Aya! So, don't miss a minute of the latest DC Nation podcast!

item.title: ATA - Road to The Avengers: Iron Man 2
item.description: Hello, and welcome back to Across the Airwaves! For those of you who don't know or maybe have just forgot, currently on ATA, creator/producer/host Dan Schmidt and I (Michael J. Petty) are going through each individual "Pre-Avengers" Marvel movie, leading up to May 4th world premiere of "The Avengers", in the form of commentaries (you know, those things on the Special Features that no one ever clicks on)! We have already commentated on Iron Man and The Incredible Hulk and are now bringing you Iron Man 2! Thor and Captain America: The First Avenger will be on their way, but for now, take a break on a rainy afternoon (actually, any afternoon would be just fine, even morning works!), put in your DVD/Blu-Ray disc of Iron Man 2, and watch it, with us taking to you in your ear... Enjoy!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 3rd commentary in Across the Airwaves' "Road to The Avengers" series on Iron Man 2!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 76 (Enhanced) “All You Need Is Love”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week's episode features reviews of our favorite shows where one of the main characters was in need of some love. Once upon a Time gave us a story where Snow White  in need of a cure to a potion that made her incapable of expressing love, Castle as always was chasing after Beckett,  Breaking In's Cam was in need of a grand romantic gesture to hook up with Melanie and in the Fringeverse Olivia was willing to sacrifice her memories for Peter to be in love with her. However, romantic love wasn't the only thing some characters were looking for as we also got some buddy love as Dean reuniting with Cass allowed them to work out their differences on this week's Supernatural and Psych's Shawn and Gus proved that they can maintain their lifelong best friend chemistry  even though Shawn having his appendix removed delegated him to solving the mystery through an iPad. Plus, on top of that we got some really fun romance between Lassie and his jailbird girlfriend Marlowe. Then again, the only show that might not necessarily fit the theme of this ATA Episode is Community but I guess Jeff's ego got some love as he impersonated Ryan Seacrest or maybe Troy gave Abed some much needed love as he tried to help him with his addiction of hiring celebrity impersonators. Anyway, to find out which one  of these characters  got the love that they needed or are still in search of it, tune into this podcast episode affectionately named after the popular Beatles song All You Need Is Love.
item.itunes:subtitle: On ATA 76, we're reviewing episodes of Once upon a Time, Castle, Breaking In, Psych, Community, Fringe and Supernatural that all deal with a character in need of some love.

item.title: ATA DC Nation – Week 3 (Enhanced) “Is It Razer's Edge or The Razor's Edge?”
item.description: Hey guys, and welcome back to DC Nation! This week on ATA's DC Nation review, Dan and I talk about the 3rd episode of Green Lantern: The Animated Series entitled "Razor's Edge" and the 21st episode of Young Justice entitled "Images". We also talk about this weeks DC Nation Shorts, including the Batmobile feature, the Shazamwich! (in which I will memorize for the next episode), and the new Super Best Friends Forever short. There was a lot of discussion on this episode about a new DC Animated Universe (in which, we believe, Green Lantern takes place), DC Nation's upcoming series for November: Beware the Batman, White Martians, Young Justice Invasion, moles, Beast Boy, and my "Superfriends announcer voice"! We have also added a new section to our DC Nation reviews entitled "A Child's Perspective". In this section, we see DC Nation in the eyes of a 7 (soon to be 8 ) year-old! All this and more on the latest DC Nation!
item.itunes:subtitle: It's Week 3 of ATA DC Nation featuring reviews of the Green Lantern The Animated Series episode “Razer's Edge” and the Young Justice episode “Image” as well as a discussion on the DC Comics Shorts Super Best Friends Forever and MAD Presents – Sh

item.title: Across The Airwaves – An Interview with Bryan Q. Miller (Enhanced)
item.description: Hi everyone, and welcome to Across the Airwaves. For those of you long time fans, and those who have tuned in for this interview, we would like to thank you in advance for viewing our little podcast. A few weeks ago, I (Michael J. Petty) had sent a tweet to DC Comics scribe Bryan Q. Miller (Smallville, Batgirl, Teen Titans) about a potential interview about the upcoming Smallville Season 11. He graciously agreed and with the help of some other Superfriends (thank you Brandy!) podcast host/creator/producer and my close friend, Dan Schmidt, and I got to interview Bryan for, what turned out to be a very inciteful episode of Across the Airwaves, as ATA and Retro Reviews unite for this unprecedented challenge, that only super-friends can face. In any event, we were very humbled that Bryan agreed to the interview and want to publicly thank him for all of his work at DC, as well as the insight he gave us, on and off camera. Now, before we hear our lovely ATA Corps complain that Nico Reifsteck & Woo S. Kim were not in on the interview, do not be alarmed, they are fine, in fact, they sent us some of their questions for Bryan, so they were included. So, on that final note, I will ramble on no longer, I only wish to give to the world, Across the Airwaves' interview with Smallville Season 11 writer: Bryan Q. Miller!
item.itunes:subtitle: Join Michael and Dan as they have a conversation with Bryan Q. Miller about his time working on Smallville and the show's soon to be released Season 11 Comic Book. We also talk about Bryan's run on the DC Comics Batgirl Volume 3 and Teen Titans.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 75 (Enhanced) “The Podcaster I Have Become”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, I know the introduction to this episode says that ATA 75 is all about reviewing all the content that made up this week's DC Nation and our favorite live-action shows that are currently airing new episodes but we discovered that covering both of these sections made this podcast way too long.  So to make keeping up with our show much less daunting for you loyal followers out there, we've decided to separate our reviews of DC Nation, which focus on Green Lantern The Animated Series, Young Justice and DC Comics Animated Shorts into its own separate ATA Podcast Spin–off. In other words, with DC Nation now out of the equation, ATA 75 features Nico joining the party as we review new episodes of Once upon a Time, Psych and Supernatural as well as reveal our favorite comedic moments from Fox's Breaking In, Modern Family and the long-awaited return of Community.
item.itunes:subtitle: With the decision to make our section reviewing all of the content that makes up Cartoon Network's DC Nation into its own separate podcast, ATA 75 features reviews on Once upon a Time, Breaking In, Modern Family, Psych, Community and Supernatural.

item.title: ATA DC Nation – Week 2 (Enhanced) “None of the Robins Ever Complained”
item.description: MEANWHILE AT THE DC NATION! Dan noticed the threat of our Across the Airwaves episodes becoming too long, leaving him with no other choice but to move our new DC Nation section to it's own ATA podcast spin-off!!! And in the biggest team up since the formation of the Superfriends Dan Schmidt and myself (Michael J. Petty) are going to be covering Cartoon Network's DC Nation including Green Lantern: The Animated Series, Young Justice, and all of DC Comics Animated Shorts!  As for this episode, which marks the 2nd week of DC Nation, we cover the Green Lantern episode "Beware My Power: Green Lanterns Light, Part 2" and the Young Justice episode "Coldhearted", as well as the DC Nation Shorts like "New Teen Titans", the DC Demonstration for a Batarang, AND the Japanese Baby Superman! So,what are you waiting for? Dust off your old utility belt, strap on that cape and join us for DC Nation talk every week!

item.title: ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews 23 - AlisaLea's being held Hostage by Checkmate?
item.description: Welcome back, welcome back, welcome back to Across the Airwaves' Smallville Retro Reviews! This time on Retro Reviews, Woo S. Kim and I (Michael J. Petty) are joined by Smallville/Young Justice fan (and occasional podcaster herself) Alisa Lea Gossage! On this episode of ATA's SRR, we discuss the Season 9 episodes Checkmate and Hostage, as well as talking about Clark's destiny as Superman, the banging in Woo's apartment, and a little Young Justice talk as well. So, please join us for this great follow-up-to-JUSTICE episode and check out Dan and I's reviews on DC Nation EVERY WEEK on Across the Airwaves!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 23rd episode of Across the Airwaves' Smallville Retro Reviews hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S. Kim, with special guest-start Alisa Lea Gossage!

item.title: ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews 22 - JUSTICE
item.description: Smallville has changed the lives of millions, and I do not believe that this is an exaggeration, and since this shows creation, I have wanted to talk (on air with Dan Schmidt and Woo Kim) about the episode that changed mine and made me really want to be a hero. This episode is the 121st episode of Smallville, written and directed by SV-scribe Steven S. DeKnight, the 11th episode of season 6, and the 1st episode of Smallville I have ever seen, this is Justice! On this week's special episode of Retro Reviews, ATA creator, host, producer, and my friend Dan Schmidt, my co-host, friend, and sidekick Woo S. Kim, and myself, Michael J. Petty will talk about our experiences with this episode, our reactions to a live-action Justice League, Cyborg replacing Martian Manhunter in the New 52's JLA, and our over-all thoughts on DC Comics, over the past 75 years. This is Michael J. Petty, and if you're listening to this, you are the resistance!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 22nd episode of Across the Airwaves' Smallville Retro Reviews, hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S. Kim, with special guest-host Dan Schmidt!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 74 (Enhanced) “We've Got DC Nation's Back”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, if you haven't caught on already it's pretty obvious that we are all about superheroes and with that thought in mind, I'm proud to present Across The Airwaves as the first premiere podcast source to cover Cartoon Network's new Saturday morning lineup entitled DC Nation! And when I say that we're covering DC Nation, I'm not just talking about more Young Justice reviews, I'm talking about an entire section reviewing the entire programming block dedicated to the characters of DC Comics from episodes of Young Justice and Green Lantern The Animated Series to the animated shorts and superhero mythbuster clips that test out real-life versions of comic book objects such as Green Arrow's Boxing Glove Arrow. Plus to sweeten the pot, this new DC Nation  section will be joined by another superhero expert here at ATA (next to myself) Smallville Retro Reviews' host Michael J. Petty. However, for those of you worried that Michael joining us means Nico will not be a part of this week's episode, WE'VE GOT YOUR BACK as he joins the party for our extended section dedicated to the return of Fox's Breaking In where we reveal our favorite comedic moments from the episode and discuss many of the changes that were made for Season 2. Also as always Nico provides us with his very informative news section and together we review new episodes of Once upon a Time, Psych and Person of Interest as well as give our favorite comedic moments from The Big Bang Theory.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA becomes the first podcast source for DC Nation reviewing Green Lantern, Young Justice & animated shorts apart of Cartoon Network's line up. Plus we review the return of Fox's Breaking In, Once upon a Time, Psych, Big Bang Theory & Person of Interest.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 73 (Enhanced) “Raiders of the Shortened Podcast”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week Nico and I are making things up as we go while we run from a giant boulder, breakout of a tomb filled with snakes (SNAKES! I HATE SNAKES!) and sneak aboard a submarine all to find the lost Ark of the Covenant before the Nazis. Actually, we are not going after  the infamous radio for speaking to God that can melt a bad guys face off, we're just recording a podcast featuring reviews on a new episode of Castle and the Midseason Premiere of Psych as well as our favorite comedic moments from this week's Modern Family. However, since Psych had an Indiana Jones themed episode we decided to apply the same adventurous theme to ATA 73, so grab your Fedora, crack that bullwhip and click the link below for a somewhat shorter but satisfying podcast  which captures the spirit of adventure.
item.itunes:subtitle: With Midseason Premiere of Psych being an Indiana Jones themed episode we decided to apply the same adventurous theme to ATA 73 through our reviews on Castle, Psych and our favorite comedic moments from this week's Modern Family.

item.title: ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews 21 - An Avenging Review of Superman, Leviathans, and JLA: Doom!
item.description: Hello Retro Reviews Junkies, and welcome back to ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews! I, your host and "professional" podcasting singer, Michael J. Petty would like to personally thank all of you for sticking with us for 21 episodes + our Power Rangers Special (23 if you count "Zod's Tanksgiving" twice!) as would my Dick Grayson to my Bruce Wayne aka Woo S. Kim! Anyways! It's a Brand New Day, and the sun is high, all the birds are singing cause we're back in action! This episode, Woo and I cover the newest The Avengers trailer in exclusive detail, as well as talk about Justice League: Doom (which just came out last week) which lead into some DC Comics talk. BUT! The main theme of this episode, as always, is Smallville in the form of our discussion on Bryan Q. Miller's Smallville: Season 11, coming to the Internet next month and to your local comic book stores this May! Shout out to St. Charles' Graham Cracker Comics in Kane County, Illinois (which I visit (almost) very/other week). After this, yes, there's MORE, we cover this first half (give or take a few episodes) of Supernatural's Seventh Season! Including the death of Bobby and Cas (NOT in that order!), Season 8 predictions, Lucifer, and the Leviathans! So, thanks guys for tuning into this episode, which, before fading out with the sounds of Michael J. Petty and Air Supply, has a few "special" surprises. So, enjoy!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 21st episode of Across the Airwaves' Smallville Retro Reviews hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S! Kim.

item.title: ATA - Road to Avengers: The Incredible Hulk
item.description: Hello loyal Marvelites and welcome back to Across the Airwaves' Road to The Avengers! This time on our podcast, ATA executive-producer and host Dan Schmidt and Retro Reviews' host Michael J. Petty dive into full commentary and discussion on the 2nd Marvel Studios film: The Incredible Hulk! As you'll hear on the recording, this movie brings out so much discussion for Dan & Michael, that they start talking about Ang Lee's Hulk, The Lonely Man, Red Hulk, Captain America, The Avengers, The Leader, Hulk comics, super hero movies, David Banner, Lou Ferrigno, Supernatural, and much much more! So, put in your The Incredible Hulk Blu-Ray/DVD and sync up our audio with your, because this HULK PODCAST will be smasherific! Assemble!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 2nd episode of ATA's Road to Avengers mini-commentary series featuring Dan Schmidt and Michael J. Petty as they commentate on: The Incredible Hulk!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 72 (Enhanced) ”Villains”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, you know how villains are characters that we love to hate because we despise the fact that they can stay one step ahead of the hero but  love it when they force that same hero to reach new heights by setting up a search for their long-lost father or forcing them to unlock a hidden telepathic ability? Well, this week on television it seemed that every villain in the book raised their ugly head as the evil Mayor took steps to destroy a romance on Once upon a Time, Castle contended with a betrayal from someone he trusted, Alcatraz unleashed an inmate who tried to gas an entire subway train and that damn sneaky Elias from Person of Interest proved that even Wall Street isn't safe from his criminal empire. However, the title of most dastardly villain for the week would have to go to Fringe's David Robert Jones as he proved that he is capable of things much more sinister than kidnapping blonde female FBI Agent's out of weird places like gas station bathrooms. On that note, our sitcoms didn't even escape acts of villainy as Howard on The Big Bang Theory had a fateful encounter with a crazed armadillo and Modern Family featured Luke setting up a vile trap to bring Lilly down. Again, with all this talk about villains you're probably scared that bad guys will be coming after you while listening to this podcast but don't worry Nico and I will ease your fears as we give you reviews on the  emergence of villains that seemed to occur during this week in television. Plus to make you feel even better we will even throw in an extended discussion on Fringe because yes, the episode was that great.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's episode is all about those characters we love to hate, villains as we review episodes of Once upon a Time, Castle, Alcatraz, Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest & Fringe where evil reared its ugly head.

item.title: ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews 20 - Whitney's Tempest
item.description:
Hello fellow Meteor Freaks, Smallvillians, Crows, and Kryptonians and welcome to Across the Airwaves' Smallville Retro Reviews Episode 20, "Whitney's Tempest"! Throughtout this episode, Woo and I talk about the Season 1 finale "Tempest" and the Season 2 episode "Visage" while making references to Supernatural, The Big Bang Theory, James Hansson, and more! So, enjoy our talks on Tempest, Visage, Whitney Fordman, Supernatural, Dan Schmidt, Season 11, The Phantom Menace, 3-d, Action Comics #1, Dective Comics #27, A-Ha!, and much much more on the latest SRR!
P.S. Jeffster! lives!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 20th episode of Across the Airwaves' Smallville Retro Reviews hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S! Kim

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 71 (Enhanced) ”International Podcast of Mystery”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, get ready to enter the world of espionage as this week's Castle having our favorite mystery writer go all Secret Agent Man while teaming up with his ex CIA girlfriend inspired us to give you a spy themed podcast. And through connecting the dots with all of this week's airings of our favorite shows we realized that they each contained an aspect of a secret agent's life with Once upon a Time's Mayor reminding us that behind a pretty face can lie an evil mind and Alcatraz telling us that with a mad bomber around every move you make, another chance you take because odds are with the CIA using drug dealers to finance the war on terror, Person of Interest's Reese may not see tomorrow. Yes, I think you know what classic television theme I'm going for but how I'm going to fit Big Bang Theory and Modern Family into it, is beyond me unless a very ugly painting or a drunken Claire wanting to have Cam and Mitchell's baby has something to do with a mad man's evil plot to rule the world like David Robert Jones kidnapping Olivia out of a gas station bathroom on this week's Fringe. However, on Supernatural that pesky Satan inside of Sam's head seems to be up to something dastardly, which inspired an e-mail from ATA's own international man of mystery Michael J. Petty about the future and possible Series Finale for the show. So now that you have your objectives, your mission if you choose to accept it, is to listen to this podcast before it self-destructs in 5 seconds (just kidding), but remember to do it at your own risk because if you or any of your team members are captured or killed, the government will disavow all knowledge of your actions.
item.itunes:subtitle: Enter the world of espionage as Castle going all Secret Agent Man to team up with his CIA ex-girlfriend inspired us to give you spy themed reviews on Once upon a Time, Alcatraz, Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest, Fringe & Supernatural.

item.title: Across The Airwaves' Road to the Avengers: Iron Man
item.description: Hello ATA fans new and old, old or young, human or... well, Asguardian? Kryptonian? Hulk? I don't know! Welcome to Across the Airwaves' newest spin-off, entitled, Road to the Avengers!  This podcast miniseries is our first attempt at commentating on some of our favorite movies, and what better movie to start off with than "Iron Man"! Iron Man was the 1st of many movies that Marvel Studios was behind to be apart of a "bigger universe", aka the Avengers Universe. In honor of may 4th's release of "The Avengers", we here at ATA, well, mainly Dan and myself, started the "Road to Avengers" campaign! This campaign will start with Iron Man and end with Captain America: The First Avenger, all before the release of Marvel's The Avengers. So, since this is the first ever Road to the Avengers Podcast we just ask that you sit back, relax, put in Iron Man, and enjoy the film with us as we talk about it while watching. So, get ready, because some heroes are born, some are made, and others are built! Stay tuned for the next Road to the Avengers Podcast:The Incredible Hulk!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 1st episode ATACommentary2's "Road to Avengers" series, featuring Iron Man!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 70 (Enhanced) ”ATA Noire”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, in response to Castle's recent Noir episode and this being our 70th show we're turning back the clock about 70 years to give you a Noir themed podcast complete with a 1940's style intro and closing. Plus our Castle section even features a special guest from the days of femme fatales and Maltese Falcons, the daring, ever elusive gumshoe, Dan Schmidt Private Eye. As for the rest of the podcast, we reveal our favorite commercials from Super Bowl XLVI while continuing to fight our way through the on-again off-again nature of the Spring Television Season with reviews on Alcatraz, Person of Interest, Fringe and Supernatural as well as our favorite comedic moments from the week's episodes of Modern Family and The Big Bang Theory.
item.itunes:subtitle: In response to Castle's Noir episode, we're turning back the clock 70 years to make ATA 70 a Noir themed podcast reviewing not just Castle but the week's episodes of Alcatraz, Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Person of Interest, Fringe & Supernatural.

item.title: ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews 19 - Lex Luthor For President!
item.description: Judging from the headline, this must be our Presidents Day special feat. Michael J. Petty & Woo Kim! On this weeks episode, MJPETTY7 and WSK9002 discuss the two Smallville episodes which feature Lex Luthor as the President of the United States of America! I know, scary right? Well, it actually happened in both Smallville's future AND the DC Comics! (Check out the story "Superman/Batman: Public Enemies" to find out how Lex was impeached) So, after covering the episodes 1x6 Hourglass and 7x18 Apocalypse, the Dynamic Duo tackle more news on the CW's new (potential) super hero series: Arrow! All this and more on the latest episode of Across the Airwaves: Retro Reviews!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 19th episode of Across the Airwaves' Smallville Retro Reviews, hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S! Kim!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 69 (Enhanced) ”Once upon a Podcast”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, first off I'd like to thank all of you who either hyped up or joined us for our Chuck Finale Live Show otherwise known as Chuck Versus The ATA Live Show, it was really great to get the opportunity to converse with people who actually listen to our show. Unfortunately, due to the event itself along with all the preparation that went into it, we got behind schedule on our regular ATA podcasts. The good news is Nico and I are right on top of this issue working tirelessly to release a barrage of podcast episodes that will get our reviews caught up with the new television you are currently watching. On that note, our oncoming storm of podcasts begins with this one, ATA 68, a fairytale themed episode adding ABC's Once upon a Time to our slate of reviews with an extended section that gets those of you who may have not seen the show caught up to speed.  At the same time, we continue tracking the development of the other addition to our slate of reviews the new Fox Series Alcatraz and review our old favorites such as Person of Interest, Fringe and Supernatural.  Also what would an Across The Airwaves Episode be without our favorite comedic moments from the always laugh out loud hilarious Big Bang Theory.  So if you're sitting at home, bored with nothing to do or just simply missing Chuck give this podcast a listen because you might just find some new shows to get into with Once upon a Time and Alcatraz.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA 69 is a fairytale themed episode inaugurating ABC's Once upon a Time into our slate of reviews. Also, we continue to track the progress of Fox's Alcatraz as well as review new episodes of Person of Interest, Big Bang Theory, Fringe & Supernatural.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 68 (Enhanced) ”Nico Versus the Chuck Finale”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, have you ever had those moments in your life where it feels like everything is going your way? Well, that's what happened with Nico and I recording this podcast because we ended up with one of our best episodes ever.  Don't get me wrong, there was still editing that needed to be done,  but in terms of emotions we were running on full cylinders by giving you some good old fashion drama as this week's Castle prompted Nico to get up on  his soapbox to make an intelligent argument about how reality shows are making people stupid one episode at a time and  watching the third episode of  Fox's new series Alcatraz caused me to express a serious concern about there not being any more original ideas out there for a sci-fi/fantasy TV Series. However, just because Nico and I got a little opinionated  doesn't mean we didn't have any fun with this podcast as we took a breather to discuss our favorite comedic moments from an outstanding 101st episode of The Big Bang Theory and threw around some pretty wild crackpot theories during our discussion about Fringe. Then from here we went into what I call the main event as Nico who unfortunately was not able to join us for Chuck Versus The ATA Live Show was given the floor to give his thoughts on the Chuck Series Finale with a heartfelt sendoff for the little show that could that was worthy of the podcast equivalent to an Academy award. I've known Nico for a very long time and  next to the MDA Summer Camp that we used to attend, saying goodbye to Chuck is the only other thing that I've ever seen him get this passionate about so get ready to bring out the Kleenex if you are a hard-core Chuck fan. Although, the good news is for those of you who might be a little bit apprehensive of listening to this podcast due to the emotion, Nico ends things on a  positively optimistic note as he reminds all of us Nerd Herders that we have not heard the last of Chuck Bartkowski and the Buy More. So please drop whatever you're doing and listen to this podcast because it's one of ATA's best by simply giving you some serious closure to Chuck coming to an end especially if you were somewhat upset by the ending.
item.itunes:subtitle: On ATA 68, Nico and I review the week's new episodes of Castle, Alcatraz and Fringe along with revealing our favorite moments from The Big Bang Theory. However, most importantly Nico gives a heartfelt sendoff to Chuck worthy of an Academy award.

item.title: ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews 18 - The Amazing Avenging Season 11!
item.description: Hello ATACorps, MARVELites, Nolanites, Whedonites, DC Comics gurus, and Smallvillians and welcome to Across the Airwaves: Smallville Retro Reviews, Episode 18! On todays podcast episode, Woo and I (Michael J. Petty) talk about the newest trailers for "The Amazing Spider-Man" and "The Avengers" as well as the recently announced "Smallville: Season 11" comic written by ATA fan favorite: Bryan Q. Miller! Yay! We also discuss modern geek/nerd fandom, Arrow, Supernatural, a little Star Wars, and we decided to leave the mics on for a few extra minutes to get our feelings out. So, basically, this was our "break" episode. So, grab your coffee, strap yourself in, and let's go for a ride!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 18th episode of Across the Airwaves' "Smallville" Retro Reviews, hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo Kim!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Chuck Versus The ATA Live Show (Enhanced)
item.description: Over the years there has been many characters on Television that I've loved but there isn't one that I admire as much as Chuck Bartkowski. In the world that he exists in most people just see him as a lowly Buy More employee, you know the guy that you call when there's a computer emergency.  Then again, to  the people that are closest to him and us as the audience Chuck is a goofball nerd, a hapless romantic, a heroic spy but most importantly Charles Irving Bartkowski always knew how to help those in need by just emanating this internal optimism that had a habit of reminding us no matter how hopeless things appear to be, they can turn out to be okay in the end. In fact, I'd like to think Chuck created a movement in the real world that inspired fans to live life with his eternal optimism as we tirelessly went out to buy our 3-D glasses, order Subway sandwiches and join in on a flash mobs all to overcome the hopeless situation of NBC canceling Chuck but somehow like with the experiences of the show's title character things turned out to be okay as the show did the impossible of being renewed not just once but twice, something that has never occurred in the history of television. And  you   want to know why we kept wanting more Chuck? It's because he almost acted  as an IT repair man of our personal lives giving us the instructions on how to overcome our shortcomings and failures by just simply being positive with everything we do. Now, after five seasons of fun adventures our intersect training wheels have been taken off as Chuck has come to an end with the Buy More's automatic doors closing before we really got to see things between our hero and the love of his life, Sarah were going to be okay but as a reviewer on Small Screen Scoop.com put it best you don't need someone to tell you that Chuck and Sarah will be okay, because you just know it. Again, there's people out there who were absolutely infuriated by the open ended nature of this ending but ultimately what the Executive Producers  were going for is giving us that last piece of vital advice before sending us into a world without Chuck. In other words, Fedak and Schwartz not allowing us to see  Chuck's future  but leaving us with the assumption that it will be okay is there way of telling us how to live our own unseen future, with eternal optimism or else we will end up like that fun killer Daniel Shaw. On that note, we here at ATA full well understand that living your life with constant eternal optimism is not easy to do especially with one of their favorite shows from going off the air so to keep you from running around screaming pineapple, we decided to have an event called Chuck Versus the ATA Live Show to act as a final tribute to the little show that could, which played a part in the creation of our podcast. However, this chance to say goodbye extended beyond myself and Smallville Retro Reviews' host Michael J. Petty as we got some of you listeners out there to join in on reminiscing about the great times we had watching Chuck from the pulse pounding action to the Jeffster performances and the heartwarming moments. Although, for those of you who didn't make it to join us after the airing of the Chuck Finale we proudly present to you a rerecording of Chuck Versus The ATA Live Show...
item.itunes:subtitle: Here's a rerecording of Across The Airwaves last final sendoff for NBC's Chuck entitled Chuck Versus ATA Live Show for those of you who weren't able to join us after the Series Finale.
