item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 67 (Enhanced) ”It All Started with a Big Bang”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week marks the beginning of Fox's Alcatraz being added to our slate of reviews and let's just say that it all started with a big bang because this episode is dedicated to celebrating the 100th Episode of The Big Bang Theory. So to make this an extra special bazinga Nico and I decided to give you an extended Big Bang Theory section featuring not just our favorite comedic moments from the 100th Episode but our thoughts on the big twist that occurred with Penny and Leonard's relationship at the end of the episode as well as our favorite comedic moments from all 100 Episodes of The Big Bang Theory. Also the fun doesn't stop there as ATA 67 has reviews on an extremely thrilling episode of Castle, Person of Interest, Chuck, the return of an old enemy on Fringe and our favorite comedic moments from a bleeping new episode Modern Family.  By the way just so there isn't any confusion, the review on Chuck in this episode is the same as what was featured on last week's ATA Episode 67 Sneak Preview.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's episode celebrates the 100th Episode of The Big Bang Theory with an extended section on the show but the fun doesn't stop here as we also have reviews on Castle, the pilot for Alcatraz, Modern Family, Chuck, Person of Interest and Fringe.

item.title: ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews 16 - Ryan James
item.description: Hello and welcome to Across the Airwaves' Smallville Retro Reviews segment, dedicated to giving weekly reviews on classic Smallville episodes hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S. Kim! This week, Michael and Woo reviewed the "Ryan James" themed episodes of Smallville: 1x16 Stray and 2x08 Ryan! They also discuss the Chuck series finale "Chuck vs The Goodbye", news on the movie "The Muppets", and much much more! Let the Civil War begin! P.S. Vote for Captain America!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 16th episode of Across the Airwaves' Retro Reviews hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo Kim!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 67 Sneak Preview (Enhanced) ”Chuck Versus the Bullet Train”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, it's Dan here. Right now, I am in the progress of editing Across the Airwaves Episode 67 for your listening pleasure. However, with the Chuck Series Finale and our Live Show this Friday, I'm going to give you Listeners a sneak preview of ATA Episode 67 featuring our review on the penultimate episode of Chuck entitled Chuck Versus The Bullet Train so all of you will be caught up on Nico and my thoughts about Chuck as we head into the finale.  Also included in this preview episode is a message from our friends at Legendary Women Inc. and Sweet the Smallville forum dedicated to Clark Kent and Lana Lang regarding their charity event raising money for the Christopher and Dana Reeve Foundation. By the way, don’t forget to join us this Friday, January 27 for our Chuck Finale Live Show (Chuck Versus The ATA Live Show) at 10:15/9:15c on our UStream page.
item.itunes:subtitle: Here's a sneak preview of Across The Airwaves Episode 67 featuring our discussion on Chuck Versus the Bullet Train to get you caught up on Dan and Nico's reviews before the Chuck Series Finale and our Live Show.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 66 (Enhanced) ”Don't Go Breaking My Heart”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week's episode is entitled Don't Go Breaking My Heart because Cam and Mitchell sang the actual song on the Modern Family and we don't want Fox to go breaking our hearts over their recent stunning announcements.  The first being Fox calling Fringe a money pit that has put Season 5 in doubt and second the network setting the release of new Bones episodes to an undetermined date following the airing of the new American Idol season. However, despite this awful double whammy that sent us reeling, we did have something to be excited about on this ATA Episode an e-mail from ATA Supporter Jason Andorfer that made it into our review section for Person of Interest. Also this week we have some great discussions on Castle, an episode of Bones that was one of the series' best, Person of Interest, the third to final episode of Chuck, Fringe and a fun throwback to The Untouchables on Supernatural. Oh, and let's not forget our favorite comedic moments from this week's episodes of The Big Bang Theory and Modern Family. By the way, don't forget to join us this Friday, January 27 for our Chuck Finale Live Show (Chuck Versus The ATA Live Show) at 10:15/9:15c on our UStream page.
item.itunes:subtitle: This ATA is titled after Cam and Mitchell's musical number on Modern Family and us not wanting Fox to go breaking our hearts over their announcements about Bones & Fringe. Also we discuss Castle, Person of Interest, Big Bang Theory, Chuck & Supernatural.

item.title: ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews Episode 15 - Exile & Phoenix
item.description: Hey guys! For our landmark 15th episode, Woo and I decided to continue where we left our last episode off, the Season 2 finale Exodus. We return with the Season 3 premiere and second episodes Exile and Phoenix! These episodes go hand-in-hand and relate much to our previous episode. We also reveal some new news about DC Comics logo, George Lucas, and the CW's Green Arrow series "Arrow". So, join us again next week for our episode on two of my most favorite Smallville episodes, Stray and Ryan! And don't forget to tune into Across the Airwaves' Ustream channel at 10:30/9:30c this Friday, January 27, 2012, for our special retrospective live show (Chuck vs The ATA Live Show) for the NBC series Chuck which will be concluding this Friday as well. More information on that can be found here: http://acrosstheairwaves.com/chuck
item.itunes:subtitle: The 15th episode of Across the Airwaves' Retro Reviews, dedicated to reviewing episodes of the hit series Smallville, hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S. Kim!

item.title: ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews Episode 14 - Rosetta and Exodus
item.description: Hey everyone, and welcome back to Across the Airwaves' Retro Reviews! This episode covers 2x17 and 2x23 Rosetta and Exodus in one of our best episodes yet! We cover Christopher Reeve on Smallville, Woo's Smallville fantasy, the 2nd season finale, Red K, and DC Comics news on the New 52 and a potential TV series to hit the CW entitled "Arrow". So, hold onto your hats, because this Retro Review goes everywhere and then some!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 14th episode of Across the Airwaves' Retro Reviews hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S. Kim!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 65 (Enhanced) ”Guess Who's Back”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, I invite you to rap with me, guess who's back? Back again, The Doctor's back, tell a friend. So why are you still here rapping?  Go out there to tell everyone you know that The Doctor's return means that Across The Airwaves, the only podcast that's as cool as a bowtie as a special treat on its 65th Episode our review on the 2011 Doctor Who Christmas Special for all of you Whovians down in Who–Ville, all the tall and the small.  Wait a minute, wrong group of Whovians, but it's a perfect way to segue into announcing that Michael's How the Grinch Stole Video Podcasts led the way into giving ATA it's largest number of listeners per month so kudos to him on that one. Going back to this podcast episode our review of the Doctor Who Christmas Special  is complemented by our favorite funniest moments from a new episode of Modern Family along with a discussion on the Midseason Premiere of Supernatural. We also continue with our series of reviews on the final season of Chuck with this week's episode being highly entertaining but leaving us scratching our heads on where the heck this show is going in regards to its finale, even though we are trying really hard to just sit back and have fun as we watch Chuck come to a conclusion.
item.itunes:subtitle: Guess who's back? The Doctor! In other words, this means ATA 65 has a special treat, our review on the Doctor Who Christmas Special The Doctor, The Widow and The Wardrobe. Also we review new episodes of Modern Family, Chuck and Supernatural.

item.title: ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews Episode 13 - Season 10 (DVD/Blu-Ray)
item.description: Hello favorite followers! Michael here; today's episode of ATA's (Smallville) Retro Reviews, Woo and I cover the 10th and Final season of Smallville, including reviewing the Season 10 DVD/Blu-Ray Boxset(s)! Also, two special announcments were given in this episode as well. The first includes a PSA by Woo, which warns people who live in big cities (or any city in general), not to go out late at night! The second is about the Starkville's House of El's (SHoE, the #1 Smallville podcast in the WORLD!!!) FINAL episode (175), which actually features Dan, Woo, and myself, along with a host of other Smallville/SHoE lovers. So that's it for this week guys, and we'll be back soon with out 14th episode. Cheers!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 13th episode of the infamous Across the Airwaves' Retro Reviews featuring Michael J. Petty and Woo S. Kim

item.title: ATA's Retro Reviews Special - Power Rangers!!!
item.description: Hey everyone, it's Michael J. Petty, yes, I'm still living! It has been a long hiatus I know, but my podcasting partner Woo S. Kim and I do need breaks every once-in-a-while. ANYWAY, some time ago in November of 2011, Woo and I recorded a special Retro Review hitting close to our childhood. We recorded about Saban's Power Rangers! In this action packed episode, we talk Mighty Mophin, Zeo, Turbo, In Space, Lightspeed Rescue, Time Force, Wild Force, Dino Thunder, S.P.D., Bulk and Skull, Billy Cranston, MMPR: The Movie, Turbo the Movie, Samurai, Forever Red, Countdown To Destruction, and much much more!!! So, join us for a very special Retro Review to kick off the new year!
item.itunes:subtitle: A SPECIAL episode of Across the Airwaves' Retro Reviews, hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S. Kim, about Saban's Power Rangers!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 64 (Enhanced) ”Chuck Versus the Podcast Episode”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week's Chucktasticly filled podcast features reviews on not just one but two episodes of the fan favorite TV Series Chuck. The first episode Chuck Versus the Santa Suit was the biggest episode of the series since its spectacular Season 3 Finale giving us everything we wanted to see from the return of a major villain. As for the second episode Chuck Versus the Baby, the cliffhanger that we were left with at the end of the previous episode caused us to go into it really pumped up only to be disappointed but then later satisfied as we were given a feel-good ending that left Nico and I smiling. Also since we had the extra time, Nico and I discuss if Chuck being originally picked up by another network besides NBC would have allowed it to extend past five seasons and give you our predictions for the Chuck Series Finale.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's Chucktasticly filled podcast features reviews of not just one but two episodes of Chuck. Also we discuss Network decisions that could've been made to extend Chuck past five seasons and give you our predictions for the Chuck Series Finale.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 63 (Enhanced) ”Podcast of Interest”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week's episode is entitled Podcast of Interest because it's obviously dedicated to the new CBS Series Person of Interest, which had Nico and my favorite Midseason Finale for the Fall 2011 TV Season. However, that's not all when it comes to sparking your interest in this podcast since we also discuss the shocking discovery made at the end of the Psych Midseason Finale and use our review of Chuck to explain why people who were disappointed with the second half of Season 4 really should come back to the show since there's some really great things ahead as we head towards the Series Finale. Also as an added bonus Nico gives you the lowdown in his new section on all the Summer Movie Trailers that were released over the Holidays along with links to watch them on our YouTube Channel.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's ATA is entitled Podcast of Interest since Person of Interest, had our favorite Midseason Finale for the Fall. We also keep your interest in this podcast by discussing Psych's Midseason Finale and why viewers who left should return to Chuck.

item.title: How the Grinch Stole Christmas: An Across The Airwaves After Christmas Special
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, it's Dan here.  First off I want to sincerely apologize to all of you especially Michael after how hard he worked on this coming out so late and after Christmas but now that my busy schedule over the holidays as come to a close, I'm proud to present to you an Across The Airwaves Special Video Presentation of the Dr. Seuss classic How the Grinch Stole Christmas where the Grinch's voice is done by ATA's very own Michael J. Petty and the story is read by him too!
item.itunes:subtitle: Across The Airwaves proudly presents a special video presentation of How the Grinch Stole Christmas were the Grinch's voice is done by ATA's very own Michael J. Petty and the story is read by him too!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 62 (Enhanced) ”All We Want for Christmas is more Community”
item.description: It was the night before Midseason Finales and all through the house, not a creature was stirring, not even a mouse. Actually, quite a lot of people are stirring as Community fans including Nico and I face the possibility that the shows most recent episode Regional Holiday Music might be its final episode due to the announcement that NBC has benched Community for new episodes of 30 Rock. So in response to yet another boneheaded decision from the old  Peacock, we've decided to throw ATA's Holiday Party in honor of Community by this podcast closing out with this sounds of Troy and Abed's Christmas Infiltration Rap and us giving our favorite comedic moments on what may be their final episode. Plus Community even makes our Chuck review  as we discuss two surprise celebrity cameos that occurred in the episode.However, that's not all the presents Nico Clause has in his bag, as this ATA Episode features reviews on the Midseason Finale's for Castle and Bones that left Nico and I on opposite sides of the fence when it came to them being good or not.  At the same time, we use this week's episode of Person of Interest as a soapbox to explain how it has become one of the best new shows on television and our review on Chuck gives the promise that it's on track towards once again becoming the little show that could we had such a soft spot for in it's first three seasons. Also there's more where that came from as we round this podcast out with our favorite comedic moments from a Christmas episode of Modern Family as well as a standard episode of The Big Bang Theory.
item.itunes:subtitle: With Community staring down the barrel of cancellation, we decided to celebrate our Holiday Party in honor of the show along with giving you reviews on Castle, Psych, Modern Family, The Big Bang Theory, Bones and Chuck.

item.title: ATA's Smallville/Supernatural Retro Reviews 12 - A Very ATAmas
item.description: Ho ho ho and a Merry Christmas to all of our amazing fans on the Interwebs, as Dan would call it, and welcome to another episode of Across the Airwaves' fresh new section entitled "ATA's Retro Reviews! But since you were put on the nice list, you won't have to listen to Dan and Nico banter about new TV episodes, instead, you get Michael and Woo to talk about Smallville (and in this episode, Supernatural)'s Christmas episodes! LEXMAS and A VERY SUPERNATURAL CHRISTMAS are two of our favorite Christmas episodes here at ATA (but don't count out Chuck vs Santa Claus)! So, without furthur adu, let us at ATA bring you, a brand new Retro Review!!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 12th episode of Across the Airwaves' Retro Reviews hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo Kim

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 61 (Enhanced) ”Rest in Peace Bobby Singer”
item.description: Hi ATA Listeners, I have some very sad news to report Sam and Dean Winchester's grumpy mentor and monster researcher extraordinaire Bobby Singer has tragically died at the hands of  THAT DAMN GOOD FOR NOTHING LEVIATHAN DICK ROMAN WHO I REALLY WANT TO SEE DEAN BLOW OUT OF HIS MISERY WITH A SHOTGUN BLAST TO THE HEAD!  Anyway, in coming down this week's ATA is obviously dedicated to the memory of   everyone's favorite drunken Demon Hunter, good ol' Bobby Singer with this episode featuring an extended Supernatural section and the show ending with a song that I think best describes Bobby, The Allman Brothers Band's Ramblin' Man. However, on a more somber note or for you who are in denial that Bobby is gone ATA 61 also has some solid reviews for the Season Finale of ThunderCats, Psych and Bones as well as our favorite comedic moments from Modern Family and what may be the penultimate to final episode of Community.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's ATA is dedicated to the memory of Bobby Singer who tragically died on the most recent episode of Supernatural. Also along with this tribute, we have reviews for the Season Finale of ThunderCats, Psych, Modern Family, Bones and Community.

item.title: ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews 11 - The Spirit of Promaganda
item.description: In the aftermath of a very sad Supernatural mid-season finale, Woo Kim and Michael J. Petty return to the podcasting world for a Smallville Retro Review of 4x18 Spirit. Yes, the prom episode. They couldn't pass up the opportunity for some promaganda and had to cover this episode. Although Michael gets upset about Lifehouse's song choice, Woo is there to keep him on his rocker. So enjoy this latest episode of ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews, and come back next time for our Christmas episode of Retro Reviews feat. Lexmas and A Very Supernatural Christmas...Nuff said!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 11th episode of Across the Airwaves' Retro Reviews on the episode Spirit

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 60 (Enhanced) ”Animation Domination”
item.description: This week's ATA is entitled Animation Domination because like Fox's Sunday Night Lineup the majority of this podcast features reviews on two episodes of the Cartoon Network Animated Series' Young Justice and ThunderCats. However, for those of you who might not be animation fans you're not going to want to pass this edition of ATA up since our other favorite shows being on hiatus gave us the opportunity to have an extended discussion on the Castle episode Kill Shot where Staina Katic as Beckett and Jon Huertas gave their best performances of the series.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA 60 is entitled Animation Domination because this podcast features reviews on two episodes of Young Justice & ThunderCats. However, If you're not a animation fan this episode is still worth a listen since we also have an extended review on Castle.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 59 (Enhanced) ”Dan and Nico, Interrupted”
item.description: This ATA Episode is entitled Dan and Nico, Interrupted as we got a little off our rocker like the two old guys from the Muppets when it came to reviewing the week's schedule of our favorite shows. Again, Nico's harsh criticism regarding Sweet's interaction with Daisy on this week's Bones was warranted but  me being disappointed with this week's episodes of Psych  and Fringe came across as a bit wacko. I don't know if it was the soothing saxophone sounds of Kenny G that Shawn and Gus used to take down the killer of the week messing with my head or Supernatural ending with the possibiliy that a major character could die but something made me nutty when recording this podcast. Anyway, regardless of what I was smoking (yes, that one goes out to you ATA Supporter JColeman) my out of place criticism spawned a great discussion with Nico on the week's new episodes of Psych, Bones, Person of Interest, Fringe, Chuck and Supernatural that I'm sure all of you will enjoy. Plus as always we share our favorite comedic moments from Modern Family, The Big Bang Theory and Community, which in this episode kicks off an ATA Campaign where you listeners need to go and vote for Sheldon himself a.k.a. Jim Parsons to win a People's Choice Award.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week on ATA, Dan must've been taking crazy pills as some of his reviews were a bit hypercritical but it spawned a great discussion with Nico on Psych, Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Community, Bones, Person of Interest, Fringe, Chuck & Supernatural.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 58 (Enhanced) ”Nimrods, Bozos and Crazies”
item.description: Hey Everybody, this week's ATA is entitled Nimrods, Bozos and Crazies because the highlight of this episode is Nico's justified rant during our Chuck section about the stupid decisions NBC has made over the past few years causing the network to go from number one all the way down to number four almost in what felt like overnight. Also this ATA podcast's closing song is Kiss from a Rose by Seal, which was performed on the week's episode of Community, a show that NBC is making the bad mistake of benching for the second half of the 2011–12 TV Season. However,  just because NBC is currently making some really dumb decisions, we don't let them rain on this episode's parade as it is chocked full of great reviews for Castle, Young Justice, two episodes of Thundercats, Psych, Bones, Fringe, Chuck and Supernatural along with our favorite comedic moments from The Big Bang Theory and Community.
item.itunes:subtitle: Nimrods, Bozos & Crazies is ATA 58's title because Nico gives a rant about NBC's stupid decisions. However that's not all as we have reviews for Castle, Young Justice, Thundercats, Psych, Big Bang Theory, Community, Bones, Fringe, Chuck & Supernatural.

item.title: ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews 10 - Zod's Tanksgiving!!!
item.description: Hello loyal ATA/Smallville/Woo followers! We are terribly sorry about the delay of Retro Reviews episodes, but this DOUBLE EPISODE will make up for that. In the first hour, Michael J. Petty and co-host Woo S. Kim cover 3 Zod themed episodes of Smallville. 9X1 Savior, 9x22 Salvation, and 10x19 Dominion! One before Zod, two before Zod, THREE BEFORE ZOD! And After that, because of technical difficulties on Michael's end, Woo recorded a second hour Thanksgiving (Tanksgiving) episode featuring the episodes 6x7 Rage and 10X7 Ambush, the Thanksgiving episodes of Smallville. So, enjoy that as well as our Zod half of this Thanksgiving Special! And if you think that's good, wait until our Christmas Specials....
item.itunes:subtitle: The 10th episode of ATA's Retro Reviews featuring special Thanksgiving surprises!!!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 57 (Enhanced) ”Let's Twist Again”
item.description: Who's that podcastin up there? Is it a bird? No! Is it a plane? No! Is it the twister? Yeah! So join Nico and I for a podcast episode where our favorite shows twist again like they did with the cliffhangers at the beginning of last summer. Yeah, you heard me right the episodes of Castle, Psych, Bones, Person of Interest, Chuck and Fringe that we review on this ATA Podcast all feature some sort of twist. However, the fun doesn't stop there as we cover an episode of Supernatural that doesn't fit our episode's theme but is still fun nonetheless as well as give you our favorite comedic moments from the week's episodes of Modern Family, Big Bang Theory and Community.
item.itunes:subtitle: Join us as we review episodes of Castle, Psych, Bones, Chuck and Fringe that all feature a twist. However, the fun doesn't stop there as we cover episodes of Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Community that didn't fit this podcasts theme but was fun anyway.

item.title: ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews 09 - BQM
item.description: Hello and welcome back to ATA's Retro Reviews!!! So, apparently Woo and I are doing a decent job, because you're all back!!! Anyway, this week, we are covering two of our favorite Bryan Q. Miller (ex-Teen Titans and Batgirl writer) written episodes of Smallville!!! 8X5 Committed and 8x12 Bulletproof. Committed is actually the first real Clois episode (I believe) and Bulletproof is just awesome! So, without further adu, please sit back, relax, and enjoy our BQM episode of Retro Reviews!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 9th episode of ATA's Retro Reviews hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S. Kim

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 56 (Enhanced) ”ATA Ain't Afraid of No Ghosts”
item.description: When there's something strange in your neighborhood who are you gonna call Across the Airwaves with a Halloween episode!  Yeah,  I know it's a little after the fact but please bear with us as we get back on track and enjoy the fun with a podcast featuring the sounds of Halloween along with reviews of Castle, Psych, Last Man Standing, The Big Bang Theory, Community and Supernatural that all had a Halloween theme. Also we give our thoughts on standard episodes of Young Justice and Person of Interest as well as the Final Season Premiere of Chuck.
item.itunes:subtitle: When there's something strange in your neighborhood who are you gonna call Across the Airwaves with a Halloween episode reviewing Castle, Young Justice, Psych, Person of Interest, Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Last Man Standing, Chuck & Supernatural.

item.title: ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews 08 - Geoff Johns
item.description: Across the Airwaves' 8th Retro Review episode!!! Hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo S! Kim, our favorite (BESIDES Dan & Nico) co-hosts talk the Geoff Johns written episodes of Smallville. Season 8's Legion, Season 9's Socitey/Legends (the "Absolute Justice" event), and Season 10's Booster. As Michael points out in this episode, they all help Clark Kent become Superman in very unique ways while paying homage to all sorts of heroes, past (JSA), present (JLA), and future (Legion of Super-Heroes/Booster Gold)!!! So, sit down, strap in, and prepare to fight as one in this 2-HOUR ACTION PACKED EPISODE!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 8th episode of ATA's Retro Reviews dedicated to Smallville's Geoff Johns' written episodes!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 55 (Enhanced) ”Chariots of Fire”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, join us as we race Chariots of Fire style to catch up with current new episodes of our favorite shows by reviewing the episodes of Castle, Young Justice, Psych, Person of Interest and Supernatural for the week of October 17th. Also along with this slate of reviews Nico and I share our favorite funniest moments from the week's episodes of Modern Family, The Big Bang Theory and Last Man Standing.
item.itunes:subtitle: Join us as we race Chariots of Fire style to catch up on new episodes of ATA Favorites by reviewing episodes of Castle, Young Justice, Psych, Person of Interest, Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Last Man Standing & Supernatural from the week of Oct. 17th.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 54 (Enhanced) ”Psych–Out”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, I want to sincerely apologize for it taking so long for us to release a new episode. I had some health issues followed by some technical issues with my computer but the good news is everything's fine now and I'm hoping if it doesn't psych you out too much that you're willing to step back through a time warp to help us celebrate the debut of our section on Psych with our review of the show's Sixth Season Premiere. However, the fun of this episode doesn't end with Psych since this podcast includes reviews of Castle, Young Justice, Tim Allen's new sitcom Last Man Standing, Person of Interest, Fringe and Supernatural along with our favorite funny moments from Modern Family, The Big Bang Theory and Community, all from the week of October 10th.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sorry about the delay in episodes but here is the debut of Psych on ATA along with reviews on Castle, Young Justice, Last Man Standing, Modern Family, The Big Bang Theory, Community, Person of Interest, Fringe and Supernatural.

item.title: ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews 07 - Scare and Thirst
item.description: It's our Halloween episode of ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews! Michael J. Petty and Woo S. Kim cover two scary Halloween favorites 4x10 "Scare" and 5x5 "Thirst"! Yes, we know, Thirst is a little over the top, but we ARE open to suggestions for episodes to cover. So, please enjoy these episodes (and watch them BEFORE or WHILE listening to this podcast) and have fun with it guys! Stay super!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 7th episode ATA's own Smallville Retro Reviews!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Smallville Retro Reviews 06 - Season Seven Overview
item.description: Like I told you all last issue, err, I mean, episode, we are cranking out the episodes this week!!!! We have a NEW theme song. A NEW mentality. And a NEW way to review an entire season of Smallville in about an hour!!! How great is that!?!?!?! So, this episode, we're covering the Writer's Strike season of Smallville aka Season 7. We talk the premiere and finale extensively along with Green Arrow spin-off, Veritas, Batman, and much, much more! So enjoy this episode and stay tuned for SRR's Scary Halloween episode which is due to be released Thursday for your convinence and our own. Stay super everyone!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 6th episode of ATA's Spin-Off show: The Smallville Retro Reviews!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Smallville Retro Reviews 05 – Season Six Overview
item.description: HATERS GONNA HATE! That's what we have to say to those fans who dislike the sixth season of Smallville. The season that introduces Oliver Queen, Henry James Olsen, Martian Manhunter, Bizarro, and the Justice League has taken so much hate over the years, that Michael J. Petty and Woo Kim have had enough! They defended the season bravely and nobley, but not enough to excuse Lana Luthor or Noir I'm afraid. ATA's Smallville Retro Reviews episode 5 has been critically acclaimed as the BEST SRR episode to date! So please sit back, relax, and enjoy the rant, err, I mean, show...
item.itunes:subtitle: The 5th episode of Across the Airwaves' Smallville Retro Reviews covering the 6th season of Smallville. Hosted by Michael J. Petty and Woo Kim!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Smallville Retro Reviews 04 – Season Nine Overview
item.description: Hey! Hey! Hey! It's the Smallville Retro Reviews (that's SRR to you)! This time on the SRR, we talk about the entire ninth season of Smallville! While mostly talking about Zod, we also talk about the unfortunate death of Apple creator Steve Jobs and Woo and I's experience with Apple. Also, we talk about Cartoon Network's MAD's Smallville: Turn Off The Clark. Lionel Luthor acting like a chicken is TOTALLY worth it!!!! So, tune in for our 4th episode of ATA's SRR hosted by yours truly Michael J. Petty and Woo Kim. Tune in next week for our overview of the 6th season (yes, I said 6th) of Smallville! Somebody SAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAVE me!!!!!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: This time on the SRR, we talk about the entire ninth season of Smallville! While mostly talking about Zod, we reflect on the unfortunate death of Apple Creator Steve Jobs and have some laughs over Cartoon Network's MAD's Smallville: Turn Off The Clark.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Smallville Retro Reviews 03 – Relic & Kandor
item.description: Gotta get back in tiiiiiiimmmmeeeee!!!!!!! Oh yes, don't worry, this Back to The Future/Supernatural Mystery Spot reference IS intentional as we are reviewing the episodes of Smallville that, go back in time. Yes, this week, Woo and I are reviewing Superman favorites Relic (1961) and Kandor. Both of these episodes give us more information on Jor-El, the father of Clark Kent aka Kal-El aka Superman and his first experience on Earth as well as his friendship with General Zod (back when he was a Major) on Krypton. But, enough of me talking, just listen to this hour long episode and be sure to tune in next week for our Smallville Season 9 overview!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: Michael and Woo return to review the Smallville Episodes Relic and Kandor! So find a barn loft to get cozy with someone special and enjoy this trip back down Jor–El memory lane.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 53 (Enhanced) ”Strange Things”
item.itunes:subtitle: There's strange things happening on ATA 53, ain't no doubt about it. At least we were able to obtain some sense of normalcy by providing reviews on Doctor Who, Castle, Young Justice, Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Community, Fringe & Supernatural.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Smallville Retro Reviews 02 – Lineage & Eternal
item.description: Following the smashing hit that was Smallville Retro Reviews Episode 1 (feat. Pilot) comes the 2nd installation of SRR, but this time reviewing 2x07 and 8x18: Lineage and Eternal (respectively). Join Woo and myself as we plunge into the "behind-the-scenes" of last weeks episode Pilot in this 30 minute episode!  And don't forget to check back in next week for our review on Superman lore episodes Relic and Kandor! So strap yourselves in, this one's gonna be a bumpy ride!!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, Michael and Woo talk about the Smallville episodes Lineage and Eternal. So turn off your TV and listen to our newest episode of ATA’s Smallville Retro Reviews! Which are just as long as a Clone Wars episode. Trust me, you’re not missing muc

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 52 (Enhanced) ”Cass has gone and poisoned the water hole!”
item.description: Uh–Oh ATA Listeners! Cass has gone and poisoned the water hole leading to one of the best episodes of Supernatural that we've seen since Season 5.  Yeah, I know  at the end of last season Nico and I were ready to consider  the show about the Winchester Brothers hunting the things that go bump in the night dead to rights but this week veteran Supernatural writer Ben Edlund picked us up in the Impala and took us on a thrill ride filled with eweey gooey shotgun shattering Leviathans, hallucinations of Lucifer and a shocking cliffhanger that will make you scream All Hell Breaks Loose Part 2 again. So as a result of Sam and Dean getting their mojo back, we've got a special treat for you, a discussion on Supernatural where Nico and I finally get to show you just how excited we can get about the show like in the old days before we started recording this podcast and the Brothers were hunting Yellow Eyes. However,  just because our Supernatural  (we're not worthy of Ben Edlund) Discussion is the main highlight  for this week's episode don't count out our other sections because as promised we provided you with reviews of Doctor Who, Castle, the excellent Season Finale of Alphas, Person of Interest and Fringe that are totally worth listening to especially when it comes to crackpot theories about future episodes.  Plus we have our Funniest Moments sections for Modern Family, The Big Bang Theory and Community that will show you why it's worth taking 30 minutes to watch each of these sitcoms.
item.itunes:subtitle: Uh–Oh! Cass has poisoned the water hole leading to one of the best episodes of Supernatural in a while and an even better discussion surrounded by reviews on Dr. Who, Castle, Alphas, Modern Family, Big Bang Theory, Community, Person of Interest & Fringe

item.title: Across The Airwaves Smallville Retro Reviews 01 – Pilot
item.description: Hello fellow Smallvillians and ATA fans, Michael J. Petty has returned! This year, I have become an official co-host, but that's not all! I am back to review Smallville's finest moments! Yes, we know Smallville has been completed and Clark Kent is Superman, but we're not really ready to let go of the series just yet. And with me this year (and hopefully next year as well) is a new face to ATA, a "freshman" is you will, Woo S. Kim! Woo and I have talked for about 2 years over the SHoE website, and he volunteered to co-host this section with me. Now, our normal section will only be about 20 to 30 minutes on a regular ATA episode, but since we're reviewing 1x1 "Pilot" today, it went a full hour! Also, Woo will be on with me on a bi-weekly basis as Dan want's to co-host with me as well. So, sit back, relax, and enjoy the show!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hello ATA fans, Michael here! In the first episode of our Smallville Retro Reviews Mini–Podcast Series, I am joined by ATA freshman and my equivalent to Nico, Woo S. Kim for an in-depth discussion on the Pilot episode of Smallville!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 51 (Enhanced) ”Back in the Saddle Again”
item.description: On this week's special giant sized episode (excuse my Steven Tyler voice) ATA is back in the saddle again as we kick off the NEW Fall 2011–12 TV Season with a NEW script format, NEW reviews for the shows Doctor Who, Castle, Alphas, Ringer, Sons of Anarchy, CBS's newcomer Person of Interest, Fringe and Supernatural as well as three NEW Podcast segments revealing our favorite funny moments from the Season Premieres of Modern Family, The Big Bang Theory and  Community. In other words if you haven't figured it out based on the extreme exciting emphasis put on writing the word NEW, Nico and I have high hopes that this episode is going to kick off a season of ATA that's going to cross the airwaves or review the week in television better than ever before, so if you've just discovered us or have been here from the beginning, I would strongly advise listening to this podcast because it's jammed packed with material that's just the start of something great to come.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA is back in the saddle again as we kick off the Fall 2011–12 TV Season with reviews on new episodes of Doctor Who, Castle, Alphas, Ringer, Sons of Anarchy, Modern Family, The Big Bang Theory, Community, Person of Interest, Fringe and Supernatural.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 50 (Enhanced) ”Michael Didn't Start The Fire”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners,  have you ever heard that time flies when you're having fun? Well, that old saying has met up with Across the Airwaves as we have reached the milestone of our 50th Episode. However, just because Nico and I decided to celebrate by using this episode to take a trip down Podcast Memory Lane, we didn't start the fire on the party, in fact Michael is the one responsible by performing his own musical number paying tribute to the variety of topics we've talked about over the past 50 episodes of ATA. Plus as it turns out this spectacular 50th episode of ATA is much bigger on the inside with Nico and I reviewing the hit British TV Series Doctor Who, SyFy Channel's newcomer Alphas and the most recent episode of the new ThunderCats.  On that note, if you've just started listening or have been with us since the beginning Nico, Michael, the new guy Woo and I can't thank you enough for your support over the past 50 Episodes and here's to your support over the next 50 more.
item.itunes:subtitle: ATA has reached the milestone of our 50th Episode. So join us as we celebrate with Michael performing a musical number paying tribute to past episodes. Plus we have reviews on Doctor Who, SyFy's Alphas and the current episode of ThunderCats.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 49 (Enhanced) ”Mystery Incorporated, Ho!”
item.description: Hey Gang, it looks like we've got another mystery on our hands, so let's split up. Velma, you go with Shaggy and Scooby, I'll go with...Nico?!  Aw, shucks I wanted to go with Daphne but this isn't Scooby-Doo Where Are You?, it's ATA so I'm going to have to settle for the next best thing, Nico returning from Africa to help me record a podcast episode reviewing the new Cartoon Network shows, ThunderCats and Scooby-Doo: Mystery Incorporated. Highlights from this episode include Nico giving all of you listeners the 411 on his adventure in Africa and us using our own brand of sight beyond sight to  compare the new ThunderCats Series to the 1984 Version in a discussion that will make you proudly cry, Thunder, Thunder, ThunderCats HO! Plus this is followed up by an in-depth look at Scooby-Doo: Mystery Incorporated that pays tribute to all the Scooby incarnations from Where Are You? to the  Live-Action Films with the help of soundbites from the Mystery Inc. Gang and the creepy characters that they've met while mystery solving over the years.  Yes, if  you're an old-school animation junkie this is the episode for you, so with that I leave you with this question will you listen to this podcast for a Scooby Snack?
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey Gang, it looks like we've got another mystery on our hands, as Nico returns from Africa to give me sight beyond sight as we review the new Cartoon Network shows ThunderCats and Scooby-Doo: Mystery Incorporated.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 48 (Enhanced) ”When Captain America Throws his Mighty Shield...”
item.description: All those Decepticons and Aliens who oppose our shield must yield because we are bringing you loyal ATA Listeners a podcast episode dedicated to reviewing the hit summer blockbuster movies Captain America: The First Avenger, J.J. Abrams' Super 8 and Transformers 3: Dark of the Moon! Highlights from this action-packed episode include Nico's current trek to Africa bringing Michael J. Petty back to the show for a discussion where  sounds from the 80s and early 90s help us explain changes that could've been made to make the movie Super 8 more memorable and our satisfaction that Transformers 3 proved the popular franchise is still about robots in disguise rather than Megan Fox's underpants. However that doesn't come before us taking an in-depth look at Captain America: The First Avenger where Michael and I reveal our theories/predictions about how the film will  connect to next summer's Avengers movie. Warning!!! This podcast was recorded under the status that our listeners have seen these movies so if you are waiting to watch them on DVD/Blu-ray be warned that this episode will contain SPOILERS!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: When ATA Episode 48 throws its mighty shield, all those Decepticons and Aliens who oppose our shield must yield as Michael J. Petty joins us to review the movies Captain America: The First Avenger, Super 8 and Transformers 3: Dark of the Moon!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 47 Part 2 (Enhanced) ”Get Your Cosplay On, It's Time for ComicCon”
item.description: (Guitar playing in background): ComicCon is a festival of media, where instead of just getting info on Comics, we get news on TV, Movies and Video Games alike. But if you feel like the only kid in town without a way to San Diego, here's a song for people who weren't able to attend the Con just like you and MEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!!! Now with that I could carry along with my parody of an Adam Sandler Holiday favorite by busting out the chorus get your Cosplay on, it's time to celebrate ComicCon or I can save you ATA Listeners from imagining the horror of Nico or I trying to sing by providing what brought you to this website in the first place. And would you look at that I got what you're looking for right here with a brand-new podcast episode dedicated to letting you experience the sights and sounds of San Diego ComicCon International 2011 right through your iPod/MP3 player. Yep, this episode is all about the biggest Entertainment Convention in the world and we've got one big episode for you that covers just about everything we here at ATA have an interest in, such as new TV shows like CBS's Person of Interest, Returning Series like Castle, the upcoming movie Amazing Spider–Man, video games such as Batman: Arkham City and what's going on in the world of Comic Books. In fact, there was so much stuff at this year's ComicCon to be excited about we had to break this episode into two parts. Basically, to sum it up Part 1 features a section where Nico and I make sense out of the News Headlines that erupted out of G4 Network's coverage of ComicCon as well as our sources on the Internet. We also followed this section up with a discussion on the celebrity panels for the upcoming Spider–Man movie along with the TV shows Terra Nova, Castle, Ringer, Doctor Who, Torchwood: Miracle Day, Falling Skies and Psych. Then with Part 2 of the podcast Nico and I cover the Panels for Community, Bones, The Big Bang Theory, Fringe, Person of Interest, Grimm, Chuck and Supernatural. So if you're one of those Listeners who likes to skip around between the topics that we discuss in our episodes use this post as a guide when it comes to which part of this Special ATA ComicCon Episode you want to listen to or if you want just listen to the whole thing to impress your friends with with your infinite knowledge of current Pop Culture. Again, this was a big episode of ATA and that especially goes for all the outside research plus editing that was done to make this recording possible so I sincerely hope you enjoy our tribute to the biggest Entertainment Festival of the year San Diego Comic Con 2011.
item.itunes:subtitle: Part 2 of ATA's ComicCon 2011 Coverage features more discussions on the Celebrity Panels that occurred at the convention for the TV shows Community, Bones, The Big Bang Theory, Fringe, Person of Interest, Grimm, Chuck and Supernatural.
