item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 46 (Enhanced) ”Hold On, The Fall 2011 TV Season is Coming”
item.description:
Hey ATA Listeners, does the summer heat have you down? Well, (Sam and Dave music starts playing) hold on, ATA is coming with Nico and I giving you a preview of the Fall 2011 TV Season. In other words, we're using this episode to discuss the new shows we're going to be watching, the shows we  decided to pass on and the predictions that we have for the return of our favorite shows like Castle. Highlights from this episode include my excitement over CBS's Person of Interest a new show from JJ Abrams and Jonathan Nolan, Nico discussing his struggles over having time to add shows like The CW's Ringer as well as NBC's Prime Suspect to his TV watching schedule and we both talk about the Networks failing to see that putting shows of the same genre on at the same time might be a bad idea especially when it comes to Friday night. Also if you don't listen to the Enhanced ACC version of our podcast here is the list of links to the previews for the new TV Shows and shows in their  Sophomore seasons that we discuss in this episode just so you have a frame of reference to work with. Monday Night
2 Broke Girls Terra Nova The Playboy Club
Tuesday Night
Last Man Standing Body of Proof Ringer
Wednesday Night
Revenge
Thursday Night
How to be a Gentlemen Person of Interest Charlie's Angels Prime Suspect
Friday Night
Grimm Blue Bloods
item.itunes:subtitle: Summer heat have you down? Well, hold on, ATA is coming with a preview of the Fall 2011 TV Season including discussions on new shows we're going to be watching, shows we decided to pass on and predictions we have for the return of our favorite shows.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 45 (Enhanced) Beware my Mutant Asgardian Power, Podcaster's Light!
item.description: Aye ATA Mortals, it is I, the Mighty Dan returning to you from the land of Asgard with a podcast episode, in which thee would consider to be one hammer wielding, ring slinging and submarine lifting of a good time that would make you call out for another as your hand smashes your iPod against a table. Basically, if you haven't caught on already this episode of ATA is all about Michael joining Nico and I to review three of this summer's biggest blockbuster movies Thor, X-Men: First Class and Green Lantern. Highlights from these reviews include an analysis on how Kenneth Branagh's mastery of the material in the Thor comics totally alleviated our fears of the Norse God turned Superhero being translated poorly to the big screen. Also we discussed the talented young actors   who by adding their own flair to the popular Mutant characters might have made X-Men: First Class the best superhero movie of the summer and how the lack of this technique in Green Lantern might have ruined DC Comics' attempt at creating another film franchise.
item.itunes:subtitle: Aye ATA Mortals, it's the Mighty Dan returning to you from the land of Asgard with a podcast episode where the Brave Nico and I are rejoined by our Brother in Arms Michael as we review the summer movies Thor, X-Men: First Class and Green Lantern.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 44 (Enhanced) ”Party On, Till New TV In September”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners,  join us as we party on Earth, Wind, Fire and Rain style till new TV in September with our reviews on the Season Finales of Chuck, Castle, Bones and Supernatural that are filled with a barrage of crackpot theories and predictions for the return of these shows this Fall. Highlights from the episode include Nico's thoughts on the Smallville Finale since he wasn't able to join us for the Live Show, a strong explanation on why Castle had the best finale of the season and our thoughts on the bombshell dropped at the end of the Bones Finale. Plus if that's not enough, this episode of ATA creates some Season Finale suspense of its own with two hard-core debates on the Chuck Finale and the writers making a decision in the Supernatural Finale that may have put us on the crossroads with continuing to review the show. But don't worry, even though it bothered us this issue has nothing to do with Lisa and Ben. However, for the answer on if Supernatural will be a part of our slate of reviews in the Fall, you're just going to have to wait until September, just like with new episodes of our favorite network shows. Again, unlike a Writers Room, you listeners out there do have control over the decisions made with ATA so if you want Supernatural to stick around in our reviews, let us know through Facebook posts, Tweets or  E-mails. On that note, even though we're holding off the verdict on Supernatural until the Fall, expect ATA to be around during the summer but first we're taking a brief hiatus to set up a new and improved format for our upcoming coverage of the 2011–2012 season But we will be back in June to review the summer blockbusters Thor and Green Lantern starring ATA favorite Ryan Reynolds. Also, we’d like to thank our guest hosts AlisaLea from the Young Justice Podcast and Robin Burdge from Media Junkyard and Starkville’s House of El for joining us on the Superman Live Show and for all the tremendous support that all you Smallville fans out there gave us on the night of the event.
item.itunes:subtitle: Join us as we party on till new TV in September with our reviews on the Season Finales of Chuck, Castle, Bones and Supernatural that are filled with a barrage of crackpot theories and predictions for the return of these shows this Fall.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Superman Live Show (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, it's Dan here with a very big treat for all of you, our much advertised and anticipated event, Across the Airwaves' Superman Live Show dedicated to celebrating the trials we witnessed throughout the course of the hit TV series Smallville that transformed a high school freshman named Clark Kent into Superman, the greatest hero that the world has ever known. Basically, as the Live Show started it did a nice job of taking flight with the host of the Young Justice Podcast, AlisaLea Gossage's always wonderful insight on everything Smallville but then this podcast blasted into the stratosphere when we got a big surprise as Robin Burdge, a host on the podcasts Media Junkyard and Starkville's House of El, the number one Smallville podcast on the Net entered the chat room and then faster than a speeding bullet,  our very own Michael J. Petty had Robin up on the Skype and talking with us. Yes, you read that right, one last-minute Twitter post got Across the Airwaves biggest celebrity guest yet and thanks to Robin along with AlisaLea's presence this Live Show became exactly what I wanted it to be, an incredibly memorable event dedicated to Superman and one of my favorite TV Shows, Smallville. Honestly, I know this may come across a little as sucking up but having your and Michael's support when it came to saying goodbye to a show that has been so important to me over the years, meant the world to me especially when some of that support came from Starkville's House of El, and the very podcast that inspired the creation of Across The Airwaves. I mean, just getting the opportunity to ask you questions, Robin to pull back the curtain on the podcast that I've been listening to for the past three years was wicked cool and I sincerely hope that I've broken the ice enough between ATA and SHoE soon to be Geek Out Loud for us to become friends and that goes for the guys at Media Junkyard as well. So  now that I've made Robin who might be reading this turn bright red, there's one thing I want you listeners to take away from this blog post where I've basically kneeled before Zod and declared we're not worthy to some highly successful podcasts, which is listen to the Superman Live Show.  I don't care if you're a regular Superman fan, just enjoy watching Smallville, or are just a general fan of ATA, this is one of the best shows that we've recorded since the insight that was given to us by our excellent guest hosts was simply spectacular and if you listened to us live on the night of the 20th, I would still recommend checking out this re–recorded version because it contains jaw dropping images and audio that we were unable to put into the podcast while we were live due to the restrictions of Ustream. By the way,  if you want to hear more of our excellent guest hosts spectacular insight, check out AlisaLea on her Young Justice Podcast and check out  Robin on the Media Junkyard Podcast, the final season of Starkville's House of El Episodes 154–175 and coming soon to a iTunes near you, the new Geek Out Loud.  Also if it's easier to access the links to these podcasts are available on the right-hand side of this webpage under the category of References. Oh and one more thing, I'd like to thank you listeners who joined us during the Superman Live Show, this episode would not be possible without you which is something that especially goes for Shannon Cochrane, Noelia Davila, James Hansson and Josiane Ochman whose barrage of Tweets featuring their favorite Smallville Clark Kent Memories played a huge part in helping me complete the script for this episode, so thanks!
item.itunes:subtitle: Here's the recording of our Superman Live Show where we were joined by AlisaLea host of the Young Justice Podcast and Robin Burdge host on the podcasts Media Junkyard and Starkville's House of El in celebrating Clark Kent's transformation into Superman.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 43 (Enhanced) ”Tribute”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week's podcast is called Tribute cause well, each of the TV shows that we review in this episode all paid tribute to something.  On Chuck, they paid tribute to the motion picture epic known as Star Wars, on Bones all the characters pay tribute to a fallen comrade and on Castle they pay tribute to fashion?! Yeah, I wasn't too fond of Castle covering the topic of fashion either, but at least it created a solid debate with Nico that led into a huge discussion revolving around the death of a major character on this week's episode of Bones, so please make sure that you're all caught up because there's some mega-spoilers in this podcast. Other highlights from this episode include speculation on which character is going to get killed in the Season Finale of Castle,  our theory that season seven of Bones is going to put Brennan and Booth up against a Government conspiracy and us giving out random facts about a variety of topics throughout episode. So with that, there's only one thing left for you to do, put the lime in the coconut and listen to this podcast. By the way, due to preparations that needed to be made for the Superman Live Show and Nico having Final Exams our editing timetable has gotten off a bit so please bear with us as we try to get all of our Season Finale episode reviews released as soon as possible because believe me when I say good things come to people who wait, especially in regards to the Superman Live Show.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's podcast is called Tribute cause we review episodes of Chuck, Castle and Bones that pay tribute to a variety of things such as Star Wars, fashion and the loss of a friend.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 42 (Enhanced) ”Get Off Of My Dreams, Get Into My TV Screen”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, on this weeks episode Nico and I discuss predictions for our favorite shows that we want to (Everybody sing Billy Ocean style!) get off of our dreams and onto our TV screen with reviews for the episodes of Chuck, Castle, Bones, Smallville and Supernatural leading into their Season  Finales along with us taking an in-depth look at the stunning but yet mindbending Season Finale of Fringe. Highlights from this episode include how a trip to LA can be added to a long list of reasons on why Castle is one of the best shows on television, a discussion on what we believe to be Bones' best episode of the season and us giving props to Ben Edlund who appears to be the Lone Writer who pulled Supernatural away from the brink of cancellation. By the way, be sure to join us May 20 at 9:15/8:15 Central on ATA’s Ustream Channel for our Superman Live Show dedicated to discussing the Smallville Series Finale and remember for this event to be possible, we need all you listeners out there to send us your favorite Smallville Clark Kent/Superman memories by using e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, our YouTube Channel or this blog to answer the three following questions… 1. What is your favorite memory from watching Clark Kent on  the TV show Smallville? 2. What is your favorite memory of the character of Superman?  (This can come from anywhere, comics,  the George Reeve Superman, the Christopher Reeve Superman movies, the many animated versions of Superman, Lois and Clark, Superman returns  or something more obscure like buying your first Superman action figure.) 3. How has the character of Superman inspired you personally or why do you love the character?
item.itunes:subtitle: On this weeks episode Nico and I discuss predictions for our favorite shows that we want to (Everybody sing Billy Ocean style!) get off of our dreams and onto our TV screen as we head towards their Season Finales.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 42 Sneak Preview (Enhanced) ”Smallville 10x20 Prophecy”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, with the Series Finale airing this Friday night, Nico and I thought it would be more relevant if we reviewed the penultimate or second to last episode of Smallville before the finale, so here is a sneak preview of Across The Airwaves Episode 42 only featuring our review on the Smallville episode 10x20 Prophecy with the reviews for the week's episodes of Chuck, Castle, Bones, Fringe and  Supernatural set to come out in the official release of ATA Episode 42. However, be forewarned  that in  this preview  Nico and I expressed some serious concerns about  the Smallville Finale because we like all of you fans out there want it to be a huge success which means that were sharing with you our thoughts on Prophecy early in hopes that you listeners will send us comments, Tweets, Facebook posts and E-mails that will help alleviate our anxiety for the Finale. By the way, while we are on the topic of Smallville, be sure to join us May 20 at 9:15/8:15 Central on ATA’s Ustream Channel for our Superman Live Show dedicated to discussing the Smallville Series Finale and remember for this event to be possible, we need all you listeners out there to send us your favorite Smallville Clark Kent/Superman memories by using e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, our YouTube Channel or this blog to answer the three following questions… 1. What is your favorite memory from watching Clark Kent on  the TV show Smallville? 2. What is your favorite memory of the character of Superman?  (This can come from anywhere, comics,  the George Reeve Superman, the Christopher Reeve Superman movies, the many animated versions of Superman, Lois and Clark, Superman returns  or something more obscure like buying your first Superman action figure.) 3. How has the character of Superman inspired you personally or why do you love the character?
item.itunes:subtitle: This sneak preview of ATA Episode 42 features our review on the Smallville Episode 10x20 Prophecy because Nico and I thought that it would be more relevant if we reviewed the penultimate episode of Smallville before the Series Finale airs this Friday.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Smallville Finale Preview Mini Podcast (Enhanced)
item.description:
Hey, ATA Listeners to get all of you pumped up about the Smallville Series  Finale this Friday, May 13 at 8/7c and our Superman Live Show next Friday night May 20 at 9:15/8:15c Michael and I decided to record a Mini Podcast Episode discussing the trailer for the Smallville Series Finale that was shown at the end of last week's episode entitled Prophecy. Highlights from this Mini Podcast include Michael pointing out the footage from the Smallville Finale that was used in the trailer, our predictions on how Smallville is going to end and us preparing to say goodbye to show that we have grown up with over the past 10 years. Here is the trailer for the Smallville Series Finale if you want to use it to follow along with our podcast... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NrLxE-K05bI&feature=channel_video_title
By the way, be sure to join us May 20 at 9:15/8:15 Central on ATA’s Ustream Channel for our Superman Live Show dedicated to discussing the Smallville Series Finale and remember for this event to be possible, we need all you listeners out there to send us your favorite Smallville Clark Kent/Superman memories by using e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, our YouTube Channel or this blog to answer the three following questions… 1. What is your favorite memory from watching Clark Kent on  the TV show Smallville? 2. What is your favorite memory of the character of Superman?  (This can come from anywhere, comics,  the George Reeve Superman, the Christopher Reeve Superman movies, the many animated versions of Superman, Lois and Clark, Superman returns  or something more obscure like buying your first Superman action figure.) 3. How has the character of Superman inspired you personally or why do you love the character?
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey ATA Listeners, to get all of you pumped up about the Smallville Series Finale and our Superman Live Show next Friday May 20 at 9:15/8:15c Michael and I decided to record a Mini Podcast Episode discussing the trailer for the Smallville Series Finale.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 41 (Enhanced) ”Miracles”
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this weeks episode is all about miracles and no we are not paying tribute to the band Jefferson Starship, who Dean Winchester claims to be horrible and hard to kill.  Actually we went with his title because the characters on our favorite shows all seemed to be in need of a miracle this week with  Bones and Booth looking for that emotional spark to begin their romantic relationship, Oliver searching for a way to remove the Omega tattoo on Smallville, the Fringe Team looking for a way to save our world and on Supernatural a miracle did occur as the writers used a shocking twist to put what started out as a lackluster Season Six on the path towards an outstanding conclusion.  Highlights from this episode include my predictions on how the Smallville Series Finale is going to play out, Nico and I piecing back together are our crackpot theories on Fringe after this week's episode left us with a huge game changer and last but not least we we bask in amazement over the writers of Supernatural turning things around to make us excited about watching it again. By the way, be sure to join us May 20 at 9:15/8:15 Central on ATA’s Ustream channel for our Superman Live Show dedicated to discussing the Smallville Series Finale and remember for this event to be possible, we need all you listeners out there to send us your favorite Smallville Clark Kent/Superman memories by using e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, are YouTube Channel or this blog to answer the three following questions… 1. What is your favorite memory from watching Clark Kent on  the TV show Smallville? 2. What is your favorite memory of the character of Superman?  (This can come from anywhere, comics,  the George Reeve Superman, the Christopher Reeve Superman movies, the many animated versions of Superman, Lois and Clark, Superman returns  or something more obscure like buying your first Superman action figure.) 3. How has the character of Superman inspired you personally or why do you love the character?
item.itunes:subtitle: This weeks episode is all about miracles and no I don't mean the song by Jefferson Starship because the characters on the episodes of Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural that aired this week all seemed to be in need of a miracle.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 40 (Enhanced) "It's The End of the TV Season As We Know It and I Feel Fine"
item.description:
__ It's the end of the TV season as we know it and we here at ATA feel fine, at least for the most part as Nico and I reach a bittersweet crossroad over being extremely excited to see how things going to play out for the characters of Fringe and Supernatural as they face the end of the world in their respective season finales but yet with this week's Bones being used as a backdoor pilot, we were hit with the hard cold reality that some of our favorites like Chuck and Smallville for sure will be coming to an end. On that note, highlights for this episode include an in-depth discussion on Booster the final episode of Smallville written by DC Comics legend Geoff Johns and the gunslinger from the Old West, Dakota Dan joining us for our rooting tooting review of this week Supernatural. Speaking of Smallville, be sure to join us May 20 at 9:15/8:15 Central on ATA’s Ustream channel for our Superman Live Show dedicated to discussing the Smallville Series Finale and remember for this event to be possible, we need all you listeners out there to send us your favorite Smallville Clark Kent/Superman memories by using e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, are YouTube Channel or this blog to answer the three following questions…
What is your favorite memory from watching Clark Kent on  the TV show Smallville? What is your favorite memory of the character of Superman?  (This can come from anywhere, comics,  the George Reeve Superman, the Christopher Reeve Superman movies, the many animated versions of Superman, Lois and Clark, Superman returns  or something more obscure like buying your first Superman action figure.) How has the character of Superman inspired you personally or why do you love the character?
item.itunes:subtitle: It's the end of the TV season as we know it and we here at ATA feel fine, sort of, as we reach a crossroad over being excited for the season finales of Bones, Fringe and Supernatural but yet saddened by Smallville and most likely Chuck coming to an end.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 39 (Enhanced) "Magic Carpet Ride"
item.description:
On this podcast episode, you don't know what we can find, so why don't you come along with me ATA Listener on a magic carpet ride because this  week of television got a little trippy as a Volkoff begins acting like Mr. Rogers on Chuck, Beckett starts hanging out with a writer that's not Castle, Bones believes that Booth saw a Yeti in Nepal, Clark is transported to a darker version of Smallville that exists on an alternate Earth, the Winchester Brothers are driving a Mustang instead of the Impala and to top it all off, Fringe gets animated literally! Thankfully, after a week of television that felt like puffing the Magic Dragon, Nico, Michael and I are here for you Listeners acting as the White Castle to cure your case of the munchies through a great discussion about how Castle, Bones and other police procedural shows are taking notes from each other on how to create lasting romantic  tension and Michael joins us for a fairly in-depth discussion on Kent and the other final five episodes of Smallville that makes up for the shows obnoxious five-week hiatus. Speaking of Smallville, be sure to join us May 20 at 9:15/8:15 Central on ATA's Ustream channel for our Superman Live Show dedicated to discussing the Smallville Series Finale and remember for this event to be possible, we need all you listeners out there to send us your favorite Smallville Clark Kent/Superman memories by using e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, are YouTube Channel or this blog to answer the three following questions...
What is your favorite memory from watching Clark Kent on  the TV show Smallville? The weight andWhat is your favorite memory of the character of Superman?  (This can come from anywhere, comics,  the George Reeve Superman, the Christopher Reeve Superman movies, the many animated versions of Superman, Lois and Clark,  Superman returns  or something more obscure like buying your first Superman action figure.) How has the character of Superman inspired you personally or why do you love the character?
Just as a minor note Michael and my excitement/sadness over the upcoming Smallville Series Finale caused our Smallville section to be a little long-winded this week making this podcast episode longer than usual so if you're not a Smallville fan just skip this section, which goes from 01:16:07 to 01:56:38 and you'll have a podcast that is our normal standard length.
item.itunes:subtitle: On this podcast, you don't know what we can find, so why don't you come along with me ATA Listener on a magic carpet ride because this week of television featured episodes of Chuck, Castle, Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural that got kinda trippy.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 38 (Enhanced) "Pizza on the Beach"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, on this weeks episode of Across the Airwaves, we serve you up with a slice of reviews for Castle and Bones that will hopefully hold over your appetite until next week, where we will be back to reviewing not just the shows featured in this episode but Chuck, Fringe, Supernatural and the final five episodes of Smallville. As for this week, highlights include Nico dishing some big casting news on the upcoming movies, Superman: Man of Steel as well as The Dark Knight Rises, a discussion on a huge plot detail that was revealed about the season finale of Castle and more about the upcoming Bones Spin-Off crossover episode. By the way, be sure to join us for our Superman Live Show dedicated to reviewing the Series Finale of Smallville occurring on Friday May 20th at 9:15/ 8:15 Central on our Ustream Channel.
item.itunes:subtitle: On this weeks episode of ATA, we serve you up with a slice of reviews for Castle and Bones that will hopefully hold over your appetite until next week, where we will be back to reviewing a full slate of our favorite shows.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 37 (Enhanced) "Don't Call Us Sidekicks"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, on this week's episode don't call us sidekicks, as we have our resident superhero expert, Michael join us for an in-depth discussion on Cartoon Networks and DC Comics' brand-new hit animated series Young Justice. In this section, we not only review Young Justice but go over the show with a fine tooth comb as Michael and I give our thoughts on the first nine episodes of the series, analyze each of the characters one by one and talk about our future predictions for the storyline. However, if you're not really a big fan of superheroes that doesn't mean that you should take a pass on this episode because what would an Across the Airwaves podcast be without fulfilling your Nathan Fillion fix for the week as we review an episode of his hit show Castle that takes the idea of Law and Order in a whole new direction. Other highlights from the episode include Nico making a pretty  solid argument on why this week's Castle was mediocre and yours truly bursting with excitement over DC Comics' plans to dramatically expand their fan base with several upcoming television productions in addition to Young Justice. By the way,  after listening to this podcast, if you want more information on Young Justice or episode by episode reviews of the series, be sure to check out the Young Justice Podcast produced by our friend and contributor AlisaLea.
item.itunes:subtitle: On this episode don't call us sidekicks, as our weekly review of Castle is followed by ATA's resident superhero expert, Michael joining us for an in-depth discussion on Cartoon Networks and DC Comics' brand-new hit animated series Young Justice.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 36 (Enhanced) "Whodunit?"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week's episode is called "Whodunit?" because this week's episode reviews actually ask the question whodunit? with Chuck trying to figure out who is picking off the CIA's Intersect Candidates one by one, Castle helping the NYPD find out who killed the Head Writer on a Soap Opera and the Fringe Team on the Other Side racing to find the identity of Bolivia's kidnappers. Other highlights from the episode include Nico and I getting so excited about Fringe being renewed for a Fourth Season that our imaginations run wild with predictions for the future of the show in a Fringe section that you don't want to miss. Also we dish on some Superman movie casting news brought to our attention by our good friend AlisaLea, use the fact that this week's Castle was filled with a bunch of recognizable guest stars to prove it's one of the best shows on Television and discuss what the concept of Agent X has in store for Chuck's big sister Ellie.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's episode is called "Whodunit?" because this week's episode reviews of Chuck, Castle and Fringe that dealt with multiple murders and a kidnapping actually ask the question whodunit?

item.title: Across the Airwaves Episode 35 (Enhanced) "Ring My Bell"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week's episode is entitled "Ring My Bell" because the ringing of Dr. Bell's historic bell in this week's Fringe not only gave him a new lease on life inside the body of FBI agent Olivia Dunham but it also signified the rejuvenation of Brennan and Booth's relationship on Bones as well as the plot line of Chuck training Intersect Candidates giving the show's writers, a second wind that should hopefully get them through the rest of this season and possibly a Season Five. Highlights from this week's reviews of Chuck, Bones, and Fringe also include a debate on if Chuck's sister Ellie will become an Intersect Candidate, our discussion on Brennan and Booth relationship prompting Nico to dish on the upcoming Bones spin-off and myself being totally amazed by Anna Torv as a Dr. Bell possessed Olivia because she was able to channel sci-fi legend Leonard Nimoy's personality in her performance to a degree that she even sounded like him. So with this theme of resurrection established, why don't you breathe new life into your own week by listening to this highly enjoyable episode of Across the Airwaves.
item.itunes:subtitle: Join us as we ring the bell on this week's reviews of Chuck, Bones and Fringe that all connect to each other by the theme of getting a new lease on life, which in terms of TV means creating new plot lines or resurrecting characters to keep your interest.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 34 (Enhanced) "Ready, Aim, Float!"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week's episode earned the title of "Ready, Aim, Float!" because our reviews focus on an episode of Bones where Booth has a sniper shootout with the show's new big bad Jacob Broadsky and an episode of Fringe where a scientist gives people the ability to defy gravity. Highlights from this episode include Nico revealing some information on The Dark Knight Rises as well as two new upcoming sci-fi television series,  yours truly giving a theory on Bones regarding the motivation behind Broadsky's vigilante tactics and the both of us using our experience at Camp Horizon to give some great insight on the portrayal of the people with disabilities in this week's episode of Fringe. By the way, for those of you looking for reviews of our other favorite shows, you are unfortunately going to have to wait because Castle was off due to the season finale of The Bachelor and Smallville along with its follow-up show Supernatural are still on hiatus until April.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's episode has the title of "Ready, Aim, Float!" because our reviews focus on an episode of Bones where Booth has a sniper shootout with big bad, Jacob Broadsky and an episode of Fringe where a scientist gives people the ability to defy gravity.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 33 (Enhanced) "Countdown to Extinction"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, this week's podcast is entitled "Countdown to Extinction" because the episode of Castle we are reviewing is ironically titled "Countdown" and with the success of Smallville coming to a close with a proper ending, several of the shows we cover on Across the Airwaves are facing extinction or in other words cancellation. Right now, Human Target is first in line for extinction followed by another one of our FOX favorites Fringe, which was wrongfully moved to Friday night. Plus on top of that, Chuck is once again on the chopping block, where it's been ever since coming into existence. Obviously, as tremendous fans of these three shows we took some time out of this week's reviews of Chuck, Castle, Smallville and Supernatural to defend the shows that we love currently on the bubble for cancellation, with me getting up on my soap box to once again emphasize my praise for Fringe being one of the most imaginative shows on television and Nico calling out the networks to come up with a new rating system that is more in tune with the Internet as well as DVR. Again, TV by the Numbers might be the one that needs a new rating system because they have said that Chuck was going to be canceled over the past four years and it still hasn't happened yet (knock on wood) but after Nico states his case, it seems more likely that great television shows like Fringe and Human Target aren't getting a fair chance due to the networks not realizing they need to advance with technology. Other highlights from the episode include more praising of Nathan Fillion  in response to his great performance on this week's Castle, future  predictions for dare I say Chuck Season Five, our pleasant surprise towards the addition of Superboy on Smallville being a trip down memory lane rather than a confusing mess of comic book mythology and our response to the shocking death of a re-occurring character on Supernatural.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's episode is entitled "Countdown to Extinction" because we took some time out of our reviews for Chuck, Castle, Smallville and Supernatural to defend the shows that we love currently in danger of cancellation like Fringe as well as Human Target.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 32 (Enhanced) "A Fortunate Mistake at a Masquerade"
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, it's Dan here, after surviving the world's greatest bachelor party, that caused me to wake up the next morning to find a Lemur on top of me, a Bride in my closet and the Luthor Corp. sign in my living room. I pulled off getting over my magically induced champagne bender to finish editing this podcast. And on this week's episode as expected we are reviewing episodes of Chuck, Castle, Fringe, Smallville, and Supernatural but not Bones because it is on a three-week hiatus due to American Idol. Highlights include,  Nico and I discussing an episode of Supernatural that hit really close to home as well as us giving our reaction on a fun but off-the-wall episode of Smallville that was supposedly the sendoff for one of our favorite characters here at ATA, the legendary Chloe Sullivan. Also, yours truly once again spreads the love for John Noble because his performance in this week's Fringe flashback episode as Dr. Bishop was absolutely superb and I get on my soapbox to ask all of you TV fans out there to perform a job for Superman, which is saving four of the six  shows that we cover from extinction at the hands of their respective networks.
item.itunes:subtitle: After surviving the world's greatest bachelor party, I overcame my magically induced champagne bender to finish editing this week's episode, reviewing Chuck, Castle, Fringe, Smallville, and Supernatural but not Bones because it's on a three-week hiatus.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 31 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey ATA listeners, on this week's episode love is in the air because our full schedule of reviews include episodes of Chuck, Castle, Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural that for the most part had a Valentine's Day theme Valentine's Day theme or at least focused on a major romance in each of these TV series. Highlights from the episode include Nico believing that Bones' Happy St. Valentine's Day Massacre episode has put the show back on track and Yours Truly getting really excited about Olivia and Peter poking up on Fringe. Also Nico and I try to get to the bottom of why Supernatural fans are so against the addition of Lisa and Ben to the story because we believe that after being through Hell, literally Dean Winchester deserves to get what he wants, a family.
item.itunes:subtitle: On this week's episode love is in the air because our full schedule of reviews include episodes of Chuck, Castle, Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural that for the most part had a Valentine's Day theme.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 30 (Enhanced)
item.itunes:subtitle: When there came a day, a day unlike any other, where I found myself facing tragedy, fighting foes no single podcaster could withstand, my co-hosts united to help make this week’s reviews of Chuck, Castle, Bones, Fringe, Smallville & Supernatural possibl

item.title: Across the Airwaves Episode 29 (Enhanced)
item.description: On this week’s episode, we are one TV Show shy of being back to reviewing a full schedule due to Castle being off this week, but the good news is after an extremely long wait Smallville and Supernatural have returned with new episodes. Plus as expected we also have new episodes of Chuck, Bones, and Fringe to review as well. Highlights from this podcast include some casting news on The Avengers movie, an in-depth look on an episode of Chuck that could best be described as simply satisfying and myself along with Nico being extremely excited that Supernatural is back on track or in the words of Aerosmith's Steven Tyler, back in the saddle again. Also, we would like to thank certain people for joining us last Friday, February 4th for ChloeFest 2011! Special thanks goes to Legendary Women Inc, AlisaLea, and Allison Mack for potentially listening and for her portrayal of Chloe Sullivan aka Watchtower over the years.
item.itunes:subtitle: On this week’s episode, we are one TV Show shy of being back to reviewing a full schedule due to Castle being off this week, but the good news is this podcast contains reviews for all new episodes of Chuck, Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural.

item.title: Across The Airwaves ChloeFest (Enhanced)
item.description: When it comes to the character of Chloe Sullivan, we Smallville fans, we have our opinions, some of us believe her destiny is to be a reporter for the Daily Planet, while others see her as the superhero Watchtower and then there's the people who actually believe Chloe will become Lois Lane or  the comic book fans like me who beat our heads against the wall, wanting to ensure that Chloe will forever be a part of the Superman mythos. However, despite our differences we have one thing in common when it comes to Clark Kent's best friend and one of his greatest allies, a love for the character of Chloe Sullivan. A love that inspired us to have ChloeFest 2011, a live show event that is Across the Airwaves version of This is Your Life Chloe Sullivan, through us using E-mails, Voice Mails and Tweets from fans all over the world to reminisce on our favorite memories of this legendary character and pay tribute to the wonderful actress who has played Chloe over the past 10 years of  Smallville, Allison Mack. On top of that to really make this event something  that Allison Mack and Smallville fans can cherish we brought in a few special guests to help us take a trip down memory lane as well as review Chloe Sullivan's triumphant return in Smallville's Final Mid Season Premiere "Collateral".  These guests include Margaret J. Bates, from Legendary Woman Inc. a charity organization inspired by Chloe Sullivan, recurring star on HBO's Eastbound and Down, Elizabeth De Razzo who's acting career has partially been inspired by Allison Mack and it wouldn't be a live show without the return of ATA's very own recurring host, Brain Trust member, Michael J. Petty. By the way, thank you to all the Chloe fans out there who sent us their favorite Chloe memories as Voice Mails, E-mails and Tweets, if it wasn't for you this Live Show would've not been possible and in return for your support all of the Chloe memories that you sent in were a part of this podcast episode. So now that we've got all the business out of the way it's time for me to present, without further ado ChloeFest 2011...
item.itunes:subtitle: This is the recording of ChloeFest, our Live Show event dedicated to celebrating the life of Chloe Sullivan and paying tribute to the actress who has played her over the past 10 years of Smallville, Allison Mack.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 28 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey Everyone, if there was podcast equivalent to an Academy Award, it would go to Nico because his insight on this week's shocking and incredibly well done episodes of Chuck, Castle, Bones, and Fringe really made this podcast (that went a little on the long side) something special for all of you listeners out there. Highlights from this episode reviewing an excellent week of January television include Nico comparing Castle and Beckett's relationship to Firefly's Inara and Mal, myself comparing Bones' Hanna to Scrappy Doo and some news on the casting of Superman in Zack Snyder's upcoming film. By the way, I know this announcement is only relevant for about the next 24 hours but please remember to join us tomorrow night February 4th for  Chloefest, a live show event dedicated celebrating the life of Chloe Sullivan airing at 9:15/8:15c on this website: http://www.ustream.tv/channel/across-the-airwaves-live immediately following Chloe's triumphant return to Smallville in the episode Collateral.
item.itunes:subtitle: If there was podcast equivalent to an Academy Award, it would go to Nico because his insight on this week's incredibly well done episodes of Chuck, Castle, Bones, and Fringe really made this podcast something special for all of you listeners out there.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 27 (Enhanced)
item.itunes:subtitle: Great Scott, ATA Listeners! This edition of Across the Airwaves is a Back to the Future Themed Episode due to us reviewing Christopher Lloyd's guest appearance on the mid season premiere of Fringe as well as the Mid Season Premieres of Bones and Chuck.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 26 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, on this episode of Across the Airwaves, I was  replaced by an impostor, DUM, DUM, DUMMM!!!  No, actually the voice you will be hearing throughout this podcast is mine but something  goofy happened with the Internet connection so my voice was much deeper than usual, almost as if it was going through a voice changer. Although despite me sounding like Zordon (yes, here's a guy that made a Power Rangers reference) this episode is still really worth the listen, because our discussion on the most recent episode of Castle and the action packed FOX TV series Human Target is really insightful through us looking at these shows from a lot of different aspects within the TV Industry. Highlights from this guerrilla style episode that would make a conspiracy dude like Guerrero proud include Nico making predictions on the love story for both Human Target's Chance and our man Richard Castle. Also I make a request for you to send us your favorite Chloe Sullivan memories to help us enhance our upcoming Live Show, ChloeFest as well as reveal two new ATA segments that will be occurring on Twitter as well as our Facebook wall entitled Things Learned from Watching How I Met Your Mother and Psych Thoughts. By the way don't forget to support Legendary Women's Inc.'s charity for the Christopher and Dana Reeve Foundation in both Chloe Sullivan and Allison Mack's names which will be running through January 22nd. At the same time, don't forget to join us on February 4th at 9:15/8:15c for ChloeFest, a Live Show event, celebrating the life of Chloe Sullivan that will be occurring on this web site: http://www.ustream.tv/channel/across-the-airwaves-live following the airing of the Smallville episode Beacon.
item.itunes:subtitle: Despite Internet connection issues making my voice sound like Zordon from Power Rangers, this week's episode features a very insightful discussion on the most recent episode of Castle and FOX's action packed TV Series Human Target.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 25 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, on this week's episode we are only going to have a review on the mid season premiere of Castle and take a quick look at the results of the People’s Choice Awards because we want to gradually ease back into a full schedule of reviewing our favorite shows which includes not only Castle but Chuck, Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural. Also we need the spare time to prepare for our next Smallville Live Show on February 4th entitled ChloeFest 2011, an episode of ATA that will not only review the episode Beacon but be a chance through the magic of a Live Show chat for all of you fans out there to have a conversation on how much we love the character of Chloe Sullivan and discuss her triumphant return in the Smallville Mid-Season Premiere Collateral! Highlights from this episode include a commercial made by Legendary Women Inc. advertising their charity event for the Christopher and Dana Reeve Foundation along with ChloeFest.  Also we announce the winner of the TV Guide Magazine Cover Contest, Nico uses this week's discussion on Castle to compare his Top 5 List of the celebrities you would sleep with if you had the chance to yours by asking you to send your list to acrosstheairwaves@gmail.com and we have an amusing debate on if the People's Choice Awards are relevant. By the way as a reminder don't forget to join us on Friday February 4th at 9:15/8:15c for ChloeFest, a live show that will be following the Smallville episode Beacon and airing at this web address: http://www.ustream.tv/channel/across-the-airwaves-live.
item.itunes:subtitle: On this week's episode we are only going to have a review on the mid season premiere of Castle and take a quick look at the results of the People’s Choice Awards because we want to gradually ease back into a full schedule of reviewing our favorite shows

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 24 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, it's Dan here, with our most spontaneous podcast ever. Basically, spur of the moment is the best way to describe this episode because getting our Brain Trust member Michael J. Petty set up on Skype turned into a full-blown conversation about Smallville and throughout the discussion someone pressed the record button, which voila! produced an episode dedicated to recapping the first half of Smallville's so far outstanding 10th Season. So if you're a Smallville fan a grab bowl of popcorn and sit back as we take you through all the great moments in this first half of the show's Final Season that made you believe a man can fly. By the way due to the spontaneous, uncensored and somewhat on unedited nature of this episode, Nico sadly was not able to be in this podcast but he will be back to review the Mid-Season Premiere of Castle.
item.itunes:subtitle: Grab bowl of popcorn and join us for an episode dedicated to recapping the first half of Smallville's so far outstanding Final Season by going back through the moments that made you believe a man can fly.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 23 (Enhanced)
item.itunes:subtitle: Jingle bells, Hannah smells, Dr. Bishop had his cow lay an egg, the Justice League took on Slade and ATA covers Mid-Season Finales today! If my twist on a Christmas Carol hasn't made it obvious, the final episode of ATA for 2010 has a Christmas theme.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 22 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, here's a podcast episode that felt like we used a mirror box to enter a parallel universe because throughout our discussions on this week's episodes of Chuck, Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural, Nico and I came to the shocking revelation that Anna Torv and Cassidy Freeman, both actors we've been known to complain about in the past are getting better in their performances, which is great news for them and even better news for us because we have even more of a reason to get excited about our favorite shows. Highlights from this episode include Nico and I expressing our somewhat disappointment over Chuck's Mid-Season Finale, getting up on our soap box to complain about FOX moving Fringe to Friday night and us using a part of our Supernatural section to make a please for all of you ATA supporters out there to give us more feedback through e-mail, Twitter, Facebook and voice mail because we really need support when it comes to formulating crackpot theories every week.
item.itunes:subtitle: Here's a podcast that felt like entering a parallel universe due to this week's Chuck, Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural sho

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 21 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, it's Dan here, ready to have Nico throw the book at you, no just kidding. I'm actually here to give you a new podcast episode that's not so ordinary this week due to Turkey Day formally known as Thanksgiving. And how the episode is different this week is that we only have a review of Chuck but don't worry you're not gonna be short changed on any ATA fun, since we use the extra time created by our other favorite shows being on hiatus to cover two new hit shows that premiered this fall ABC's No Ordinary Family and CBS's Hawaii Five-0. Highlights from this episode include some big casting news on the upcoming Christopher Nolan/Zach Snyder Superman movie, Nico's fascination over the term Giant Blond She-Male and we have a slight debate over the violence featured on Hawaii Five-0.  Plus Nico and I reveal our favorite characters from both No Ordinary Family and Hawaii Five-0.
item.itunes:subtitle: On this week’s episode, due to Thanksgiving we only have a review of Chuck this week. However, we use the extra time created by our favorite shows being on hiatus to review two new shows that premiered this fall, No Ordinary Family and Hawaii Five-O.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Smallville Patriot Live Show (Enhanced)
item.itunes:subtitle: Here's the recording of our second Live Show dedicated to the Smallville episode Patriot chocked full of all the humor, fun, comic book geekyness, sex appeal, Nico and Lifehouse singing that a Smallville fan could want or need after their favorite show.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 20 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, have you ever wondered the answers to the questions do aliens really exist, is the lost city of Atlantis really on the bottom of the ocean, is there such a thing as fairies and does Belgian chocolate taste as good as they say? Well on this podcast episode, Across the Airwaves gets to the bottom of these unexplained and unsolved mysteries with reviews on this week's episodes of Chuck, Castle, Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural. Highlights from this podcast include my experience of watching Monday night television with a really tough crowd, Nico being haunted by the character of Hannah even though she was not in this week's Bones and if you thought we got excited about Fringe last week, you ain't seen nothing yet, as we both call Anna Torv's  performance in this episode dare I say outstanding.
item.itunes:subtitle: On this week's episode Nico and I try to solve the unexplained from the existence of aliens to fairies with reviews on this week's episodes of Chuck, Castle, Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 19 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, it's Dan here with some good news and some bad news about this week's podcast. The bad news is we don’t have a review of Chuck due to the special about President George W. Bush that aired on NBC but the good news is we still have reviews on the episodes of Castle, Bones, Fringe, Smallville, and Supernatural that aired throughout the week. On that note, highlights from this week's episode include Nico and I getting excited, I mean getting really excited, over Fringe. Also we have a slight disagreement on our feelings about Castle, followed by us praising this week's episode of Bones for being Hannah-free and Nico giving me psychiatric help on what exactly is going wrong with Supernatural.
item.itunes:subtitle: We've got good news and bad news about this week's podcast. The bad news is we don’t have a review of Chuck but the good news is we still have reviews on the episodes of Castle, Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural that aired throughout the week.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 18 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, it's Dan here with a podcast that's a little on the long side this week, but it's totally worth the listen because this episode features some really great reviews of Chuck, Castle, Bones, Fringe, Smallville, and Supernatural that are thought provoking and highly entertaining too. Wow I used the word "too", I hate that word, it makes me sound like the Wicked Witch, a Dr. Seuss book or even worse Arthur Petrelli for you Heroes fans out there, blah! Anyway, this week's episode included Nico and Dan actually having their "first fight" just like Chuck and Sarah. Plus on top of that our fight was over the future of the show Chuck, now that the Intersect has been remove from his head. However, before things got heated like a crappy reality show, Nico turn his anger towards Booth's new girlfriend on Bones, Hanna who he accuses of making David Boreanaz and Emily Deschanel look like buffoons. Yes, Nico does use the word buffoons in this podcast. Also, I make things up to Nico by saying a comment that causes him to crack up laughing but it might have also bought us tickets to the very place where Sam Winchester or the show Supernatural's missing soul can be found.
item.itunes:subtitle: It's Dan here with a podcast that's a little on the long side this week, but it's totally worth the listen because this episode features some really great reviews of Chuck, Castle, Bones, Fringe, Smallville, and Supernatural that are highly entertaining.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 17 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, I know it's a little after the fact, but here's a Halloween themed episode of Across the Airwaves featuring reviews of Chuck, Castle, Smallville and Supernatural but no Bones and Fringe due to the airing of the World Series on Fox. Petty gives us some crackpot theories about Sam's resurrection on Supernatural. Also Nico and I cover all the gamechangers/shockers that occurred during this week of television which left us simply floored. item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 16 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, its Dan here with another set of exciting reviews dedicated to Episode 5 in the new seasons of Castle, Chuck, Smallville and Supernatural.  At the same time, if you’re wondering why we’re not talking Bones and Fringe this week, both of these shows are on hiatus due to the baseball playoffs airing on Fox. As for highlights from this episode, Nico and I marvel at Joshua Gomez and Adam Baldwin's performance in this week's Chuck and discuss our first voicemail (YAY!) from Across the Airwaves' biggest supporter Michael J. Petty.  Also in the last ten minutes of this episode, we call out the writers of Supernatural to give us answers on Sam's release from Hell and his shocking personality change. By the way, keep an eye out for Across the Airwaves' mini-episode dedicated to Nico and I discussing the new hit TV series' CBS's Hawaii Five-O and ABC's No Ordinary Family as well as promos for our next Live Show on November 19th which will be dedicated to the Smallville episode Patriot.

item.itunes:subtitle: Hey Everyone, it's Dan with our podcast episode dedicated to reviewing the new episodes of Chuck, Castle, Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural that aired during week four of the Fall 2010-11 TV season.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Smallville 200th Episode Live Show (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, after all the hype your chance to finally relive that monumental Friday night extravaganza is here with the re-recording of a major event in Across The Airwaves' history our very first Live Show dedicated to Smallville's 200th Episode! Yes, now you can listen to our unedited and off the hook Live Show all about Smallville, which many of you joined in on, any time you want. And with the posting of this episode I'd would also to thank all you listeners and everyone over at Starkville’s House of El who joined us for our Smallville 200th episode Live Show. It was an awesome way to capitalize on a memorable event for Superman Fans everywhere and I really enjoyed meeting some new people who share my passion for Smallville. Also special thanks goes to Joe Hummrich for supporting our Live Show, it truly means a lot to Nico and I for a SHoE co-host to take interest in our podcast. Any even more special thanks goes to guest host Michael J. Petty, the unsung hero of this Live Show because without his continued support of this podcast, getting us connections with SHoE and creating some jaw dropping promos this event would have not been possible. So thanks again Michael and I cannot wait for you to join us again in November where we will be having another Live Show dedicated to the Smallville mid-season finale entitled Patriot.
item.itunes:subtitle: This is the re-recording of a major event in Across The Airwaves' history our very first Live Show dedicated to Smallville's 200th Episode!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 14 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, it's your man Dan here. Due to the hype surrounding our awe inspiring fun loving extravaganza known as the Smallville 200th Episode Live Show, which we'd (as in Michael, Nico and I) like to thank you for supporting, I got kinda behind on my editing schedule, but after much anticipation here is our podcast episode dedicated to reviewing the third episodes in the new seasons of Chuck, Castle, Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural. Highlights from the episode include Nico's and my crack pot theories for future plot lines of Supernatural along with our tremendous new and improved sound quality!
item.itunes:subtitle: After much anticipation, here is the podcast episode dedicated to reviewing the third episodes in the new seasons of Chuck, Castle, Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural featuring our new and improved sound quality!

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 13 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, sorry it took me so long to post this episode on the Web but there were some plumbing problems at my house limiting my computer access  for the week. Anyway if you haven't caught onto the pattern already (Ooh Fringe reference!),  this episode is dedicated towards Nico and I giving reviews for  the second episodes in the new seasons of Chuck, Castle, Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural. Highlights from the episode include Nico giving his two cents on Booth's new girlfriend, Hanna, myself trying not to be afraid of the writers on Fringe attempting to cross the line and the both of us getting more and more excited for the Final Season of Smallville.
item.itunes:subtitle: If you haven't caught onto the pattern already, this episode is dedicated towards Dan and Nico giving reviews for the second episodes in the new seasons of Chuck, Castle, Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 12 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hi Across The Airwaves Listeners, it's Dan here. This week's episode is dedicated to something that's been a long time coming, the kick off of the 2010-11 TV Season. Yes, you read that right the excitement of new TV is here, YAY! In other words, this means Nico and I get to focus on what this podcast is truly about, weekly episode reviews on your favorite shows including Chuck, Castle, Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural. Highlights from the episode include Nico professing his undying love for Castle's Nathan Fillion as well as Chuck's Zachary Levi, myself making a heartfelt plea for Michael Rosenbaum to return in Smallville's Final Season and the both of us questioning why the writers of Fringe keep trying to make us like Olivia (BLAH!) when we clearly want more Peter and Dr. Bishop. Also as a minor note for those of you who listen to the MP3 version of the podcast, the name of the actor who played the Taxi Driver in the Season 3 Premiere is not Cameron K. Smith like Nico mentioned, his name is actually Andre Royo.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week’s episode is dedicated to Dan and Nico kicking off the Fall 2010-11 TV Season with discussions on the season premieres of Chuck, Castle, Bones, Fringe, Smallville and Supernatural.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 11.5 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hi ATA Listeners, it's your TV Watching Buddy Dan. This week due to the preparation needed for our podcast that is dedicated to kicking off the Fall 2010 TV Season, Nico and I decided to release a mini episode (yes this time it is mini, unlike The Last Airbender episode) where we discuss the Summer Finales for Leverage and White Collar to give you listeners something to do as you eagerly await the premiere of new shows along with the return of old favorites. Highlights from this mini episode include Nico and my predictions on future seasons of both Leverage and White Collar.
item.itunes:subtitle: On this week's mini episode Dan and Nico discuss the Summer Finales for Leverage and White Collar.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 11 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hi Everyone, it's Dan here with another podcast for your listening pleasure. In this week's episode, Nico and I pay tribute to Mark A. Sheppard, the man who has the uncanny ability to show up on almost all of our favorite shows by discussing several of his Television Guest Star appearances. However, our reasoning behind dedicating an entire podcast episode to Mr. Sheppard comes from more than him popping up on a bunch of TV Shows. It comes from his knack for taking a character he is guest starring as for 42 minutes or a handful of episodes and make them memorable, which is an impressive feat especially since starring cast members get at least 12 episodes to generate audience interest in their character. Most likely in Mark A. Sheppard’s mind bragging about his acting skills is the last thing he is concerned with, he’s probably just glad he’s getting steady work. However, Nico and I are extremely impressed that he keeps showing up on popular TV Shows and we look forward to episodes that we know he is going to be in due to the fact that his presence means we’re normally in for a treat. So basically, this podcast is to you Mark A. Sheppard because if you or anyone that you’re connected with is listening, we want them to know that your work is just as valuable to us avid TV watchers as it is to the people behind our favorite shows.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this week's episode, Dan and Nico pay tribute to Mark A. Sheppard, the man who has the uncanny ability to show up on almost all of their favorite shows by discussing several of his Television Guest Star appearances.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 10 (Enhanced)
item.itunes:subtitle: Reaching the milestone of their tenth episode, Nico and Dan discuss the new episodes of Leverage and White Collar airing on their respective networks.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 9.5 (Enhanced)
item.itunes:subtitle: Now that they have gone through the process of grieving, Joel (subbing in for Nico) and Dan have decided that they are going to confront the disappointment of M. Night Shyamalan’s The Last Airbender head on.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 9 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey Everyone, it's Dan here. Recently I watched the cable station G4's coverage of Comic-Con 2010 which was a great way to see the sights and sounds of pop culture's biggest event with out having to deal with the headache of crowds and long lines. However, as cool as the special was, there were points that between the talking heads, on-location reporters and the news ticker running across the bottom of the screen, I felt like I was getting hit with an overwhelming avalanche of Entertainment news. This caused Nico and I to feel that you, our listeners were having the same problem, making us feel that it was our responsibility at Across The Airwaves to help you brave the storm of information. So we put our heads together and came up with this week's episode dedicated towards Comic-Con 2010. The episode includes us reporting on the news headlines that came out of the event and discussing the TV celebrity panels where the people behind our favorite shows revealed information about their new seasons premiering in the Fall. Yep, you read that right, this episode is as much about Comic-Con, as it is a preview for the new Fall TV Season, meaning that you need to give it a listen cause it's nothing but double rainbows all the way. Also here are the links to the celebrity panels discussed in the episode for those of you unable to listen to the Enhanced ACC podcast. By the way, I've included as an added bonus, a link to the Thor movie trailer shown at Comic-Con. (Thanks to Michael J. Petty on finding the Smallville Trailer). Supernatural Comic-Con Panel Smallville Comic-Con Panel Smallville Season 10 Trailer Fringe Comic-Con Panel Chuck Comic-Con Panel Castle Comic-Con Panel Thor Movie Trailer
item.itunes:subtitle: This week’s episode is all about Comic-Con 2010 with us reporting on the news headlines that came out of the event and discussing the TV celebrity panels.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 8 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey ATA Listeners, it's Dan here and first off sorry about taking so long to post this episode. I had a computer glitch that threw off my timetable for editing. Moving on to more positive things, this week's episode was recorded on location at Camp Horizon, a camp for people with disabilities. Highlights from the episode include an in-depth look at Camp Horizon starring 19 year Veteran Counselor, Dan Persak. We then follow this up by having various Campers and Counselors join us on a conversation all about the world of Television covering topics from Sesame Street to Homer Simpson to Sept. 11. Yes, things get a little serious in this episode as we pay tribute to the moments in America's history that were broadcast on Television. However for those of you looking for something more upbeat, don't worry the seriousness only lasts for one segment, everything else is fun. So put down that duckie and listen to this podcast episode because I think it will leave you pleasantly surprised. Before we get to the links I'd like to give a big thank you to everyone from Camp Horizon who joined in on this podcast episode... Jason "JB" Baueris Alex Blocker Chris Blogg Nick Castro Plamen Chakov Dylan Chandler Zach Gadson David Kirby Brian O'Donnell Bobby Parikh Kushal Parikh Dan Persak Casey Sutton Dana Wesley Also if you would like to volunteer at Camp Horizon or donate money please visit their website at www.associationofhorizon.org. You can also access their page through the Referrences Section on this website's sidebar.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's episode was recorded on location at Camp Horizon, a camp for people with disabilities.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 7 (Enhanced)
item.description: It's Dan here with Across The Airwaves Episode 7 dedicated to Nico and I discussing the first four episodes of Leverage Season 3. Highlights from the episode is a new segment which will be apart of our Leverage discussions called Let's Stump Nico and an interesting theory on how this new season of Leverage may be very similar to the movie The Usual Suspects. I'd also like to use this post to thank all of the 137 people who are subscribed to the podcast at the time this current episode is released as well as the people commenting on our website. Your interaction with our show means a lot to Nico and I based on the fact that it's our inspiration to keep driving forward with this podcast. So please keep it up because the more feedback you provide to us the better our podcast will be.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's episode is dedicated to discussing the first four episodes of Leverage Season 3.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 6 Book Two: Waves (Enhanced)
item.description: Here's Across The Airwaves Episode 6 Book Two: Waves or in other words Part 2 of our podcast dedicated towards Avatar The Last Airbender and lifting the spirits of its fans due to the disappointment surrounding M. Night Shyamalan's new film based on the popular Nickelodeon Animated Series.
item.itunes:subtitle: Here's Across The Airwaves Episode 6 Book Two: Waves a.k.a. Part 2 of our podcast dedicated towards Avatar The Last Airbender.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 6 Book One: Air (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey it's Dan here commenting on the fact that recently the disappointment of M. Night Shyamalan's The Last Airbender has had us fans of Avatar The Last Airbender questioning our love for the popular Nickelodeon Television Series. In response to this Nico and I, along with our guest Animation Expert Joel Rodriguez decided to dedicate this episode completely towards this landmark in American Animation just to keep you Avatar Fans from feeling the need to go hide in the back of the closet. In fact, this episode has so much great stuff for Avatar The Last Airbender fans to sink their teeth into like character bios and our opinions on key story arcs we had to break it into two parts or in this case books. Yes you heard it here, Across The Airwaves is all about Avatar pride so get some popcorn, pull up a chair and relax as we bring this outstanding Animated Series back to the warm and fuzzy place it had in the hearts of us fans. Besides you never know but we might just get some new people to check out the show. Listed below are the links to Across The Airwaves Episode 6 Book One: Air. The links for Part 2 will be listed in the next post.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's two-part episode with guest Animation Expert Joel Rodriguez is dedicated to the popular Nickelodeon Animated Series Avatar The Last Airbender.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 5 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey it's Dan here with episode five. This week Nico and I discuss two of this summer's hit movies Toy Story 3 and The A-Team. Highlights from the episode include the lovable characters from Toy Story joining the discussion about their new film and Nico giving an interesting theory on how movies are becoming episodic like TV Shows.
item.itunes:subtitle: On Episode 5, Dan and Nico discuss two of this summer's hit movies Toy Story 3 and The A-Team.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 4 (Enhanced)
item.description: It's Dan here with another episode. This week Nico and I discuss Bones and Supernatural, the shows we are getting caught up on through DVD. We also introduce our new Blog Writer, Lev Lawrence to you, our loyal listeners. A highlight from the episode is a discussion on Supernatural enhanced by Classic Rock sounds from the show, that's almost as fun as crusin' around with Sam and Dean in the Impala.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week Nico and Dan discuss Bones and Supernatural the shows they are getting caught up on through DVD. They also introduce their new Blog Writer, Lev Lawrence.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 3 (Enhanced)
item.description:
On their third episode Nico and Dan take a look at the Fall 2010 TV Schedule and the new shows that will be premiering. These shows include The Event, Lonestar, Chase, Hawaii Five-O, No Ordinary Family, Undercovers, Law & Order: Los Angeles, Outsourced, $#*! My Dad Says, Nikita and Love Bites. Highlights from the episode include an in-depth look at No Ordinary Family, a discussion on how Undercovers is a threat to Chuck and news about Supernatural joining Smallville on Friday nights. Here's a list of links to trailers and more information on the new Fall shows discussed in this episode for those of you who listen to the Standard Podcast... Monday Night

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 2 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey everyone it's Dan with another episode of the Podcast. This week Nico and I discuss TV Shows that were canceled during the 2009-10 season such as Heroes, Dollhouse and FlashForward. We also take an in-depth look at Iron Man 2 as well as providing news on the stars of Big Bang Theory wanting a pay increase. Highlights for the episode include Nico's thought-provoking theories on how Dollhouse could have stayed on the air and me applying my wham-bam comic book knowledge to Iron Man 2.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week Nico and Dan discuss TV Shows that were canceled during the 2009-10 season along with taking an in-depth look at Iron Man 2.

item.title: Across The Airwaves Episode 1 (Enhanced)
item.description: Hey everyone it's Dan, your host with the long awaited first episode of the Across The Airwaves Podcast in Enhanced ACC Format. This week Dan and Nico describe the unique format of the podcast while giving reviews on the Season Finales for the 2009-2010 TV Season. Highlights from the podcast include a mind blowing theory about Charlie from the alternate reality on Fringe and predictions about Smallville Season 10. Also if any of you have any questions or thoughts about this episode feel free to comment on this post, tweet on it or e-mail us.
item.itunes:subtitle: Our long awaited first episode of the Across The Airwaves Podcast featuring reviews on Season Finales for the 2009-2010 TV Season.
